review_content: Convenient 5-minute checkin. Got the key and dashed to the room. TV could have been a little bigger but other than that, met most of my expectations. Free coffee in the mornings!I am here and I am terrified! Cockroaches and a smell a horrible smell. Like death rising to choke me to death with bed bugs.Pros: friendly helpful staffCons: damp floors, pubic hair in the towels, NO hot water, terrible smells, panhandlers, woke up the next morning with some sort of bites on my legs, that I developed hives from...possible bed bugs but we saw spiders too.This motel 6 is terrible. It smells. Outside smells like pee. The elevator smells like pee. The room smelled like musty feet and wet ashtray. The ac looked like it was dropped in a pool and it barely worked. The furniture was warped from being damp. Also, the rooms haven't been updated since the 90's. And they charge extra for internet. Everything about the experience sucked.Holy crap, you guys...this place.  We were on a cross country trip and stayed in a Motel 6 in Nashville and had a great experience.  This place couldn't have been more different.  We got in the elevator URINE SMELL!  Got into the outdoor hallway URINE SMELL!  Got into the room STRANGE ODOR COMPRISED OF FEET AND CIGARETTES.  The front desk called to see how the room was.  We told them that it smelled weird and she offered to come up and spray some Glade around.  The carpet was generally damp and the television was from the early '90s.   We didn't feel like looking for another place, so we burned some incense and sprayed some bed bug spray around just in case.  All I  all, the lesson I learned from this was to listen to Yelp reviews.  Yeesh.Wi-Fi? No, Clean? No, Appearance? no. Location? nope. Safety? No. All these factors make this a terrible hotel to stay at. You first notice when you walk up to check in in the middle of the day that look like prostitutes individuals that look like they use drugs, transgender men and women, and possibly homeless or street people. All of this at check-in which took about 30 minutes. Coming in n out of the front office door, after receiving the room she a quick check was made. In the room really didn't appear as though it has been maintainin up cap for. Of time. The carpet was dirty, the desk the tables were in disrepair, which means they had stains and other markings on them. The air conditioner or heater, didn't work very well and it had an odor. The bedspread was probably filthy if David on during ultraviolet light the sheets were slightly dingy. and you get the bare minimum wash cloth towels and toiletries. The room smelled of I still older, and the door locks didn't appear to be as accurate as they could. Located behind a gas station with lots of traffic, and really no privacy, as stated earlier the street had a lot of different types of individuals. Not a good look not a good hotel not a good stay for any price. if this app could give 0 stars this one would get a negative one.BED BUGS!!! Stayed here for one night and the next morning my girlfriend and I discovered that we were covered in bed bug bites. I would definitely not recommend staying at this property. Very dirty and disgusting. When my girlfriend called the office the next day, the lady who answered the phone just brushed off our complaint telling us not to worry and that they were probably just mosquito bites.Just spoke with Teresa at the Motel 6 corporate office and she said that there is an investigation going on right now. I will update with results.I've stayed here numerous of times for Memphis in May festivities.  I never felt unsafe and this location is nowhere comparable to the ghetto.  Everytime I stayed here it was an all girl have fun kind of trip. I wouldn't recommend this as a family place to bring kids.  It's Motel 6 , what do you expect??? The location is about a 5 min drive to Beale St.  The location and cheap price is what always brings me back.  The rooms were always clean but I always spray everything down with a bottle of Antibacterial Lysol.Stayed here for 3 nights. Didn't have high expectations, just a clean room and a bed. The first day, no one cleaned our room. We came back in the evening and the bed was still un-made, everything was as we left it. I thought maybe it was because it was a holiday. The second day, they did clean our room, but did not replace our towels. Just took dirty ones. We realized this after my husband got out of the shower and had no towel. I called the front desk to get some more, and they told me they "didn't have any down there" and would have the housekeeping staff bring some up when they got there. Never happened. The tub was dirty, room was tiny, and tv was from 1990. Stay away.Rooms not great... I've been in a lot better, bugs on the floor... Got a non smoking room and still smells like smoke && in the ghetto very disappointedUnderstanding what a Motel 6 is, helps, so does understanding you're in downtown Memphis. It's a good place to lay your head and it's close to all the good spots. While the area is kinda shady, I've stayed here a bunch of times and I've never had a problem. Remember, it's Motel 6 not the ritz Carlton.

Fast and efficient check in. We arrived close to 10 p.m. on Christmas evening. The person at the front desk had a list of restaurants and pubs that were open. Very valuable as we were hungry and most places were closed.The room was cean and updated. Breakfast was great. Anything from eggs and sausage to waffles to fruit & yogurt to cereal. We would stay again if ever in the area.Rooms are small and tight. The hotel is located off a busy street ( popular)so noise is a factor, however the front desk service is great! The gals here are amazingly friendlier than any location I've stayed at and I stay at a lot......Service is everything!This is what you expect from a Hampton Inn. We skipped the breakfast because they were exceptionally busy on a Saturday morning. The room was clean and comfortable. The area of town is fine to stay in.I stayed here for a total of ten minutes. Not through the fault of anyone, but an act of the Big Guy upstairs. I pulled up after long day of travel and inspections to find a very bad thunderstorm had knocked out the power. I noticed this very fast when the firetrucks in the parking lot and the majority of the staff standing outside.The one counter person I did speak with was very polite and took the time to speak with me when I asked what my options were when I figured that I would not be staying here for the evening."The Good"- The staff interaction I had was polite and cordial given the situation."The Meh"- I would have liked to have stayed here but next time :)"The Bad"- Nothing bad that I could comment onFilthy room. Killed lots of bugs. Will never stay here again. Bathroom was not cleaned well either.We stayed here Memorial Day weekend 2011 and it was a great stay. The stay was top-notch, the accommodations were exactly what we needed and expected, and we were close enough to the touristy areas to make the drive fairly short.Two quick gripes: I don't know why the pool was closed. It was hot outside and I could have used a nice dip in the pool. The free continental breakfast was a bit of a mess and they couldn't keep up with the demand of the patrons.We would definitely stay here again. It was an above-average experience.Its ok, but I am a frequent visitor to Memphis.  the staff is fine, but it simply lacks some amenities I desire (frig, microwave, etc).  also, many of the rooms have bad elec. outlet schemes.  The shower curtains are too short for the showers, this is dumb.  So, the staff seems fine, but the managers made some poor decisions.  The restaurant across the street (Newts, whatever) has good soups.Oh yeah, Wifi is unpredictable and very slowWow. I'm REALLY surprised at all the negative reviews! This is our sixth road trip between Texas and Massachusetts, and we're always looking to shave dollars off our quick, nine-hour stays. This Hampton's $89 rate is on the higher side of what we usually pay for a highway layover, but I still think it's a pretty good deal. And we loved the accommodations: everything was very clean, staff was professional, no odd smells, very quiet, comfy beds, etc. The free breakfast had some nice touches as compared to the usual chain hotel fare, including a choice of light or dark roast coffee.Anyway, I'm glad I didn't read the reviews before staying here, because I wouldn't have done it, and we would have missed out on a decent deal!I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this Hampton.  The location is central to numerous restaurants and shopping choices.  My room was clean and comfortable.  The breakfast was typical Hampton.  I was concerned when I checked in about the very limited fitness center (just a bike, treadmill, and eliptical) but that was quelled quickly.  The hotel has an association with a full service gym (Dac Fitness) just down the road - all I had to do was show my room key in order to use the gym every day of my stay.  The staff was friendly and provided excellent customer service - something lacking in many locations today.  This will be my hotel if I return to Memphis in the future.The rooms were decent, but I didn't like how it was just a shower (no tub). Given there are other options in the area that are not much more expensive, I would go with one of those over this place.Awful! After 50+ years of extensive traveling, i should have been more concerned when i saw the complimentry ear plugs on the night table. A first for me.  Enough said??? Trains nearly shake you out of bed often and loud throughout the night. Not up to the standards of  most hampton inns. Very very small room. Old. Few outlets in room. Small desk pushed half into wall. No other chair in room.If you recently lost a lot of your pubes send me an email.  I found them...they're in the bathtub of room 425.I am a huge fan of Hampton Inn because I have stayed at so many that each one is better than the last.  This one is no different. Room was clean and didn't smell bad. Plenty of towels in the room.Breakfast is free. I love the waffles.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Memphis Airport - Conf Ctr
review_content: Nice hotel, room was clean and comfy, staff very nice. Probably one of the prettier HI I have been to recently. The walls seem really thin, though, as this is the first HI I have stayed at where I woke up to my neighbor's alarm, and left the TV on while working in the evening so that i wouldn't hear the neighbor on the phone...Loud slamming doors throughout day and night, low water pressure, barely any hot water, several members of our large group became sick from eating at their restaurant. Started to get a sinus infection/allergy reaction from their AC system. House keeping made it seem like it was a privilege to have our room cleaned and made minimal effort at the process.  They were probably the source of most of the doors slamming.Without going into details, our group had to stay there. If it were my choice, I'd never go back again.Attended a conference at this hotel. Recent renovations which were nice but the staff was awful. The conference rooms were hot & the air was not working; the manager took forever to try and assist and still did nothing when found. The maintenance guy was amazing and found fans for the grand ballroom to comfort us a little. The bedrooms were nice but some of the other conference rooms had ants crawling on the floor and a large container of trash was left at the end of the hallway for almost 2 days until the manager finally came to move it after all of our complaints. Lastly, it rained while there and the entry way and conf room #9 or 10 the ceiling dang near fell in (see pics).  Upon booking our conference at this hotel, we were promised none of these situations would happen and everything crashed once we arrived. I wouldn't advise this hotel for any conference and only an overnight stay if stuck in Memphis for a day or 2.  2 stars goes to the maintenance guy and the upgrades to the guest rooms.I have stayed in Holiday Inn hotels all over the US and other countries, they are one of my favorites. However, after staying at this location for SEVERAL days,  not sure I want to stay with Holiday Inn again. Convenient to the airport, YES but services and cleanliness.... Not so much! Not to mention the NOISE and no I'm not talking about planes, I'm talking about the slamming of doors constantly, the "questionable " people coming in and out of the lower floors, the LOUD music of "somebody " dropping off or picking up "people"....... I am not usually afraid at a hotel but this one, sure do wish I had some protection.Really outdated for the price. I took a cold shower and the front desk girls were more interested in talking about where they had their "nails did" then to correct the issue. I was only letting them know so the next person didn't have to take a cold shower on a chilly morning. It was really noisy come 3:00am with people slamming doors and hanging out in the main lobby. I arrived around 12:00am and it was pretty scary out in the parking lot. I did see a security guard that was smoking out front but he didn't seem very concerned about my safety. I also had to roll up a towel as there was a really big gap under the main door to my room. Anyone could have looked under it.  I will say I did get a free breakfast coupon from a lady behind the counter that saw that my complaints went unnoticed. It was very convenient from the airport. The bed was really pretty comfortable once you get past all the late night debauchery.This is by far the worst Holiday Inn do not expect to be able to load a webpage because the wifi is so slow and if you're hungry I would think about eating somewhere else do not expect to get what you ordered or a correct meal.   And make sure you lock up your personal items if you leave your room we had one of our coworkers have his wedding ring stolen out of his room also on two different occasions I noticed that they had gone through my bags while I was out.  We stayed here for over three weeks for work.  After enough complaints our company finally moved us out of there.This hotel was good enough if you're unexpectedly stuck in Memphis. The hotel needs updates in general; it is old and outdated.  My the bathtub was so filthy that I didn't even consider taking a shower.  Even if I wanted to shower hot water was not an option.  The water was ice cold!  The room was either freezing cold or sweltering.  The blinds in the room did not close so I was awake with the sun. The breakfast was less than appetizing so I kept my $11 and waited to find some food at the airport. If it weren't for the extremely nice staff, this place would be a zero. The people who work here absolutely save this place. They are helpful, attentive and friendly. The management better hang on to each and every one of them!  Take the airport shuttle! The driver, Brian, will having you laughing the whole way!I chose this hotel because the pictures online looked promising. Boy was I wrong. Right when you arrive, there is a security guard with a badge who is waiving off many homeless people (this is a rough neighborhood). I walked in regardless because I had to fly out the next morning and this is close to the airport (it's one virtue). The concierge and reception has three incompetent and lazy people. Two were chatting with maintenance people and feigning busy demeanors. The third was gossiping with a friend on her cell phone and rudely told me "I'm busy. Wait ten minutes."  When I finally got a key, the door was jammed and would not open. A maintenance man used his right shoulder to force it open with serious force. He then said "it is not budged" in slurred words as he stumbled. Given his glazed and blood shot eyes, I have to assume he was drunk or on something. Moreover, he was staring at my luggage, as if to steal it. Given that I arrived around 9pm and was too tired after two flights to switch hotels, I decided to suck it up. I will never go back. Stay in downtown, the 15 minute uber ride is worth your time and money.Wow what a beautiful place. It was not looking so good a few years ago. But now this place looks amazing.  The food is top notch. And in a hotel. Wow. Simply amazy.Terrible! Will NOT be going back! Service is nearly non-existent. Stayed for 2 days. Asked for clean towels at the end of the first day, because the room came with 3 and we're a 4 person family. Was told sure, no problem. Towels were never brought. Called again in the morning around 7:30, was told I have to wait for housekeeping to come in at 8:30. Ok. Towels still never brought.  Walk down to the desk to ask about the pool and ask for towels. She said the pool was closed and she'd have towels brought to our room. No sign anywhere in the hotel about the pool being closed. And STILL NO TOWELS. "Recent remodel." Our bathroom faucet was so loose, you had to hold it in place with one hand and turn it on with the other. Otherwise it just moved the whole thing. There was no ventilation in the bathroom, so if you took a hot shower, it steamed up the whole room. The door didn't line up, so if you wanted to lock the dead bolt, you had to push it in with a shoulder while you turned it. On the plus side, it was relatively clean. We were on the first floor, so didn't hear any planes from the airport. Lots of parking lot cameras and security patrolling, so it didn't feel terribly unsafe, even though it wasn't the best neighborhood. And the staff was polite and tried to be helpful. Just didn't seem terribly confident. Do yourself a favor, pick another hotel.Old hotel. Tried a renovation but still feels old. My door won't close when I leave unless I put the key in to unlock the door then shut. The faucet in my room only exhausts hot water. It's an odd hotel. Feels musty. Wouldn't suggest.Nice new hotel. Rooms are modern. Gym was awesome. It's got a huge space in the basement with stationary bikes, spin bikes, treadmills, weight equip, and free weights. While the equipment was very new, some were not working properly but overall it's a great space. Had a quick dinner at the restaurant/bar. Had great veggie quesilldias and was served quickly. Rooms aren't fully sound proof and being next to the airport is a bit loud, but if you're here for convenience of being close to the airport, it's fine. There's an on demand shuttle to the airport 24 hours a day, which is super convenient. I'd totally stay here again if I were traveling for business.Hotel itself is nice but the food at the restaurant is ghastly and overpriced. The breakfast buffet is over 10 dollars and everything is over cooked. I also had dinner there I had the salmon it was grey and rubbery. Soda from the fountain is flat and 2.50. I wouldn't stay here unless you have a car to drive to get some food.

hotel_name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Memphis I-240 & Perkins
review_content: Stayed here for one night during my road trip... check-in was easy... friendly staff... things that needs to be worked on...- water pressure in the shower and the sink- elevator - was scary riding the elevator, it was shaking as it stopped as if it was about to drop- exercise room - granted it was small, but it was dirty- wifi is slower then turtleOverall, I would stay here again, but I hope they will spend some time and money for some improvements.  The beds were very soft, but good enough to spend the night.This is a nice hotel with a very friendly staff. I believe her name is Jasmine she was very great. When I was stupid multiple days in a row and could not get on the Wi-Fi she helped me.Overall the facility is clean and the rooms are nice and comfortable. They have a great breakfast spread in the morning. I've seen bigger spread that other Marriott but this was a small hotel and they had a nice amount for their population.  Their gym on site is tiny. But they have a coupon for you to go to another gym for a week pass. Someone else's review said the gym was in walking distance. I have no idea where the gym was because when I looked on the computer it would like it was 10 miles away. I'm not driving 10 miles to go to the gym. So that would have been nice to actually use but oh well. Depending on what you're doing their location is great. Super close to the airport and easy to get to. And really not too far from the heart of Memphis and lots of the touristy things to do. Nice job overallConsidered a rough neighborhood in Memphis, but seemed safe enough to me -- and I've traveled nationwide. Everything was fine. But you can tell it used to be a lesser brand property -- their cosmetic and management changes can't conceal the fact that the walls and floors/ceilings are thin and that the hallways are narrow. But, hey, the price is right, the location is good, and it's true to the quality of a Marriot Fairfield. I would stay here again.We're staying here during vacation. They don't have enough towels, the non-smoking rooms smell like smoke, the pool is disgusting and our room wasn't cleaned until almost 4pm. I was told there aren't enough towels because they keep being stolen, maintenance doesn't work weekends so the pool is untreated and no one knew why housekeeping didn't come after being called 3 times. The positive, the breakfast isn't bad and there is plenty of parking.I complained to Marriott about the poor service. The hotel manager took $10 off our bill.I stay over 75 nights out per year and this is by far the nastiest marriott I have been to in a long time. The positive is the staff were very kind. The negative is that this hotel has not been updated since Bill Clinton was in the White House!  The ac unit only partially worked and there was mildew in the bathroom. An overall tell tale is that the two front doors are hard to open. I'm surprised Marriott allows this hotel to be in this condition!Staying one night to catch an early flight in Memphis.  Terrible wifi, poor toilet pluming, worst fitness center ever.  The room is comfortable and clean.  That's all.It has the comfort and cleanliness that you would expect from a budget Marriott. I have stayed here twice.. Reason: Business TripPros:Good location if you are conducting business lat one of the many DC locations in OBranchShares a partnership with a neighboring gym, in walkable distanceRestrooms and beds are clean, and staff is friendlyFree breakfastCons:Decor and aestheticsBeds feel cheap (but clean)Parking can be tough if the hotel is at capacity and the neighboring gym is busy..Traveling across states for work... Decent value for the rate (used Hotwire). They also had pretty decent breakfast. Even had walnuts as condiment to accompany cereals.Stayed here twice during my recent road trip, on the way to PA and on the way back.The only issue I saw was that parking could get tight if they get really busy.Service by the staff was great.  The room (yes, I had the same room twice) was clean, quiet (even though next to the elevator) and comfy.I'll be back on my next trip through Memphis.This place is a dump. the rooms appear to be nice and clean but they are very damp and dingy. Upon check in I had to get my room switched twice until I finally found a room that I  could get into and once I was able to get into the room that the air conditioning worked. The bathrooms are pretty well used and not taken care of and there isn't much near the hotel as far as food options. The area is actually pretty unsafe and I would bet you can find a better deal in safer area.1. The gym is full of gnats. I HAD to run after a day of tough work and it was the worst (short) run ever. 2. It took me ten minutes to get the shower on. Plus five minutes to figure out the temperature because the knob is broken. 3. I can't turn the shower off. I called and they don't seem concerned and I'm still waiting. 4. I would like to sleep at some point tonight and I am not pleased!!40 bucks off Priceline name your own price. Clean, with pool and gym, free parking, free breakfast, free wifi! Great bang for your buckVery clean, manager was VERY accommodating and the staff was very friendly.As usual the Fairfield didn't disappoint!! The room was clean, the staff was friendly, the breakfast was satisfying and the shower head pressure was wonderful after being on the road all day and most of the night.Do not stay here!!! We were robbed traveling through to Florida and they did nothing to help but shrug there shoulders!!!

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Memphis East-Sycamore View
review_content: I've never had bad luck so far with La Quinta's before. Their pet policy is perfect as I was traveling across country with two cats and this was the last night before a 10 hour drive I had to make the next day. Rooms were clean and safe for pets. I even had a personal note from the lady who set up the room for me! I'd stay with this hotel chain again. Especially with their outstanding pet policy.The price was reasonable, the location worked for my travels and the staff is very nice -- but I found a live cockroach in the bathroom. I mentioned it quietly to the front desk clerk and he was apologetic, saying the manager would probably contact me and adjust my rate. I didn't hear from anyone at the hotel, so when I checked out I mentioned to the front desk clerk on duty that day. She too was apologetic and said she'd let their maintenance person know.This was my second stay at the property, but will probably be the last.If I could give it no stars, I would. This had to be the worst customer service I've ever experienced. After waking up to find our car missing from the lot, the young girl at the counter was completed unapologetic and even laughed at us a few times. She also proceeded to keep switching up her story as to why it was towed away. We asked her several questions out of liability and she refused to tell us her name (we got it anyways).As my wife and I approached the hotel, she had a sense of deja vu. It turns out that she had stayed here before with family a long time ago although the lobby pool she recalled was replaced by a breakfast area. This hotel was conveniently located less than a mile from I-40 on a strip of other budget-to-moderate level hotels. The immediate surroundings weren't very attractive but I did not feel unsafe.Our accessible room looked good but there were some issues getting on the very high mattress. We called the front desk who seemed to know this was an chronic problem as they had a stepstool on standby for guests to use. The hotel staff did bring up the stepstool promptly.The free breakfast had a nice variety. I was very disappointed in the fitness center, a tiny box with maybe two pieces of old cardio equipment. I would recommend this property to people with long legs who are not intimidated by typical urban surroundings. The staff may not be able to help the location but they need to lower the height of the bed and mattress.I checked out early in the morning and wrote the following review 5 hours ago, within minutes after i left the hotel.  The guy at the front just called to ask us to return the pillow we took otherwise he would charge $15 for it.  He said the hpusekeeper couldnt locate 6th pillow in the room.  Well, this one did it.  I moved a star from the review.  Also, we moved the 6th pillow into the closet.  I guess they dont clean the closets!--- original review written at 8 am ----Staying here made me sad.  Really dirty and very unpleasant.  First the hotel called me in the morning and asked when we were coming in.  I told them at 5 but we ended up coming in at 3.  She told us since i said i wad coming in late they didnt clean the room yet and that they were taking time to do so.  That was pretty bizzarre.As far as ratings go - It had a good rating on trip advisor when i  booked it.  I only checked reviews on yelp when i was checking in.  That was a mistake, yelp was right. The lobby was a bit outdated when i was checking in but cleanish.  The staff was friendly so i thought was ok until i went in the room.  Everything was outdated dusty and dirty.  The only thing they seem to do is pick up trash and change bed with old bedsheets.  Pretty bad.  The bedsheet made me itchy all night.  I scratched my feet until they bled.  The bed sheet got blood on it which made me realize what brown stains on bedsheet were.  Shower curtain smelled musty.  They prob dont wash that as often as they should.Breakfast was ready at 6.  They had waffles cereal pastry etc made me think oh at least one thing look decent.  I couldnt b more wrong.  Sausage tasted freezer burn n cold.  Waffle smelled and tasted a bit old. Boiled egg was soaked in vinegar.  The only things edible were banana, pastry and cereal.This hotel was pretty bad.  We paid over $100here which only deserved to be a $60 motel.  This place seemed to be family owned.. or i could be being a racist.  I would say stay away from this hotel but it looks like many motels in memphis are like this.  All mearby motels looked outdated and sad like this one.On my way back to Texas, after a long 15+ hour drive from NYC, I needed a place to stay. It was important the hotel I stayed at accepted pets with a reasonable fee. My feline traveling companion was tired and edgy too-- carrier fever. This La Quinta was perfect!! It was non-smoking, clean and affordable. A big plus, No pet fee! Which proved a clean-pet-accepting hotel doesn't need a huge non-refundable fee. In my opinion kids can be worse in destruction of property and noise than pets.Kudos to the front desk person, Pratima. She is warm and friendly. My only complaint is the bed is too high. I had to be careful getting off it when nature called in the middle of the night (I know TMI). However, it was very comfortable once resting on it. Hope this helps!Really good experience. Everything's clean And organized. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. Who else would run out and greet us to show us where to park our Uhaul?! Breakfast was pretty good and not messy. They had biscuits and gravy and sausage. Waffles. Cereal. Yummy pastries. Fresh fruit. This hotel had the best shower ever plus a high quality shower head with multiple settings. Bed was pretty comfortable. TV had all the channels and picture was good.We are on a 6 week trip and stay in LaQuinta Inns all across the nation. This is the worst. I reserved a handicapped king and was told the reservation came into their system as a double. We are celebrating our wedding anniversary!!! Why would I reserve a double room (which I have never done!). The room smells. I am handicapped and they put us on the 2nd floor, a great inconvenience even with an elevator. There was a blood stain found on my sheet.They would do nothing when I voiced my complaints. I couldn't breathe this morning because of the wet dog smell, due to allergies.This will make me rethink our next hotel stay. I am appalled! Can't wait for the survey.Stayed here for two nights while in town. Probably the best customer service I've ever had at a hotel. Staff was friendly and attentive. After I checked in the front desk called a little while later just to check to see if everything was satisfactory. Additionally, during breakfast there was an employee walking from table to table welcoming people and checking that everything was ok again. No issues, everything was great. Only reason I'm not giving five stars is that the neighborhood is a little iffy, but not that bad...I'm glad to see some people still care about the customer experience!Other bonus to the hotel is that there's no extra pet fee (I travel all over North America with my dog and this is rare).Traveling from Kentucky from Texas we chose to stay at LaQuinta Suites. We love their pet policy. After staying in this one off of 12C Sycamore we have never been more disgusted. Upon arriving to the room I showered and was preparing to get into my bed when I noticed hairs and a reddish color stain in my bed. Not just any hair but what appears to be pubic hair. I do not have any idea what the reddish colored stain was. They offered another room which when the beds were inspected I found another stain on one of the beds. It was obvious the sheets had not been washed since my husband took the key card and some of the stain started scraping off. The final room was ok. If I had not have taken my sleep  medication my family and I would have left immediately. I am very disappointed with this establishment. The attempt to redo the hotel are lacking in the upstairs rooms considerably. The downstairs is ok but it is obvious the job was rushed and you can see the chipped tables. I give one star because I did think the fireplace area minus the chipped tables was nice and modern not like the rooms. I should also mention that the hallway smelled of urine. The rooms however smelled fine.Holy cow this place is disgusting. Lipstick on a pig, they've tried to cover up problems with some redecorating  but the awful smell, the stained and broken ceiling tiles, the old AC, the endless and stupid rules (no entry through side doors, $250 fine if you leave your pup while you go out to dinner...) I would never, ever, ever stay here again. There is plenty more to say but I'm too frustrated to say so right now. Avoid this disgusting hotel...Recently remodeled, very clean.  Exceeded my expectations. Very comfy bed. Parking very tight, no room for anything with a trailer, no truck or RV parking. You'll have to find a spot in the street or somewhere else. But the hotel is very nice. Had one issue with the room AC unit. 3 am the fan started making a squealing noise. But that my only issue with the place. I'd stay there again.While traveling across country with pets, especially cats, it is often difficult to find decent hotels to accommodate your needs. La Quinta, with the exception of a few properties, are generally very happy to accommodate pets and, they do so without charge.After traveling across country for five days, this was the last night of our five day trip. We seriously needed a good bed in a secure room that was clean, comfortable and affordable. The La Quinta in Memphis East-Sycamore View was just the ticket.Our room was large, modern, clean and comfortable. It was furnished with a large wide screen TV, a microwave, coffee bar and refrigerator. Everything was fresh, smelled clean and looked brand new. And the beds were better than some I have slept in at hotels charging $200 or more a night! In fact, over the years, I have come to experience some of the best beds in the hotel industry at La Quintas.But the best thing about the stay is this: they accepted my kitty, and we all know that a happy kitty means a happy trip the following day.Thank you La Quinta ... you continue to be at the top of my travel list.Nice stay. Clean. Staff nice. Remote for tv was chewed by a dog who had previously stayed there. No real complaints tho. I'd stay again.Stayed here overnight while on a road trip.  I like La Quinta since they are dog friendly and have comfy beds.  This location also had great reviews on Tripadvisor. Maybe I got a bad room, but it had an overwhelming smell of mildew that really grossed me out.  The smell even bothered me while sleeping.  The entire room was visibly unlevel.  The floor/wall carpet trim was all completely pulled away from the wall.  Reviews said this location was having renovations, I didn't notice any, but my room clearly needed it.  It was an ADA room and I'm guessing it has been possibly flooded before.  The shower didn't drain completely due to being unlevel and I could hear large amounts of water draining in the wall, from 2nd floor, but it didn't sound like it was going thru the pipes.  Not worth $80 for the night.  In hindsight I wish I had asked to switch rooms.I stayed 3 nights here Oct.12-15. I was on the 4th floor. It was very quiet and clean. The front desk clerk and managers were very friendly and concerned about me having a good stay. It is close to the interstate.The housekeeping staff was also nice.. I will return next time I am in town.very clean room, super friendly and helpful staff, wonderful beds and tv. our first room had a broken door lock so we called the staff and they came immediately and helped us switch rooms. we had difficulty accessing the wifi and again a staff member promptly came to the room and helped us get on wifi. not a huge area to walk the dog, but adequate near parking lot in the rear. we did not use the pool but it is indoors and looked nice. the breakfast provided was plentiful (better than other La Quintas) and the area in which to eat was pretty. somewhat out of the way for us but from reviews it was a better choice than other La Quintas in Memphis.For pet friendly places I dont think you can beat La Quintas!I think it was good. Everything worked and the pool as well. It wa very quite.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Memphis Medical Center Midtown
review_content: Located in Midtown, this hotel is a good value, however the rooms are outdated. My room in particular had a very musty smell when I first enters it. The staff however was fabulous and very helpful. Breakfast is hot and complimentary in the morning so make sure to take advantage of that. Overall, a good hotel if you're staying for one night on business like I was. If you're coming for a vacation, I would recommend staying downtown.I am truly, truly shocked at the one and two star reviews on here.  We had an outstanding visit, stayed in a quiet room, non-smoking, with a microwave, fridge and coffee machine (requested prior to the stay).The room was spotless.  No smelly anything - however, we did ask them not to use air freshener only because it didn't need freshening.  It was very, very clean.  Got professional front desk service from Darren who is an asset to the Holiday Inn organization.  Good interpersonal skills and very professional person.  I hope the brass at the Holiday Inn appreciate his professionalism and ability to make everyone feel welcome.Breakfast was varied:   had healthy choices, low-fat milk, bran flakes, good quality Greek yoghurts and fruit. Pancakes, bacon for those not on a diet.  Lots of options - we ate well here in the mornings, no doubt about it.I am still baffled by the poor reviews for this property.  We have stayed all over the world, and this location was without a doubt one of the best ever.  Clean, quiet, no "smell" ... and the most comfortable bed imaginable.  Loved it.What can I say.  When we got there, we were informed that they had a water leak which caused some of the rooms to flood so they only had smoking rooms.  I had tried to book at other hotels with no luck for some time so I already knew there were no vacancies. The room smelled horrible and was filthy. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.Will not come back staff was rude... Our check in time was 3pm didn't get our rooms until after 5 (due to a housekeeping shortage) the 4 people standing behind the desk didn't seem to mind they where to busy joking with one another and playing on. There phones.. When we did get our rooms the beds where awful the AC UNIT was extremely noisy. Awful experience!Spartan accommodations.   Requested two double beds.   Got a room with one full size bed.  Bed is very uncomfortable.   Light switches don't work. Lobby was clean and relatively well appointed though.Poor wifi connection, smelly room, not as clean as the Holiday Inn Express we stayed in the previous night. Breakfast was exactly like all the other hotels. The carpet baseboard was stapled on, like you would use your office stapler...... nuff said.I don't understand the bad reviews for this place.  Our group stayed here at the end of September for Gonerfest, and I am giving this place 5 stars because while it was exactly what we needed, they actually exceeded our expectations.  The staff was friendly, hospitable, and really went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed.  There was free, fresh coffee in the lobby every morning, including breakfast (we only made it early enough once!) that included fresh fruit, yogurt, sausage, eggs, and waffles.  The first day, I arrived extremely early, and they stored my baggage for me so I could go and take the trolley (which is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel) into Downtown to explore.  As a side note, if you are staying here, I highly recommend doing this!!!  It's a great way to explore the town.Our room was spotlessly clean, and I know this because I always check everywhere in the room before I even put my clothes away.  We were able to walk barefoot on the carpets in our room, and our feet were clean.  The beds were comfortable, with quality linens and several comfortable pillows.  The AC was on and healthily kicking out cold air... almost too much, we had to turn it down so we wouldn't freeze -- I consider that a very good thing, especially in humid Memphis weather.All in all, this is going to be our go-to place for Gonerfest every year.  The friendly staff, cleanliness, price, and proximity to everything made this the perfect spot to rest our heads between all the craziness.Stayed here for one night. The room was nice and clean. The bathroom had Bath & Body Works products! The bed was really comfortable with nice pillows. The room was kind of small, but it worked. The wifi sucked. They give free cookies and popcorn around 4 each day which was nice! The lobby was very nice! The breakfast had a large variety! Overall, it was a good hotel. But the wifi could've been better.Nice room, clean plenty of pillows, coffee maker in room. Musty odor on arrival. Staff friendly helpful. Good breakfast included with pancakes eggs etc. free wi fi!Go somewhere else.We were in Memphis for two nights. As we pulled up I knew then, I should have gone elsewhere. The Elvis Presley convention was in town!! Hotels were full. This is an outdated hotel.  Two stars were for the nice and attentive staff.  Small rooms, dirt in cracks! Love Beal St! But I we will never stay here again!I stayed at this hotel in mid-May. Between 7:00 and 9:30 at night both my car and my brother-in-law's cars were broken into while parked in the hotel parking lot. It cost me almost $900 in damages. No apology or offer of reimbursement from anyone connected with hotel. The police that came told me they were frequently called to the hotel parking lot...burglary was a common occurrence. As I was checking out, a couple were distraught as they said someone broke into their room and stole her gold earrings. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.When we were looking for something with a decent price and near the downtown area, we found this hotel. Being on Union Street, in midtown, it is centrally located for a night on Beale Street or dining around uptown.The staff was very helpful and the morning buffet breakfast was substantial for an "express" hotel. As Jenna mentioned, the breakfast is carb heavy, but if you stick to eggs and bacon/sausage along with your carbs, you'll be fine. Consider the oatmeal or cereal & skim milk instead of the cinnamon rolls! Over all, my trip here was pleasant and offered a nice bed at a decent price. The free wifi made evenings tolerable. If you're staying here to be close to someone in the nearby hospitals, be sure to let them know. They give discounts for those types of situations.Dirty room. Tiny bathroom had very little counter space. Mold in bath tub. Air conditioner never cooled the room down. Would not stay here again. They were also supposed to use my club points and didn't/ wouldn't. Very small room.Pretty bad experience so far.  Currently sitting in the lobby.  Got here and went to my room.  Heat didn't work.  I came down to the lobby an hour ago because they said they could move me to a different room.  1 hour later, here I sit.  "The computer system crashed."   Nice staff but not a great Holiday Inn on any other level.Very impressed. My bed reminded me of Marriott -- down comforter, plenty of feather pillows, firm but soft mattress, crisp white sheets, and completely fresh. Free wifi and expanded (free) continental breakfast, including the usual carbs (cereal, bagels, pastries, bread, muffins) as well as scrambled eggs, bacon, biscuits and gravy, yogurt, and hard-boiled eggs. Since these three things (bed, internet, breakfast) matter the most to me, Holiday Inn Express was perfect in these respects and earned a loyal customer here.Other Pros:  1)  Housekeeping and front desk staff were friendly. 2)  The hotel is on Union Ave, where you are surrounded by restaurants, businesses, and stores, and you are in close proximity to Downtown. 3) If you need the medical center, it is literally across the street.Cons:  1) Patients being released (ie, mental health) wander around the area and sometimes go into the hotel asking for stuff from the front desk. They are promptly kicked out, but they are still present. I asked why this happened, and apparently the hospital calls rides for patients being discharged, but then they won't let the patients wait for those rides in the hospital. So the patients just walk across the street to the hotel. Interesting.  2) The homeless are abundant here and approach your car anytime you go through drive-thrus. 3) My hotel room was crammed with stuff: couch, coffee table, work table, TV center, stand-alone closet, bench to sit on, and the bed. Further, the TV center and closet's doors swung out into the room, so that the 2 feet of walking space between ends of the room was completely taken up. In other words, it was difficult to maneuver through the room because there was just no walking space. 4) My reservation rate stated that I would receive a microwave and refrigerator, but neither was in my room. (This turned out to be OK because of the quality breakfast options, but still. I think I paid extra for them.)Anyway, I will definitely stay at HIE next time I'm in Memphis.

Stayed here on a Saturday night. The hotel is very nice very clean. The staff is very friendly and are eager to help you. We really enjoyed the indoor pool and indoor whirlpool. It was nice that there was just us in the pool section. The breakfast didn't start until 7:00 but they had it out at around 6:30. So the lady in the front desk told us we could go ahead and eat if we'd like to. Breakfast was delicious. Waffle maker is good as well.  It's not a big selection, but what they do have is good.Very nice hotel just a little outside of Memphis right off the freeway. The neighborhood seemed to be a little iffy at first, but where the hotel is at its safe. The high end cars in the parking lot helped me realize this was ok.Staff is very friendly, even though I booked the wrong date, the staff corrected my mess up and gave us a very nice room.I recommend this hotel!!!!!Fairfield Inn is located off of I-40, several miles east of the city. It's great if you're just driving through (as we were), but not ideal for those staying to explore Memphis. They've got a large parking lot that has plenty of room for trucks and RVs. It's odd that the fron entrance is facing the highway instead of where the street entrance is located.When we checked in late (around 8 or 9pm) there was only one person working the front desk. There were several people in front of me, and a few who made it known they weren't happy. The girl working the desk kept her cool and handled everyone as quickly as possible and maintained a smile the whole time. There's no way I could have pulled that off if I were in her shoes.Our twin full-bed room (no double queens here) was small and no-frills. No mini-fridge or microwave, just the basic stuff like a dresser, desk and TV. Not bad if you just need a place to crash for the night and you're on a budget.Staff was super friendly.  Room was great.  Doesn't seem busy and doing some construction so the upgraded our room.  Signs said construction to be complete Feb 2015.  Hopefully the renovations include the elevator to match the quality of the new rooms.  Also Breakfast lobby area was kind of small.This place was AMAZING! Everything was remodeled just recently!!! Friendly staff too. We ran late and missed breakfast but the staff let us get some food and was very thoughtful. On our road trip, we stayed at over 6 different hotels and this place was by far our favorite. It is extremely clean and quiet. At first we were a bit put off by the entrance of the hotel because it goes through the back. We automatically assumed it would be a shabby place but once we got into the lobby and our room, we were ecstatic! The room was spacious and bright and nicely decorated. The front desk is so sweet. We purposefully planned our trip so that we would be able to stop by here again. If you're ever in Memphis, please check this place out. The price is amazing for this kind of service and room. $109 (As of late July) The other places were more expensive and was a disappointment after staying here.Really bottom end of the Marriott chain!!! As another reviewer stated "this place really gives Marriott a black eye!!" and I certainly agree!!The hotel is filthy and smells like pool Chlorine as soon as you walk in the door! My room on the second floor was suppose to be non-smoking but reeked of cigarettes.The office style room chair at the desk was incredibly stained by God knows what and should have been pulled from service I'm guessing years ago.Our company went to CLC to save on hotel expense and I have stayed a some very nice properties but this sure isn't one of them.I posted a few pictures to bolster my review.Note: The Office Manager on duty was very nice.Man this place is sooooooo hit and miss...i have one good stay at this location and two bad ones...including this one....so here goes...i show up and get my reservation...the young lady who checks me in doesn't even bother to check my platinum elite membership...and she doesnt tell me about my reward points until i ask about them and all she says is yeah they are there and doesn't give me an option on what i would like to do with them... she doesn't give me the platinum key cards she give me the regular one and puts me on the first floor...so i think to myself whatever...we go to check in the room and it smells like somebody has been train smoking in there...then we come back out and ask for a different room where she says no problem again not checking what my status is....so i ask her do you not give out the platinum key cards any more and she thats when she looks at the status and says we do...then gives the excuse...its about that time for me to go...so i guess that constitutes bad customer service....so i also asked for late night restaurants and she procedes to tell me about fast food places...which are not restaurants...if i wanted fast food places thats what i would have asked for....so we go to our room change and come back down and i asked her about a cab and she says they usually take 10 mins if they are in the area then goes back to what she was doing...usually i get offered to call a cab...so whoever she was does not need to be at the front desk...maybe cleaning is more her alley where she dont have to interact with customers and or provide customer service!!!This place was one of our stops on our road trip back to Cali... Using my Marriot Points 10,000 to be exact I secured us a King Suite, on arrival we found that the staff had upgrade all the King Suites away to other guests... Not worried about that and not acting a fool like some might... The Hotel Manager offered me the Jacuzzi Suite instead... Cool right??? Yeah the fact that My Platinum status probably factored into that doesn't bother me at all so we accepted...So the rest of the night is spent in a nicely cleaned Jacuzzi with Beer & My Baby :)Room: Very CleanJacuzzi: SpotlessStaff: FriendlyCheck In & Out: PainlessIn all fairness, this was a clean, comfortable hotel. It's also not a Fairfield by Marriott although it appears that the management is making efforts to bring it up. It appears that this hotel started life as a Sleep Inn or similar andwas bought by Marriott.  My room appeared to have improved linens as well as the tub and surround.  The sink had not been done yet, nor had the bedroom furnishings.  The lobby has been upgraded. If you're looking for a Sleep Inn/Days Inn experience with a nice breakfast in a not-so-nice part of town, this is your place. If you're looking for a Fairfield by Marriott, this isn't it, not quite yet. Unfortunately, I'm not sure the property will lend itself to fully reaching what I'd expect from a Fairfield. Regarding someone reporting bars on the windows of the motel next door: those are decorative diamond-shaped dividers from the '80's when that was in.  Nothing more.   Yep, there's a huge dark parking lot behind the hotel. And yep, there's a large freeway right next to the hotel. I was treated to the sound of a semi blowing a tire at 6:00 AM. The windows are not well soundproofed, so it's going to be loud if you're on that side. And the "freshening" scented spray. Oh my. Disgusting. Don't bring your allergies. One of our group had a ripping sinus headache the next morning because of it.Bought a room on priceline and was thoroughly pleased. Room was clean, breakfast had a nice mix or hot/cold foods available. A little out of the way from downtown but not too far. Only downside was when we tried to locate the hotel on google maps, it directed us to a location that was 30 mins away on Macon Road, not Macon Cove...but have since rectified it. Would stay again.This place isn't great, but it isn't all that terrible.Location is not the best, with a gigantic, empty parking lot in front of it - we thought the place was closed when we first arrived! Pretty far from some parts of Memphis, but you'd have to pay more for a closer location.Room wasn't bad- fairly clean (except for stains all over the desk chair - yuck!). Our friends were across the hall and they had a mini fridge in their room, whereas we did not; but we booked the same style of room.The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful when we went to get towels and then toilet paper - still unsure where housekeeping was and why they never visited our room!!Ugh. We stay at Fairfield Inns a lot. This is the worse one by far. It gives Marriot a black eye. The entrance of the hotel was . . . in back? Our room smell like someone used an entire spray can of Febreeze. The grout in the bathroom tile didn't exist in spots--not fun with bare feet.And the breakfast was a joke. How do you mess up cereal? Well, you keep the milk in a mini fridge that doesn't work. Yum yum . . . Raisin Bran with luke warm milk!When I was in college, I stayed at a hotel worse than this one because I forgot to book a reservation. However, as an adult, we booked a reservation at a reputable hotel, and this literally stunk. I personally would go another few exits before stopping for the night. Honestly all the hotels at this exit looked a little slummy--this is probably the best of the bunch. That was the *only* reason I gave this two stars.I seriously have no clue where these 4 and 5 star ratings are coming from with the other guests. That is crazy.I stay almost exclusively at Marriott brand hotels and enjoy staying at them but this one is so nasty I will be sure to avoid it in the futureI stayed here for one night last week.  I chose this hotel because of the poor ratings for the Courtyard the next exit up.  I was also told by a friend that the Courtyard was only fair and that there were not many restaurants nearby.  I agree with Doug, the previous reviewer, the location is awful. So much so that when I pulled up to the hotel I almost called and canceled my reservation from the parking lot.   I decided that it was only one night and I would give it a try.  Once inside it was comparable to many other properties.  It was clean, relatively new and the staff was nice and professional.  The free breakfast idea was nice but the eating area was so small and crowded that I had to take my breakfast back to my room to eat. The location is a little menacing but other than that it was OK.  On my next trip to Memphis I'll stay at the Courtyard.Fairfield Inn & Suites Memphis is a hotel on the low end of the Marriott spectrum of brands. I stayed here two nights in August for a business meeting. I am a loyal Marriott customer, and I belong to the Marriott affinity program. I usually avoid Fairfield hotels, but I had few choices because I booked at the last minute during the anniversary of the death of Elvis. This event, attended by people from all over the world, never made my radar as I was getting ready to go to Memphis for the first time.OMG, this hotel was bad. I suppose it would be okay if you drove up, went into the hotel and never went out. That way you could pretend away it's failings.It is located off the freeway on a dead-end street at the end of a huge asphalt parking lot populated by big rig trucks. So much for a beautiful setting. The slum motel next door has bars on the windows, which was a little scary.  More scary was the rat that rushed me one morning while I walked around the property. Also, I returned to the hotel one afternoon to find that the coffee maker had not been cleaned. Other than that Mrs. Lincoln, how did you like the play?The only plus is that they serve Jimmy Dean sausage biscuits for breakfast, which they advertise on their website. Apparently the rats like the Jimmy Dean biscuits as much as I do. (Review based on one visit.)

hotel_name: Hampton Inn Memphis/Walnut Grove/Baptist Hospital East
review_content: We came to Memphis to see the city.  We didn't realize the hotel would be far removed from the areas we were wanting to visit,  so if you think it's a hop,  skip  and jump downtown, find somewhere else to stay. The traffic will frustrate you. The hotel itself was quiet.  We started on the 4th floor and never heard a peep, even on New years eve.  The room was adequate. No refrigerator. The air unit had been changed out, but the carpet had not and there was a large gap of exposed flooring in the room.  Again,  not a major concern but shows a lack of attention to detail.  The hotel could use a little basic maintenance and updating.  Otherwise,  it worked for our needs.Good solid Hampton inn clean and friendly all the usual Hampton Inn amenities excellent stay I recommend this great prices tooI've stayed here three times so far. No bad experience yet. Fly he front desk staff has always been very nice, professional, helpful, and friendly. The rooms have always been clean and neat.  This hotel is usually pretty quiet. The prices are reasonable. There is a gas station and Wendy's restaurant in walking distance. Most places for food will require you to drive. A lot of people stop here due to its location by the hospital. It's the perfect spot if you are going to Baptist hospital or the West Clinic.I stayed at the Hampton Inn on a business trip to Memphis, and this place was great. The location was a mere 10 minutes from the cool downtown district and it was right off the highway so it was very easy getting to. It was located right near an office park, so there was a good amount of restaurants across the street for me to grab a bit. I love Hampton Inns because they have fruit and water available when I first walk in, and this one was no exception. It's the little things that make a stay much easier and more comfortable, especially on a business trip. Hampton Inn has earned my loyalty. This room was clean and quiet. Everything I needed. They had a good breakfast in the morning, and a workout room, which I always try to hit up when I'm on the road. They were pretty busy when I arrived, and often I expect it to be loud and rowdy when groups or conventions are staying at the same place, but I couldn't have been less disturbed. I've stayed in Memphis a number of times, and I'll say I felt much more comfortable staying in this area. It's really only a few minutes further drive, but feeling like I was in a more secure area was totally worth it to me. I'll definitely stay here again.After driving all day from New Mexico, my husband and I stopped here for the night and we were not impressed. If you're looking for luxury (or even comfort)  I wouldn't recommend this hotel. The lobby looked nice and re-done but the first negative thing we noticed was that the elevator smelled awful (my husband described it as the smell of a mortuary or the inside of a vacuum). Once we got to our room I decided to take a shower and the water pressure was terrible (as my husband said, it felt like someone was peeing on him), one of the folded towels in our bathroom had a huge stain on it and our t.v. was constantly freezing and at one point stopped working all together. Aside from all the negatives, the lady at the front desk was friendly and they had fresh brewed coffee in the lobby. BUT it definitely wasn't worth the price.Tony at the Front Desk is always very upbeat and welcoming. However, this place needs. some work!  the water upon turning on is a brown rusty color!!! the picture was taken after it had been running a minute so it's much lighter than originally experienced. No shampoo!!!! AGAIN!!!! what is the deal???and this is so convenient to my client but will be rethinking my stay next time!!Lobby is remodeled but rooms are dingy and dirty and haven't been remodeled. Mattresses are horrible. Carpet is sticky from age and dirt. Avoided this hotel on 2nd trip thru this area even though I am a loyal Hilton member.My friends had horrible experiences checking in and dirty rooms. It is sad how this can ruin a hotel experience. The front desk staff was not the friendliest. And to top it off, the parking lot is windy and difficult. If you have to stay in Memphis, there are plenty of other options.A recommendable place to stay if you are in the area. Room service were very nice, they wouldn't complain if you ask them for something. The rooms were cleaned very well, smells fresh. The bedsheets and other clothes are all new. The bathroom was cleaned well, didn't had any bad experience.Glad to say that I stayed for 5 times now and I am having a great time.Upon arrival the front desk attendants, Tony and DeNae, greeted us with a warm welcome. They recommend restaurants in the area, accommodated our late check out request, and saved one cookie for us. The rooms are clean, old but clean. Would definitely stay again.I am a Hilton Diamond member and this year alone I have already stayed 93 nights in a Hilton brand hotel. That being said this was not my favorite place. It was not bad, in fact the rooms were very satisfactory. The service is why I would say I have experienced better. The women who works the breakfast in morning was kind enough in greeting guests, but was often very loud, yelling/chatting with other hotel staff. There was also 2 occasions in which she was asked to refill something on the breakfast line and she responded with no, stating that breakfast is wrapping up even though there was still 30 minutes left on the stated time. Overall, I would stay at this hotel as the rooms are satisfactory and the location worked for us.Very friendly and helpful staff. However, the quality of their hotel room did not live up to the Hilton standard. Mattress was very lumpy and creaky. Internet reception was very poor and I kept getting booted offline. This has never been an issue at other Hilton hotels that I've stayed at.  When I turned on the shower faucet, the toilet began running. In fact, the toilet ran throughout the night. Also, construction began outside our hotel at 6 am on a Sunday morning. Again, staff was great but the hotel left a lot to be desired. I wouldn't stay here again. Next time I'd pay the extra money and stay closer to Downtown.

I ate here the 2nd day of the 2015 MidSouth Hiv and Aids conference. We had buffet style. The food included a stuff cod, salad, rolls, a chicken pasta, a beef pasta, green beans, peach and Apple pie. It was really nice. It's nothing I would willing say let's go and eat there. It was good for it being free.Have never stayed at the hotel but have been to a few sit down dinners at events. The service has been done but the food is absolutely horrible. Really bad.Never stayed in the this hotel but I came for the Mothers Day Brunch. It was great. Plenty of food and drinks. For 34 dollars. Great place to take your mom for a brunch.I was with a group from work staying at this Holiday Inn on Central.  We unloaded our bags, went in to check in but only to find out that we were actually across the street at The Fogleman.  What???  We did't notice that there was a hotel across the street because the building across the street is an office building. Long story short, Holiday Inn Memphis-Univ of Memphis overbooked their hotel and sent us to a dormitory to stay.  jeremy at the front desk kept saying the " The Fogelman" was their "sister" property.  A dormitory.I will never deal with Holiday Inn especially at this location.But, I may say that I did have breakfast and lunch in the dining room.  It was very good and reasonable.  At $9.95 buffet breakfast, hashbrowns, scrambled eggs, eggs made to order and omelets, bacon, grits, oatmeal, biscuits and gravy..... all was very good.For lunch, we had lasagne, chicken cordon blue, scalloped potatoes, potato soup, catfish, blackberry cobbler and red velvet cake.  No, I didn't get all I could but I did get all I could eat.And, the complimentary coffee in the lobby in the a.m. was very good.One star because I booked Holiday Inn and got holiday overbooked.Dirty. Walls were filthy, the tv screen looked like something had been spilled on it and never cleaned, mold was growing in the caulking in the shower, broken toilet seat, cheetos were left under the pull out couch, stained carpet and couch cushions. The kitchenette had no supplies: no soap for the sink, no dishes, no napkins or paper towels. There was a layer of dust on the ice bucket and the in room coffee maker. No pool and no free breakfast. The only positives were the friendly employees, complimentary coffee downstairs, and the beds were comfortable although they were small (doubles instead of queens). Definitely an older holiday inn in need of some TLC. Won't stay here again.Very convenient location. The rooms are very neat and comfortable. Hey free parking and WiFi!Very outdated and a/c isn't worth a damn. Lady took forever took check us in.Suuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuuucks!!!!!The title of this review is "Dr. Switcheroo or How I Learned to Always Get it in Writing".On my first night there, a roach flew out of the lamp on my bedside table. I killed it and left it on the floor--in part as a warning to its friends, and in part because I had a feeling I was going to need to have proof for any complaints. I called the front desk to let them know; nothing happened. The next morning, at the two-stars-out-of-five breakfast, there was another roach on the wall behind the omelet station. I pointed it out to the (very nice) woman cooking my omelet and told her it looked a lot like the one that was in my room last night. She let the restaurant manager know and he actually came out to talk to me. Mgr: I'm very sorry about that. You won't need to pay for your meal. Me: ThanksMgr: And I understand there was also one in your room?Me: YesMgr: Have you Paid for your room?Me: NoMgr: Good. Don't. And we'll get the exterminator in here and up in your room today.Now, if we're honest, I thought this might have been a bit Too generous; my stay was for five nights. I had been considering checking out that day, but I was attending and speaking at a conference across the street, and who is going to turn down a free hotel? So I thanked him and went to my room. The front desk called and we scheduled when the exterminator could come to my room (I'd have to be gone). Then I went over to the conference. I was so pleased with the hotel's response that I called my wife to tell her about it. Not only had they comped my stay, but they sent an exterminator as soon as they knew about it. (Then I remembered that the front desk had been aware of the roach in my room for half a day, so at least the management is responsive, right?)It almost wasn't worth it. Every night when I got up to pee, I worried that my next step would crunch. But I got through, and finally it came time to check out. I was billed for all five nights. It was 6:30am so there were no managers on duty. I called the hotel when I got back to my apartment, and I got a completely different story. The hotel manager said the restaurant manager told her there was no mention of my room, and he was offering to pay for my food bill instead. I said he offered both. She said no way.After some discussion, she offered a refund for one night, and stated that her offer was exceedingly generous. I disagreed. I said that all five nights was very generous, and that at a bare minimum I didn't want to pay for either of the days I encountered a roach either next to my bed or next to my food. I made it clear that I wasn't concerned that there were two roaches in her hotel, but rather that there were SO MANY ROACHES THAT I COULDN'T GO A DAY WITHOUT BEING WITHIN SIX FEET OF ONE--and I was only in two places in the hotel!She responded about like you'd expect, and I took the one night refund. But after you expect five, and have a reasonable request for two, one doesn't feel like much. And I have to say, worrying constantly that I'd have a six-legged bedmate (or dinner date) while I was there made it completely not worth my time; if I had known it would be anything but free, I would have checked out and stayed truly anywhere else. In conclusion: If you have to pay any more than zero dollars a night for this hotel, it isn't worth it. And if you do find yourself going through something that makes your stay zero dollars a night, GET IT IN WRITING.This is a pretty nice place to stay, if you want to be close to campus. All rooms are suites and the staff was helpful and friendly. They also offer a free local shuttle. The bed, the most important thing, was very comfortable. On the downside, the property is worn. I wouldn't avoid it if you want to be close to campus, but you might consider driving in if you are picky about cleanliness or having an elegant room.Awesome service. Nice hotel. All rooms have fridge, microwave, 2 tvs, suite area. Huge shower heads. Great beds. Hotel is ran by U of M students. They take government rates.  They are in a great location close to downtown.  I would stay here every time I'm in Memphis. The rooms, service, and restaurant are great.I stayed here for four days earlier this spring and it was great! The room was like an Embassy Suites room--sitting area, then a bathroom and then the bedroom behind that. It was very spacious, had nice TVs in both rooms, and a refrigerator. The facility was really clean and the staff was very friendly. I liked the location next to the University of Memphis and it's a straight shot into downtown.Good breakfast buffet, nice meeting room & service.I am reviewing this for their Sunday brunch, but let me explain that it is a Holiday Inn Hotel located across the street from the University of Memphis. It is a training site for students from the Kemmons Wilson School of Hospitality at the University of Memphis, but it is an all suite hotel that is open to the public and also has a public restaurant, meeting rooms and banquet facilities. It's one of the best brunches in town and now that I am a mom with three children and an extended family this has become my brunch location of choice over the past few years. They have Sunday brunch from 11-2:30 and it's $19.95 for adults and $10.95 for children. It's a brunch buffet with an omelet bar, a waffle bar, meats, veggies and salads. It's basic brunch type food, nothing spectacular but good. I'm a fan of their special occasion brunches where they feature more items. They are held for Mother's Day, Easter, Christmas, Thanksgiving and sometimes Father's Day. It's served in the banquet facilities so you don't have to wait long- which is a bonus with children. The special occasion brunch also features a kids only area with special kiddie food- chicken tenders, mini pancakes, mac and cheese etc. It's fun because it's also served on a lower bar area where the kids can actually reach it themselves. It's definitely worth a try for brunch.Um, so I was surprised to find my name on this greeting placard at the registration desk on the lobby. Apparently, it's a way to welcome Holiday Inn Club Members. First of all, I didn't know I was one! And second, the others wouldn't stop making fun of me.But that has nothing to do with my review.The room and hotel were really nice! It was a King suite so we had a gigantic king sized bed that was super comfortable and another "living room" area with a fridge, sink, TV, and couch. Everything was super clean. The front desk was nice and wake up calls came on time. No complaints!Recently had the buffet at the Holiday Inn.  The food was fine, pretty good variety.  The seafood choices were pretty slim ... catfish and little else.  Service was good and cleanliness was also good.  Overall ambiance was adequet as the room is dark w/out any windows more befitting an evening dinner.  The prices for this selection at $20 each was a little high in Memphis, especially since you can have a stunning breakfast down the road at the Beauty Shop in Cooper / Young.  You won't be unhappy, but you could be really happy elsewhere

We checked in Wednesday around 3 pm after driving around 540 miles.  Great location on the 10th floor in downtown Memphis facing the Mississippi River.  You can see Arkansas on the other side of the river.  We are walking distance to everything downtown.  Neat clean hotel, very helpful nice desk clerks, but lousy wifi connection.  Breakfast is included with underground parking for $10/day with in and out privileges.  The top floors 10-12 & 14-15 are hotel rooms.  I just found out they don't use the 13th floor (superstitious)This is a hard one to write a review for as I had mixed feelings. But I think after everything, I would probably recommend it with a couple of caveats. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful which is always a good start. The included breakfast was basic but still good. It should be noted that the first 10 levels or so of the hotel is actually public parking but it didn't seem to have an impact. The hotel charges $10 for self parking which was reasonable and very handy. The location isn't bad either and you can walk or catch the trolley service easily to Beale St. We had a double room with partial views of the Mississippi which was good. I should mention that the walls seemed very thin and it was easy to hear a TV in the next room which is pretty rubbish if you want to get to sleep. The room was extremely spacious though which was great for our 3 night stay in Memphis however the bathroom was very small. And to top that off the toilet was small. Weird right? I'm not just talking small, small... I'm talking SMALL, SMALL!!! Like an 8 inch bowl small. Put it this way... unless you were a bombardier in the war... you gonna have trouble dropping it in easily. ;)At the end of the day though... it's worth staying at and I would stay there again.Holy smokes - GREAT hotel. I was a little worried about safety in Memphis but NEVER here. Would recommend 10/10 for the price. 6 or so blocks from Beale. Our very clean & spacious hotel room had a view of the Mississippi & the island. Staff was friendly & were graciously giving us suggestions on where to go.$10 daily parking ( I believe) & they offer a AAA discount. Free wifi. Outdoor pool.We only stayed here one night. It is very easy to walk to Beale Street from here and the trolley runs just around the corner from the hotel. Staff were super nice, and they serve a full breakfast. Rooms were clean and we had a great view of the Mississippi River.Traveling on a budget? This is your place!We wanted something downtown and close to Beale Street and got the best rate here, well best rate with the best reviews.  We booked a two night stay with two beds and a rollaway bed.  The room was decent size, clean, and the staff were friendly.  As others mentioned, the breakfast was decent and different on both mornings we went down for it.  It was more than just coffee and danishes.  Parking was $8/night - I saw free parking advertised some place and it's added onto your total bill when you check out.  I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others.The room was clean, and the beds were comfortable.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating when we asked to stay another night and didn't move us to another room.  The rooftop pool was nice since the temps were in the high 90's, the view from the pool was relaxing.  The location of the hotel was within walking distance to many restaurants and attractions.  Our room was on the first floor, facing traffic, but it was still relatively quiet.  I'd definitely stay here again.An older hotel but they have updated it. We got a corner room with 2 queen beds and it is very spacious.  Parking garage on the premises which is nice. Right across from Mud Island park. Within walking durance of Beale Street.The hotel was super clean and the staff super friendly!  We really enjoyed the roof top view of the bridge and the river, complete with self made cocktails and gorgeous sunsets!We don't expect alot from the free breakfast in places like this but we were pleasantly surprised at the selection and quality the buffet.What a great location..blocks from Beale Street  and easy highway access. Would stay here again no doubt!The location of this hotel is ideal and we had a very good price (granted, it's the middle of January). Our room had a view of the Mississippi and the pyramid. It was clean and large.The bathroom was maybe slightly small and because it didn't have a fan, it ended up as a sauna.The choice for breakfast was extensive (eggs, bacon, biscuits & gravy, danishes, waffles, muffins) but the quality was barely average. We enjoyed it anyways and were able to be on the road early in the morning.#sbroadtrip2013We got the room for $109 and got a beautiful view of the Mississippi River from the 11th floor! And parking is in their own garage for $10 with in/out priviliges. Only a 15 minute walk to Beale stOverall pretty darn good. The room is clean, spacious, and laid out nice. The service downstairs is friendly and fast. They can call a taxi for you real quick. The breakfast is actually pretty good. They have waffles, cereal, eggs; ham, toast, yogurt and other things. My only complaint is the elevator is a little slow and the parking is a little much but from what I hear we are still paying "ok" prices compared to other parking prices Id stay here again.Good location, surprisingly good breakfast, very comfortable beds. Elevator was a tad unreliable and we didn't have towels in the room when we first arrived. However, we received them as soon as we enquired after them. It's not luxurious, but we were happy with it and would be happy to stay again if we are ever back in town.I have traveled to Memphis a lot for work and pleasure. The Comfort Inn may not be the Peabody Hotel but for a hotel at this price point and location this one is hard to beat. The staff has always been above and beyond. The rooms have always always always been comfortable and welcoming. They have actually upgraded me to business suites several times without me even asking!
