Also this is the hotel where I was given a sample package of Wilkinson Sword shaving cream which I love and now order from the UK. There are some fantastic restaurants between here and Beale Street and an easy walk or taxi ride if you want to go directly into the drunk tank.Have been to Memphis a couple times and found Comfort Inn to be friendly, clean and reasonable for a downtown hotel. Rooms are a good size and no additional charge for parking.Very large and clean rooms. The parking is a little weird but it's in their own garage so it's secure. The staff was very nice and the breakfast was great (free with room).

The hotel was clean and very convenient to catch a flight in the AM. I was able to drop off my rental car at the airport before checking in, take the free hotel shuttle to the hotel, and grab the shuttle again to my flight in the morning.The hotel has a "Bistro", but is not close to any restaurants. But Keith at the front desk called a local BBQ restaurant to come pick up my coworkers for dinner. He also called me a taxi to go downtown to Beale Street for better food and live Blues music. Keith was a good man and hooked us up. A cab downtown costs about $20, but it was easy to catch one for the return trip. The complaint I had was that the building is a big square around the "Courtyard", but there is only one elevator as far as you can get from the lobby. I felt like I walked blocks with my bags to the vator, and just as far on my floor. I also think it is tacky for a hotel not to offer free hot coffee in the lobby. That is a homey comfort I expect. Marriott properties have been trending toward selling Starbucks in their Bistro and not having complimentary coffee in the lobby. I don't think Starbucks is special, and don't want a hotel to Nickel and Dime me for a cup of joe. This is why Marriott is not my go-to brand anymore. That's just bad customer service for a business in the hospitality business. Marriott should rethink that idea at the corporate level.My boyfriend and I were here for one night fairly recently.  I'm glad we stayed here.  Why?  Glad you asked!Let's start with check-in.  I have not seen customer service THIS GOOD in a very long time.  The staff were very professional, friendly and made us feel welcome.  We asked for a room facing the courtyard and got it, no hassles.  The property has obviously been remodeled as the lobby and restaurant were very nicely decorated.  The parking lot is VERY secure, you need a room key to get in.The room was extremely comfortable, and spacious.  It was more than functional; it was livable.  The bathroom was a nice size, although the sink was located outside of the actual bathroom.  (Not a big deal.)  The shower had constant pressure and temperature, which is an absolute MUST.I couldn't find one thing wrong with this property, but I found a lot of things that were right.  This is my new go-to property when I'm in Memphis.The lobby was very clean and the front desk attendant was friendly. We were told there wasn't a AAA discount for "that room." We had called ahead for a room for five - two queen beds and a pullout sofa. The room wasn't prepared for five. There was towel service for only three. There were no bed linens/pillow for the pullout. After calling the front desk, it would be ~25 minutes to have them delivered to wait for the driver to return. Being 10:30 pm and not wanting to wait, I called back and said I would come get them. Was told by the front desk clerk that she didn't have access and would have to wait. The pullout couch was not comfortable - but that's nothing new for a pullout. The room was very humid and warm; however, it was clean. The thermostat did not control the temp of the room making for a hot night.Stayed here for 3 nights while in Memphis for a celebration. I always stay at Marriott hotels because the beds are super comfortable! The beds did not disappoint. Check in was easy and the agent was very friendly and helpful on suggestions for getting around town. Room was clean. We had a few rooms and one of the rooms had AC issues and the drain would not close. Also needed a few extras and when brought to the room, the employee did not acknowledge us or speak a work when thanked. The main reason I wanted to write this review is to let people know that it is in the middle of nothing! There are no close restaurants, coffee shops, etc. There's a Subway across the street, but it is closed on weekends. You will have to drive everywhere and really the majority of the eating establishments that are the closest driving distance are fast food restaurants. No problems with the wifi, it is free! Lobby area was freezing cold! No luggage rack in room. Bathrooms don't have a vent which made for a moist room. Shuttle to the airport was fine. The Do Not Disturb signs were a nuisance...seems minor but constantly had to pick them up as they fell off the door every time the door was opened/closed. It's a fine choice if passing through town for a night or two or if you need to be close to the airport. Next time, I will get closer to downtown.Rooms fine. Walked a mile to elevator. Restaurant doesn't open until 6:30 am...,seems a bit late for a hotel. Staff nice enough but this place needs work.I stayed here 5 months ago and it was a little ran down. This is the closest Marriott property to the airport so I was dreading my return. TOTALLY REMODELED!!!I had a great surprise to walk into the current generation Courtyard lobby and an even better surprise to find a full renovated room! Sounds kind of funny, but the circular couch in my room would be going home with me if I could fit it in my carry on.Jeff was the agent checking me in on 10-9-2015 and checked me out the next day. He was amazing, friendly, helpful, and very customer service oriented. He deserves recognition for his work and should train others on how to treat guests. Room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. Slept like a baby. on a mini business trip/vacation and needed the rest. Would stay again just because of Jeff. He Rocks!I have to admit I came here with kind of a bad attitude, we could not get a room at the Peabody, or any downtown hotel, until Friday night.  We were glad to get a room but quite frankly as a back up, this was barely adequate and kindof expensive.Great thing was that even though there was no luggage rack in the room, they offered to bring me one.  When the gentleman came to the room with it, he asked me if I would like two.  I said I would love it so he returned with another.  When I went to tip him, he originally didn't want to take it and said, you don't have to do that.  So I gave him even more, he was great.The room was big enough and the ac worked great.  Bed was super soft, oh my aching back!  Bathroom was divided into two parts which was handy in the morning but the room with shower and facilities was a bit icky.  The tub ran a bit all night, no matter what I did.  And to get everything to flush, you had to hold it down for over 30 seconds.  There were 3 of each very thin towel so you needed twice as many.No breakfast but parking was free.  The wi fii was free and good.   Meh, not much value for 165.00 with all the taxes, fees, etc.My week started in the local area of Memphis. I found the people very pleasing and friendly until the moment I needed a hotel by the airport.The difficulty of getting thru the phone system is far the worst experience I ever had trying to call the hotel. After 8+ attempt I finally got thru and was transferred to reservation. I was told by reservation that she will call for the shuttle (648pm) and I was told it will depart at 7pm. The hotel is 2.2 miles away and so I thought it would be sooner than later. After 734pm I call the hotel and it took me 6 attempts to get thru and ask about the shuttle and I get an attitude from the lady when I asked on the delay (I was very friendly when I asked) and this obviously wasn't good enough.Eventually I was picked up and it certainly didn't feel welcoming.I travel for a living and hold a platinum status or diamond in all the hotels I stay. Can't talk to a customer in a manner of a condescending way for its plain unprofessional. Won't stay here again.The driver was very nice but the rest of the experience was not pleasant.I have been staying at this hotel on average 3-4 days a week for the past month. It has a modern lobby and updated rooms, 24 hour shuttle service and the staff is always friendly. You are not going to find a nicer hotel this close to the airport. Not only will I continue using this location until permanently relocated but will recommend to all my visiting associates once I am established in the area.This hotel is very nice.  The lobby is modern and well kept.  The rooms are extremely spacious with comfortable beds and soft towels/linens.  The gym is exceptionally great - each treadmill has its own tv.  The parking lot is gated and secure.My only complaint about this facility is the front desk staff.  When checking in to a hotel I always assume there will be a hold on my debit/credit card for "incidentals."  However, the gentleman at the front desk did NOT mention this or tell me how much it would be - and it was a lot more than I expected, which was a huge inconvenience while traveling.  (When I noticed this in my bank account the next day and called the hotel to inquire, the gentleman at the front desk - same one that checked me in - was VERY short and snippy with me, basically saying I should have known better.)  When checking out I advised the woman at the front desk that we needed to utilize the airport shuttle and she immediately called the driver.  When he came to the front desk to grab our bags, he asked how many were in our party.  Two of us were ready, the other two were right behind us - bringing their bags to the lobby.  The employee immediately cut off our conversation and said "Because we have to accommodate so many guests, we can only run the shuttle at certain times - so if you aren't all here right now, you'll have to wait for the next one."  Normally, this would make sense.. however, the lobby was EMPTY.  We were the ONLY people waiting on a shuttle.  I told her we could start loading our bags and the other 2 would be down in less than 2 minutes.  She said no.  The driver, who looked as confused as me, simply said "well, she's my boss.. so.. sorry."  We waited another 20 mins for the next shuttle, which was no big deal, but completely unnecessary.  We were the ONLY people waiting, the ONLY people on the next shuttle and the ONLY people that would have left 2 minutes late.  Ridiculous.  (Sidenote: the driver was awesome! He was friendly, helpful and very nice.)All in all, it's a very nice property with great features.  A free continental breakfast would have given it a perfect score - and friendly employees would be the icing on the cake.  Just make sure you ask lots of detailed questions about your billing - and make sure everyone in your party is together if waiting for an airport shuttle."I can't so that" should be their motto. No free continental breakfast or even coffee. Twenty minutes to buy a cup of coffee and no pastries. Rooms are okay but only two kid friendly channels since MTV no longer counts.  Grumpy front desk. Only bright spot: great, friendly housekeeping staff. Too bad can't do zero stars.Staff was excellent, hotel is under renovation (in lobby) with rooms to follow.  High and obvious security.  As you expect at an airport hotel, high noise levels from aircraft.Room was ok, as expected at a hotel in this price range.Ok, I was stranded in Memphis due to some, um, mix up by my airline.I stayed here and was simply amazed by the service.  The woman who took care of me many times that night was fantastic! The hotel is very nice, with a nice courtyard to look at from your balcony. The parking lot is fenced in and you have to get buzzed in, which is a little intimidating, but it is in an Corporate Park area, with a surrounding area that is not the best to be alone in at night. I only say that because when I was driving to walmart to buy some clothes ( thanks to my luggage being at my destination).. I witnessed a police raid on an apartment building not far from my hotel.Anyways, I digress- it is very close to the hotel, and even had hotel shuttle service every 30 minutes -24 hours a day.Can't say enough... the service was impeccable!!Please someone take my Dukedom. I guess you don't have to stay much to be the Duke of The Dump.  Major fail! Second worst Marriott property I'd ever stayed at. Should consider becoming a Days Inn or an Econolodge. Better suited for that. How can they consider charging $130 for a hotel worth $50? And $9.95 for an awful breakfast. They should be ashamed of themselves..  Just hope that Bill Marriott never visits this location.Hotel did its job, but not much more. Every staff except for the concierge was rude and unhelpful, shuttle was 10min late, breakfast closes at 9:30 (which you pay for), and make sure you put the do not disturb sign up- housekeeping tried to get in while I was still sleeping from jetlag at 8:30-9:00am! However, the beds are comfortable, and the concierge staff were lovely. Food is adequate if you end up choosing to get it. They also have free shuttles to the airport, which is close. Meh, it worked-but not a first choice.All I can say is wow and I don't mean that in a good way. First waited over a hour for the shuttle at the airport then got to the hotel to find the hot tub not working. The front staff was very nice and polite but as they say in business it's the small things that matter. It is in a good location very close to the airport and highways. This is a older hotel that's going through renovations. I would stay there again but not my first choice. This hotel does not live up to the Marriott standard at all.First, I should mention that I am a Marriott Platinum Elite member.  I stay at a lot of Marriott properties and I don't expect Courtyard to be a 5 star hotel -- it's not and never will be.  This property does have a few things that are different than every other Courtyard I've stayed at.  First, the place has security gates to get in and out and I'm ok with that.  Second, they have remodeled the lobby and it now has some kind of combination food/drink bar/starbucks in place of the normal breafast lobby area.  We had breakfast here the first morning of our stay and the coffee was reasonably good, the food was ok, but the service was really s-l-o-w and the place wasn't busy.  I can't imagine on a typical travel day morning with 30 people eatting in that they would have any hope of keeping up.  On the second morning, the breakfast bar/starbucks wasn't even open on time.  I went down at 6:30 to get a latte and there were 5 people waiting for someone to open the place.  Other than that, there is still construction/painting going on here so it's kind of inconvenient, but otherwise it's a typical Courtyard close to the airport.Omg.. I really loved my 1 week stay here. It was so peaceful & comfortable. The staff were wonderfully pleasant. There chicken wings are to die for... I'm still thinking about them..lol.. Parking is gated in which was great. Nice balcony view in my room. Barthroom was nice/ nice shower. Good & safe place to stay. Just a little far from downtown but close to the airport.

We had a very nice stay at the Poplar East Staybridge Suites in Memphis. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Free WiFi is available and the prices are reasonable.We had a one bedroom suite which was nicely appointed. As is the case with many extended stay hotels, our room was equipped with a refrigerator and stove. The hotel provides a complementary buffet breakfast. Waffles, eggs, bacon/sausage, biscuits & gravy were among the hot items available. Cereal, yogurt and fruit were also available along with juices and coffee.I liked everything about the room but one thing. I wished the bathroom were open to a hallway between the living area and bedroom rather than opening into just the bedroom. That's simply my personal preference and doesn't detract from my rating of this hotel.great staff, very friendly.convenient to the office park and shopping center nearbyroom and sheets were spotless clean and comfortableairport shuttle and mall shuttle were a huge plusPet friendly.  Awesome hotel, staff, and price. Memphis can be know for having some rough areas, but rest assured this hotel is in a great area.  I checked in about an hour before their social hour ended.  So I ran to the room and dropped my bags.  Social hour is hosted in the lobby and offered soup, salad, and bread (all very good).  They also have free wine and beer.  I stayed for about 35 min and enjoyed a nice lil meal.When I arrived with my pet the guy at the front desk said there was a $75 pet deposit.  I mentioned to him that I just stayed at two other Staybridge locations and they only charged $50, he immediately changed it $50.  When you check-in on yelp you get 10% off your entire stay, I showed him this, but unfortunately it was not reflected on my final bill :\Overall my stay here was very pleasant, great hotel and staff.  Comes with all the amenities.I love this place. I'm here in this spacious room,  watching Hector and the search for happiness (movie is great) on the DVD player in the comfy bed with fluffy pillows. The staff,  shout outs to Lois and Hayes, are genial,  helpful,  genuine,  etc. The room is way bigger than I expected,  bigger than a room I had at a resort. It didn't feel like they tried to fit in all the suite furniture in a space too small to accommodate it like in some other hotels. I am so glad the Hilton was full.  The prices are better and I could entertain in here!I was waiting on a package and Lois called me to let me know it arrived before UPS informed me via text. The breakfast buffet is generous and appealing and vast. Ripe cut and whole fruit, many types of yogurt, French toast,  etc. And they are so clever there are to-go bags for those who need them (you may have to ask for utensils). The selections of meat and breakfast breads change daily. You don't quite have to play chicken getting across the street to the Hilton,  but be careful.  Restaurants (local and chain), Target, a public library branch, Whole Foods and Kroger, and cheaper gas are within 10 minutes drive.   You can walk to Benihana and a movie theater/restaurant where you can see the latest independent films. The only cons I can think of are that smokers congregate outside the entrance and this is a pet friendly chain.  However,  even with my serious allergies, the room feels dander-free.I haven't been to happy hour and I wish I could.  Food,  drink and fun are promised.I love this place, probably the best hotel in Memphis in terms of price and features.The staff here are GREAT. I've stayed here a few times, including one time for an extended period so I'm definitely familiar with this place. There are so many perks, I can't even think of them all.Laundry facilities in house, and they're totally free. Seriously, any time you can just walk down (there's even a laundry basket in each room) and do your laundry, for free. Washer and dryer. There's free breakfast. During the week they have dinner/reception and that's free too. Of course there's other amenities like free WiFi, parking, pool.The rooms are huge. It's basically a one-bedroom apartment. You have a living room, separate dining area (yep, there's a table in there), full kitchen, bedroom, bathroom...everything.There's also loads to do right nearby. There's a Benihana just next door, a movie theater really close by (seriously, go check it out, it's a fantastic theater), and about a block away is a pretty big strip mall: Target, several chain restaurants. Another block away is even more places to eat, such as PF Chang's and Five Guys. Oh and there's a complimentary shuttle, so if you're in town on business and don't have a car, you can still get to all of these places without having to rely on a taxi.Bottom line, if you gotta get a hotel in Memphis, this is the place to stay.Outstanding.  Best hotel experience ever.  Check in was fast, the attendant even called to see if we needed anything after we were settled in.  Really great accommodations and even better if you have (well behaved) pets.I've stayed in a lot of 4 and 5 star hotels, but this one has most of those beat.  The balance of customer service and privacy is great, and everyone was very helpful and friendly.The bed was amazingly comfortable.The breakfast was just enough.  I wish they served bacon though. The lady manning the breakfast (a.k.a. Annie Lennox) was a sweetheart. She even offered to take my children!  :)Very clean room.  Got a text about 2 hours out from check-in welcoming me to the area.  Staff at check in was very friendly.  Room was very clean and well appointed.  Quiet, pet and family friendly. Would definitely stay here again if I am in the area.My hubby, daughter, myself, and our adorable Wheaten Terrier are on a cross-country trip moving from East to West and we have to look up a pet-friendly hotel every night. Despite our desired budget of $100 or less, we couldn't find another hotel in Memphis and decided to stay here (it was suggested by the barbecue store manager where we had dinner). Well, the hotel was rated very highly here on Yelp and being concerned about safety in Memphis, we came here. It turned out to be extremely nice experience. The room was a suite (first in our life), consisting of a living room with kitchenette and a separate bedroom with two double beds. Much needed free WiFi was excellent and a relief from a joke of WiFi we had endured previous two nights at 2-star hotels. Pantry on the first floor was stuffed with drinks and some important necessities (we bought cotton swabs and a small comb). And this morning's hot breakfast with its absolutely charming chef woman was a pleasure to have before hitting Graceland. Overall, very pleasant stay. Oh and I was given a special discount on a pet fee which of course didn't bring the fee down to $100 but was still much appreciated. Highly recommended!From the time I checked in with my family to the time we checked out the staff at Staybridge Suites made our stay all worth it! They have thought of everything at Staybridge Suites. My family and I stayed in the double queen bed suite and it was more than enough room for us. The room was clean and homey. Breakfast every morning was delicious and just enough to get the day started right. There is a free laundry facility on site and the hotel pantry is full of goodies for when the late night snack attacks hit! Lois (Front Desk) was EXCELLENT every step of the way. Her attention and care in providing exceptional customer service was on point and never wavered! Every evening the hotel hosts a social. It is completely free and includes delicious eats and drinks (non-alcoholic and alcoholic). The event is a great opportunity to unwind after a busy day. Debra is the woman in charge of the evening socials and she is WONDERFUL! She was always engaging and welcoming. The pool was always clean and my children had great fun there. I can't say enough great things about this hotel. My family and I had a really great time. The hotel is only a 20 minute drive from downtown Memphis, but the surrounding area/neighborhood the hotel is in is packed full of everything that one would need (Target, fast food, movie theaters, etc.). Wish I could go back to Memphis just to stay at this great hotel again!Great place to stay in Memphis! Highly highly recommend. The front desk employee Hayes went above and beyond his job when I checked in. Asked him if there were places close by to eat, he immediately gave me some menus and also suggestions for places that would deliver since it was raining outside. Later I had issues with my wireless which he immediately took care of. Clean room, great service, well priced, free breakfast and cocktail hour with appetizers - what more could you ask for??We absolutely loved this place! It's a perfect mini home with kitchen, living room and private bedroom. We highly recomend! Also, they are pet friendly! We were on a crosscountry moving from Boston to Austin and is was really nice to be able to afford a place like this to relax! Clean, nice staff, close to a lots of shops( whole foods, Corky's BBQ, Target, Petsmart and more..) Totally worth it! :)Very nice hotel.  Friendly staff.  Easy to find.  Convenient location.They were pet-friendly, well-furnished, friendly and comfortable. No complaints!Stayed for 5 nights for work in Memphis and we used a meeting room. Loved that the room was like a small apartment with a kitchen area, tv area with couch and separate bedroom. Furniture and decor was modern and comfortable. Staff was excellent. Mike & Penelope on the front desk were very professional. Eric, staff member, helped get silverware and plates when our caterer forget them. Theresa, staff member, got additional drinks and coffee when asked. There were a handful of other staff members whose names I don't have who also assisted to make our stay comfortable. Thanks Staybridge for a lovely trip.Cost/night decreases the longer one stays. Across the street from the Hilton.Right off the freeway.Clean, safe, neat facility.Nice pool.Free laundry/drier.Excellent breakfasts (better than similar places) , but some snack time on weekday afternoon  ran out of food during the week.My husband and I stayed here on a cross-country trip. We had our two dogs with us and were delighted to find a place that was not only dog-friendly but dog welcoming! They gave us a little magnet to put on our door notifying staff of a dog in our room. They cut us a break on the price for the dog to $25. They were in the middle of a remodel while we were there. The room was really spacious with high ceilings. The bathroom was a little disappointing, but it wasn't dirty, so no big deal. The furnishings and the carpet were a little worn, but I felt even more comfortable having my dogs there because of it. I feel like most hotels say they are pet friendly, but they really aren't. This hotel was actually pet friendly. The price was average - about $100 plus the pet fee and all the hotel taxes. Internet was free, and the complimentary hot breakfast in the morning was great - eggs, bacon, sausage, make your own waffles, etc. and good coffee. I would stay here again if we are ever in the area. I was actually so impressed with this Staybridge that I sought out another one when we stopped again in Albuquerque!Of the twenty or so IHG hotels that I have stayed in over the past two years, this one is the absolute best.  A little hard to find, but well worth it.  The front desk staff made me feel very welcome on arrival.  After asking for the location of local restaurants so I could determine if we could park there with a trailer, they happily declined to give me a map and instead offered a shuttle to where we needed to go.  Now that's service!  The rooms were well insulated, which was nice for us and others - preventing my daughters noise from going out while at the same time keeping outside noise from coming in.  Truely the definition of Southern Hospitality.I have nothing negative to say about this property. Extremely friendly staff. Damon at the front desk was accommodating, helpful, and so kind. After learning about my rough day, he tried to expedite the process, made good conversation, and gave me a cold bottle of water which goes a long way in the Memphis heat. It was my first taste of southern hospitality. The room was HUGE, clean, and comfortable. I wish I could've taken the bed linens and mattress home. The shower was hot with good water pressure. Free laundry!!!  The fully equipped kitchen would be nice if I was there longer. The suites even come with dishwashers and soap unlike Extended Stays!! HIGHLY recommended!I'm a frequent business traveler and recently relocated to Memphis. I resided at this hotel for close to two months (with a few absences for business travel). The staff and management are very courteous and professional. The rooms (stayed in a couple) are clean and well-appointed (for this class of hotel). The area is geographically-centric to many restaurants along Memphis' main retail and restaurant strip...Poplar Avenue. Convenient to Germantown. Twenty minutes from downtown. Twenty minutes to the airport. Any time of day, easy to get a good rest (quiet!). Relocation is highly stressful, but this facility and the staff made it easier. They even provided me with a storage locker during my absences.

A truly comfortable and clean hotel to stay at for any visitor to Memphis.  The suite allows two to room together with each roomie getting their own space.Breakfast has been great and the ladies working in the breakfast area are very friendly!The bed is incredible ... So comfortable!!!Only issue is location.  Traffic in this part of Memphis is a headache and you need to get to the downtown to do anything but it's like going home at night.Great place! It is very clean, very convenient,  and close to all the places I needed including food. The suites are nice and spacey.  Love the heater!!!!! Usually it's a heater system that doesn't allow the heater to work well in most hotels. Very cool that the windows open, makes a nice cool breeze vs cold a/c. Kroger is like 5 mins away and u can get some groceries for a weekly stay. My friends family is staying here also and they got a 2 room suite,  which is perfect for 2 couples or a separate room for the kids. Highly recommend! !This is the second time that my family stayed here whilst visiting their favorite child/sibling (me, obviously). I don't remember anything particularly disconcerting about the first stay, everything seemed ok. They serve dinner on select nights, where they offer food that looks pretty gross and cheap beer. As the lettuce offered as salad is the only vegan thing, I haven't actually tried the food, so maybe it tastes better than it looks. During their most recent stay... Hahaha. It's not funny, but I had a good laugh about it... Upon their arrival, the shower had someone's hair stuck to the wall and a used bar soap on the ledge (gross, right?), so they informed the cleaning woman of the problem when she arrived at their room. In retaliation, she did not clean the shower and then pooped in their toilet and left it for them. Needless to say, management was called. Additionally, it specifically states on the mirrors in the room that during a stay, a "light clean" will be conducted daily, including collecting trash from the room. This did not happen, all take-out boxes and other trash items piled up until my mother complained to the front desk. The rooms are large and decorated nicely. They are poorly lit, and the plates and silverware provided are not adequate. Additionally, the "light clean" supposedly includes staff running the dishwasher for you, which didn't happen. This was the last stay at the Homewood Suites for my family. For as much as they charge, the service should not be so disgusting.Nice extended stay lodging. The suites are spacious with many amenities. The kitchenette has it all. Very comfortable bed. Full self-serve breakfast included. Good location with many businesses close by.Hotel was recently renovated. Rooms were large and modern however a little dark. This was probably due to the dark wood cabinets but they still looked nice. The stainless steal appliances were a great touch.  The bed was very comfortable but the pillows too soft.  The staff were all very nice. I'd recommend itI have never stayed at a Homewood Suites before, but was very pleased. The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly, and the breakfast and coffee was delicious! Large breakfast buffet not just toast. Will stay again.There's really nothing about the place that's great, but on the same hand, there's nothing that bad either.  It definitely could use some updating and some general maintenance.  The lobby has been updated and is pretty nice.  The breakfast is your standard hotel breakfast fare.  The bed, for me at least, leaves something to be desired.   It can be a bit tricky getting here in heavy traffic as well.  Almost learned that the hard way!Nice place. Sits on hwy island. Tricky to get to. From 240 exit 15a, then as you merge off exit move all the way to left and take immediate left exit ( not marked) . It's only about 100 yards after merging. This swings you around .going back towards 240 is on yor left right away. If you can't get over quick enough, take your first right and turn around.There were remodeling and workers left door wide open 2 nights in a row. I informed them after the first day. Complained to manager about the security concern. He was very nice. He assured me they will resolve  the issue as safety of everyone is top of the list.I will stay here again.Mister is staying there as I type this while we wait on approval for a residence. I came this past weekend to find us a place and stayed 5 days with him. I personally loved the place. Our suite opened to a hallway and not outside. The suite is clean. Nothing in poor condition and nothing appeared dated. Housekeeping was consistent and accomodating. The full breakfast was decent. Not a fan of powdered or liquid eggs so I didn't eat them. There were decent options to choose from. It's located near plenty of restaurants and places to shop. The pool, gym and laundry room were clean. The Wi-fi signal is strong in the rooms and computers (Windows and Mac) are available in the lobby.The desk staff is friendly. I would come back again.Fantastic friendly staff!!!!  Very helpful in every way.  My room was extremely clean and maintained, I even received a nice note from my housekeeper daily.  The hotel was so very nice at accomodating to my group with shuttle runs.  They even made a few extra runs for us when needed.  The food was good, and the property very nice and maintained.  I highly recommend this property.This place was great. The staff was charming and helpful. The room was spacious with everything we needed for our stay. Loved the breakfast every night and the weekday dinners - thanks Lucky! (Or as we know him - L U see kee) We would definitely stay here again.  Paul at the front desk can solve any issues you have. He is a true professional. My 4-star rating was due to our being designated a king room after making reservations 6 months in advance for 2 beds.This place was a dump, it really was.  The rooms were funky and dirty.  The pool water was pea soup green.  Everything seemed to break down and they were so cavalier about it.  My air condition was broken for three days and they did nothing in spite of twice a day requests to look into it.  Staff seem more interested in twerking around the lobby instead of taking care of clients.  I can't even bring myself to waste time writing about this place.  It is the worst Homewood Suites in the Hilton chain.  I'm never coming back.My standard rating for Hampton / Homewood / Hilton Garden / Double Tree / etc. is 3 stars, but I found this one lacking a bit compared to the rooms in which I typically stay.  Pros: suite was very large, WiFi signal was strong, breakfast was above average (for a Homewood) and the morning staff were friendlyCons: everything was worn and kind of dingy, cleanliness seemed somewhat suspect, suite door opened directly outside like a motel, and the evening staff were moderately rudeI have stayed at several Homewood Suites and this is the only instance that I've encountered where my room door opened directly to the outside parking lot.  While I realize that any ax-murderer worth his salt would not be hindered by an entrance into a hotel hallway, it does provide more of a sense of security to have that buffer.  Regarding the worn and dingy comment, everything worked properly, but the suite needed some maintenance.  Most of the furniture had some sort of staining on it, the carpet looked old and worn and needed replaced, one of the closet door mirrors had a small crack across the bottom, and the bathroom fixtures were dated compared to most hotels I've stayed in recently.  Mostly because of the dingy carpet, this overall gave the impression that the room was dirtier than it likely was; however, there were a few cleanliness issues, especially around the air intakes and outlets for the air conditioning.On a positive note, the common area near the main desk seems to have been updated recently and was clean and modern.  The breakfast area was also nice and the food was a bit better than in similar hotels.Although this hotel may be a bit tricky to get in and out, it's definitely worth it. I stayed for two nights ($123/night) in a suite that was more like an apartment - separate bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, living room, and fireplace. I do wish the fireplace had worked though. Guessing by the cobwebs, it hadn't worked in a while. There was some construction when I stayed, so there was no lobby. I was confused when I wanted to check in because initially the door to "registration" was stuck. According to a letter, renovations are scheduled to end this month.The free breakfast could use improvement. I realize it's free, but even Hampton Inns (another Hilton chain hotel) or other Homewood Suites have better breakfasts. The first morning I stayed, the only hot breakfast items were biscuits and fried chicken. There's a waffle maker, so making a chicken and waffles breakfast is a no-brainer to a southerner, but my manager from Washington, DC was a bit confused at first. The second morning there were eggs and ham, but the ham in reality was hot cold cuts. Nevertheless, I think I would stay here again because of the location for where I need to be for work. In addition, there's a Starbucks, Corky's, and other restaurant options down the street. I definitely like the living room setup; as much as I travel, it really feels like a home away from home.This was a nice place to stop for the night. The property is large and has unusual amenities for a homewood suites. Basketball court, picnic tables  and gas grills dot the property. The people above us were very loud in the morning but that's not the hotel's fault. Breakfast was good and the staff was on top of keeping the breakfast area clean. The staff was very friendly. I would stay here again.I don't recommend this hotel.  We had reserved a King suite room and chose this hotel based on this room.  There were several of us traveling and we like staying all in a suite so we can visit.  We arrived at the hotel around noon to make sure we knew where it was, checked with the front desk to see what time our room would be ready. They told us around three. We came back at three and was told our room wasn't ready, so we sat in the lobby. At about 430 I went back to the front desk to ask about our room and it was then we were told the room we booked was not available, the people in it decided to extend their stay.I've asked to do that at other hotels and been told no, because the room was booked.  apparently this doesn't matter.We were given a different room for the night, and it was disgusting. It was clearly a neglected room.  The AC did not work, when I opened the closet panel it was filthy. We were extremely hot all night because it didn't work right and was very noisy.The dishwasher didn't work right. When I went to get a cup out of it, the dishes in it, were caked with food. The dishwasher had been run because the dishes were warm.Also the towel rack in the bathroom was rusted and pitted and should have been replaced ages ago. The GFCI faceplate in the kitchen had no screw and fell off.  If maintenance is this lacking, It made us wonder what else isn't being done at this property.The next morning, I gave the front desk a list of what was wrong with the room and they did send a maintenance man the next day to start working on the room, so I give them credit for that.  This first room I would give a one star, actually a negative one star.We were told we'd be switched to our room the next morning  I was given keys to a King suite, but when I moved all our luggage over and entered the room, it was clear we were assigned a smoking room.  So back to the front desk I went, and when I told them, they said that room wasn't a smoking room, but they would see what was going on - the room was clearly a smoking room the room did not have a no smoking sign on the door.We finally got keys to our other room and it was good.  There was a small amount of rusting on the towel rack but not like the other room.  This room I would give a 3, so I averaged that together to come up with the overall 2The breakfast at this hotel was nice with an assortment of hot and cold cereal, pastries, waffles, fruit and yogurt.  Coffee is available all day which was nice.  Vickie,  who worked at breakfast was very lovely and nice and we thoroughly enjoyed seeing her in the mornings and she put a smile on our faces.  The young ladies working the front desk were nice as well.A light dinner is available at night, nothing spectacular, a small salad bar and entree and veg.  This was nice because you didn't have to go out for dinner.  I think a good marketing idea would be to bring food in from local restaurants, a cross promotion type thing.This hotel is near nothing touristy, so if you stay here you have to drive to everything.  also getting to the hotel is very tricky because of how it is situated.  I had a co-pilot and we still missed the entrance at least once.  If you are by yourself, boot up the directions on your phone or hope your car has a GPS.We were compensated for the first night, but we wanted the room we booked, not to be stuck in a room that nobody should have stayed in.  I'd be reluctant to book at any Hilton hotel if they give away rooms. I wrote to corporate, and management at this hotel it took several days for a response, when I did get one it said they had 3 days to investigate it, and I didn't get a response for a week.  What I would have liked would have been an apology, saying they are looking into maintenance issues to make sure there hotels are well maintained and keeping guests happy.  I'm being sent a coupon for a free night's stay.  Big whoop.We traveled with four Tweens from up north. This place had mixed reviews and we were unsure. The pool was clean and the front lobby welcoming. They had a candy corner that we liked. Also fluffy bedding. NO bugs. None and we looked.  The grill area was clean and overall we enjoyed our one night stay. Starbucks and Olive Garden a short ride away.Nice people who work here. One lady has been there for 20 years. They are like a family away from your family. Free breakfast and dinner if you choose. The dinner is free Monday - Thursday and breakfast is free daily.  If you are away from home and need a home to stay, give them a chance to be your second family. It is tricky to get in and out, but it is nice. They are also planning to remodel their rooms soon.If you have to spend more than a few days in Memphis and would like a nice place to stay with a cozy feeling, I highly recommend staying at the Homewood Suites.  I've stayed here 2 out of the 3 times I've been to Memphis and it has never failed.  It definitely knows how to please its guests! Nice lobby area with a charming fireplace surrounded by cushy couches. A dining area next to the lobby provides hot, toasty complimentary breakfast complete with pastries, cereal, fresh fruits, bagels, waffles, coffee, orange juice, water, etc...Best of all, the complimentary "light" dinner from Monday - Thursday that changes daily. A menu is found on the fridge in your room that serves as advance notice of what dishes will be served each night for the whole month. There's always fresh salad with a variety of dressings to choose from in addition to the main dishes. Oh, but I love the salad here! I love it so much that I once opted for three huge plates of salad instead of the dinner being offered.AND there's free beer on tap from 5-7:30pm as well! I believe the two beers on tap were Bud Light and Amber Bock the last time I stayed here.Besides the free food and beer, service is just as stellar! The guys that work here are always willing to answer all the questions ranging from check-out process to best BBQ restaurant to the best gentlemen clubs around Memphis. Not that I've been to any of the clubs here, but I've heard stories. ;)Free shuttle service is provided to and from the airport, as well as any destination within a 5-mile radius of the hotel. Since the hotel is on an island - surrounded by freeways, this was a very good idea! Imagine trying to beat the cars whizzing by at 60mph while you try to get across the freeway to get some dinner and accidentally get hit. Yeah, not so fun, huh?  If you do use the shuttle service, be nice and tip the drivers! =)  They'll be nice to you and show you awesome BBQ joints you'd never hear about.The rooms come equipped with a kitchenette, pots, pans, dishes, dishwasher, refrigerator, etc.  Other amenities include a pool (for those humid, sultry summer days and nights), basketball court, free high-speed internet, a small gym, and a business center.This place is definitely a home away from home!!

hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton Memphis East
review_content: Rooms are good, comfortable and clean.  Friendly staff.  Unfortunately, it's located in between really heavy traffic roads, which makes it a bit stressful to access.I want to rate this higher because the front desk was so friendly to me when I arrived pretty late at night. He was wonderful. I'm rating it lower based on the age and cleanliness of the room. I was too tired to switch rooms and was just there to crash a few hours before an early morning meeting so tried my best to look past a toilet seat that was broke loose from the toilet, a dirty headboard, and a older sunk in mattress. I quickly wiped down the headboard and tried to focus on sleep. As other reviews online note, the bathroom is tiny! You have to angle in to shut the door that nearly grazes the toilet. The area is convenient and safe. The rate was affordable. I chose this room over the Hyatt Place which I had stayed at for similar rate last trip because I am a SPG member and wanted to take advantage of building points on my loyalty account. I'd like to see a remodel to the building before it would be my first choice in the future.I tried to order room service, but even though all of the printed literature in the room said that their kitchen was supposed to close at 10p, when I tried to order at 9.15pm, I was told on the phone that the kitchen had already closed at 9pm. The sink in the bathroom is blocked because the plug is stuck in the down position.The door to the bathroom doesn't actually have space to close if the toilet seat is down, so you can only close the door by opening the toilet, squeezing into the bathroom, then putting the seat down afterwards.The tiling in the shower is cracked, and (more worryingly) the tiling on the wall doesn't actually reach the end of the shower, so there is a 1.5" vertical line of exposed interior wall structure (!)The bed is ridiculously soft (and I generally like a soft bed).Showtime is programmed into the television, but is not available and there is no signal on that channel.When it rained, the cable went out entirely. Luckily it only rained for 15 minutes or so.The air conditioner is surprisingly loud, difficult to hear anything over it, very difficult to sleep through it, like a car engine level of noise. And the thermostat is completely dysfunctional, so you just have to manually turn on and off the a/c.I would be perfectly happy with no frills, but this is just a mess. Very uncomfortable and stressfull (which is not what you want from any hotel). There are too many dilapidated, broken, non-functional details. They need to spend less money on the clunky furniture and pay your maintenance staff to repair the amenities.Why is there so much hate here? Our room was clean, the hotel was clean, and we took advantage of the gym. There also is free parking and wifi. This hotel is close to Beale Street and other attractions. The only reason why it isn't a 4-star is because the breakfast is $10pp. Lame.I had the delight of having a room by the elevator with a view of a giant loud air conditioning unit. The bed was comfortable but makes this weird squeaking noise that is so loud that you can hear it through walls. I paid $10 for eggs and fruit for breakfast. The fruit was inedible because it had already started to ferment. The staff was lovely and the room was clean. As a newly minted traveling salesgirl, I'm on the lookout for a hotel chain to meet my needs. 4 Points may not be it.Perfect for business travelers.  I had no problems.  This seems like a much safer option than some other hotels closer to the airport.  Free shuttle which they booked ahead of time to ensure timely departure, newly renovated everything, comfy bed, complimentary bottled water in the rooms, free breakfast.  Chris helped me sign up with their rewards program.  I was here for work and conducted several interviews in the lobby undisturbed.  I will definitely stay here again.I would give 3.5 stars but, I could only choose a whole number. The hotel is clean and the front desk staff are very friendly. The buffet breakfast is good but, be sure to get in by 9am for the best selection. The room is standard and clean. As another reviewer stated, the HVAC unit is loud. The bathroom is sized okay for one person (at a time ) to do what they need to do. You will need to maneuver yourself to get the door closed past the commode (maybe they should have a non-swinging door instead). The hotel is close to shopping, dining or whatever you want to do in a urban city. I look forward to coming back.Got a room here through Hotwire. Showed up and there had been a bus load of people dropped off. Although there were at least 20 people checking in in front of us, we were through the line and up to our room in 15 minutes. John W. Checked us in. Super nice, very informative and ensured we had a single king instead of two fulls. The hotel just finished a large renovation and was very comfortable in the lobby. Our room was on the fourth floor corner with great views. Went up to the indoor pool with a couple of drinks and enjoyed the water before we headed to dinner. The bed was very comfortable and the room temp was perfect. Only downside was the cheap toiletries and valet cost. Used to seeing high end toiletries and.most people have a car to the hotel. Valet should be complimentary to guests.UPDATED- Read Below. Location wise: This hotel is in a bad spot. You only have access to one restaurant that is rather pricey. The shuttle will take you to other nearby places, but keep in mind that this hotel only has one shuttle that is expected to run to the airport and take customers to local shopping and restaurants. MOST IMPORTANTLY, this hotel has awful management. I am a loyal Starwood Platinum member for the last five years and I have never experienced the lack of management skill this hotel exhibits. I waited 55 mins at the airport for the complimentary shuttle service, even though the hotel is only 15 mins away. When I first called, the front desk said it would be 20-25 mins bc they were out- I ended up waiting nearly an hour.When I arrived at the hotel, I made a customer suggestion to a manager that the hotel should consider having two shuttles available, so no customer would ever have to wait such a long time. The manager on duty said that I should've called earlier in the day and told them my flight schedule. I have never within the last five years of being a high level Starwood member been asked to make prior complimentary shuttle reservations. The management was nothing short of arrogant and blew off my suggestion. The driver, Cornelius, had way more customer service skills than anyone working the front desk, or on the management team. Kudos to him and his professionalism.UPDATE: Before my departure, a front desk clerk pulled me aside and told me that the team met to better determine what they could've done better and decided to compensate me by supplying some Starwood points for the inconveniences. The amenity gift and their recognition of the situation was certainly appreciated for waiting outside for nearly an hour on a shuttle, when I would've have been at the hotel in half the time using a taxi service already at the airport.Second time staying at this hotel. I find it very reasonably priced, always very clean and the beds are plenty comfortable.This is the typical airport hotel that I don't like, except that it isn't an airport hotel.  The lobby and common areas aren't too bad, but the rooms need to be updated.  We were told that our room price included a free breakfast, but that was a lie.  There were three separate parties in the restaurant who told the waitress that we were told our breakfast was free, but she said that someone was mistaken.  Room service begins around 8:30 on the weekends, which is way too early.  I put the card that read "Later please" on the door handle.  We received a note under our door that said that we would have to request room service, since we left the note on the door.  What does "Later please" mean then?  The lighting in the room was terrible.  The bathroom was very small.  Apparently, the bathroom tiles were newly installed, since there were penciled measurement markings on the tiles.The best thing about the hotel was the free parking, free internet and the bed.Okay so I finally got my towels I requested and now I'm in the lobby and apparently there's this big white cooler filled with bottled drinks which you were supposed to help yourself with but the check in girl never mentioned. In addition, I forgot to mention that upon arrival, I was standing at the podium waiting my turn while a line formed behind me. She approached the podium and yells "who's next?"  Duh? I'm next I say.   ...( who else would be next? The guy behind me? And besides am I in line at a Mc'Ds ? No, good evening, may I help you or Welcome to Four Pts?) what a difference from the Four Pts in Nashville.   The next morning we came down at 9:30 am for the $10/pp bkfast and found that they stopped serving at 9!  It wasn't even free . So I decided to get some free coffee, and guess what? The thermos was empty.  Not to be swayed, I asked the front desk for coffee and she asked the mgr who instead of filling the thermos, directed me into the kitchen to get some coffee.  It seems the managers here don't take ownership of anything here.Acceptable. Clean, free wifi and parking. Beds are terribly uncomfortable and are doubles, which is just too small. Stayed there over a week ago and the $50 incidental hasn't been released yet, which indicates lazy management since I know my bank always releases those asap. $10 breakfast was terrible. Woman who checked me in was incredibly rude.We loved our stay here. The staff was friendly and helpful. They even gave us breakfast because it was our wedding weekend. The room was clean and comfortable with great rates.  The only complication we had was the location because we weren't used to the area and it was hard to get in and back out again. But we  will definitely stay here again.We stayed at the one on Stansell a couple months ago and it was awesome. So we thought this one would be too but apparently the one on Stansell is newer and the suites location. The Poplar is an older hotel that they gave a facelift to because it's obvious the elevators are ancient (and not very clean). Beds are ok if you like a firm bed but they don't have queen beds, only King or two doubles (was expecting queen).  When I asked for the St Jude discount, the reservations line said there was not one but gave us some sort of alternative deal that was $10 more overall. Breakfast is $10 a person for what other hotels in the area give for free. The staff was very nice, one lady at the front desk was extremely helpful and did all she could to get us the lower rate but was not able to change it in the system so she gave me 2 free breakfasts so it worked out.Convenient location with decent rates. The room I stayed in has carpet on the floor that needs some remodeling. Air conditioning is constantly running if kept at 70 degrees. The shower head in the bathroom does not work properly.They had barbecue one day. It is also kind of complicated to get to the hotel, if you are not used to the area.Four Points Sheraton Memphis East just barely gets an A-Okay. Free shuttle from airport and free wi-fi, are nice, but I didn't need to use either. A shuttle to Beale Street might be nice! I found service on the phone and in person to vary widely, as some front desk clerks were awesome, and some scattered and unhelpful. There's no restaurant or bar, but they do serve a breakfast for $9 (didn't use, just head to the Blue Plate Cafe, nearby). I found the room to be adequate, with need for improvements. The bathroom door in my room got jammed at the toilet, needing brute force otherwise. The parking lot is policed by nice security guards, so your ride is safe and secure.This is 17 minutes from Beale, via a circuitous drive on I240. The location is kind of nice, though, as it's near Germantown, and nicer shops on Poplar Avenue. So your savings from staying on Beale can be spent elsewhere. I would probably stay in this area of Memphis again, but choose another hotel over Four Points Sheraton.I'm not sure what the previous reviewer was expecting from a three-star hotel, but my wife and I stayed here New Year's Eve night and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  The hotel is well-kept, clean, has a classy (not-over-the-top) decor (main lobby, hallways, and rooms - ours at least), offers free wifi, has a very large fitness center with modern, fully-operational equipment, and every member of the staff we came across was friendly and acknowledging.  The location is convenient to Beale Street and the downtown Memphis area, and yields no worries about safety when coming and going during the late hours of the night.  The hotel didn't seem too incredibly busy, so no concerns about finding a good parking space; but I'd imagine if it were at full capacity, there might be some.  We ended up making a last minute reservation for a single night, so the rate wasn't the best ($119); but for the experience and the limited notice, I'd say it was worth it.  We didn't get a chance to try breakfast since we usually stay out way too late, and wake up way too late the following morning/afternoon, so I can't speak on how good a value the $9 meal is; however, maybe it's just us, but it's like people make or break hotels in reviews based on continental breakfast, and that in itself seems silly.  But again, maybe it's just us...Bottom line, next time we're in Memphis for more than a few hours, Four Points will be on our list for convenient and confident places to call temporary home.  I think if given the chance, assuming you're not a crazed breakfast tyrant, you just might enjoy it as well.Is not in centrum but for was a good location because I had the car. Good price and good breakfast. Recommended.

Could the folks that work here possibly be any nicer?  From valet to check-in they treat you so very well and you can really tell that they enjoy their jobs.....The location is right in the center of it all so it's a great place to use as your hub.  I stayed at the newer Courtyard during my last visit, but wanted to be more in the center during this trip.  It's older than the Courtyard, but very clean and my suite is simply huge.Great peeps...phenomenal location....great price.  You can't go wrong.This might have been the most disappointing hotel stay I've ever had. The only saving grace was the staff, which had wonderful (albeit poorly trained) people.If you expect the Marriott or Residence Inn brands to ensure quality, you will be sorely disappointed. People who left positive reviews haven't stayed in many hotels. PROS- Hotel staff was nice, but they took their time doing anythingCONS- Hotel is ancient- Beds were uncomfortable and lumpy- Carpet smelled musty in public areas and the rooms- Breakfast was inedible- Elevators are slow- Rooms have little to no sound insulation, especially the bathrooms- Value (over $200 including tax) was poor - I've spent half as much and gotten better roomsTIPAvoid at all costs. There's nothing of note nearby.Spent thanksgiving out in Memphis and stayed here. The hotel is downtown, so yes, expect to pay $20 for valet parking daily (can come and go as you please), or $8 for self parking (which you pay everything you leave). The hotel itself was lovely. Check in process was breeze. We were helped up to our room by the bellhop and given some tourist pointers as to where and what's cracking around downtown. The room was big and spacious. A separate living/sleeping area which was perfect since we were traveling with my dad. (Nice roomy pullout couch bed). A nice sized kitchen area with fridge, micro and stove. Separate dinning area for 2. The room was immaculate. No dust, no fly away hairs from the previous tenants and it smelled fresh. Not to mention, they welcome dogs. Plenty of room for my 2 Bostons and their crate. However, the "potty area" is where they lose a star. When a hotel welcomes dogs, you assume that they have a designated potty area on site. Not the case here! You need to leave the hotel entirely, walk down a shady looking ally way.. Go up 2 blocks where they have this this square/park area for your pups to release. My poor Bella couldn't even make it the first go around. She peed in the ally! Lol Definitely something I wanted to mention if you're traveling with dogs. (Be sure to have a buddy embark down there with you at night.) But it was clean and provided potty bags. Also, be sure to check out the roof top terrace. Take your camera because there's opportunities for an awesome sunset shoot! This place is super close to Beal St.. Not even a 10 minute walk. And because we had such a great experience with the hotel itself and staff, we will definitely stay again! Minus the dogs.. LolI was greeted with a grunt and a frown from Elmo, the valet guy.  He was so rude, nasty and unwelcoming that even though, I was booked for six nights, I cancelled my stay and moved to the Westin hotel instead.  The rooms were also small and weirdly laid out.  Everything felt old.  I suggest you stay elsewhere.Good location, nice big suite, separate bed room, kitchen. Nice lobby and room.Stay here, it's good.This was actually one of,if not, the nicest marriotts I have ever stayed in. As soon as you walk in you feel the true vintage vibes of Memphis surround you I was expecting the room to be small,as most old buildings have small rooms,but I was pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean, spacious,and nice. All of the employees were very nice and accommodating,there's nothing but good things to say about them. The maids are up and cleaning constantly starting from  the morning. The hotel serves a great breakfast with many choices and options, you can even make your own Belgian waffles! (Yummm)  There's a whole little waffle bar set up with at least 5 different types of syrups and a bunch of toppings. The only issue with the hotel is there is next to none parking,but the valets are very good at their job and get your car to you quickly.Some Good, Some BadResidence Inn Memphis TN.  On balance good, but not all good.We are fans of the Residence Inn brand hotels by Marriott. We have stayed in them from coast to coast. We really like the amenities including the space, full kitchen (even though we never cook), WiFi, included breakfast (not "free", just included in the price). The staff is almost always on the ball and accommodating. First, let me give you the "Some Bad" part of the story. I arrived by taxi in the mid afternoon. I was alone - my wife would arrive later. The cab driver unloaded me with five pieces of luggage on the sidewalk. High end hotels would have doormen. At Residence Inn we don't expect doormen. This senior citizen (me, the old guy) drags all five pieces through the door and into the lobby. I see the desk way over there, across the lobby and in three trips manage to get all the luggage over there. I check in, get a luggage cart and load it up. At this point a guy shows up and asks, "Can I help you with that?" !!!! I declined the offer of the person I took to be a bellhop. I could be wrong. Maybe he was not a bellhop. He could have been another guest just trying to help me out. But over the next couple of days I saw someone who looked just like him doing employee-like tasks in the lobby.We (my wife & I) like king size beds. For this trip in mid April, 2015, at first we booked our room for a Saturday and Sunday night. No problem. Then we had a change in plan and wanted to start on Friday night. Ooops. No king size bed rooms available on Friday. I tried the internet. I tried calling the national number. I tried calling the hotel itself. No king size bed rooms available on Friday. Okay. Booked a queen size bed room for Friday. "Don't you want to have the same room for the whole stay?"  "NO."  The pictures of the room with a queen size bed shown on the web site look interesting. They say how wonderful the room is. It was not wonderful for us. The room had all the usual amenities of a Residence Inn like a full kitchen and a sofa and a desk and a table. But the arrangement of space was awkward. Then, on Saturday night we got our room with a king size bed. WOW. It was on the top floor and was the biggest suite we have ever stayed in. It seemed like 1,000 square feet. It had two huge rooms and closets and a room with a vanity/sink and a room with a toilet/shower. We believe they may have only two rooms with king size beds, both on the top floor. (Don't know - just a guess.)But the staff was super accommodating. They went well above and beyond to give us good service. This is the most mixed experience I have had at a Residence Inn. Would I go back? Only if I could get the room with the king size bed.Dude! Have I not reviewed Marriott Residence Inn?Hubby, my 2 sons & sometimes one of their GFs, have stayed here on at least 3 trips.Twice, we have gotten a 2 br/2 ba suite with kitchenette and living room. 2 queen beds and a couch bed. Comfy beds & Lots of room for a family even at $300 a night, Solid value due to great location (walk to restaurants, bars, River Walk, TomLee riverside park, Peabody Hotel, Starbucks at 3d & Beale area, I-40 & 55, trolley, YMCA, FedEx Forum, Redbird StadiumFelt very safe, good service & valet parking is reasonable (drawback - no dedicated parking & street parking is tough)Recently renovated, formerly historic Memphis apartment building, decent breakfast 7am - 10am (they start pulling items at about 945 so do not be late!). It is an older building so lower your expectations and enjoy the space & location and don't look for luxury or style here. Good value, friendly & helpful service.Landon was very pleasant towards everyone, and provided outstanding customer service!  My friends really enjoyed his sangria concoction too.I just left Memphis after a two day stay for Memphis in May. This is my preferred hotel when in Memphis for pleasure.   I have stayed in this hotel in the past and have enjoyed the hospitality of the staff.  Likewise,  during this stay, the staff were friendly and went out of the way to make our stay pleasant.  My friend and I stayed in a two bedroom suite The bedrooms were spacious enough for our brief stay and the views were great.  The only drawback was the noise from the street, especially the noise from the trolley.The employees at this hotel are amazing. We had a wonderful experience. They were so accommodating. The hotel is older but it has been renovated to a beautiful hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed are conversations with James. Thank you all.   We would stay here again.This particular Residence Inn is quite close to everything in Memphis, Downtown. Walking distance to Mud Island, Beale Street, and the trolly is only a block away. When I visited here, April 2013, the place was under renovation and the suite we stayed at was worn and tired, but clean. Some issues with how they maintain the place, one of the two toilets were broken and not flushing, and even after telling the desk, nothing came of it. It's a good location, the staff was very nice, but unless you get one of the new rooms/suites, I'd avoid it. Be sure to ask what the vintage of the room is.We really enjoyed our stay here.  The room was large and very comfortable.  The location was convenient and the staff very friendly.  We highly recommend this hotel.Residence Inns are my favorite Marriott hotels. I'm mostly giving this one 3 stars because of the parking situation. I honestly can not stand it when hotels don't provide parking. We were able to nab a spot on the street, but almost had to park in the garage which only takes cash. The hotel does not have an ATM. It's located nicely and the breakfast is great.This hotel exceeded my expectations. I booked it because it had the lowest rates compared to other hotels in the area. I was amazed at how large the room was and even more amazed by the incredible customer service provided by the hotel staff. It was also a short walk to Beale Street.Always enjoy our stay here.  This is an excellent location for downtown Memphis and the staff is excellent. Like the layout of the suites.  Undergoing renovation for an even better experience.Great hotel. Great location. Clean, spacious rooms with semi-unusual layouts. I avoided the whole valet parking mess by parking around the corner and ended up only paying $5, yes $5 bones for the weekend. Gotta love those automated parking lots. Anyways, the big bonus with this hotel is the nice hot tub on the roof. I really enjoyed soaking away the muscle pain from all the walking I did in this little city. I would stay there again and recommend it to others. The location is perfect for exploring Memphis' highlights.Very nice experience. Staff was great. Location excellent.  Room clean and comfortable.  And quiet.Could not sleep all night. Fans and A/C units outside the room extremely loud, avoid the 2nd floor at all cost!I really love this hotel and often advise out of town visitors to check it out before making final reservations anywhere else. It's right in the middle of downtown Memphis, just blocks from Beale Street, AutoZone Park, Court Square and the trolley line. They just renovated a few years ago, and the hotel looks fresh and modern on the inside. Notice I said modern and not contemporary. The rooms are spacious and the one that I stayed in had a little kitchenette. No need to use the kitchen to cook breakfast though as Residence Inn offers a free (and yummy) breakfast buffet for all guests. The lobbies are nice, and there are many conference rooms for business meetings and conventions. The staff is also very friendly, and there is valet service available.
review_content_20: We absolutely loved staying in this hotel for marathon weekend, and we'll probably return to it the next time we're staying in Memphis. In the past, we have always stayed at the Peabody or the Marriott, and the quiet, restful environment of this hotel was really welcomed for all of us runners! We also appreciated the valet parking and the WONDERFUL effort the hotel made to accommodate all of us leaving early for the starting line: While typically they didn't serve breakfast on weekends until later, they had a lot of popular runner foods out early, like bananas, bagels and, of course, coffee. Very thoughtful! I also called the desk to ask if I could buy some tea varieties in their store because what I found in the room seemed to be only caffeinated choices, and we wanted some before going to bed the night before the race. The woman at the desk told me to just come down to the breakfast area  and help myself to whatever varieties I wanted there. Again, very thoughtful!We loved our room! We had what I think is categorized as a "one bedroom," and has the bed/bath area separated and slightly raised from the living/kitching/dining area. It was very relaxing and comfy. The kitchen was well stocked with dishes and utensils for us. The Internet is not wireless, but wires are provided, and it's FREE. Two small things: The remote for the living room television didn't work at all, except to turn it on, and the phone in the living area didn't dial the pre-programmed numbers, so there was not way to call the desk from that phone. I didn't tell them about these issues, so I didn't give them an opportunity to fix them.This hotel is very well located for many downtown restaurants and activities, as it is super close to (but blessedly off of) Beale Street and very close to AutoZone Park, the Orpheum Theater, etc. There are also great restaurants nearby, including two of my favorites, McEwen's on Monroe and Automatic Slim's on 2nd. Rendezvous Barbecue is also very close. This is a GREAT place to stay in downtown Memphis. We loved it. Everyone was very friendly and helpful, and we were quite pleased with our stay!I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The building looks a little old/dated from the outside, but that image changes as soon as you walk in the door. The lobby and mezzanine where breakfast is served and where the gym is are nicely decorated and comfortable.The rooms are even better. I love the funky layout and the full kitchen is a definate plus. The bed is SO COMFY and there is plenty of storage space. The bathroom shows a little wear and tear if you look closely, but in the grand scheme of things even that is just fine.I was happy to see dumbells in the gym - most hotels seem to just have cardio machines. The machines themselves are just fine - not the latest and greatest but certainly better than some hotel gyms I've stayed at. I love that there are two treadmills - more of a chance to get one! Looking forward to staying here again in November!Great location!!! Only 3ish blocks to Beale, close enough to walk and far enough away to sleep :-) There is valet service so you can just pull up in front of the hotel. The kind valet also helped us to our rooms with luggage etc. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful in getting us the best rate possible ($129 per night). Breakfast, happy hour, and wifi included.The rooms have a small kitchen which was really helpful for us. It makes such a difference to not have to eat out every meal. The shower is ok, but not the best in terms of luxury and water pressure. I would definitely stay here again.PET fee: $100 non-refundable one time fee for your stay. Ouch, this hurt. But, I could not find another hotel that would allow a dog in the room so I went for it since we were staying two nights. There is a park two blocks north and there is another that looks over the water about three blocks away. The down side is that the closest park has a small group of homeless and didn't feel quite as clean or safe as others I've been too. Still, it got the job done. There are tons of squirrels so if this makes your pet crazy go to the park closer to the water on Front St.Great location, clean comfortable rooms (like all Residence Inns I've been to), great front desk.  There's a $16 valet parking fee per day but you get unlimited ins and outs.  AAA discount (10%, I think).  Breakfast buffet included.  Easy walking distance to Beale street, Rendevous, Gus, and the Mississippi River.  The guy at the front desk was hilarious!  Made us laugh every time we entered or exited the hotel.  Price was not bad either (about $127/night for 3 people with AAA discount).  Free in-room high-speed internet.  One odd thing we noticed--the windows in our 10th floor room did not have any screens or anything on them, so if you opened them up all the way, someone could fall out, if they were being careless.  Dangerous for small children!I'd never stayed in a Residence Inn, and wow did it outdo my expectations. 4 blocks from Beale St. In an art deco building that was recently inducted into the historical society. The room was adorable!! If it were a studio apartment for rent, I'd be in heaven. The complimentary breakfast was way more than expected- eggs, yogurt, bagels, english muffins, toast, cereal, waffle maker.. not just your average crap complimentary breakfast. The staff was accomodating and really into making guests happy. The southern charm of a "yes, maam" always does the trick, too. If in Memphis, I'd recommend this hotel.This hotel has a great location, right next to Beale Street.  The staff is friendly and helpful, and since it's a residence inn you get all the typical features (free breakfast, free happy hour during the week, a kitchenette in your room, etc.).  It is clean and looks well maintained.I stay in a lot of marriotts and sometimes the residence inn is nicer than the mainline marriott in a given city -- this is the case in Memphis.  If you are deciding which marriott to book, I would pick this one over any of the others because of location + quality of the hotel.

review_content: Started off with valet which was super friendly and took care of us quickly. The guest services was great, check in not till 4 but we got our rooms at noon and placed us on the 10th floor with an excellent view. The beds were very comfy and pillows were fluff. I usually pick doubletree when I stay downtown but this will be my spot from here on out. Great place to stayKeeping with the Holiday Inn theme on our travels, my sister and I wanted to find a spot that was downtown that'd we'd be able to leave the car at and walk around at night without having to drive. For a Sunday night, a non-smoking, king-size bed room was $160 + valet that was $22/day. You are able to take your car in and out if you wanted to, but we chose not to considering where we were. The Holiday Inn is really centrally located and is easy to get to great bars and restaurants in the area. We did hit up the pool for a hot second. Not sure if you're allowed to smoke out there, but a guy was. The shadows caught up to us pretty quickly at 6:15pm which is a bummer since that seems like the time one would enjoy lounging in the sun. This location would do swell with a jacuzzi, in my opinion. On our floor there was an obnoxiously loud ice maker that sounded like someone vacuuming in the hallway, but we couldn't really hear it in our room. The view from our room was meh, but the bed was uber comfy, and (not sure if we were just a little tipsy or tired) but the sheets smelled amazingly fresh. I can quote my sister having said, "I need to ask the maid what they wash the sheets in..." before slipping into a good night's sleep. I would definitely recommend this location if you're looking to hit up Memphis downtown at a good rate to split with someone! Head out to the pool early if you want to catch some rays, and avoid a room by the ice machine!I recently stayed here during a business trip, I normally stay at the Peabody across the street but it was all booked and the Holiday Inn is very centrally located right downtown (its big selling point). Its only a few blocks to Beal street or the trolly line. The hotel staff are very friendly and generally helpful, my room was clean enough, the linens and such worn to the degree you might expect from an urban holiday Inn. My stay was not terrible, but this place does not offer anything especially terrific either.
