For the record, I did use the valet parking and they did not damage my car.It is a Holiday Inn, but the location is top notch. Heart of downtown with access to everything. I never really noticed this hotel until this weekend. Perfect place if you plan on having a late night of weird.There are many issues with this hotel though I will say it's location is very nice. Close to the Mississippi River and the restaurants nearby are great. However:1. check-in is 4PM... I was told NOT ONE room would be available until 4PM.... until I complained to the manager and was able to get in a room at 2PM. I have to mention... their concern for my well-being was discounted by the manager and the receptionist at the desk. Abhorrent customer service.2. The guest bathroom on the 1st floor had a piece of toilet paper between the stall doors b/c otherwise you could see through it while someone was using the restroom. This isn't fixable?3. The shower never got hot... I took a cold shower the evening of my check-in and a tepid shower the morning after.4. Turned the air conditioner on... and it made such a loud noise... I had to turn it off to sleep.5. Choose the Hilllllllttttooooonnn (IHG won't allow me to use the correct name and submit this review) down the street. You're likely to get better services and a newer hotel.Went here for a conference, and I would not recommend it. I'll be brief:(1) Yes, it is in the downtown area so that is convenient.(2) Yes, there is parking and valet. But, it is ridiculously expensive but I guess you pay for the safety of your vehicle in a less than safe downtown (comparatively to the rest of the US)(3) The conference rooms are nothing to write home about, not even the "grand ballroom" which isn't really so grand.Overall, I just don't know that I would stay here if it wasn't for conferences or business trips. You can find some place nicer for your personal vacations.I would love to give this hotel 4 stars. The location is great, the staff is very polite and helpful and the rooms are clean and nice, but.... After driving away from hotel about 25 miles or so my car told me I had low tire pressure. I pulled into gas station to air it up and noticed the sidewall of the tire was ripped and the wheel scratched, it was ruined. I had to replace the tire $150. This positively happened with the valet service at the holiday inn. If you stay here inspect your vehicle before leaving.I'm forced to stay here frequently due to business. The location is good as there are many different food options. The rooms have nice TVs but they are not hooked up to HD. The pillows were not cleaned. I could smell the hair product of whoever stayed the previous night on the pillows. But my biggest complaint of all, which led me to writing this review is the hot water situation here. The past 3 times I've stayed here, the hot water has been lukewarm at best. The worst part is that the front desk is fully aware of the problem and it has yet to be fixed. Completely unacceptable and I would never recommend anyone ever staying here.Pros: Comfy room, proximity to Beale, affordable,Cons: View from our room was terrible (a parking garage and the broke down Benchmark), no pool/whirlpoolOverall I have to say I was pleased with my stay.  I usually like to stay in the Peabody across the street, but it was booked the weekend I visited Memphis.  However, you can't beat the location of this Holiday Inn.  It was a quick 3 minute walk to Beale, and had tons of restaurant and bar choices close by.The room was clean and comfortable.  My room appeared to have been recently remodeled, and it was a good room for the price.  No breakfast, pool or hot tub though.  I was disappointed with that.After a long day of travel we arrived! The staff was super sweet and hospitable.  Our room was nothing special but suited us just fine. We had a view of the Peabody and were given lots of great recommendations of where to grab some food! We will be traveling back to Memphis soon and look forward to staying again.Can't recommend highly enough the staff here, they were so friendly and helpful wish we could have stayed longer. Felt so welcome at all times. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Would have been nice to have a fridge. Or a kettle for tea drinkers.But really they were great.Hotel was great ....clean, comfortable and close proximity downtown attractions, restaurants, etcetera as well as within walking distance to Beale St.   Note that valet parking is $20 and there I'd no self parking available at hotelI was on a business trip to Memphis which made me choose this hotel as it was close to my client location. The location of the hotel itself gets high points. The two things that scored top points besides the location are the staff and the room service. I would give them 5 stars for their friendly staff (they were really good i must say) and great room service. But here are a few things i noticed about this place which made me give it a 3 star rating.1. Expensive parking. $20 a night2. I had 6 issues during my one week stay which are as follows:              a. Noisy room on my first night stay here. I was later shifted to a different room which was calm and silent. I appreciate the fact that they were quick in changing my room.              b. The lamps in my room were flickering when i moved in. I had to call the front desk to have them replaced               c. The chair in my room was already broke. Again another service request to have it replaced. All the time the front desk was quick to have them replaced               d. It was impossible for me to control the temperature in the room. The Air Conditioners and the thermostats were old and hard to regulate. I had to switch off the AC to get a good night's sleep.               e. The coffee machine in my room was broke. I noticed it on my 5th day of stay but they did not replace it. Not sure why.                f. The computers next to reception area for guest use are outdated. One of it had a bad display and super slow. The other computer they had worked well but the printers weren't functional when I tried to print to them. 3. I didn't like the fact that some signs in this hotel were taped to the wall using a duct tape. Really?? Why would you even do that. Also, it wouldn't be fair for me to not mention that i saw signs "Renovation in progress" signs posted in this hotel. I hope they fix atleast some of these issues. I sure plan to stay here on my next trip to Memphis. BTW, there are no refrigerators in the room or even a microwave. And, the TVs need an upgrade as well.We stayed here this past weekend and had a great experience. Staff was friendly. The lobby was festively decorated for the holiday (I'm a sucker for Christmas decorations). Parking was only $12 a night. Our room was clean. Sheets were immaculate and the beds were comfortable. Bath and Body Works toiletries = yay!  I slept like a rock, I didn't hear any of the noise from the street.  Excellent location, my dude was able to walk to Beale Street and back to pick up some Dyers take out in less than 10 minutes. Rendezvous is right behind the hotel. Lots of good eats to be had in the area! The only bad: the parking lot elevators are incredibly slow. Take the stairs.From the minute I walked through the doors, I was treated with  kindness, friendliness and excellent service. I had booked two nights, but because of bad weather one of my flights were canceled and I was forced to spend the night at the Dallas/Fort Worth Airport. When I arrived in the morning, I told them what happened, and they didn't charge me for that night. Even better when I got there very early in the morning--hours before the official check in time--they found a room for me. In short, they truly babied me. Especially Stephanie at the front desk. Later, I had lunch in their understated restaurant and it was top notch. The chicken cooked impeccable and the ice coffee strong and perfect . The room was large, the bathroom, while small, was impeccably clean. But again, it all comes down the the service. I have rarely been treated so well, and I travel quite a lot for business.I was tied to the gov't rate so I had to stay here. It didn't have the niceties I've come to expect. No refrigerator or microwave, there was a coffee pot but no coffee (got some from front desk), no breakfast included, $12 parking. This was a bad choice for a business trip. Room is dated, I checked the sheets and they were clean but hadn't seen bleach in years, bathroom is ok, big tv, great location. The ears plugs had me worried but so far only slight noise. I won't be taking my shoes off to walk on this carpet - ugh! Internet ?This hotel was awesome! Super impressed with the quality of the hotel and the hospitality I have received here. Shout out to my home girl Trina who works at the front desk for being so wonderful to our big group!Great hotel. There was some construction noise when we first got there, but nothing unbearable. Stayed in one of the remodeled rooms, and it was pretty nice. Served it's purpose as a place to crash at the end of the night. Would stay here again.Just okay. Nothing special. Parking lot was full, so I had to park across the street. Think it's a little cheaper than the daily rate here, so I guess I'm okay with that. The rooms look & feel outdated because of the chosen decor. Very convenient to everything downtown.Overpriced breakfast. $10.95 for full and $7.95 for continental.This was our home away from home during our stay in Memphis.  It is an older downtown hotel, right across Union Avenue from the famous Peabody Hotel.  Like all older hotels, it has its quirks and charm.  The quirk was the elevators.  They are old, they are in the process of being replaced, and the service elevator to the parking garage was most fun.The hotel is walking distance from Beale Street, many good restaurants, the Gibson Guitar Factory and the Memphis Rock and Blues Museum.The food in the restaurant, at least for breakfast was good.  The coffee was good.The staff was helpful, friendly and made our stay enjoyable.  I would recommend staying here if in Memphis, and would go back to this particular Holiday Inn Select in the future.
review_content_20: I *love* this place. In fact, if I could move in (or afford to stay for like a month) I totally would, no question. The staff is very helpful and oh-so-friendly. I've now stayed three times in the past four years (every time I've road tripped through the area) and won't stay anywhere else. Walking distance to Beale, easy parking (a bit pricey, but... I've paid more) and easy to get to Graceland or where ever else you want to go.Room service is great - quick and tasty.It's a bit older, but it's clean and the beds are super comfy. I can't wait to come back!!Ask for a real pillow not a throw pillow also the iron was damaged and messed up my shirtThe only good thing is it is close to Beale Street.  The room is poorly appointed, over priced, and small. The TV isn't HD, parking is inconvenient,  and the place just feels old. On top of all that, a jackhammer was working right above us until after 6pm.This was a good hotel. Beds were clean, carpet vacuumed, and bathroom clean. Looked like our room was renovated recently but there were so many scuffs on the walls though. The beds were to my liking and pillows. The bathroom could have used a fan. It got so steamy and hot in the bathroom when shower was on and really made the rest of the hotel room humid. The staff were very nice in the lobby and each day when we wanted towels from the housekeeper, she was very accommodating too! In the guest service book in the room, it had said the room service was open until 10:30. We called at 9:50pm and no one answered. We waited a few more minutes and called again. No answer. We then called the front desk. The front desk person went back to the kitchen and apparently the chef left. There wasn't an apology or anything. We are at the restaurant for a lunch and breakfast - on diff days. We had a nice server. Decent food on the menu. And decently priced food. The elevators were working ok but not the service elevator. It had gotten stuck a few times, luckily when I wasn't in there. I would come back again. It was a good price, safe and so close to everything - Beale St (3 blocks), FedEx Forum (4 blocks), downtown (1 block), Civil Rights Museum (15 minute walk - I walk fast).If you are an out of towner not too familiar with the Memphis area and worried that you will not be close to it all or in the ghetto, stop your search.  The hotel is located perfectly on the corner of Union and 2nd.  A safe and close walk to the ever popular Beale Street, numerous bars, and some really good restaurants.  You can even walk to the trolley which makes getting around even easier and super cheap.  The location is the greatest asset to this place.  The hotel itself is a little bit older, but not in any means rundown or shabby.  It has everything you need in your room, except an exhaust fan, and is more than comfortable.  The elevators are really fast and the parking garage is extremely convenient in a city with not a lot of parking (be prepared to pay $15 a night for parking).  We didn't check out the restaurant/bar downstairs, but it looked like it wouldn't be a bad stop at all.Be aware that there is no free breakfast to guests.  I know most hotels offer this, but not here.   I believe the breakfast buffeff was $13 in the morning, but as I mentioned previously, you are so close to so many great stops don't be afraid to adventure. Overall, this is a great hotel that is reasonably priced.  Great location and a very helpful staff.  If you are looking to spend a weekend or any amount of time in Memphis, make sure you include this hotel as part of your choices.  As an aside, we drove to Rhodes College several times and the driving time was less than 10 minutes.  Other than that we stayed parked and walked most everywhere else.We stayed at this hotel for one night. It's definitely an older hotel so our room and bathroom were small, but we didn't mind since we were not planning on spending a lot of time in the room. It was still a nice room that was clean and had a comfy bed. We requested a room on a higher floor with a nice view and they were able to accommodate us. The desk staff was friendly. The location was perfect! It's a great hotel for a quick trip to Memphis.Let's start with location - perfect!  Right down within walking distance of everything, and close to tons of recommended dining and bars.  Noise however... let's just say when you find two pairs of earplugs in little baggies next to a picture of a motorcycle on your nightstand, you get worried.  The first night wasn't too bad actually, but night 2 was horrible - very loud traffic from the street and we could hear our neighbors up and about quite a bit!  Other downside for them - is that I thought breakfast was included, and it is not.  But there is a restaurant downstairs (we didn't eat there though).  Go to the Rendezvous behind in the alley for super-yummy ribs and pulled pork!  Don't let the alley entrance scare you!  Fairly clean and comfy otherwise.  I've never stayed in Memphis before, so don't have anything in the area to compare it too.  Not sure the price was that great for a no-frills loud hotel, even with great location: $87/nt with $12/nt parking.When we made our first trip to Memphis to look for potential places to live when we relocated, we neglected to book a hotel before hand.  We rolled into town after an 8 hour drive (it was 5am) and had a hard time deciding where to stay.  We stumbled upon The Holiday Inn on Union, pulled in, and within 10 minutes I got a King room for $100 bucks per night.  This hotel is everything it needs to be- clean, quiet and in the perfect location.  The staff was friendly and we utilized the free internet room next to the check-in desk for much more than our allotted time (out of courtesy I think there's like a 30 minute limit) printing out MapQuest directions and Googling apartment locations. There's free coffee in the lobby and either cookies or donuts (some sweet breakfast-y treat in a basket) which is good enough for me!  Every time anyone from back home comes to town to visit we make them stay here.  The Peabody is simply fabulous, but if you aren't a big spender this is the best option downtown.Such an improvement!!: After escaping the America's Best Inn farther down on Union, I had this hotel as my last/only option. I had to pay twice as much, but it was worth it. The room was clean, the bed VERY comfortable. The bathroom was small, but inviting. Tons of mirrors, good lighting. Great view. The parking was a bit pricy, but I felt like my car was safe - worth it. didn't have a chance to try the restaraunt, but it looked great. Sushi place RIGHT next door. The Denny's on the other side was even tolerable. Being within walking distance to everything downtown was a plus, too. CD player/clock radio was a nice touch. Wolfgang Puck coffee in the room was good, too. It would have been nice if they offered military discounts every day of the week, though. All of the staff I encountered were extremely helpful and friendly. They offered a late check-out, if you made arrangements with the front desk. I don't know if I could afford to stay here every time, but if I could I would.

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Memphis Primacy Parkway
review_content: I stayed here for two evenings over a weekend earlier this month with my wife.  We arrived at the hotel shortly before the check in time and had no problem checking into our room. The hotel seemed nice enough with a bright well lit lobby and a nice looking breakfast area.  We ended upgetting a room on the fourth floor and as we got out of the elevator I was immediately hit by the distinct smell of weed.  That smell would linger in the hallway the rest of the night but would be gone the next day.Whenever we stepped into our room I ended up being quite pleased.  It was set up nicely with our king sized bed against one wall facing the TV and a long set of desks on the other side under the TV.  The bed ended up being super comfortable and both my wife and I enjoyed a couple of good nights of sleep.  The only real problem that we had with this la quinta was the gym.  While I myself did not go to it my wife described to me a number of broken machines with the only working one being a treadmill.  That was disappointing as the rest of the hotel seemed rather nice.The bottom line for me is that I would stay here again in the future. While it certainly wouldn't be confused with a luxury hotel, it was clean and comfortable and I enjoyed my stay.This LaQuinta stay has been on par with other La Quinta stays. I wouldn't stay here if my in-laws weren't rewards members, but who argues with the in-laws on a trip?!  It's easier just to go with the flow, so here we go!Hotel still offers smoking rooms, which you can smell from the hallway. It's pretty unpleasant and the smell seeps into the non-smoking rooms.  Minus 1 star!I didn't experience the hot tub, heated pool, or use the WiFi mentioned by the front desk. So, I can't comment on those.The elevator nearest to breakfast is pretty terrifying; it felt like being on a theme park ride. Continental breakfast was okay. They have waffle makers, cereal, bagels, toast, and apples. There is also biscuits and gravy, but they're cold on purpose. There's a microwave, but, no thanks.  I would have liked to see some bacon or eggs, or something else hearty.Shower had hot water; toilet and sink worked fine.  Plenty of seemingly clean towels available. There's a star. The bathroom is half of the hotel room, and a pretty important part of the stay. Room feels dirty. It looks dirty. There's a pretty large dark stain in the carpet at the foot of the bed (picture included).  Everything that was once white (smoke detector, telephone, light switches, lamp shades, AC, caulk all over) is now dingy and yellow. The bathroom is updated but the rest of the room could use a refresh. There are dirty corners and damaged walls. Put it this way- you wouldn't feel comfortable walking around barefoot in this room.  Minus 2 stars. The room, after all, is the most important part of the hotel.No USB charging ports, but there is a 32" flat panel TV, and it actually has HD channels.  In my experience, most hotels just slap a flat-panel in the room and expect it to be an improvement over an older CRT TV.  That's usually not the case when they pump standard digital, (or even analog, yuck) signals into these nice TVs. It doesn't work like that; you need HD!  They've done it right, so that's a plus.  Sadly for me, that's only the 2nd star. I can't go any higher than that.This is a review that I wish I could give three and a half stars.  The lobby and the exterior are lovely.  There is a swimming pool, hot tub and laundry room.  Our room for one night was $99, which is very reasonable for the location.  The rooms are large and very comfortable.  There is a nice long desk spanning across the window area of the room.  There is plenty of storage and light and the bed is very comfortable.  The room itself seems very clean.  Our bathroom is in a bit of disrepair.  There are cracks in the ceiling and the bathtub needs to be replaced.  There is a huge hole in the middle of the bathtub.  The toilet is so low to the ground that it is extremely uncomfortable.  Also the water level is very close to the toilet seat, which can present problems, especially for men.  Know what I'm talking about?  My boyfriend knows.The temperature in the room can be set to either hot or cold.  There is no in between.  The temperature was 90 degrees outside, so we chose cold.  It is so hot and humid at a temperature higher than 68, which was the temperature the thermostat was set at when we entered the room.  We both thought it was too cold, so we set the thermostat to 72.  Within five minutes the room was humid and uncomfortably warm.We are only staying at this hotel for one night and overall we are very happy with our visit.In contrast to the somewhat gritty neighborhood of the last La Quinta in Memphis that my wife and I patronized, this property appeared to be located in an upscale city neighborhood. We knew we picked the right place for us and our dachshund when we saw the ad on their front door advertising how pet-friendly they were.  The gentleman at the front desk person was pleasant and seemed genuinely interested in our travels.Our accessible room was the most spacious of the four Tennessee hotels we stayed in during our road trip. The room did have an unique shape with an almost circular foyer and interestingly provided two mini-fridges. The one minor ding I would give is that there was no ice machine on our floor. We did not have the opportunity to partake in the free breakfast, fitness center or the pool but the latter two looked enticing to me. If you don't need to be in the heart of town, this hotel makes for a comfortable, welcoming stay.This is by far one of the worst hotels I have ever visited. The room smells heavily of mold and mildew, the staff is not helpful at all! When my husband made the reservation, he requested a crib. When we got there it was not in the room so he asked again. Long story short, they didn't bring the crib until after midnight! I had to stay up with my little one to make sure he didn't roll off of the bed, which he would definitely do. He's a squirmy little guy.My husband, aka Save a Penny Jenny, only chose it for the price and location. We will pay extra next time and stay downtown.Decent hotel for a decent price and it's in a good location. The front desk people were friendly and knowledgeable about the area which I really appreciated. We were told what streets to avoid if we were going drinking on beale because of dui traps. THAT WAS GREATLY APPRECIATED lol eateries near by typical fast food fare, not that far of a drive to tunica mississippi. The rooms were a little dated, but clean and no sign of insects. It's worth staying one night.If you are traveling with dogs and you are a non-smoker, this hotel doesn't care. The hotel is very clean compared to most the La Quinta chain hotels, but their breakfast is horrible.Not fancy, but good, clean place for a decent price. If visiting St Francis hospital, it's just a walk across the street. I always get a nice welcome when I visit. Breakfast area could use some more choices, but it is a continental breakfast style. Pet friendly too. Yes, whoever cleans, needs to address the public hallways, and the garbage cans in the hallway.For the price of $65 a night, this place is just perfect.  On our way from Dallas to Cincinnati we needed someplace to stay in the middle.  For the price and the amount of time, this seemed to be just what we needed.  The bed was comfy (and clean) the bathroom was big (and clean) and the room was big enough (and clean) with a large TV, desk, bed and bench, that we could relax for the whole 9 hours we were spending here (mostly sleeping). The front desk staff was very friendly and surprisingly the continental breakfast the next morning was better than I expected.  Belgian waffle maker, bagels and muffins, cereal, eggs (hard boiled...but still), yogurt and fruit.  Juice and Coffee.  Perfect. It's a quiet hotel even though it's right across from a hospital.  So if you ended up getting sick or accidentally incur a fatal wound, no worries help is close.The staff very friendly, room very clean, pet friendly. Nice courtyard with smoking permitted, gazebo, pool, hot tub. Breakfast typical cereal, hard boiled eggs, etc. The grounds are so well kept, enjoyed our stay...The hotel staff was excellent. The room was average but very clean. The walls are thin and if you're there on a busy weekend bring ear plugs! The hallways were dirty and stayed that way all weekend. There was a pizza box next to a trash can in our corridor when we checked in Friday night and it was STILL there Monday morning. The grounds were very pretty and serene. There too they could have used a scrub brush. It could be a very nice place with a little work.I Hotwire'd this hotel after a bad experience at an Extended Stay in the area. I was disturbed by the Extended Stay (for which I had a free night voucher), and decided to leave. The room was unique and modern, and the bathroom was clean with new fixtures. I would gladly pay for a room at this hotel rather than get the crappy Extended Stay room for free.Im really torn on how to rate the hotel.  Here is why:The rooms were nice,  big comfy beds, nice view good size flat screens...the doors to the bathroom were flimsy closet doors that lacked privacy or any sort... and the elevators were SLOW.   The breakfast was good in the mornings, and the woman service was quick and attentive. The hotel its self is in a great location.My big displeasure....We arrive Saturday,  that night we are heading out to go to the casinos and we hear a new born kitten mewing. we look high and low and finally discover the poor baby is trapped in the column outside the hotel. immediately we go in and tell the woman on shift,  who tells us yep- someone told them about it - YESTERDAY- We ask why is it still in there, and she tells us she doesn't know what the manager has plans to do...  The next morning sure enough the pool little baby is still trapped and mewing, we get the manager of the hotel who tells us they are not going to destroy the column to rescue the kitten, tried to explain how it is a support structure and it would not happen, we explained that no it is not a support structure, the bottom was obviously hollow, we could remove a panel at the bottom and let the lil baby out, he said no. we told him he was heartless and went on to call the Shelby county animal control, the aspca, the non emergency  help line and 2 other numbers we found and no one seemed to give a damn...  Which is unacceptable...  heaven forbid you take a couple nails out of the wood and make an escape route for this lil baby... instead it gets to suffer and bake inside this column in 85+ degrees until it dies....   Nice heartless people.... Whats a better welcome to a hotel then the smell of decaying kittens... :(Me, my husband, and 2 Boston Terriers shared a room with a king sized bed. The room was huge, clean, modern. Dogs loved  it bc there was room to run around. I loved the bed. Dogs stay free. Free Breakfast.Spacious room, great bedding, very clean overall....no complaints!We found this room deal on Travelocity and stayed here for only 60.00 during Mother's Day Weekend....can't beat that!The parking was well lit and this seemed to be a very nice area.Decent room for a reasonable price in a nice area of East Memphis. The hotel room cost us ~$90 and was quiet, spacious, and clean. Nearby were several good places to eat, like Ruth's Chris and P. F. Changs. The surrounding area seemed safe, comprised mostly of medical buildings, strip malls, and restaraunts.The room had recently been renovated and featured laminate "wood" flooring in the entry and bathroom. Flat screen HDTV mounted to the wall. Plenty of lighting. The bathroom was large and the water pressure good (and HOT!). The bed was fairly comfortable for a hotel bed, but it had a weird faux suede blanket on it that was warm but not really comfy because it was thin and heavy. Free breakfast in the morning was standard fare: bagels, muffins, cereal, Belgian waffles, juice, coffee, you know. The OJ was gross and the coffee tasted like gas station coffee, but whatever. It's free. The eating area was large and they had Sportscenter on, so no complaints there.We stayed here because it was across the street from the hospital and we were in the middle of a newborn adoption. We came at the last minute & we had to get a smoking room. Jasima was the clerk & she was so helpful. She told us to have the person in the morning switch us to a nonsmoking room in the morning when one comes available. The next day we spoke to Laleita and let her know what was going on. She told us to check back with her later to see if we could switch. When we came back from the hospital she had switched it without us even having to ask. We were so grateful for the staff's care and concern for us while we were staying there and making things so easy while we were going through a challenging time. We are telling everyone to stay at La Quinta!The hotel room itself was fine. LCD/LED tv, fridge, king size bed. The problem was the area. Two cars, including mine were broken into! They got a whole $3 out of my dash. $175 to replace the window and 2 hours later I was back on the road. I parked on the side of the hotel. Not the back. Apparently, this was not the first time it had happened either! Beware with this one.Pretty nice hotel, we were having a nice day enjoying the room until two hours after we decided to go the car to go out, and found the driver side  window broken and my $300 gps and the $250 speed radar detector where gone...   Everything happened between 7:00 pm and 9:00pm.... And yeah front desk forgot to tell us that memphis in general is a dangerous city, and also to take your valuable with you....But besides that, the hotel try to help us everywayThe hotel room was so lovely! It looked like a much more expensive hotel, but we did have some little issues. First of all, the pet floor was the second floor. We had to take both of our big dogs up and down the elevator to go outside, that was a little rough for them. The only other issue we had isn't the hotel's fault, we had terribly loud neighbors who seemed to be having a party all night. This is an ok place to stay overnight, but if I were going to stay a few days I might find someplace else.
review_content_20: There were several problems with our room: bathroom sink leaked on floor, drain in tub broken, no toilet paper in room, along with a slew if housekeeping issues. M&M melting behind toilet, empty water bottle under AC unit, Gatorade bottle left on floor next to garbage can, used paper cup on floor by the bed, weird dried liquid on the bathroom door and the mirror in the room, weird dirt/stain on the bed spread, used toothpick on the night stand. For the price per night at La Quinta, the house keeping should be on point. The only saving grace of this stay was we brought all of this up at checkout and they comped one of our nights.Great room & very affordable. Perfect for our purposes of staying a night on our road trip across the states.We had lots of problems with our room- not the least of which was that the electric blinds would not shut.  The major issue was cleanliness.   Lots of grime left around and when we went to make coffee we found that the coffee grounds from the previous occupant were still there.The front desk was "sorry".For the first time, La Quinta has failed me!$105/night for a spacious, modern suite with hardwood floors and two TVs (one 42" flat screen plasma in the living room), and a bed so comfortable you'll forget you're in a hotel room.I would NEVER have expected such plush surroundings at a La Quinta Inn. I'd read that the hotel had just been remodeled, but didn't expect to walk into an HGTV makeover! Incredible. I also experienced wonderful service upon check-in, and the host recommended fantastic bbq in the area. BRAVO all around!

review_content: place is great! hidden little spot right around the corner from beale street, i called and made a reservation and asked them how far beale street was and they answered with just a 3 minute walk around the corner!, well dang they wernt kidding!, see that some folks say the location is seedy but everyone that comes to this location is here for one thing! beale street, so not sure why they say that hotel is perfectly fine, sandra front desk/ breakfast attendant was very helpful and made fresh scrambled eggs and waffles, parking was free and the lot was spacious and was safe. rooms were nice and clean/ staff was excellent nothing i didnt like about the place, everything was greatFirst time in Memphis means you definitely want a convenient location to check out Beale St. and downtown. While looking for a spot, my friend and I were surprised at how pricy some of the accommodation was in this city. With a little more research, we ran into Vista Inn & Suites and chose this place since it was affordable.The verdict? Clean. Decent. You get what you paid for (YEP!)Your basic motel stay is really what you can expect from Vista Inn & Suites. There is complimentary parking available and a nice reception desk which friendly staff. The motel consists of two separate buildings, which some rooms being smoke-friendly. Be sure to specify in your reservation which you want. We ended up in a smoking room and our clothes definitely smelled like such.Complimentary breakfast in the morning with pastries, cereal, and egg/waffles made to order. Rooms were decent and freezing when we entered, but crank up the heat and that problem is fixed in no time. The Wi-Fi here works okay but can go off sometimes. Be patient and it'll come back on eventually! For the TV selection, there were limited channels, but you'd be able to find at least a news station to relax to before going to bed.The real key is that it's two blocks from the southern end of Beale Street and downtown. No need to drive over/find a DD. The area is a bit sketch, so be sure to walk in groups to the area and have a good time. You'll appreciate its proximity which really makes Vista Inn shine.We went for this place given it was pet friendly and downtown. The price was good for the location, but as other say in the reviews, you get what you pay for. If you have a pet, you will be forced into the smoking rooms. They will also charge you a fee for you having the pet (which is pretty standard, just surprised we were forced into a smoking room and charged extra for it). Upon getting into the room, I realized we probably should have went with a different place. It was dirty, the heater was loud, the remodel they had done looked to be half-assed, missing fixtures covering the vent in the bathroom.. the list just goes on and on. There was a dead roach on the bathroom floor along with cigarette ashes. I wasn't brave enough to sleep under the covers either given the condition of the place. I noticed a hard item poking me in the back when sleeping that night, and after pulling back the sheets noticed it was a lighter... yes.. a lighter. How a lighter managed to get between the sheets was beyond me. That just makes me think they probably didn't change them from the previous guest. I will state the staff was really nice. The location was awesome as we were able to walk over to Beale St. Parking was free, and they offered breakfast the next morning. Out of all honesty though, you might be better off sleeping in your car. Chances are that it'll be a lot cleaner. Don't make the mistake we did, spend an extra $30 for a place down the street. You'll be a lot happier.Having caught wind that there was a very real possibility that our trip to Memphis may be cut short (if not canceled altogether) and with the usual no-refund-for-last-minute-cancellations hotel policy in mind, we opted to look for a budget hotel located as near to downtown as possible. With these criteria, Vista Inn was where we ended up staying.First thing that needs to be addressed is that the area seems to be rather seedy, especially when you arrive late at night. I can say, however, that while it did not seem like Pleasantville, we never felt unsafe during our stay. It is conveniently located close to AutoZone Park, Beale Street, and other attractions in downtown, and this is a major plus.The beds were not the most comfortable, the sheets and towels were a bit scratchy, but the refrigerator in the room was very much welcome. We were not unrealistically hoping for a luxe experience, but we were not hoping to wake up to a spider inches within our faces, either. I would give Vista Inn two stars, but the budget prices, free parking and convenient location are urging me to give them three stars. Do not automatically count them out if you are looking for a hotel downtown, unless you want five-star accommodations and/or are arachnophobic.Great location !! Right downtown memphis.. next to Beale street and near sun studios... and all restaurants and all are just around the corner. Free parking, free wifi,  free hot continental breakfast from 6 till 9 am.. real nice helpful staff.. I'm really glad we stayed here. The rooms are ok... that's why I don't give it the 5 stars... the price was ok.. not too cheap not too expensive.. half of the tv canals weren't working so that was kind of bad since we were staying 4 nights and we like to relax and watch some tv at night so... other then the somewhat dated room we were very satisfied with all! If i would come back to memphis wouldn't mind staying here again !I decided to come to Memphis for New Years festivities and the Liberty Bowl. This was the only hotel still available.  You can hear all outside noises... I mean full conversations. My nonsmoking room reeked of smoke when I first entered it. The room is tiny. It did seem to be "clean".This hotel was very dirty. They charged me extra for a nonsmoking room claiming that nonsmoking rooms by definition were nicer. I'm  glad i didn't  look closely at the smoking room - just a whiff was enough to make one feel ill. So, this nicer room included a half used bottle of shampoo, an air conditioner that hardly worked (really a bad thing when it is in the 90's), tv didn't work, free cockroach and an attempt at a modern style in the bathroom where the sink is missing a leg. I will not stay here again. I could find similar lousy ammenities for a fraction of the price.Decided to take a girls trip and didn't want to spend too much on a hotel. Wow, that was a mistake. Not a good place to stay. Especially if you are a female and unfamiliar with the area. When we first checked in to the room, we were told our room will be ready at 3pm despite check in time being at 2pm.We finally get to our room and the door doesn't close. How do you give someone a room knowing that the door is broken???Management came and fixed it but my experience already ruined. Didn't think stay could get any worse. Wrong. Heard people next door getting intimate, people blasting music at 2am, people above us having a frat party, seedy looking guest, trash left outside of door, renting out parking lot to game goers and no spaces left for actual guest, etc.But it's close to Beale st and the baseball stadium!!My first annoyance was the $12 upgrade fee they charge for a nonsmoking room. I don't know why you would charge someone extra for a fresher space but whatever. Not a huge deal. But I definitely could have done without the dirty sheets and towels, bed bugs, and lizards. Not even joking. I saw something scamper across the floor and thought it was a mouse until I saw it moving much slower. Got up a bit closer and realized it was a lizard. I'm from NYC and a true city girl to the fullest. So, I wasn't feeling nature making itself at home in my room. I booked here despite the reviews and against my better judgement only because it was last minute and really didn't seem all that bad from the pictures. But I won't be staying here again. Next time, I'll invest in something a little nicer for cleanliness and comfort's sake.The place is not all together horrible but, not the nicest. They give you shampoo and soap from other hotels, I  wonder why they have these. The shower curtain was moldy and the bathtub was dirty. The office person was nice. About 4 blocks away from Beal street and 2 blocks from the Peabody, that is the best part about the hotel. If you can afford to stay somewhere more expensive, you should do it.Five stars not because it is a five star hotel but because it's top notch for what it is. Upon checking in I met the nicest gentleman. We talked about food, health and how much we both dislike Walmart and he mentioned a great place to eat, but unfortunately the Blues City Cafe was undergoing renovations and was currently in another building with a very limited menu. Moving on to the room, walked into a very clean smelling room. Furniture was new, bed was just right, linens were clean, NO bed bugs, carpet appeared clean, bathroom was clean, water pressure was amazing in the shower. Room was 210.Location was great (only a few short blocks) especially for the price of the room ($60ish). I felt safe and didn't see any derelicts around. Ample parking on site. I would definitely stay here again and will recommend. There is no reason to pay $150+ to stay on or nearer to Beale St.You get what you pay for and for me being from Chicago and staying in a Comfort Inn near Springfield IL, this was absolutely nice. The reason for 3 stars you're probably wondering?As I was leaving @ 9:35 AM today (Room 273) (August 13th, 2015). I went to the bathroom to place the ice bucket back into its spot and lifted the tray that was on the counter and was greeted by a nice little brown cockroach running about. I looked at it for a while and tested its ability to run and survive, swatting it various times with the wash cloth, trying to smash it with my hand. Boy those suckers are fast and resilient. When you thought they're dead, they're not. They're the O'Possum of the insect world. The point here is it's not a surprise for me to see a cockroach in a hotel / motel of this price range, it does genuinely mean there is something wrong but what can you do when hundreds of thousands of people of all regions stay there yearly with a price like that? You get what you pay for so lower your expectations.Upon arrival, the room was very tidy, smelled good (some people complained of a cigarette smell, my wife and I are both cigarette smokers, so if there was one we didn't notice and they claim to be 100% smoke free enviroment?). Looks semi updated inside the rooms with a fresh coat of paint in both the bathroom and the outside area where the bed is. Our room was very clean, carpet was very clean, bed sheets, pillow sheets and blankets were fresh and clean.The pool was green, but while we were there I did see someone come by and start cleaning and treating the pool and refilling it with water and all that pool stuff you'd normally do. But by the time it actually looked half way decent to go swimming it was my time to leave. The select of channels on the TV was very basic maybe around 20 - 25 channels at most? Wi-Fi was spotty and slow and would drop connection most of the time. Girl at the service desk was very nice and joked around with us about our northern accents. All in all, this place is classic case of you get what you pay for. Don't expect top notch but don't expect it to be a complete dump. It's just that happy median it's ALRIGHT. It's close to Beale St, AutoZone, Sun Studios, Graceland, Gus's chicken and there is plenty of parking during the weekdays, I had not a single issue as some have said in reviews with the parking lot being loaded with cars (maybe the weekends sure but weekdays expect no issues unless its some special occassion)Don't be turned off by the reviews please. I was at first but I took a chance and was happy with what I got, with an exception of the cockroach but if you're going to be out all the time on Beale ST, this is just an alright place to sleep, you want high quality then go look in the 250 - 300 dollar price range elseware, if you just want a place to crash and freshen up with no bullshit, this is it.Old motel in the middle of town.  Close to everything, so not planning on staying in the room, just wanted a place to lay my head. For that it is great.  Clean room cold a/c hot water.  If you want luxury stay at the Peabody and pay $200 per night!Room stunk of cigarette even though it was a non smoking room, wifi dropped in and out, shower curtain had mould on it, and our toilet didn't seem to be attached to the wall properly. The only plus to this  hotel was its location and cheap price and that's just the thing you get what you pay for I guess. We literally were only there to shower and to sleep so thankfully weren't there too long to have it totally bother us.This place is a dump!!! Not joking bugs remote broke then got a different one had to walk back down there to get it and it was broke tv was junk door lock broke no dead bolt no fire alarm no covers on outlets bathroom yuck tube/ shower black asked for my money back and the guy refused to give me my money back but we still left it was to yuck to stay here please don't go there just keep driving I give this no stars because it was so gross and dirty I would never stay there I would rather sleep in my carWOW, what a dump!!  I have honestly never stayed in a hotel where I basically cried myself to sleep because I felt so disgusting just being in the room.  There was mold (of the black and green varieties) on the ceiling, huge (blood?) stains on the carpets and hairs on the bed and in the bathroom towels.  There were drunk people screaming in the middle of the night... I heard "B**TCH, GET THE F*** UP" and then tried to fall asleep as quickly as possible so as to pretend that I really wasn't lying there in filth listening to these hillbillies fighting with each other.  The location is good; however, I would seriously blow my budget and pay to stay in the Peabody or somewhere next time.  I DREADED going back to this hotel room even when I was drunk.  Would recommend staying as far away from this craphole as possible.If you want 5 stars go to another place. If you want affordable yet clean stay here.  Jessica was on duty and very sweet.  I asked to see a room prior to paying and she gladly showed me a room. That room had a large stain on the comforter and the tub was very stained. She could tell by my face I was not real happy so she showed me another room. Much better.  I checked for bed bugs did not find any.. was walking distance to beale st. I would stay again. I am a total hotel snob and for me to say I'd stay here is something. ..This place is terrible! Room was dirty, carpet disgusting, missing light bulbs, clogged sink, bath tub plug didn't work, holes in walls with tape over them, tv was too dark to watch even after adjusting it, pillows were old and stained, bed broken on one side, wifi is very weak, no security locks, no fire alarm, my dog found rodent bones in the parking lot twice. I did ask for a refund and was refused.Not the nicest by any means, room smells like crap and deadbolt was busted, burn marks everywhere, but it's cheap and close to Beale street.This place is ok for what we needed it for.  A one night stay while we stopped in Memphis on our way to Georgia.  It's definitely a no frills hotel.  Some pros and cons:Pros:-great location-private off street parking- staff is super friendly and helpful - lots of pillows on your bed, makes for a good nights sleep- the room is overall pretty clean - the black out blinds are bomb - they offer pastries and such for breakfast (I didn't get to try it  as we slept past 9am that day)- room did come with a small microwave and fridge Cons:-the sheets are clean, but ours had a cigarette burn on the top sheet- towels are clean, but super dingy and cheap quality - WiFi is free, but spotty and slooowwwww - bath tub was super dirty and should probably be replaced because there is no coming back from how it looks. - they don't supply many toiletries, there was no conditioner and no wash cloths. - isn't a very modern hotelOverall, for what I paid (close to $100 for a king size bed) I expected a littler nicer quality of room.  I might stay here again if its just a one nighter b/c even tho it was close to $100 it was the cheapest rate to stay close to downtown.  If I was staying longer, I will probably fork over more money and stay someplace a little nicer.   Oh and they accept pets for a $30 additional fee.
review_content_20: Not at all bad for the price.  We paid for the "hostel" room for 4, expecting bunk-beds, but actually got 2 double beds. The room was fairly clean, but I had to do a bit of tidying - trash on the floor (under table & cabinets) from the previous guests and the counter wasn't wiped clean.  The beds were clean and bug FREE, which is the most important part!  The room has a mini-fridge, microwave, and TV.  The hot water was difficult to find and took a while to get started.  The WiFi did not work, which was a bit irritating.The location was ideal.  It was right in between Downtown and Beale Street.  The hotel looks a bit sketchy, but I felt perfectly safe.  The walls are a bit thin though and despite the fact that Beale Street was only a few blocks away, people were partying on the breezeway all night long.  Overall - for 25$ per person per night, it was well worth the money.I'm usually pretty sketch about motels, I don't like staying in them as they're usually dirty, with mouldy furniture and creepy people hanging outside your room (well that's what I imagine when I think of motels) but as we were only passing through memphis we didn't want to fork out a lot for accommodation and so decided to risk it and stay here. I have to say I was pleasantly suprised. Instead of a creepy pimp like person and the front desk, we were met by what seemed to be a college kid working there for the summer. Well dressed and spoken and was very welcoming. The room itself was tidy and the bathroom was a lot fancier than I expected. The bed was much larger than I expected and aside from the mouldy throws motels insist on using, it was v clean. I'd give it 4 stars out of 5 for a motel (maybe 2/5 if I was comparing it to say a hilton). We also walked to everywhere we wanted to see (Lorraine motel, gus' fried chicken and Beale st) in about 15-20 mins of the motel so we were pretty happy with that. All in all we were really happy with our stay!My family and I were late booking a room downtown for the first weekend in December (St. Jude Marathon weekend). Rooms book up a year in advance for that weekend. I looked everywhere and everything was booked. I happened upon the Vista Inn and they two rooms open due to a cancellation. I  booked them immediately. I was a little nervous because I had never heard of the place. Let me just say that our experience was wonderful! We have already booked our rooms at the Vista Inn for the 2013 marathon weekend. We have stayed at the Westin downtown, the Peabody and the Holiday Inn downtown. We had a better time here than any of those places! No it isn't as fancy, but it has a small town feel that the others don't have. It was very clean and the rooms were more spacious than the Peabody rooms. We were literally steps from the start/finish lines of the marathon. We could sit comfortably in the lobby of the Vista Inn and see the runners finish. The doors to the rooms face outside, not a hallway, so street noise could be an issue. If you are like most people and are a part of the street noise it won't be an issue though. Beale St is one street over, so the location is perfect! Great location but without the parking or valet fees (free wifi too)! The rooms have recently been updated and are nice. The outside is pretty plain, but it's what's inside that counts, right?One major highlight was the young lady who worked at the front desk. Her name was Jessica and she made each guest feel like a VIP. When we arrived she told us she gave us rooms right next to each other because she noticed they were booked under the same last name. She really went above and beyond to take care of us. She even indulged our need for hot tea and hot chocolate by repeatedly supplying us with a thermos of hot water. The place was booked solid and there were a ton of people coming in off the street asking to use the restroom or for other stuff. The staff was patient and polite to each person, guest or not. We plan to book the Vista Inn for every trip to Memphis. Hopefully Jessica will be there, and if she is I am sure she will remember us, because it is just that kind of place.The short version: we were eaten alive by bedbugs. I survived to tell the tale. Barely.The long version:Once upon a time, four of us went to a conference in Memphis.We (Meff, Jax, Cari, and I -- names have been obviously changed to protect the innocent) booked a room at the Vista Inn and Suites about a couple months in advance at a fairly low nightly rate (~$90/night), considering the prices at the other hotels in the area. The motel was close to Beale St. and cheap, so we weren't terribly miffed when the amenities it claimed to have -- business services, WiFi, a continental breakfast -- were less than impressive.Our first night was uneventful. Maybe the bedbug scouts hadn't returned with news of our arrival, or  maybe they were just patiently biding their time until they decided to attack. Either way, blood was not shed that night. It wasn't until the next afternoon after I returned to the room that I realized I'd been bitten by something.... What that "something" was, I couldn't quite tell, but I assumed they were from mosquitoes.  Right? There's no WAY our room could have bedbugs. ... Right? ... !After a night out, Cari and I slept on one of the beds, and Meff was asleep on the other. Jax, who had slept on the floor the previous night (don't ... ask.... just don't), slept on the floor again. It was good for his back, he said. It felt good, he said. Well, he was probably not feeling so good after he woke up covered in bites. The bedbugs had decided to strike.We spent the next evening at B.B. King's Restaurant and Blues Club and walked over to Rendezvous afterwards.  Meff and Jax, after comparing bites (again, don't ask), realized our hotel room was infested with bedbugs. I finally caved in to the realization that I, too, had been bitten by bed bugs. Meff didn't want to talk to the woman at the manager's office because he was certain she hated him (well, the feeling was rather mutual), so after securing back up (i.e., Jax and Cari), they stormed off to the office to rectify the problem. I couldn't do much more than roll around in bed (a bed that was infested with bedbugs, mind you) because BBQ beans, while really, really tasty, can cause great gastric distress that I really wasn't prepared to deal with at that moment. One of the motel employees came to the room to look for the bedbugs, stating that "We haven't had an outbreak in, like, two years." He wasn't able to find any, and went back to the office. Fueled by rage (and, no doubt, by the itchy bites on his legs), Jax pulled the bed away from the wall and threw up the bed sheets. Tiny, tiny little bloodsuckers were everywhere. Jax picked up a tiny plastic bag and started collecting them to provide indubitable, scientific, empirical evidence that bedbugs WERE responsible for sucking the life out of our bodies. He ran out of the room to show the motel manager.Meanwhile, I was still uselessly curled up in a ball on the infested bed. Stupid bedbugs. Stupid, tasty BBQ beans.Finally, the other three obtained a solution from the office: they would move us to another one of their properties. A van came by to pick us up several minutes later and drove us to the other motel, which was about five miles away from the convention center where our conference was being held. However, they promised they would schlepp us back and forth between the hotel and the convention center at no change. When we arrived, we found that they arranged two rooms for us instead of one (although the thought occurred to me that they may have put the boys and the girls in separate rooms for propriety's sake, not for comfort -- but hey! I'm not going to complain).The rest of our time in Memphis was relatively uneventful. They kept their word about schlepping us back and forth between the convention center and the hotel. We were even shuttled to the airport at the end of our stay free of charge. The woman at the counter whom Meff and Jax hated still charged us when we asked if they could hold our bags -- $5 a head. She obviously did not care that our blood was being drained while we slept in one of their rooms. Meff and Jax remain mortal enemies with that woman to this day. Oh, yeah, and during our entire stay, we were always short on towels. Four people, but three towels. Jax dried himself with the blow dryer. It was a hard life for poor Jax.To sum up my Yelp review:Pros: Cheap. Most of the staff tried really, really hard to rectify the situation, and I admire them for that. Cons: Motherf'narkin' bedbugs. Forgivable cons: Poor WiFi. Nonexistent business center. Continental breakfast of "meh" quality. But I can forgive all that, given that we were in a pretty cheap motel.The end.This is an honest, down-to-earth inn, and it must be the best-kept secret anywhere near Beale Street.As anyone knows who has visited Beale, or Memphis for that matter, knows that the hotels there are ridiculously overpriced, even in the offseason  - even three days before Christmas! - and for a single-bed, no-frills room. When Erstwhile Helpmeet and i travel, we tend to forego luxuries in favor of spending our money on souvenirs and such, but even the zero-luxury options on Beale were ludicrous to our reasonable budget. Vista Inn looks like your typical walkup strip motel, to the casual passerby. But it is staffed by awesomely friendly, welcoming, and very knowledgeable people; it is two blocks from Beale, an easy and interesting walk; it has secure offstreet parking at no extra cost. It is very nearly literally across the street from the stadium; if you are a reasonably hardy foot-tourist, you can walk to Mud Island with ease, or to the downtown streetcar even more easily. Our room, with two doubles, came complete with fridge and microwave at no extra charge, and was so clean you could practically *hear* it glittering. The beds were remarkably comfortable and the linens and towels both ample and high-quality; everything provided was of much higher quality than anyone would suspect - it really felt much more like staying in a hands-off B&B than anything else. All this for under $100/night. No lie. We will absolutely stay here if we ever happen to visit Memphis again, and recommend it to everyone we know who might do likewise.found blood sucking bugs crawling in bed. left this x*# at 1am without a place to stay for the night.  we would rather sleep in our car instead.GREAT location and you probably won't find cheaper for the area - the motel is located SAFE walking distance to beale st, and right next to the greyhound station. Easy access to sun studios which offers a free shuttle to graceland. cost per night is not the cheapest for your typical motel room but still cheaper than your average hotel. the front desk workers were very nice and helpful.Overall no complaints and I would easily stay there again.Great value for its location! Only 5 mins from Beale street and 10 mins from downtown.  I had trouble with bug bites the first night.  I'm allergic so it wasn't pleasant at ALL! The staff were polite and helpful.  The room was clean and comfortable.  I recommend this to anybody who wants a no frills but decent room.  I was in room 213 and we didn't get any wifi.  NOT COOL!Not horrible, but I guess you get what you pay for.  Great price if you're looking to stay near Beale Street and Sun Studio.  The staff were very friendly and we also lucked out that our bunkmate was a nice dude traveling on business.  Two bunkbeds and a tiny bathroom were all we really needed while traveling anyway.  Beale street is a nice area, but heading the other direction Memphis gets very shady and ghetto.  I was able to rent a locker for less than $2 to store some items while we walked around.  The razor wire and local panhandlers were a clue that this wasn't the best area, but still we met some nice people who were traveling.I will admit that I was skeptical. I will also admit when I'm wrong.  Great staff, basic coffee and pastries in the morning, incredible location being only two blocks off beale street and surprisingly fairly priced.  The security guy was drinking beers in the parking lot and the bed could've been softer, but overall it was a great little spot to crash for a night!We were a little hesitant because of some of the reviews, and because we don't know the area well and were afraid it was too far out on the fringes of the downtown/Beale street area. But, at $60 per night, it easily beat out any other downtown hotel, so we took a chance on it - and I'm so glad we did. It's very clean and the service can't be beat, and it's within walking distance of everything.OK, some brief cons:-No coffeemaker in the room. However, there is free coffee in the front lobby.-Hot water took a little while to get started - shower was fine, but the sink tap didn't seem to heat up.-Wireless was spotty, kind of went in and out. Still free, though.Pros:-Very close to downtown, just a short walk. We were looking for dinner at 8:30 on a Wednesday, and the woman at the front desk assured us that we'd be safe walking toward downtown - she said she did it every night alone, and that there are cops everywhere downtown anyway. Sure, we got harassed for money, but that happened everywhere that tourists were, and not especially near the hotel.-The front desk people are super friendly and accommodating. In the morning, we were preparing to check out at 11 when we realized that the ducks would be marching at the Peabody hotel just two blocks away. The woman at the front desk was kind enough to allow us to continue storing our stuff in the room for an extra hour, just so that we could go see them. (Alternatively, they let you store stuff in the office for five dollars.)I'm really glad we took a chance. We will definitely stay there again the next time we're in Memphis...and hey, if ambience is what you're looking for in a hotel, just walk down to the Peabody, get a drink and watch those ducks go.

review_content: For the price, I really expected a microwave. I went down the hall to vending. The sign on the door to 'Ice and Beverages' only contained an ice machine. So, I had to pay $3 for my soda downstairs. You have to pay for the Internet, too, which is kind of strange. Even cheap motels have free Wi-Fi. There isn't a tub in our room. I haven't seen that in a long time. And th continental breakfast consists of pastries, juice and coffee. Sigh. This is the first night of three, and I'm already disappointed. Maybe I should wait to write this review...I spend about 250 nights staying in Marriott hotels with my business. The room in this hotel was very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. The waitress at the restaurant Tiffany was absolutely the highlight of this stay. She was very friendly and extremely accommodating. She should be training everyone else on staff. I'm not sure if it's a Memphis thing, but out of the two Marriott properties that we have stayed in, neither one had staff that was as friendly or hospitable as they are in other cities. I felt like I was in the way. Bottom line, it's a fine property. You will be in a very clean room and sleep on a very comfortable bed. Just don't expect to get the warm and fuzzier from any of the staff. Unless you have Tiffany. Tiffany is awesome! There is no charge for parking which was very nice.Clean, comfortable, and just a little weird getting into the parking lot!Siri got us here, sorry other drivers behind me!Clean hotel, quiet, safe location with good service. This was a Priceline hotel and was a real bargain. Good service and a large comfortable room made for a good stay.We got a great deal on this hotel, but didn't really realize how great a deal until we got there- this hotel is very nice!!  It's clean, modern, and has great amenities like a bar and a small restaurant.  The hotel rooms are sleek and a good size.  The bathroom has this lotion that I am now obsessed with, this citrus woodsy lotion that is incredible.  I looked up the brand and the junt is like $40 for a little bottle!  The only detractor for this hotel is that it's one way all the way around it, so if you miss the entrance (and it's easy to miss) you get to loop all the way around again.   "Look kids! Big Ben! Parliament!" ran through my mind a few times trying to get into this place.  Be careful, Memphians are terrible drivers and you might get rear-ended trying to figure this place out.  And I write that with love as I am an ex-Memphian.Horrible experience during judicial conference, had to move to 4different rooms, old section is terrible, had to move to newer section. Girl who said she was manager (evening) was no more than front desk clerk. Spoke to front desk manager he was worse. Never saw GM to complain. I have stayed all over the country and this was the worst hotel experience I ever had. Tried to complain to corporate and they didn't care as less. Gave me a confirmation complaint number that did absolutely nothing. Surprised Marriot has their name on this building. Corporate office was only concerned about money and no customer service. When I asked front desk staff name of GM they didn't even know. I will never stay at another Marriott again.The other night (or shall I say early morning), I was cruising down Poplar, and I saw a Marriott.  I knew there was a Marriott off of 240, but maybe my eyes were playing tricks on me.  Apparently there are 2 of them off of 240.  Long story short, a few months back, I got a reward certificate for a free night at any Marriott, to be used by 4/29/13.  Well, I guess I either forgot about it, or pushed it back, but I noticed that I should probably use it or lose it!  So I called up the Marriott line (Sunday afternoon), told em what I wanted, and they put in the reservation.  That simple.  They even told me it was a new property.  So that was exciting.Yes, I spent the night in a hotel in a city where I stay in.  Shit happens.  It gave me an excuse to write another review.  So I packed my bag (my laptop, and my work clothes) and off I went.  I decided to kidnap my roomie, as we had nowhere to be until later Monday.  As we approached Poplar, I noticed you have to take kind of a Uie to get there, as Poplar splits.  So keep that in mind, its the last entrance on the left before 240.Parking is free, and was easy to get a spot.  I could tell, it really was new!  The lobby is spacious, with white brushed tile and looks like walnut for wood.  I would like to say it is pretty close to "chic'" but still knowing it is a Marriott.  It looked like they were having some lobby party, but we wanted to check out the room.  So I got to check in, and ride it on up.  As we got up to the room, I noticed the key entry was like a magnetic circle thingy (like they have on the doors @ the Peabody)- I have know idea what in the hell the technology is called.  The room was overlooking 240, towards the city, and the room was a nice size, and clean.  To say the least, it wasn't bad for free, and I am actually kind of surprised it was only listed as a category 3 (out of 7) hotel!  The only downside is having to pay for internet (even though I am a silver elite member), but it was $10 for 24H (idk, maybe I will get reimbursed?).  Can't complain about the bandwidth, as I am STILL waiting on mine to get fixed at the apt.The TV was a decent size, about a 37' or a 42'.  The beds were comfy, along with these really bright ass reading lights.  That was cool.  There was also an iPhone radio alarm clock.The bathroom had a single sink, lined with marble and the same type of wood in the lobby (ok, now I think about it, maybe its cherry?).  The sinks and tub were made of Kohler nozzles, and had pleasant streams of water to cleanse the mind, body and soul.  Did I really just say that?When I woke up the next day, I was shocked to see that the parking lot was empty with the exception of 2 cars, and then I realized everyone else probably works 9-5s...This is a new, solid choice in East Memphis that if you use Marriott a lot, you would not be disappointed.  And only having to pay for internet, you can't beat that!  I will surely tell my friends and family about this place if they do not want to stay downtown...I have stayed at 140 different marriott properties this year.  By far the worst front desk service I have experienced.  Changed my rate because I changed cards.  I was told the front desk supv had no authority to help a customer - the GM made that rule.  Rooms are much smaller than normal full service Marriott.  Other great hotels in the area!!!The hotel is nice as are the rooms, BUT I can't believe they have the nerve to charge for Wifi here. I'd be willing to not stay here again and go somewhere cheaper for free wifi. That's just not something I expect to have to pay for at a decent hotel in 2014.Pros: new, clean, and comfortable.  Staff was friendly and location was convenient for our stay.  The bedding was comfortable, the TV and electronics were up to date, the bathroom was nice and shower was decent. free parking and no resort fees mandated.Fair price point. (there for a wedding, so may have gotten a better rate than others)cons:  -no room safe, but you can get a box at the front desk-breakfast (at least on weekend) was 7 to 9 am.  ends too early for a relaxing weekend and starts to late for a business person.  food was OK-bar was good but it closed 1130 on a sat night..really?, the place was busy!-wifi was not freei would probably stay there again.Free parkingFree WiFiNice staff although we had to get our own luggage out the car and look for one if those baggage carriers.The lounge is niceThis could very easy be a 5 star hotel but I did have a few issues but nothing that will keep me from staying again and I will be in town again this weekend and I will stay hear.  My shower didn't drain well or maybe it did because the water rain out on the floor because the slope was off. Secondly, my key had to get reset twice.The service was GREAT and the room was also GREAT! Everything was in top notch and I will stay hear again as I stated earlier when in town for another meeting and I have three brother that live close by. I may even stay hear on personally visits also. LOL! Nothing like having your own space!Pros-Check in was quick and friendly.  Room was set at 66 degrees - this is good for my radiating husband, AC unit kept up overnight so it stayed cool.  Room and bed was clean, spacious and aside from lacking a fridge, was great.Shower pressure was also good (important for hubby!)Room service was quoted as going to take 40 minutes, it took 20.  The lady who delivered it was very friendly and the food was hot, tasty and reasonably priced for hotel food.  We ordered the fried chicken salad (with grilled chicken) and the cheddar, bacon burger.Cons -No free wifi - inexcusable in today's society!While breakfast selection was pretty generic and tasted ok, I ended up biting into a piece of plastic that was amid my chopped pineapple.  Not cool! We heard nothing but running water - all freakin' night!! like someone above us had a shower, all night.  UGH.This was the wedding hotel we stayed at when we got to town. This place is a but confusing to get to. Ignore google (gasp!) and keep going east on Poplar till you are able to u-turn after the 240 exit. Entrance is the third in your left.  When I went to checkin, the receptionist knew right away who I was and because I had tried to check in via mobile phone, but didn't quite finish the process because I rejected some option. She said she figured it out and had me squared away already. Service bonus points!!The rooms are updated and all the fixtures are really nice and the toiletries they provide are really nice (Bath and Body Works). My only complaint is that there is no safe and all the bedside plugs are on one side. If you're a bathtub kind if person, maybe this hotel is not for you. We loved the large shower. The bathroom door slides open to reveal a closet, so you can't have the closet, and the bathroom door open at the same time. We left the privacy tag on our door both nights, so we didn't experience the housekeeping. But one housekeeper did ask how we were doing when we were leaving. More service bonus points!The parking lot is a bit confusing because you exit a different way from the entrance, but at night, they block off the exit. The hotel bar closes at 11, but still a nice place to hang out with some friends. I know there is breakfast and a menu available, but we didn't get to experience it. Also, there is no free wifi. Overall, a nice hotel, but an extra star for the great service.Great hotel! I normally don't writeReviews but this hotel surprised me. Great staff, the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in at a hotel, clean, updated, breakfast and dinner were great. All good things. Great place to stay in MemphisNice facility.  Horrific & insulting service - primarily @ front desk.  Walked out & cancelled reservation after a bit.  No response from Manager OR Marriott Customer Service.  61 nights so far this year @ Marriott hotels.   I won't EVER return to this one......The Wifi is $9.95 a day. This is unacceptable. I spent $209 to stay here for one night and they can't comp wifi? Many Marriott properties still charge for this. When I stay at IHG hotels they don't charge for wifi. It seems silly to me.Marriott, this is 2014. The days of charging for wifi are over.The hotel is comfortable and the staff is friendly.I won't stay here again due to the wifi issue. Sorry.From the minute I walked into this hotel the customer service was outstanding. The staff was friendly and gracious and took care of everything I needed. The room was very nice  and housekeeping was some of the best I've seen. The location. Is central to everything in Memphis. Easy access to shops, restaurants and entertainment. I will definitely stay here again when I am back in Memphis. I have already recommended it to my friends and family.Got in around 6:30 pm for a meeting tomorrow morning. Hadn't been to Memphis in a few years, and couldn't remember this property. Turns out it had been a Holiday Inn and had been shut down, gutted, and reopened as a Marriott!Nice property and friendly staff - also found good rates (AAA can be your friend!) for a regular room. Thought the bathrooms were nice. Walk in shower in mine, no tub. Liked the look overall. Also liked the free parking (I get free internet because I'm top tier status with Marriott, so that's not a biggie for me.) And internet is free in the lobby, I think.But biggest shout out would be for the young woman working behind the bar. I opted for doing dinner there, and she was just social enough. Good personality, not too clingy, if you know what I mean. Had Fried Oysters and Blackened Catfish with cheese grits. Was very good!To my mind, it's what a full-service Marriott property should be. Nice place, good location, good staff, good food, fresh clean rooms.The room:  clean, updated and comfy!  Nice coffee set up and the refrigerator is a plus!  Got our room on a priceline deal.  The lobby was crowded and busy, bar was hopping!  Our floor (3rd) made me realize I should have asked about the tour bus in the parking lot and the fact everyone seemed to know each other.  And, it was loud- hallway conversations,  doors slamming- not very quiet.  If guests aren't with a group... Separate them!!!  Put them on a different floor!  And I agree.... Free wifi is everywhere except here!  For a quick overnight it's not worth it but would have liked to use my iPad)-:  this would be nice if it was quiet but I am glad we didn't pay more)-:Absolutely worst internet service, after months and months of excuses that the Internet would be fixed it's still the worst internet I have ever experienced. On average the speed is 50-100k per second, bellsouth dial up 15 years ago was much better.  Very disappointed that this property cannot fix this problem.
review_content_20: Excellent stay, we ended up in a corner room -- huge & spacious.   Front desk staff was great, all around excellent stay!  Kudos to Marriott!I was so impressed with this place until i realized they're garbage. We told the front desk our names and they congratulated us and sent us up with the bellhop. there was a bottle of wine and a jacket that apparently someone had brought up here for themselves and had checked in earlier. There was a note the wine was from the front desk staff so we didn't question it. So the bellhop took the jacket. So it was fine until someone came up to the door trying to get in at 7:15 am. He acted apologetic and walked away from my husband. Finally they called up and said "no one is booked in that room," which i doubt because someone had checked in, brought wine and a jacket, and there was a cheese tray here. My husband had to give them our info over the phone at 7:30 when they called. That is not a reasonable hour ever, but especially after a wedding! It rained and the view with the rain is lovely.Other than that, the room doesn't have a fridge but it is nice. The bed is too soft for me and there are no extra blankets already in the closets. The couch is a nice place to relax. Regardless, I won't be back.Updated feel for the whole property. Real nice people. Good bar and restaurant (only had dinner). Rooms were as expected. Concierge lounge fine. Hotel killed me though when I put the tag on my door for breakfast, and it never shows up. Called front desk- while getting absolutely no apology the receptionist told me that other guests had the same problem and that the kitchen received no room service requests and that they are trying to find out where the tags went. Clearly they realized they messed up. No apology. No call back. Not cool.
