hotel_name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Memphis Airport Graceland
review_content: This place is too expensive to be in the middle of nothing. The shuttle service is non existing. Only goes to the airport and graceland. Not to Walmart or anywhere else. U can't get food cuz ain't nothing around. Will not be back. The rooms are clean thoWhen we checked in a sign said "Please don't mind our dust" or words to that effect.  Well I did not realize they were going to be using a needle gun or a chipping hammer above our room.  Either they should discount the rooms or warn the customers.  I called the desk to get move to another room and the reply was "we here the noise all over the hotel".  Then how about this. Close the Hotel, finished the remolded fast, then reopen.  My wife and I are truck drivers an decided to stop her to catch up on some well needed rest of being on the road.   As for Breakfast, the eggs had more water in them than eggs, bisquits were wet.  Coffee was good. Final thought, if you want some rest at least during the day, you might look elsewhere.First, the good. Our room was ready early so we were allowed to check in about 2 hours early. Thank you! This was very helpful.  Beds, restroom, and room were clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast was above average with hot, fresh make-your-own waffles, coffee, pastries, eggs, biscuits, bananas, yogurt, etc. When leaving for the airport, the shuttle was right on time at 4:30 am (!!) and the front desk clerk even made me coffee early although the continental breakfast didn't officially open for another 90 minutes. Thanks!!! Your efforts and politeness were very appreciated.Now the not so good. Upon arrival at the airport, the shuttle never came despite several phone calls to the hotel and repeated assurances it was "almost there." We finally had to take a taxi - $17 from airport to hotel less than a mile away. The neighborhood is not one for walking as it's mostly industrial. The hotel was undergoing renovations so there was hammering and paint fumes. The "Hi Def TV" was not. Other guests I spoke to had problems including getting locked out of the hotel at night and having to bang on the doors to get back in. And when friends who were leaving early one morning pushed open the door and it came off its track, they were threatened with having to pay for damages.My previous experience with La Quintas in general was positive, which is why I chose this location. But all in all, I think I'd try somewhere else next time.2 Stars for a 2 star hotel. I'd pick this place over a motel or something similar, but you can definitely do better for the $.Check the date of my post before you stay, as we speak they are undergoing major renovations and it is LOUD. Constant drills, saws, hammers, etc. every morning.Neighborhood sucks! What a lame location. Semi ghetto semi industrial. Nowhere near pretty or nice to look at. Liquor store, gas station, pawn shop, liquor store, strip mall, loading docks, etc. This week can't be over soon enough.WIFI IS AWFULWell now... where do i start...  Not only are you secluded in a sketchy neighborhood and the parking is locked behind gates but the there's no real food for miles and the rooms aren't very nice.... the bed wasn't great at all. I checked in and the computer wasn't working well... I'm tired and it's been hundreds of miles... I get keys and end up opening a room that's occupied. Why? because when they went to check in the computer wasn't working either and nobody bothered to make a note. I get checked in and try to take the pup for a walk.. um... where is the grass? They have one strip of grass in the parking area that is used and abused. Now I usually love La Quinta and stay there BECAUSE it's pet friendly... but no grass is not pet friendly. It's just in a very poor location and some of the rooms need some work.Visiting Memphis for the first time. As soon as we landed at Memphis we went to get our car rental. Turns out they ALL close between 11pm-midnight. Therefore leaving us stranded at the airport with no car to get to hotel. The good thing is it offers shuttle service to and from hotel to airport. Only thing is it ends at 11pm. Mind you its past midnight, we are exhausted from flying ALL day and wanting to go to our hotel. We decided to call the hotel and see if they can pick us up even though it was well past their service hours. Somehow they managed to get their shuttle driver to pick us up at 12:45 am and bring us to their hotel. This was a blessing in the skies! Soon as we got here the front desk service was great!! She greeted us and made us feel extremely welcomed. The room itself was clean and comfortable. Our room had a mini fridge which was a big help because we stored our water throughout the week. Not to mention, it also has a microwave. TV is a flat screen Insignia brand. Very spacious for two people to stay in. Housekeeping kept our room clean. When we asked for extra towels they didn't hesitate and gladly handed them over. They do offer free continental breakfast: cereal, fruit, bagels, toast, coffee/tea, orange juice, eggs, sausage, biscuit & sausage. They do have two waffle makers but there's always a line to make some. Overall this hotel is a great place to stay at!I made a reservation online for a suite with two double beds.  Even though the reservation was made almost two months in advance, there was no such room available when my family arrived.  We were given a suite with one king bed, along with two rollaway beds, with the explanation that they "try to honor room requests."  There is one little strip of grass for pets, and there was an obvious issue with people not bothering to clean up after their pets.  The breakfast was fine; it was pretty typical.  I would not recommend this hotel, and we will not be staying here again.The associate at front desk Nikita was friendly and very helpful.  On the treadmill and the elliptical in the Fitness Room the power did not work even though they were plugged in.There were no decent restaurants for miles.  The parking lot has an iron fence with electronic gate.  The Non Smoking room had had a smoker in it.  The mattress and bed were good.  Breakfast was good.  I felt stuck here.  I had bid on Priceline.  I had no warning that there no restaurants for many miles and that the neighborhood was sketchy.  I do not recommend staying here.I did NOT want to get out of bed...it was that comfortable.  Huge shower head in the walk in accessible shower.  Very quick check in, friendly staff. Iron security fence around parking lot.  Fourth floor room lifted us above the traffic noise.  We will be back.If you plan on using a shuttle from this hotel understand it will not be available.   Dirty, unclean, toilets that don't work.  Do yourself a favor and stay anywhere but here.DO NOT BRING YOUR PETS HERE!!My stay here would have been fine if I would not have brought my dog. My friend and I went out Saturday night for a total of about 4 hours, when we got back to the hotel we went to the front desk and asked for a new do not disturb sign because ours mysteriously disappeared. We were told that my dog was being hysterical. When we got back to the room there was a towel in front of the door (fine) and A BOWL OF BEER on the floor for my dog to drink. Now I was hysterical. We took the night to calm down and went to talk to the hotel staff in the morning. A very pleasant staff member told us that it was a regular guest that constantly complains and that it wasn't that big of a deal. She was very concerned that someone had entered our room and especially concerned that there was beer left for her. My dog is less than 10lbs and alcohol is considered toxic to dogs. She called a staff member down who looked us in the face (hardly) and told us they were talking about putting water in the room. Luckily, my dog doesn't like beer so we had evidence to show him that it was clearly NOT water.La Quinta apparently has absolutely no process in place for dealing with these situations which I have an extremely hard time believing. Especially considering that it is a pet friendly (supposedly) hotel and I saw over 5 other dogs at least while walking mine throughout the trip. I was also called and told that the hotel tried to call me, but I had my phone on me all night, it was in my hand, fully charged, with service and received no calls or voice mails. I was 10 minutes away all night and gladly would have came back to calm my dog down. I was also told that another dog on the floor was barking, which could have been what caused my dog to bark in the first place.Although I was comped one day, which I had to ask for, it doesn't change the fact that great harm could have been done to my dog and I am worried for anyone else that plans on staying here.Upon arrival, I knew immediately the location was to be a huge problem.  This hotel is across the street from a shipping/loading facility for tractor trailers, and the amount of racket was almost intolerable. The whole hotel smelled like there had been some sort of plumbing disaster, it smelled like feces.  The smell persisted through our whole 3 night stay.  If I hadn't paid in advance, I would have left and found somewhere else to stay.The woman at the front desk took 20 minutes checking us in because she was venting about the terrible night she was having, and checking her cell phone every two seconds.  She was covering the shift for a no-show, and apparently many of the rooms had to be turned over last minute just to accommodate their reservations.When we arrived in our room, I was overwhelmed with a smell of smoke.  I had requested a non-smoking room because I'm sensitive to the smell, but my fellow traveler was a smoker, so I just decided to let it be, especially since the front desk lady had already informed us that they were totally booked up. When we got ready for bed, I noticed that the sheets and pillows appeared soiled. In addition to brown stains, there were numerous pieces of hair all the same length and color (not matching either of our hair) stuck to the various pieces of bedding, obviously this bed had already been slept in.  Not wanting to further upset the guest services woman (she was very nice) I simply called down and said that I needed clean linens.  Obviously shift change had occurred, because this new woman at guest services was quite dismissive.  She told me that when her driver got back, she would send him up with clean linens.  The linens never came, so finally I went got them myself.  The "driver" who was supposed to bring the linens was kicked back in a chair in the lounge playing on his cell phone.  All he gave me was two sheets, no blanket, no pillow cases... Luckily I had packed one pillow and a blanket of my own.When I went to shower, I had a couple problems with the sanitation.  The nonskid mat on the floor of the tub was lifting off, and the underside was not clean.  The clear knob on the shower had lots of black mold on the inside.  The shower was odd-shaped, so by the time I was finished bathing, the floor was soaked.  The vent in the bathroom didn't work, so the whole place fogged up.  I had to use several of our clean towels to sop up the water in the bathroom floor, so the next day I asked the rude front desk lady for clean towels.  Same excuse - "When my driver gets back I'll send him up with clean towels".  Though I reminded her twice throughout the day, we never saw any clean towels.   I finally used my own $ in the guest laundry to wash towels so we could bathe. Next time I use a 3rd party to book sight unseen, I will do THOROUGH research.  For the price I paid, I expected much better.I took the redeye from San Francisco last night and Twana checked me in at 10:30 this morning even though check in time is not until 3 PM technically. you've got to love the southern hospitality. The hotel is very nice the rooms are clean and comfortable and I'm looking forward to staying hereI wish I could give this place zero stars.  The airport shuttle took an HOUR to pick me up.  Don't bother.The rooms are ok the bathroom could be a little bigger and the towels could be a little more fresherIt's pretty "meh".  Locked gate, gravel piles next door.  I've stayed in better places but also worse.  Beds are comfortable, air conditioning works.  For some reason I can never get the WiFi to connect.  Best part: pet friendly, although not much of a yard for the dog.  When I come to Memphis again, without my dog, I'll give this location a pass.This is a perfectly good la Quinta. Staff is professional, kind, courteous, efficient & helpful. Hotel was Very clean. Rooms were spacious, well appointed. Amenities were good. Laundry, exercise & a nice breakfast, lobby lounge area. They also had a snack concession area to purchase mw meals, drinks etc. There wasn't much of an area to walk your dog just a grassy outline perimeter around the 8 ft secure fence around the hotel. And it was in a big industrial area so no real parks for your dog to exercise. It's right off of the split onto 240 E & W so convenient to the highways. But not much else in the area. It was a perfectly nice stay but I wasn't crazy about the location. I would rather stay downtown or East Memphis where there's more of a community feel with lots of restaurants, & conveniences around.The free breakfast is the only reason for the additional star.  This place is really really crappy.  Black mold behind the toilet tank, the bathtub faucet dripping at a rapid pace, sink faucet is broken and scalds your hands, TV reception is awful, carpet feels grimy, elevator doors shut on you.  Hospitality is so so.  Don't stay here.From the outside, this hotel was a bit scary -- right off the highway, not inviting, and the parking lot was gated and locked -- but it was very near the airport and just where we needed to be for an early morning flight out.  However, once inside, the staff was friendly, inviting and warm.  The room was very clean and spacious.  The price was very good.  This hotel fit our bill to a "T".During a cross country trip from CA to TN, I stayed in 5 different La Quintas. THIS was by far the nicest one! Starting with the front desk, the employee was VERY friendly and even got us a quieter room, after I told him that I was a light sleeper and our room was initially by the elevators and lobby. La Quintas are pet friendly, which was a MUST, since we were traveling with my large dog. The room was clean, bed was comfortable, TV worked, internet worked, room was quiet, parking lot had a gate with a code, and there was hot breakfast in the morning (although don't get too excited, it's just powdered eggs and sausage- but still, a step up from the other La Quintas!). We stopped at Graceland the next morning, which was close by. They offer military and government discounts, which was great. While it may not be a Hilton or Sheraton, it was definitely the nicest La Quinta of them all!
review_content_20: Front desk staff were uninterested in being helpful in any way. Parking was gated which was good all things considered.  Had to change rooms due to broken fridge and dirty bathtub. If you can, keep driving. This La Quinta is not representative of their brand. It's like once you're east of Oklahoma their hotels get worse and worse.Clean room, gated parking lot, and friendly staff! I only took one star off because it was a little pricey and breakfast was not fully stocked; however, to their defense, it was really busy and they may have been having trouble keeping up. We went swimming, the pool was nice, but they did run out of towels at the pool; the staff did quickly run and grab a couple out of the dryer for us, which was nice. Overall, we would stay again, if we were in the area.Clean!! ...and so nice and accommodating.  Great pool. Gated parking.  Right by an industrial cement plant, so close your curtains before you change lol.This hotel was super nice. Coming off the interstate it is right there and is very well lit up! Which is a plus considering the area. I drove up a few miles to find something to eat & felt very nervous! But the hotel itself was awesome! After a 12.5 hour day of driving it was perfect! My only complaint was the area/neighborhood & the sound of planes. I was thinking I was hearing thunder, when it dawned on me that I was next to an airport. ha! Oh and the walls were paper thin. I was woke up at 1:30am and 3:42am from the sounds of other guests coming off the elevators and loudly making their way to their rooms.What a horrible stay. My first room smelled like a cigarette filled old bar. The next morning I went down stairs to get coffee, and got denied. The sad thing was she just finished brewing the coffee, and I was told "I am doing something else." There is no restaurants in the area.  Don't stay here!Overall this place is just your average hotel. I've been driving out west on I40 and I decided to spend a night in Memphis. My goal was to find a hotel in a relatively safe area at an affordable price.. After a long hassle while trying to get food I decided to go with La Quinta off of Millbranch because I just wanted a place to crash.. Glad I chose this place.The hotel isn't too far from I40 and the major pro about the hotel was that they had a gated parking lot. The hotel staff was nice and accommodating and the room itself was clean and quiet. This place is also about 5-10 minutes (or even less) from Graceland, although I had no interest in going..Overall I had to pay $93 (roughly w/taxes included). A little more than I wanted to pay, but it was worth the good nights rest in a clean room with the safe feeling that your car won't be broken into. Check-in time is 3pm, and check-out time is 11am (you can ask for a later time)The No Fun Motel. $250 fines for everything! If you leave your dog in the the room unattended- $250. Smoking- $250. Then there's the al a carte menu of lesser fines for missing towels, wash cloths and bath mats. There is also no AC unless you request it. Tried to call the front desk to get the air conditioning turned on but the cord is broken on the phone- so no land line phone either. No, no, no, NO everything here. Oh and the rooms still have low definition TV's.Price and room amenities give this hotel my four star rating.  The location is by one of the states biggest attractions the home of Elvis Graceland.  It's about a 6 minute drive into downtown.  For me location is key and this hotels location suits those who are visiting the city for only specific reasons.  Aka airport overnights and GracelandHotel needs a face lift in the rooms. The staff was friendly. The breakfast offered was pretty poorI rarely write a bad reveiw about any place, but this place took the cake. The tub was gross, housekeeping did not change the sheets ( I know because I had make-up stains from the night before still on the pillow, that housekeeping just simply turned over), 1 face cloth, 2 hand towels and 3 body towles, WTF, La Quinta. Key cards not working, no cups. room not cleaned at 5pm. Terrence, the person at the front desk tried, but he could only do so much. 2 thumbs down. one good thing free breakfast that had bacon, biscuits and gravy, coffee, tea, make-your-own waffles, cereal, muffins, eggs. Because of the food I will give you 2 stars, instead of one. GET IT TOGETHER LA QUINTA INN & SUITES!!!!!!!!!This hotel allowed us to bring our dog in, which was great.  The room was huge, open, and clean.  It smelled faintly of bleach on the sheets and on surfaces, which I like in a hotel room.  The bed was soft and comfortable, nothing too fancy, but it did the trick and I didn't wake up with an aching back the next day.  Cable was in the room on a decent television.The bathroom was completely clean, with little toiletries set out for our use, as well as a clean white grout/tile shower and bathtub.  We were comfortable, the walls were thick, and we didn't hear our neighbors at all.  Bonus -- the curtains blacked out the light very well.  All in all, a good experience at a reasonable price.I was pleasantly suprised by this place.  It was very clean and the room was very up to date, not shabby at all.  Most importantly the staff that greeted me at 11:30pm were very helpful and nice.  I would stay there again. My only complaint is that it was hard to find at first.Great staff, very clean, decent price, & shuttle service to Beale Street during select hours...only a $15 cab ride to Beale....located in an industrial area by the airport...restaurant in parking lot......I'd stay there again.La Quinta is a great chain. We used our rewards points for an impromtu trip to Memphis. The hotel is near the airport, but we only heard 3 planes the entire stay. The area is a little sketchy, but they have a secured parking area. As always with the chain, free hot breakfast, clean rooms and good service!Very clean, hot breakfast, and really excellent service from the people at the front desk (even when we rolled up at midnight). We kept our car here during a short trip, and for a very small fee, $5, they allowed us to keep it in their secure parking lot with a keycode, which made me feel good about the security of the car. The only thing that I thought was a little weird is when we returned from our trip, I guess their driver wasn't available, so they sent the handyman (in his painting overalls) to come get us... a little strange.I was forced to make an unplanned stay at Memphis thanks to Delta.  Needless to say I was not in a very good mood and was not happy about having to find a hotel last minute by the airport.  However, I was pleasantly surprised by La Quinta.  I have not stayed with them before but they certainly exceeded my expectations.The staff was very friendly and helpful.  When the shuttle driver found out we had missed our connections and would be spending the night in Memphis he drove us around the hotel area to find something to eat so that we wouldn't have to walk.  The woman who checked me in searched for every rate and discount possible and loaded me up with free toiletries.  For $65 a night the room was more than adequate.  It was fairly new and very clean.  Despite the proximity to the airport it was very quiet.  The free breakfast was pretty much on par with a Hampton Inn.  The hotel location was not a great area and there was not much open in terms of restaurants or stores but since it was only a 5 minute drive to the airport it worked.

review_content: Very professional and clean hotel. Great for business trips as they provide all of the amenities you need to be able to work from your home. It doesn't hurt that fine dining is right below your room at Frank Grisanti's.Shana was extremely helpful in resolving a error on my bill.I would definitely stay here again.This was a very nice hotel for a decent price on Hotels.com. Being that i am a Quadriplegic wheelchair user, i have a few complaints. The so-called "wheelchair accessible" rooms are actually regular rooms that were sorta adapted to accommodate wheelchair/elderly occupants. Rm 220 has a tub with safety bars. Rm 224 has a roll in shower with a sitting area. The problem with Rm 224's bathroom is that it was poorly made to be accessible. If you are a non walking wheelchair user like myself, i advise you to not stay in this room alone. There is a significant ramp up into the roll-in shower & the shower bench is up too high. So i had to take a running start to get up the ramp & into the shower. I then had to ask my partner to remove my chair. Im 6'1 & my feet barely touched the ground. The water runs out of the shower into the rest of the bathroom floor because there is not enough of a drainage ditch & there is no divider to catch the water. The shower bench does not let up at all because the shower rail is restricting it from doing so. The bed is up a little high & should be lowered to accommodate wheelchair users that are unable to transfer to higher beds. All in all this is a great hotel that i would suggest to others in my condition, just not alone.Two-room suite- complimentary drinks- complimentary made to order breakfast and coffee++ awesome cocktail hourAs others have said, this place is dirty, old and nobody seems to give a darned. Mildew in the shower, closet door unable to close and... get this... no toilet paper in the room and it took them 25 minutes to get it to me after I called. Good thing that Mother Nature didn't call.I've stayed at the Hampton Inn right next door and it's nice, for a Hampton Inn. Much better value, clean and well-appointed. Everything the Embassy is not.The hotel is currently under renovation, so several of the nicer amenities weren't available during our stay - but, the suite was very clean and well furnished. Happy traveler - will be better next time with the full made to order breakfast :)The hotel Is great--construction is complete and the result is very sleek and modern. The breakfast/reception area is not as upscale as other Embassy's but I have no complaints about the room, breakfast or manager's reception--all of it was really great. The hotel is accommodating and inviting and I would highly recommend it!! The attached Italian restaurant is a bit pricy but also delicious. They have Peroni beer, Italian wine, and four beers on tap. How can you go wrong when a hotel has that? If you are in Memphis and looking for a suite hotel you can't go wrong here. Enjoy your stay ~~Decent Hotel for what it was. The room was nicer than what I expected. My issue was with house staff. My wife, kids and I stayed there for 3 days. In town for a family reunion. For the entire time we were there no one came to clean our or bring clean towels. I had to go find the maid and grab clean towels off her cart. I also had to take my own trash down stairs to throw it away. Nice rooms, but very subpar service. Will we be coming back? Thats a negative ghostriderwe stayed here while meeting a long lost family member.... the hotel staff did everything within their power to accommodate the reunion and make our stay comfortable. .? will stay here again.Worst hotel in the world. Dishonest. Greedy. Do not stay at this property .The owners should be ashamed.Entire first floor and central atrium is under construction until April 2015. No awesome made-to-order or hot breakfast, swimming pool, gym, and construction noise after 7am. Driving in from Oklahoma, my family was more than bummed. Great opportunity for discounted rates? Not a chance. Not even a free cookie. Although the front desk was nice enough, she had no frontline authority and the hotel management was making decisions based on something other than customer satisfaction. Highly unusual for Hilton Embassy Suites.This is a nice hotel. A great place to stay for a long hotel stay when you are in town on business! I am pleased with the accommodations except for a few things. One night we found ants in our room, eating the cookies on the counter by the microwave. We called the front desk, who then sent up a maintenance man to spray for the ants. He told me that they usually come up from under where the refrigerator is located. In all honesty, although I appreciated the prompt response to spray for the ants, in most hotels they would have sprayed, moved me to a hotel suite, or discounted the price of my room and provided me with some type of complimentary voucher to a restaurant. After all, seeing ants eat your food in a hotel is very gross. I agree with one reviewer that the walls are paper thin and I noticed that my bedroom wall shakes every time a guest in the room next door closes the door. I can hear the conversations next door, and let's just say, that's not all that I've heard. The air conditioning system is also hit and miss. Sometimes the room seems cooler than on other nights. I think that the thermostat is there to make you feel as though you are in control of room temperature when you are not. The complimentary breakfast is not bad, but the area that it is served in is more low class cafeteria than for a hotel like the Embassy Suites. The area is basically the lobby of the hotel and makes the hotel sound loud and chaotic, particularly during breakfast and their complimentary happy hour in the evening. I also noticed that sometimes their dishwasher does not thoroughly clean off the food particles from their silverware. Frank Grisantis restaurant is okay only if you are really hungry. So far I have ordered a salad, entree, and dessert and it all tasted uninspired and something that I would have done better cooking myself, especially for the price. One of the best things about this hotel is that it is in a great location. There are restaurants and places to shop everywhere. One last thing that I have to add is that in my personal experience, the bellman was not helpful. The bellman watched me pull up with my vehicle, take out a lot of luggage for my entire family (for a long hotel stay), and then simply walked off without speaking or providing me with a cart to load my luggage. I saw him a second time in the lobby as I was checking in, where he did not speak or offer to assist me in anyway. I would still recommend this hotel, but it's just not 4 or 5 stars. I almost gave it 2 stars, but I hear that renovations are coming in July.The hotel is under major renovation despite them only mentioning that the breakfast would be limited. Hammers & jackhammers by 8 am daily. Fitness center closed. Pool closed. Breakfast area closed. Breakfast was a paper bag with prepackaged muffin, granola bar, & apple; no other choices & nothing hot. The room was fine, but construction noise unpleasant.We had to book here at the last minute on a long trip that we were running behind on and were pleasantly surprised with how nice it turned out.I am guessing this hotel is about 20-25 years old but it seems like it has been well taken care of. The staff was super nice and our whole family loved the made-to-order complimentary breakfast.We managed to squeeze two adults and 6 kids into the room without any issue. There were two Double beds (I don't think they were Queens, they definitely could have been a bit bigger) a pull out couch and a little collapsable crib for our youngest, and still it didn't even seem cramped.Its got a cute decor with the atrium inside and the pond with the fish and the ducks doesn't come off as tacky. All in all I would definitely stay here again.Great location and very comfortable rooms. I only gave it four stars because of fitness center being unavailable due to renovation but once that opens it will be perfect!This hotel in undergoing renovations so a lot of the usual niceties weren't available. What should be noted however is how nice and accommodating the staff here was. They were pleasant and all smiles despite all the chaos going on. Made us feel welcome and helped out in any way they could. Usually I would avoid hotels with construction, but you shouldn't have that concern here! If the staff were this warm and nice during construction, I can't imagine how nice they would be otherwise!I was worried with the reviews but I had a very nice stay. Bed was comfortable, down pillows, and linens were very soft. Standard ES layout, a true suite so you can shut living area door from bedroom. Bathroom had tub/shower combo and plenty hot water. There are rooms with shower only so ask if you want one. Mini fridge has small freezer area and There is a microwave. Comfortable desk space. Indoor pool and jacuzzi, gift shop, business center, fitness center all on ground floor. Depending on which room you get the noise level changes. I think the rooms closer to the front are quiter. The breakfast area in back, gets noisy in the morning. The restaurant is Italian in the hotel. There are lots of nearby restaurant you could walk or drive too. Corky's BBQ is close and the best in town. This is my go to Memphis hotel.Nice hotel as another Embassy Suites offers spacious rooms and an amazing hot breakfast, specially omelettes.I have traveled around the country and I've been to a lot of Embassy hotels, and this hotel let me down a little bit. The breakfast was a bit lacking and one day we did not have our beds done, however we let the front desk know and they were really attentive sending someone to tidy our room.In conclusion, the hotel is OK even though there are better Embassy Suites, this one is fine to stay a short time. The hotel is well-located in Memphis near a mall.I am a regular business traveler and this the worst embassy suites I have stayed at. The furnishing and carpet are tired, the temperature controls non-functioning, poor plumbing, and very thin walls. Make sure not to get a room along the entrance side as the signage lights shine directly into the room.Terrible! This hilton honors member will not return. Opened our sofa bed for our daughter to sleep on and the whole thing fell apart. Called the front desk to report for maintenance. His repair work was to use zip ties to hold the mattress in place. That repair lasted about 20 minutes until it broke again. HBO was out for all 3 nights of our stay. Only one elevator worked. Hair in my breakfast pancake. That's just the highlights.I highly recommend you never set foot on this property. I am a Diamond member of Hilton Honors and in my opinion, this property should be deflagged meaning no longer allowed to be attached to the Hilton family of brands. Why? On Thursday night I rented two adjoining suites on the 3rd floor for 4 adults and 5 children. The kids were having a blast as they always do at Embassy Suites swimming, jumping on beds, etc. That night about 8 PM one of the members of my party noticed that a bedroom door was closed. She opened the door and then sceamed. Her 3 year old was literally hanging out of the area where the window would be. I say would be because the complete window was lying on the floor of the room. Yes, the entire window. After grabbing the child and saying a few prayers, the front desk was called who sent maintenance to the room about 20 minutes later. They braced the window so it would not come loose again during our stay. Amazing part? Not one word from anyone at the hotel. Not a peep that night, no apology, no manager showing up at the room, no well anything. At about 9:30 AM, I headed down to the front desk and the manager on duty was not even aware that this had happened. When I told her she responded that this must have been very scary for you. That's it. No apology, no we will check every window in the hotel, no escalation to GM. I followed this conversation up with a call to Hilton customer service who was very helpful to the point of calling the hotel and saying the GM, Heather would call me that AM on my cell. Well never heard a peep from Heather. I am a Diamond member. A child could have easily died or been seriously injured that night. I am literally in shock about this incident. Half of Hilton's operations are based in memphis not a mile from this property. Until a few years ago that included the Embassy Suites brand. This of all your properties should be in tune with customers. Other things happened during our stay as well. In the middle of the night a large panel came off the wall and crashed onto the floor. At 10 AM with sunny skies the power went out for an hour. Bottom line is avoid this property. Read my other reviews, I do not say things like this, it's not my MO. Well it wasn't AVOID this property.
review_content_20: I am Hilton Diamond Status (as high as a loyalist can go)  for over 5 years now and you would have thought I walked in from off the street. The front desk was almost annoyed at the fact that I had the audacity to check in at 4:40 PM.Pros - better part of Memphis (if that is possible), convenient to the indefinitely under-construction I-240.Cons - dated, musty, in house restaurant was insanely expensive for Mama Celeste/Stouffer-esque lasagna.In summary, the Embassy Suites hotel is very good, the hotel staff is even better, and I definitely recommend staying here.The Good:Rooms:  The rooms are suites (given the name of the hotel) and provide spacious and comfortable accommodations.  The bed was comfortable, there were plenty of TV channels, I felt right at home.Food:  I didn't try the room service, but the continental breakfast in the morning was always very delicious with many tasty and health options.  I never tried the cook-to-order meals, but they looked very good too.Staff:  The first night I stayed at the Embassy Suites, my heater was broken and it was pretty cold all night.  I told this to the front desk staff on my way to work the next morning and they had it fixed by the time I returned that day.  This is excellent service, which I expect, but a lot of other hotels would offer to move me to a different room instead of fixing the issue immediately.The Bad:Parking:  There are very few parking spots near the front door of the hotel and it is hard to find a good one.  Most times I was stuck with a parking spot in the very back corner of the parking lot which required a little bit longer of a walk to get into the hotel.Wifi:  The wireless internet, while easy to connect to, was extremely slow and I had trouble doing basic online tasks like checking my email and the news.Love the Atrium and peaceful setting. The rooms are suites. The layout is nice. The beds are COMFORTABLE. Good free Internet. Nice flat screen TV's. We Loved the Atrium, the DUCKS and Koi in the little creek. It was a peaceful setting. We really enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. Breakfast  on the weekends were wonderful. Made to order  Fried eggs,Omelettes,& pancakes with grits and bacon or buffet style  scrambled eggs, sausage links,oatmeal  and  French Toast. In the evening there's a drink reception each day. If that's not enough there's a nice restuarant  in the hotel.A very nice heated pool and exercise/work out room. Helpful , friendly staff. It was a great location. We will stay there again.A very pleasant hotel, with plenty of room for our family of four.  The rooms are arranged around an atrium, attractively decorated with plants and a flowing "stream," with koi and several ducks (so take that, Peabody!).  The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the service was excellent.  On the theory that free food and drink make people happy, there is a free breakfast with cereal, fruit, yogurt, sausages, eggs, etc. and a cooked-to-order omelette and pancake station (go early if you don't like waiting in line).  There is also a "Manager's reception" from 5:30 to 7:30 every night with complimentary booze and snacks.  It was like an Elite event without the fun.A nice fitness center with Precor machines, a pool, and free parking were nice amenities.  There are so many other hotels in spitting distance that the room price was very reasonable.  The only downside is that this is a popular hotel for traveling school sports teams, so prepare for some noise on the weekends.Not a bad place to sleep when traveling for business.Every time I'm in Memphis for work and need to be near the Germaintown area, I stay here. It's your typical Embassy Suites with lots of families and the like just getting away. The breakfast in the morning and cocktail hour in the evening makes it worthwhile.Skip even trying to use the internet here. It's $9.95-12.95/day and doesn't work worth a shit. In the last 5 years it's never worked once when I've been there. Luckily AT&T 3G internet works in the room, so I can still use that internet to connect in for work.No complaints, definitely a professional establishment with southern hospitality.This place was clean and the bed was comfortable. At one point I had trouble with the TV in the living room area, but they came by and fixed it while I was gone. They also have a pretty good breakfast spread. The worst part was the Internet connection. There is a free connection that is crap and even the one you pay for is terrible. It became very frustrating when I was trying to work at night.The Embassy Suites is just average.  It's overpriced for what it is.  Yes, the rooms are technically "suites" but the layouts are strange so the room did not feel spacious.  The furniture was definitely worn in.  There was also a shower instead of a tub, which was a little odd.  Free hot breakfast in the morning was nice.  The omelettes were great.  Pancakes were so-so.  I also liked the "manager's reception".  I say that in quotation marks because the manager never came to his or her own reception.  Order "The Freddy" it's the bartender's special drink.  Fruity and delicious. Wi-fi is not free.  It's $10 a day which seemed steep.  Printing and internet in the business center are free, however, which was nice.   Housekeeping did not come on one day.  The hotel seems overwhelmed when they are busy and unable to accomodate a full house.Another so-so Embassy Suites, but overpriced for its location. Exceptionally nice staff. Long line for the omelettes, and the buffet food is reminiscent of the high school cafeteria. The worst thing about ES is that the bedrooms have the windows and the "living rooms" with the desk face out onto the walkway and atrium, so if you want to work in there it is either very dark or you have people walking by 15 inches away and looking into your window.They do have a free shuttle, but it stops at 10 pm so I couldn't use it to get there from the airport. For other trips it can be 0 - 30 minutes wait. The very nice driver gave me a good rundown of all the nearby BBQ places.The wifi is insufficient for any individual to stay online for more than a couple of minutes. Each night that we were here, one or more high school groups have been here, with kids hanging out in the atrium loudly until late. Our nonsmoking room reeks of stale smoke covered with air freshener. Twice housekeeping has neglected to leave us washcloths.  The fire alarm was tripped as a prank tonight, and an hour later it still sounds like bourbon street on Marci gras out there.  We will check out in the morning and complete our stay at another hotel. This place has been awful.The hotel is clean and even smells good. The staff is extremely friendly (especially the breakfast staff). The only things that were kind of a problem were paper thin walls (we heard our neighbors showering, closing their door, and at times even talking), lukewarm coffee at breakfast, and the shower didn't drain fast enough so we took showers in a puddle. The ice machine is literally on the other side of the hotel. that's just a bit annoying. We would stay here again because of the staff and the cleanliness.I usually stay at this hotel for business, and I always enjoy my stay.  The staff is exceptionally friendly, professional, and accommodating.  The 24 hour fitness room is quite nice and is equipped with two treadmills, two ellipticals, one bike, and two weight benches.  They also have a dumbbell set with weights from 5 lbs to 50 lbs, medicine balls, and yoga mats.  The swimming pool area is nice as well.  They have a game/arcade room for children.  I never went in, but it looked like the kids were enjoying it.  The cooked-to-order breakfast in the morning was very nice and the manager's reception in the evening was great, and usually needed after a long day of work.  Freddie is typically the bartender in the evening and he has his own special cocktail that is a must try.  The hotel is a bit old and could use some renovations, but overall I've never been disappointed.I'm trying to chalk my experience up to a bad week at the hotel.  I stayed here for business for six nights.  The continental breakfast is pretty great and they have a happy hour every night which is also awesome as it is free.  Things that were bad for me were no hot water in my room on three occassions for showers - a MASSIVE outbreak of dozens and dozens of children running all over the hotel.  I work nights so I sleep during the day and you could hear kids screaming all day running past your room.  You couldn't use the pool or hot tub because about 30 kids would be crowded into the area.  I'm hoping that is was just week I landed on coming here and not a constant every weekend thing because I probably will have to use this hotel again for work.  The room cleaning is sketchy - my first day I was sleeping during the day and the lady knocked persistently until she woke me up and when I told her through the door I was sleeping and didn't need cleaning right now she forced me to get dressed and sign some paperwork AFTER I told her I was sleeping - it was really rude - she kept knocking even after she woke me up.  Apparently it was a paper that if you signed they didn't have to clean your room at all - so that was annoying as well to fix.  The rooms are nice - suites - two hd televisions - but mine at least was a little worn out.  My room was also two floors directly above the pool and sometimes had a chlorine smell.  The room service is from the hotel restaurant frank grissoti - they were prompt but the food from the restaurant is pretty bad and its a very expensive restaurant.  I kind of wish they had a different selection.  Most of the bad things were in details - overall my experience was decent.  They make up for some bad things with the free breakfast and happy hour.  But some things were not so easy to forget...like the overnight front desk clerk being less than helpful and filled with disdain for anyone who approached his counter and the fact that they didn't have several umbrellas to loan out to guests for the constant memphis rain storms.The hotel is ok, but for an Embassy Suites it could have been better.  Upturned tables and such laying in hallways.  Room was clean but not sparkling either.  Several glasses had fingerprints and spots all over them.  Furniture was old and cheap, looked thrown together from a yard sale.  Internet access is not free of course.  Lots of hot water available. Staff is friendly and helpful.  Nice breakfast server downstairs in morning.

review_content: As far as hostels go, this one is pretty good! It's a church with a big parking lot, very safe part of town, too. The doors had security codes, which were changed regularly. I never felt unsafe there alone. Lots of cute restaurants nearby. The beds were OK. If this is your primary concern, I recommend the co-ed dorm, which had double beds that looked more comfy than the twin ones. If you're a neat freak, this place probably isn't for you. It's not the cleanest, but it's certainly not the dirtiest either. For the price and location, it's a pretty good place.The Pilgrim House in Mid Town, Memphis is an awesome place to stay for a week! This past week my friend Chris and I were finishing mixing a record at Ardent Studios and this was the best place to lay our heads, and meet some really awesome people! The Hostel is quite large and with plenty of rooms, both private and shared! We shared a room with 6 bunks in it! We always had roomates! There are lockers in your rooms if you want to lock your stuff up, but I never really thought it was a big deal! The Staff at Pilgrim House was great! Super helpful and for 20 bucks a person, it's a very nice cheap place to stay! Lots of parking and a block a way from multiple places to eat, drink, and be merry! You are assigned 1 chore a day while staying at the Hostel and I thought well this will probably be a hassle but it was actually really easy and takes about 2 minutes to complete every morning! It also makes you feel more at home and helpful! I loved it.. It also keeps the place very clean! They have both private and shared bathrooms and a huge kitchen with supplies for cooking! They have free coffee as well! All and all this was a perfect stay for us! Cheap, Fun, and we met people from all around the world!I loved staying here. Very home-y. The women in my dorm were all courteous. The staff is very friendly and I got a great run down of the facilities. $27 got me a cool bed (it was scorching last night), fresh shower, wifi, comfy couch to work on. They also offer a free pancake breakfast but I stuck with my protein shake, which I was able to mix up in their fully stocked kitchen. Each person needs to help out with a chore before they leave, but I was happy to take out the recycling. I would definitely stay here again.We actually booked this place thinking it would be a creepy church experience, and it would add to our southern experience. It did add, but not because it was creepy. It was totally awesome. The staff was SO nice. There is no indoctination like I expected as it's attached to a church. It's really sweet and large and nicely run. The whole 'daily chores' thing made us worry but it was actually really fine, the chores were something like refill the ice trays to throw out one of the recycling bins to wipe the kitchen stools. It takes between 30 seconds to 2 minutes, max. There's a lot of rooms, bathrooms, living room space. We got a private room and one space in the dorm, my only complaint is the private room, which is for three, had a bunkbed, with the bottom a double, so three of us didn't fit well, so the third just slept happily on one of the couches and we all ended up having a great night's sleep both nights. Totally worth staying at. I think it was way better than a hotel would have been.Awesome place to stay. Clean very nice staff free breakfast and very nice dorms. Would stay there once again for sureWe had a lovely stay. (We being my husband, 5 year old, 19mo old and me). Neighborhood was beautiful and friendly. Quiet, clean, and bright. Beds were not the most comfy but the private room was more comfy than expected. If you're an early riser prepare in advance to go somewhere else until at least 9. We went to Brother Junipers for a fabulous breakfast until we could check out at 9.Wonderful place, friendly staff, and you can't beat the price. I paid $40 for the private room, which was small but cozy. The hostel is right in the middle of one of Memphis' most walkable neighborhood, and is close to everything. Would stay there again.It's entirely possible to stay in a clean, safe, friendly place in the heart of Memphis for $15 a night. That is, if you don't mind sharing and cleaning up after yourself.The place is Pilgrim House, Memphis' only hostel.The Pilgrim house is located inside First Congregational Church in Cooper Young. It's a little more cozy than the average hotel. When I stopped by, a college student was working in the library, the RAs were checking people in, and a man who had walked to Memphis from California was talking about his adventures with a small pack of Australians in the hostel's sunny kitchen.It's only $15 per person to stay in one of the shared dorms at the Pilgrim House. There are two single-sex dorms and one co-ed dorm, each with several sets of bunk beds. There are also a handful of private rooms, which are are $30 for one person (plus $15 for each additional person). There is a private bathroom, as well as dorm-style bathrooms.Guests are allowed to use the kitchen and the library, take whatever they want from the free food stash, and rent bicycles for the day through Revolutions Community Bike Shop (which is located in the same building).There's just one catch - because Pilgrim House is a hostel, they ask that everyone who stays there pitch in by doing a small chore. Most of the chores are things like unloading the dishwasher, taking the recycling out or sweeping the kitchen - they're light and take about five minutes.I loved this place. Very quiet. In a great neighborhood. Spacious. You can't find it on Hostels.com though, which is kind of frustrating. It was recommended to me by some people in Nashville who had stayed there. Cool lounge, big kitchen.My husband and I stopped in here for a night on a road trip through the South, paying just $30 for the two of us. They didn't have a private room available when we booked earlier in the week, so they placed us in a co-ed dorm with no other people. There were a couple of full-size beds, too, so we were able to sleep together. There was a door to a private room in the co-ed room, so there was still traffic in and out. The bed itself was pretty uncomfortable, but you really can't complain for $15 a night. My only genuine complaint is that it was very, very hot in our room. There was a window a/c unit, but it didn't seem to be able to cool such a big room.Compared to other hostels, it's very clean and has a lot of common areas. There is a big kitchen and a library, as well as a couple other sitting rooms with couches and funny-shaped pillows. The staff was friendly and gave us advice on where to eat and drink in midtown. The hostel uses entry codes on a few doors to get in, so it was nice not having to use a key. There was a handful of other people staying. I could definitely see myself spending a week here if I had time.Overall OK as far as staffing and organization, but I do have to question security because one of the guests staying in our room who failed to respect curfew managed to "break in" at 3am and had the nerve to wake me up by putting his chihuahua on my pillow. It sort of means pretty much anyone can get in any time they want. Watch your stuff and your security if you're sharing a room.When I returned here in 2012 it had been taken over by young students and did not have the good age and nationality mix it had previous year. Consequently, perhaps, it was radically less clean, the bathrooms in particular, and 'staff' was very unprofessional. I may give it one more chance but not more if it is not as it was in 2011.My sister and I stayed here for two nights while we were in town, and this hostel (along with the city in general) made me wish I could stay for much longer. Clean, friendly, and unbelievably cozy. Each day each guest has one small chore to complete, but it's hard to argue with that when you are staying in a safe and homey place for as low as $15 a night. I sprung for a bit more to get a private room, since I didn't know the place and was traveling with my young sister and some expensive photography equipment, but after seeing how friendly and safe the place is, I would go for the shared dorm rooms.Other charming bits:-- Common areas with comfortable couches and tons of books that people can read, share, swap, leave behind.-- Mordecai the cat, who lives in the hostel.-- Bicycle co-op in the building where you can rent bikes.-- Very friendly staff - R.A.'s who live in the building in exchange for covering shifts.-- Right around the corner from the Cooper neighborhood, with cafes, restaurants, bookstores, etc.A great place to stay in a great city. Try it out.I have literally lived in hostels for 12 of the past 18 months, and this is the most pleasant, comfortable place I've ever set foot in. It's so nice that it's confusing. Seriously. I was convinced for 5 minutes I was in the wrong place. Then I saw the giant kitchen, talked to the super-friendly people, checked out the rad and big beds in the equally rad rooms, and grabbed a good old Bloom County cartoon collection (starting with Penguin Dreams and I'll work my way up from there) from their well-stocked library, and I was at home. Scratch that. If I had a home it still wouldn't be this nice. I'll update if I find a flaw later, but right now after 4 days of 12-hour drives across the US, this is a slice of heaven with habanero on top. (did I mention it's $15 per night? total. no fees. no nothing. hell, it cost me $35 for a patch of dirt 10 feet from the 101 in California just to set up my tent in a puddle. Memphis gets much respect from me for this.)Great Place!Very clean very cozy. If you are staying in Memphis this is the place to be. They have full size beds in the dorm rooms, and they have private and public bathrooms. And for $15 a night, that's cheaper than staying home.It's a little far from downtown, but driving is easy, and the neighborhood is pretty hip. You have to do one chore each day wile you are there, but they are easy, and it only takes like 5 minutes.I've been too allot of hostels around the world and this one actually ranks fairly high. Everything is super clean and safe, and just nice. The major con is it's a bit out of the city, but one bus will take you directly downtown. if your coming from the south via Amtrak you'll have to get a cab cause it's just too late for most buses and if your going south via Amtrak just get a cab cause it's too early for most buses.You have to do some chore while your here, which really isn't too bad, otherwise that's it. Just a nice simple clean hostel on the backside of a church.Not very cooperative, I wasn't able to stay here because I could not check in until 4pm, I had to be somewhere during check in hours, and no special arrangements would be made. I ended up walking 7 miles to the river through the parks and woods, and ghettos and historical districts and found a more accommodating place in town.Definitely worth the insanely cheap cost to stay here. I've resided in co-op housing and traveled through hostels, and this place is much cleaner than the former and less institutionalized than the hostels I've stayed in. I stopped here for a night on a long drive from MI to TX, and the chore I got was wiping down the dining room tables, which took 5 minutes. Most people working and visiting the hostel were in their 20s, and everyone was very friendly. There were lots of maps and brochures sitting around for tourists' easy access, as well as local menus organized by geographical distance. The hostel itself is in the hip Cooper-Young neighborhood. Even if it weren't a safe neighborhood, the hostel sits on the third level of a building next to a church, and door codes are needed to get in. Probably the most cost-effective part of my trip.When we finally arrived at the Pilgrim House, it was like a breath of fresh air. That was when we finally got there. Prior to our arrival, we tried calling but found out that there phone lines were not working and that's why we were unable to contact anyone and make a reservation. My friend that I was traveling with also was a little apprehensive about staying there because the Pilgrim House is located at the back of a church and we weren't really looking to stay in a Christian youth hostel. Anyway, a person from the church finally let us into the building after nearly dehydrating outside in the fierce Memphis heat and the Pilgrim House felt like we had arrived at home. The set up seemed like a real house in that bedrooms were set up around living spaces. It is a co-op style establishment in that everyone who stays at the Pilgrim is expected to pitch in and clean up and that way it was maintained rather well. Remember to do your chores or no key deposit back!In hindsight, the only drawback to staying at the Pilgrim House was that a lot of the staff that works there also lives there. I didn't feel completely welcome because I knew I was on their turf. Otherwise, The Pilgrim House was a positive experience and I would stay there again. It is not a Christian retreat which we feared and I think it was 15 bucks a night for a shared room. It is located in a cool part of Memphis and right down the street from the hostel is the wonderful little coffee shop: Java Cabana.I stayed in the pilgrim house for 4 nights and I loved it. Never stayed in a hostel before and this was a great time. Yes u do chores but so what. I spent less then 20 minutes all together on the chores. For 15 bucks u can't beat it. Most of the staff were really great. Did see much of the cat. Every1 that stayed there were really cool. Had a great time n would go back there anytime. Thank you pilgrim staff u helped make my time alot more fun :)
review_content_20: I really liked staying at the Pilgrim hostel. It was clean the staff was friendly and the people staying there were nice aswell. The chores they have you do are super easy and take about 5 minutes max. It is in a safer hip part of town so you don't feel scared. Near by are some good restaurants too! I recommend staying here if you are on a budget and are up for an adventure!I almost didn't stay here because the website makes it look like this place is run by a bunch of stodgy old church ladies, but the staff are actually young and fun, and so is the atmosphere here. It's a bit far from downtown so you do need a car. It's super-affordable, one of the nicer hostels I've stayed at.Stayed here for a night during a road trip through Tennessee. It was not at all what I expected from a church hostel! There was plenty of space, lots of comfortable loungey-areas to hang out, and a huge kitchen. They require that you do one chore while you're there that takes about 3 minutes (mine was wipe down the kitchen tables). The dorm rooms are cramped with rickety bunk beds so I didn't sleep very well. Then again for $15 it was fine for a night. If I was to stay there for longer, I'd definitely try to get a private room. The town near the hostel is cute with good restaurants, but it's definitely easier to have a car if you want to go down to Beale street at night.Didn't  love this place...staff was type A about everything unlike most other hostels i've ever been to. take this place with a grain of salt. 5-7 miles out of town, you'd need a car. good coffee shops, antique shops and cafes nearby as this is a trendy outskirt neighborhood.A friend and I booked a reservation here for one night, happy to have a very cheap place to stay as we passed through Memphis. We checked in, played with their really cute cat, and then left for dinner. When we returned, we met near disaster - the cars that had been parked on either side of us earlier had been vandalized while we were gone. Each one had a window smashed, and who knows what belongings were stolen from within the car. We immediately decided to head back downtown and wound up, thanks to the extreme number of drunk tourists populating all of the cheaper hotels, staying at the Peabody. After an outrageously expensive night of deep sleep on an amazingly plush bed, we finally got through to someone at the hostel to let them know why we hadn't returned the night before. When I explained the situation to the girl there, she seemed unconcerned. Her deadpan response was, "Yes, some cars were broken into." She then proceeded to ask whether we had left belongings there and said goodbye. There was no apology and definitely no offer of a refund. I mean, the girl obviously wasn't personally responsible for our crappy situation, but she didn't seem to care, either. I'm guessing that her nonchalance indicates that break-ins are not uncommon. So to those of you bringing a car (especially one filled with all of your belongings because you're roadtripping to LA to begin grad school...), be warned. You may not find it like you left it.

review_content: I had a god experience at this hotel, I would stay here again. Right next to Beale St. The room had a balcony where we can here the music. The breakfast was okay. Things I didn't like.-no bellman-the one egg dish had ham and bell peppers.-the area to drop off your luggage Other than that, this place was great.Like most other Hampton Inns across the country, this one offer clean rooms and good front desk service. They also have typical Hampton Inn breakfast and a very helpful breakfast staff.This hotel is literally located a block away from Memphis' famous Beale Street. Next door, you have a pizza shop where you can buy a cheese slice for $5 or $6 for pepperoni. Inside the hotel they also have a small bar and restaurant with yummy gyros.WHY ONLY 3 STARS? Here's why I am only giving this hotel 3 stars- It's noisy as hell. All through the night you hear music and banging. The front desk has a disclaimer about the noise, but I would imagine they could construct an effective barrier to drown out the noise a little better. I was up all night both nights I stayed here, even after using sleep aides to get some sleep. So, don't expect to get much rest if you decide to stay at this specific hotel, BUT you can expect good customer service like any other Hampton Inn.The Hiltons are good friends of mine. Well, at least their chain of modestly priced hotel properties are good friends!The Memphis Hilton is very clean and convenient to all things Memphis as a tourist (though be warned Graceland is nowhere near downtown). As noted at the desk "Beale can be noisy" this is not a place to stay if you are a light sleeper. Memphis is working really hard to clean things up, even so Beale has a gritty side that keeps me from recommending it to a solo traveler after dark. Many rooms have a lovely alley view of Beale St bars and restaurants complete with patrons ready to refund whatever they ate and drank for dinner. That's Beale! Parking is super easy and convenient here. The staff is tops. Security is very visible and other touches like a key card activated elevator make your stay more pleasant in the #4 out of 10 most dangerous cities in the US.Great location in write at Beale Street can listen to music all night hopefully like good musicReally amazing customer service, and right next to all the cool places you want to be.Hotel staff is VERY FRIENDLY. We arrived a little early and they allowed us to go ahead and check in. The lady at the front desk was extremely courteous and helpful. Housekeeping staff in the hallways asked us how our room was.This hotel is a little pricey, but you are paying for the awesome LOCATION, which is literally steps from Beale Street. We could hear the sounds of Beale St from our room, but that's what we were there for, so it didn't bother us. This is probably not the hotel for you if you are there to get some sleep or get work done. Our room was very nice and clean, and the bed was comfortable. I like that the hotel is very secure. You have to use your key card to access everything -- the elevator, the doors after hours, the parking deck (which is right next door, not valet, costs $19 per night). They have a bar in the lobby, and there is also a sundries shop to purchase miscellaneous items such as toiletries and snacks. Wi-fi was easy to access and worked well. My only complaint was the free breakfast buffet. The free buffet is one of the reasons I chose this hotel, and it was not up to the quality of other free buffets we've had. The sausage and eggs were barely warm. The eggs were a little weird (powdered?). They had other things like bagels, yogurt, bananas, and muffins. Selection was pretty good, just needed the hot foods to be hot. I guess I shouldn't complain since it is free.Despite the buffet, we will most likely stay here again.Overall: GREAT hotel in a GREAT LOCATION. Buffet -- meh.This Hampton Inn is located right off Beale St downtown. We stayed here over a long weekend and were impressed. We had one of their suites which was very nice. Well appointed, with balcony, small kitchenette and living room room area, and a separate bedroom (king bed) and adjoining bath (flat screens in both rooms). For a place that I am sure sees its fair share of partiers, the hotel and our room were in nice shape and very well kept. They do not offer room service, but there is a Fajita joint attached that will deliver. The hotel also has a nice complimentary breakfast buffet with a good variety...cereals, fruit, yogurt, bagels, waffle makers, and a couple hot buffet items (eggs and sausage when we stayed). Overall it was a nice place to stay and I would return if I am back in Memphis.Love coming here. Great place to stay. Rooms are nice. Right in the heart of downtown, Beale St. Memphis. Staff is friendly. Check in was easy and fast. Complimentary breakfast. Balcony view of Beale St.This place was totally decent. Definitely didn't exceed expectations or anything, but all needs were well met. The staff was helpful for getting taxis and helping us with directions. There were always a few people at the desk ready to help and there's a tiny snack shop next to the desk with some pretty good options, especially if you're coming home from a long night on Beale and feeling snacky :) My bf and I also stayed at the Hilton while we were here. It's particularly good for a Hampton, and the other is particularly bad for a Hilton. and this place was significantly nicer, but much louder! However, they definitely warn you ahead of time about it and that's just the price you pay to stay in the fun part of town. The gym was, of course, tiny. But they had a bench, some free weights, and a few cardio machines. If you're creative or just a cardio bunny, you can make do here. At least they have one. If I ever go back to Memphis, I would consider staying here again but only if there was a humongous price difference between here and the Peabody. Now that place is awesome! But this place definitely does the trick for a place to sleep and grab a quick free breakfast.Nice people, clean rooms but not a place for a good nights sleep. Very noisy even on the 6th floor. Outside music from local bars/clubs.Centrally located, friendly and helpful staff, wonderful and generous breakfast buffet all made this particular Hampton Inn stand out. While other reviewers complained about the noise, we didn't need to use the earplugs that they handed us when we checked in. The noise wasn't bad on the 6th floor even though we were close to Beale St. We heard the music but it was bearable. Room was very clean. Liked that we had a safe in the room. No fridges in the rooms.My boyfriend & I stayed here for Valentines Day. They let us check in early which was great because we were seeing a show at the Orpheum and wanted to get ready before the show. The staff was friendly. They have an indoor pool & hot tub (24/7) The room was clean & bed comfortable. One thing I was worried about in Memphis was safety and I felt extremely safe. You need a room key to get in the elevator to the rooms which is right in front of the front desk. When we went to smoke a cigarette at 3am, there was a bunch of security hanging out in the lobby which was awesome. THE LOCATION WAS AWESOME if you are wanting to party on Beale Streets! It's 1/2 a block away and was an extremely easy walk. Saw complaints about noise level in other reviews and when you check in there is a sign saying basically that they are right on Beale Street. Our room overlooked behind Beale & we heard nothing all night and it was a Saturday night. The only thing that could be improved was Breakfast when it came to the eggs, sausage & fruit. They did have yogurt, cereal, bagels & waffles though so we were satisfied. Would stay here again definitely!!!!!Staff was friendly. The Night Auditor gave us each a large complementary Toblerone chocolate bar when we arrived which was a nice surprise. Super soft beds. I felt safe. Main doors to lobby were locked at night and you needed to ring a bell to be let in if you didn't check in yet. Additionally, you need a key card to call the elevator. Our guest room was right next to the elevator and I didn't hear any hallway noise or street noise. Nice indoor pool with hot tub (no jets or bubbles), gym, and business center. Nice to have free wifi even though we didn't use it. The lobby layout was communal and it reminded me of a cozy Smoky Mountain cabin. I liked the free breakfast. Parking was a $15.56 + tax, but I knew that when I booked. It was a wonderful stay. Check out the video I made at this hotel: youtu.be/v0tDkEr-amkThis Hampton Inn delivers on location and cleanliness. In general I like Hampton Inns for their reliable internet, check, and decent cable tv offerings, check, and free coffee in the morning, check.Back to location, this Hampton Inn is just around the corner from the heart of Beale St. Also, I walked to the Civil Rights Museum/Lorraine Motel, about 10 minutes away, although you can take a street car which is about 2 blocks away. There is also a Starbucks one block away and a Hooters across the street for catching whatever football, baseball, basketball game might be on. Parking is $17 extra which a lot of other have mentioned and the spots are super narrow. Overall, Hampton Inn is a good option although if money is not an issue and you are picky then the Peabody might be a better option.This Hampton Inn is 3.5 stars, better than average but below very good. Overall the staff were very nice and the rooms were clean. I stayed three nights here. The location to Beale St is great step out the door and turn the corner.. it's only 1/2 block away. The down side was every morning it took 15 mins of running the water to get it warm enough for a shower, also late night hunger will not be satisfied until the morning. No options. Which surprised me for a so-called "party area". So it had pros and cons. Overall I'd stay again just on proximity to Beale Street.We have stayed at the Hampton many times in many different cities, and we have never been disappointed. They have an adequate breakfast, with clean and quiet rooms. If you stay here, try to get a room NOT on the Beale Street side. We were on the Peabody Place side, and had no problems at all. Others on the other side had difficulty with noise, and unruly guests. I was surprised at all the security here, but I guess it is necessary. For one thing, you can only use the elevators to get to your rooms. No stairway access except in emergencies. Also, you need your room key to access the elevator, and, at certain times of day, the lobby bathrooms and the lobby itself. We asked for one, king bed, but, somehow, we got two standard beds instead. When we stayed at the Hampton in Nashville, they did the same, but we got two queen beds. When you make your reservations, be sure they give you what you ask for. Other than that, the rooms were clean, well-serviced, and comfortable. The staff was nice and accommodating. You can usually find good rates at these hotels, even when they are located in or near popular sites.Stayed in the King Suite with 3 other people. The room was spacious and clean. The pull-out couch not so comfortable but my guest didn't complain much.The hotel is around the block from Beale St so if you want a quiet room this hotel is not for you BUT if you are stying in Memphis why not listen the music from Beale St to keep you in the mood of Memphis???The continental breakfast was AWESOME and lots to choose from!Would definitely stay there again!My mum and I had the absolute pleasure of staying here. All staff members were absolutely wonderful and went above and beyond to help us. This isn't something you come across too often. The rooms are super clean comfy beds fantastic breakfasts. This is the best spot you could stay in to be so central to Beale St. Would highly recommend.I've always enjoyed Hampton Inns. The branding is great, affordable, rooms are comfortable. But as soon as I was greeted by Mario, I knew I was in the right place. :) (Ok, also the sign at the front desk was adorable so that won me over too.)I would have given this place a 4 at least, but Mario greeted me by my formal name when I walked past the desk or had a question AND there is a pool/hot tub AND we are a street away from Beale St. Perfect :)This Hampton is in a great location! Close to Beale Street. Rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was great. All staff was kind and helpful. We'll be making more trips to Memphis in the future and plan on staying here again
review_content_20: If you are in Memphis, stay here.  Period.This hotel is right around the corner from Beale Street, probably the only reason that you are in Memphis in the first place.  Located within easy late night stumbling distance from all of the nightlife that Beale offers, the Hampton Inn cannot be beaten for the pure convenience factor.The staff is typical Memphis friendly in that if you are in a hurry for something, you will be disappointed.  But that is part of the overall charm of the entire city.  Kick back.  Relax.  Smoke em if ya got em.The rooms are larger and nicer than your average Hampton Inn in that they are suites with a 'full' kitchen included.  Not that you should use it, there are fantastic eating places literally around the corner.  Rendezvous is just a few blocks away if you get that urge for some Memphis Dry Rub served ala Tourist Style.  The hotel has an adjoining covered parking garage so that you can park your ride while you enjoy the ride.Was transferred, left a message, called again later, transferred again, then waited on hold for around 8 minutes waiting to talk to someone to ask how much a room was. Giving up. Shouldn't be that difficult to ask a simple question.Spent a night here not long ago. Lovely location. Only exception is you have to pay for parking. Our room was on Peabody st side, high up so it was nice and quiet. Didn't see any unruliness or rude guest. Rooms are modern and tastefully decorated. Facilities are good. Breakfast was wonderful. Good options for cold/hot foods. Would stay again.We loved the very welcoming lobby/living room area which also served as a breakfast eating area in the mornings. To the right was an inviting fireplace with sofas and chairs although it was in the 60s when we were there on November 21. The large breakfast buffet was very good. Different coffees were available all day and night. Although we were warned that we might hear music late into the night in our room, we did not. Our room was quiet. This hotel was quite a bit more expensive than any other place we stayed on our two-week road trip, but you are paying for location. The parking cost $15.56, and there was a sales tax plus a hotel tax which increased the total price by $50. That's my only complaint.Very pleasantly surprised with the Hampton Inn on Beale St! Spent the night here with the family for a downtown weekend and play at the Orpheum. Wasn't sure what to expect for a family stay this close to Beale St but it was great. I used a fellow Yelper tip and requested a room high up which reduced the street noise and this was probably a good call. The staff was very attentive and polite, everything was clean and new, the indoor pool and breakfast buffet were HUGE hits and the location was great. Little details like the unique TN/Memphis related pictures next to every room number and the guitar artwork in the rooms are what upped this place up to 5 stars for me though. The price seemed a little expensive for a Hampton Inn when I was researching, but after the stay I say it was fair and worth it. You can't beat the location and the amenities plus the staff.loved the hotel, room and the pool!  kid friendly too!  we were right downtown and within walking distance of everything.  only downside was that we had a car top carrier on our van and it didn't fit in their parking garage so we had to park down the street, but price wasn't bad for parking.Awesome staff at the hotel. The FD supervisor is amazing! The breakfast staff is amazing and very friendly. I will visit this hotel again!I stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend. Upon arriving there is a garage adjacent to the hotel to park in. We arrived a lot earlier than the check-in time but the lady working the desk had no problem letting us check-in. The entire stay was full of a friendly/helpful staff. The hotel is super close to Beale Street as well as a lot of other tourist attractions.The hotel is clean and well-maintained. The elevators require your key card to use after certain hours so the added security is nice. The breakfast set up in the morning was nice with hot and cold foods available. The room was clean and fresh. Although the bed was a little harder than I am used to it did not bother my sleeping at all. The bathroom was spacious and clean with all the amenities available.
