As another reviewer said there is a sign at the front desk stating that it can be loud because of Beale Street but I did not seem to have a problem with it. My room didn't face Beale Street directly but it did face a park that had a band playing into the early morning and I didn't find it too loud to mess with my sleep.All in all this is a great hotel to stay at if you want to be in this part of Memphis. When I go back I have no problem staying here again.Awsome place and people to boot! We were warmly greeted by Rashonda I believe who was vary helpful. Even though I was excited about getting over to Beale St. and keept bombarting her with question she laughed with my wife at my excitement. Even offered her a place to stay in  St. Louis if she would be unable to find a place when visiting STL in the next few weeks. Hope you enjoyed STL when you came up Rashonda.     Location was fantastic. Super close to alot of things Charles Vergos, Beale St., trolly and so much more. Only stayed one night coming through town on our way back to STL.     Rooms were clean and staff was all friendly. Parking garage is just a few steps form the door. Breakfast is served just like all Hamptons we have been too. Super big breakfast area with nice seating. The gentleman who was keeping the breakfast stocked up worked his butt off with all the guest eating in the morning. This is not a bad thing, but showes he is deffently their to make sure you are treated great and get what you need and want. Thank you sir for being upbeat and a friendly man at breakfast.Have stayed here on business two times. The first time we stayed at the Westin and decided to save a bit of money and try this place. The staff are some of the friendliest people around. Always cheerful and helpful. The hotel as a whole is clean, warm and friendly with newer furniture. The location is also great, near all of the action. You can ask for a room on the quiet side if you don't want to hear the noise from Beale street. Love the fact that it has breakfast which is included in the price of the room and that coffee is available all the time. The rooms are spacious and include a nice workspace and large bathroom. My only complaint is that the beds are a bit hard, but certainly not uncomfortable. Since we will continue to do work in Memphis, we will continue to stay at the Hampton Inn.Great location overall. Loved being able to walk right over to Beale St.  We had trouble with our keys constantly, which you need for everything. (Nice for safety, of course!)Beds were not comfortable. The staff was friendly & helpful. Breakfast was so-so, but there's lots of good food in Memphis!!Great location a block from Beale street which to me is a positive!  However, beforewarned if you are a light sleeper this may impact you depending on which room you are given.  As a HH member, I was given a high room with windows facing Peabody place which is on the opposite side of Beale and I had no problems.  My colleague; however, was given a Beale side room and heard the jazz music all night.  Fortunately she was happy with it...Gym is small but decent (one treademill and universal weight machine).  Small indoor pool and jacuzzi. Best part of the stay: FREE wifi, breakfast and all day coffee and fresh fruit.5 stars for location! Literally a half block from Beale St and EVERYTHING is in walking distance, we parked our car in the garage and didnt move it until we left. The front desk service was great, but keep in mind there is a sign on the front desk that says "ATTENTION PLEASE This hotel is located in the sports and entertainment district of Memphis. As such. it is noisy here till the wee hours. We want you to have as enjoyable a stay with us. If you are looking for a quiet hotel (and area) this isn't it. Eat, Drink, Boogie... Repeat" and its true the party really gets going on Beale St and doesnt stop til after 3am so keep that in mind!As soon as we got there we freshened up and walked down to Rendezvous for ribs (it was abt 2 blocks away) and then did a little touristy walking through the Peabody and some shops all of which are very close. We swam in the pool in the hotel (the pool is not very big but the jacuzzi was heavenly, esp after a long night on Beale!) and got ready and headed out to Beale St that night which was literally in our front yard at that point. If your looking for a place to crash before & after bbq & beale st I definitely reccomend the Hampton. If youre looking for a quieter family weekend, I definitely do NOT reccomend it, but it fit our purposes perfectly!The location of the Hampton Inn is great for easy access to Beale Street and Gibson Guitars.Check in was a breeze, our room is extremely clean and comfortable.The parking is self-parking, no valet in a parking garage attached to the property, just know that it runs $18 per day.  We have not found a downtown hotel in any city that doesn't charge for parking and this rate is not bad.Our room is quiet, but I can imagine on a weekend when Beale Street is hopping, it may be a tad noisy, but well worth it for the location.I will update once we have breakfast, but so far it is great!Proximity to Beale st, Gus's, Rendezvous, Arcade, Peabody, and Fedex Forum is the BEST!Came for UFC 107 and found that having everything in walking distance kept the cab fees down.. hotel staff was very helpful.Not too expensive or too far, walking-wise, to hit up when you spend a wild night on Beale, which we did.  When friends come to town they try to book a night here and a night at The Peabody.Great pillows.  Hey, it's important, right?  Fresh-smelling, slightly bleached bedding, the comforters are classy and clean, and you don't feel like you need to roll them down.  Yes, I've stayed in my share of dives on road trips.It's a nice hotel.  New furnishing in the bathrooms, Wi-Fi, and close to the happening places in downtown -- catch brunch on Beale before you head home.Excellent location and staff!  We wanted to go to a different city for our Christmas holidays and we decided to give Memphis a try.  We are Hilton Honors members so we expect a lot from any Hilton stay.  Hampton Inn Beale Street Team delivered! We stayed five nights including New Year's Eve.  The location is perfect for walking to Beale Street for fun and all of downtown Memphis, including the National Civil Rights Museum (a must on your trip!)  We had a suite on the 6th floor and even though people talk about it not being a quite location-Beale Street parties etc., we found it very quiet. It is the perfect size for a few days away from home.  The kitchenette is well stocked and includes a dishwasher, stove top, microwave and a decent size refrigerator.  We enjoyed several meals in the kitchen that has a table for four.  The living room has a sleeper sofa (the only negative-it was all springs and not very comfortable) and sitting chair and flat screen TV.  The layout of the suite was perfect for a family trip-we could go out on our daily adventures and come back to the hotel suite to visit and relax.  The queen size bed was super comfy and the pillows were nice and soft.  The curtains were nice and heavy and kept the light out when sleeping.  The bathroom was spacious enough and extremely clean.  The breakfasts were well presented and well stocked.  The staff was very kind and helpful.  We highly recommend this Hampton Inn and thank them for all their help in making our family trip so happily memorable. We will absolutely stay at this location again!Well, this wasn't the W... but it served its purpose, and like the other reviewer said, it's in a great location.  I'm not sure how much the room cost, but it was clean and the staff was helpful.  The decor was actually decent for a Hampton Inn, but the bed was not comfy and the linens were pretty standard.  Overall, it was good for a short weekend stay.Good location, prices ok, but not one of the best Hampton Inn's I've been to.For the most part, you're paying for the location of this very generic hotel. It's right on Beale Street, close to FedEx Forum and Autozone park. Great location if you want to be a tourist and leave the car in the parking garage for the majority of your stay. Speaking of, be prepared to be gouged on parking. We were surprised to find a $17/day charge for parking on our bill that we assumed was free for hotel guests. Breakfast was average.It's a solid hotel with a great location and a high price. No real complaints, but nothing very special.
review_content_40: Expensive Hampton Inn!!!!  its in a nice location, right off of Beale St if that's what you're into.  The staff is nice, very helpful.  Rooms are clean, maids were friendly.  Parking is kinda pricey.  You can walk to the trolley which will take you around downtown Memphis.  I've been here several times, so I would go back.The location is outstanding if you want to be in the middle of tourist town, which for this trip we definitely did.  This is one expensive Hampton Inn, however.  We splurged on a suite, which was defininely 2 rooms but it wasn't the most spacious suite I've ever been in.  The ceilings were very low and the rooms felt a little outdated even though I think the hotel is relatively new.  Everything you want to see is no more than 4 blocks away - Beale Street, Autozone Park, Rendevous, Gibson Guitar factory...all conveniently located.  The noise from Beale Street stays pretty loud until the early morning hours, so unless you also plan to be up and out late too, you probably shouldn't choose this hotel.Nice little hotel in the heart of downtown Memphis. It's moderately priced and about a block from Beale St -- Memphis' answer to Austin's 6th St.

review_content: Staff very friendly and helpful. Great location to visit Elvis home. Hotel outdated and just average on cleaning. I have been at worse hotels.  Nothing so bad that we would not stay again.Don't stay here.Ranking this based on price, it is a dump.  It is not Elvisey.  There is no Elvis magic that makes it worth the price.The two room suite is not a suite. Two tiny rooms and bathroom access is only through one. So the other room has to walk thru the room with the restroom. Free internet is worthless. I have to type this with my personal wifi hotspot. No customer service at all.  Forget a toothbrush at Hampton Inn?  They will give you one. Here?  They tell you when the gift shop opens tomorrow so you can buy one. There was a giant Beetle awaiting us in the room whith was a bonus. Bottom line, this is a low value budget hotel (think holiday inn) at a premium price. Come here if you want the complete Graceland Ripoff experience. It's a dump for the price. 'Nuff said.I highly agree with the last three reviews of Elizabeth, Steve and TJ - not worth any money - basically a Ramada Inn or some other crappy hotel in the US. Also in an unsafe part of Memphis (but i'm not sure there is a"safe" part) They do have security when you enter which I suppose is helpful. The staff was friendly!oh and the breakfast - cold cereal. TerribleThis Hotel was a complete and utter disappointment.  I classify it as a tourist trap in it's current condition.   I think this hotel represents Elvis horribly and I'll tell you why.   1.)  We stayed in one of the standard rooms and it appeared to us like renovations were never done since the hotel originally opened (in the 1980s?) and before it became the Heartbreak Hotel.  It gave the general appearance of old and unclean.   2.)  In addition the room was set to 79 degrees when we entered it, felt like it was in the 80s and after adjusting the temp it seemed like it took hours for the temp to become bareable.  3.)  They have a security gate check into the parking lot however we heard some noise outside and saw a man get out of his car in the middle of the parking lot and proceed to urinate in public.   Considering that they have security this was not only disgusting but also left us feeling unsafe.4.)  There were numerous dead bugs found in different areas of the room.5.)  The desk clerk was kind enough to write up a report of this for the General Manager along with my contact information.   I never heard back from the General Manager so I actually had to call her a few days later and I left a voicemail.  Instead of her calling me back, it appears that she pawned the report over to her night Manager who I finally heard from.  The night manager apologized and then said she wouldn't offer any type of credit.  It's like she found all of this acceptable.  I consider this extremely poor customer service from Management an insult to Elvis, his family, and myself as a customer.I hope they do Elvis justice with the new hotel they are building although I probably will not go based on my experience with this old hotel.  If I owned the old Hotel they are currently operating I would close it immediately until the hotel is brought up to acceptable Elvis standards.  They are likely generating very bad public relations (as evidenced from other reviews too) which could impact the new Hotel they are building and is likely impacting people considering seeing Graceland itself.  On a bright note, the Graceland tour and their staff gets five stars!I gave this place a third star solely for the staff.  The people who work in this building are exceptional, especially considering the amount of complaints that I am sure they must hear on a daily basis.Overall, this place is, unfortunately, a dump.  It's been a dump for a while, but I think that since the Graceland Hotel plans have launched, the owners of this building no longer take pride in upkeep of the rooms and the morale of the staff.The rooms are old...which isn't always bad, except that these rooms have clearly not been maintained in probably a decade.  With stained carpets and furniture and walls in dire need of fresh paint, it's clear that no one has invested in the location in a very long time.I understand the draw of staying in a place that seems to be the heart of the King himself, but seriously, don't.  You'll do yourself a favor to stay further outside of town (in a much safer area) and just driving in during the day to catch Graceland.  Heed the warnings, Yelpers!I'm glad I did it, because it feels like something you have to do if you're an elvis fan. But it was overall a pretty crappy hotel. Staff was super nice though. Not a great neighborhood.I found this place to be exactly what one would expect.  The suites were laid out a little strange with the bathroom off the private bedroom which made privacy impossible but they can't do much about that.  The staff was fantastic.  Truly understood hospitality.  If you are going to Graceland I would without a doubt stay here.   It was old like many reviews stated but if you started changing a lot of things would it be the Heartbreak Hotel or just a super 8 next to Graceland?Thank God, I didn't listen to any of the yelp reviews on this hotel. The staff was awesome and the bartender Bryan was the most knowledgeable ,kind and sweet person I've met in a long time. It's so great to be around people with the same interest, it's like an Elvis convention 365 days a year. I wish every vacation could go this well.I'm sure the five star rating I gave this place is causing you to question my reviewing credibility ...BUT give me a shot to explain. This little hotel is not 5 star as in fancy schmancy but 5 star in its own right. When you sign up to stay at the Heartbreak Hotel you expect it to be close to Graceland and Elvis themed and that's exactly what it is. The place is staffed with great friendly people and is walking distance to Graceland. It's a really cute hotel with gimmickie Elvis stuff everywhere. What is most important to me is that it's safe and clean, and it was. Like I mentioned the staff at front desk was very welcoming, the souvenir shop had great stuff at decent prices, and everything from the lobby to our room was spotless. This hotel is exactly what you expect it to be and I had a pretty awesome experience here!A dump that hasn't been cleaned since Elvis died.Took my Elvis-obsessed daughter here for a surprise visit to Graceland. She loved the hotel for all of the Elvis themed decor, but I thought it was in need of an upgrade. Our suite had two rooms, which was nice but it wasn't anything special. Aside from the two elvis pictures on the wall, it was basically a Best Western room in disguise. The lobby is the highlight of the hotel, but on the smaller side. The "heartbreak" pool was a nice touch, but again very small and my daughter couldn't go in as it was 5ft deep all around. The Jungle Room lounge is a small bar/eating area with basic food (hot dog, hamburger, etc). The staff was very friendly and the gift shop and lots of nice Elvis memorabilia. The close proximity to Graceland was a plus as it was just a short walk across the parking lot.We have been planning a trip across America for a year and Graceland was going to be our third stop on a 6000 mile road trip. First of all they charge your Credit Card the day you make the reservation, so be prepared to pay long before you arrive.The hotel is need of some cleaning and painting, some of the walls in the hotel and rooms need to be touched up, $300 a night is very pricey. Lisa Marie you need to get involved with this hotel and have the staff take care of the hotel and the guests.There is a shuttle to Beale Street from the hotel for $5 where you can shop and eat, there is a COP on every corner so rest assured you are safe.Now let's get down and dirty, if we hadn't talked to other guests at the hotel and around town I would have thought it was me. There were two African American female employees at the check-in desk, they made a white female employee come out and help us, other guests complained of the same thing. I sent an email to Graceland, Inc. do you think they would respond. The two African American females were rude and wouldn't help us, Yikes!There are no different employees of ethnic groups at Graceland or the Heartbreak Hotel to respond to needs of Hispanics, Asians, etc.Remember me, we had our picture taken before the tour started and when we got back we bought it for $20, and you  threw it at me, then I asked for a bag and I think it bothered you, well guess what, you will never get a dime from us again.The hotel feels run down.  It is dirty and I felt that the the owners are about getting the most money they can for least amount of effort.  The room we got had old beds that sagged when you sat on them.  I could feel the spring push through.  Room  226 had a strange odor; I wanted to open the window but it was sealed shut.  The "free" breakfast was one of the most dismal I have had in years. TERRIBLE.  No fresh anything.   The room wifi was free and the shower was hot (otherwise I would have gave it 1 star).  Not recommend ... get a nearby hotel that will be cheep and make up for what you save with their Elvis package.Terrible customer service, rude employees at the store, run down rooms, I took my aging mother here for the Rock and Roll package. Over $500, totally not worth it. Graceland it's self was awesomeI agree with everyone who talked about the excellent staff. Most true! They gave dining recommendations that were right on target. Also a good complimentary breakfast, including Krispy Kreme donuts! We appreciated the shuttle to Beale St, was great not to drive more after a long day of driving.  We also had a ton of space in our hotel suite -- an extra room that we didn't need but I could see how that would be great for a family. Here's the caveat: if you are used to staying in uniform nice hotels, this is not the place for you. It is quirky and eclectic. And, it's super convenient to Graceland but nothing else. The area around there has a strip mall feel.Basically an Econo Lodge with some posters and a gift shop. Slow wifi, and the house keeping has a meeting every morning to discuss how to be as loud as possible in the early hours. Other than the 24-hour tv station devoted to the King, this place was pretty much a huge disappointment.If you like ants. Get ready to welcome them. You will be sleeping with then. Leaving now and going to the best Western... Will update laterI will give this hotel 3 stars because of the service and accommodations. The hotel itself could use a face lift.  That being said we still had a nice time here. Since we were going on a Graceland tour the next day we figured why not stay at The Heartbreak Hotel?The hotel has a shuttle van that will take you to Sun Records, The Peabody Hotel (where the ducks walk) and on to Beale St. and pick you up at a later time.Beale St. was more than I expected, neon lights all around, people singing the blues everywhere.  We stopped to watch one group, the singer said he's played with BB King and other well known blues singers.They had what they call (Big Ass Beer) for sale in plastic cups labeled "BIG ASS BEER:"  We only had one because we had to get up early the next morning for our Graceland tour,  but it was awesome, and I am so glad we came here.This place is very comfortable, friendly, kitchy, and close to everything Elvis. My husband bought a package deal from them that included about 5 different activities (Stax, Sun, Hard Rock Cafe, Graceland, and the Rock & Soul Museum). We did them all in 2 days. The best part is the hotel offers a shuttle to Beale street for $5 pp each way. A hell of a deal considering you'll have to find your way there and pay for parking if you don't. This was out first trip to Memphis and we also caught a Memphis Grizzlies basketball game, to which the shuttle took us so we were able to drink up and have the shuttle take us back to the hotel. We didn't drive the whole weekend. I bring this up because nothing else, besides Graceland, is nearby. You'll need to either keep driving to Beale Street or take the shuttle. Almost everything is off of Beale street. Graceland is next door and we got up early Saturday morning, walked across to the Rock & Roll cafe and then straight to Graceland. The hotel plays Elvis movies in the lobby nonstop and there are Elvis pictures everywhere. Including the room. Somehow, we got upgraded to a suite with an extra full sized bed (along with the king size we reserved) so we were pretty pleased about that so that my husband could watch tv in one room and I could sleep in the other. This is not a fancy hotel, but it is very clean and comfortable. I thought the staff was super friendly and helpful. My husband described the deluxe breakfast as lots of bread items, some fruit, and coffee. Would I stay here again? Yes, definitely. In fact, we plan to rerun in the spring.The heartbeak hotel is  located in a very unsafe neighborhood but there is a guard to get into the hotel.  When you first walk in don't get the impression that the room looks just like the lobby.  The room isn't colorful at all.  The rooms are very old and small.  We were in the hotel for a 1 night stay and were glad we didn't stay any longer.  We went down stairs for dinner and the food was mediocre.  The salads were fresh and their fried pickles were amazing.  You have to go to the bar to get another drink refill if you need one.  In the dinner room there is a projector playing Elvis clips from all his tours and shows.  For breakfast the food wasn't good no protein just carbs, so you might have to bring protein bars if you just cant have carbs.  The biscuits were dried out and the gravy on top wasn't good either.  The juice for breakfast was watered down and the bar wasn't open to get soda.  Our room looked right out to the heart shaped pool its very cool but very small.  It doesn't fit that many people in the pool.  Graceland was right next door in walking distance.  Would stay here if I went to Graceland again.
review_content_20: Heartbreak hotel on Lonely Road!! Can't get more Elvisy than that!!!Since we were going all the way to Memphis for Graceland, I wanted the full Elvis experience for my mom, so I booked our one night stay here. I did read reviews here on yelp and tripadvisor, so I knew not to expect anything fancy. Elvis themed rooms (regular rooms just have pictures of elvis, you have to rent the higher ends suites for the decked out rooms) and fun lobby decorated with purple and gold furniture. A cafeteria called the Jungle Room and heartshaped pool outside. A free shuttle service from and to the airport, a short walk to Graceland made everything super convenient. They even have a pink Limo pick u up for dinner at the nearby bbq joint Marlowes! Just pick up the pink fuzzy phone in the lobbyyelp.com/biz_photos/elvi... and a friendly driver who will even take ur picture for u, will come pick u up within 15minutes! I got a king bed suite ($150) that comes with pretty good sized room that has another room separated by a wall and small kitchenette area in between. The other room has its own tv and sleeper sofa. Watch Elvis 24/7! The sleeper sofa was EXTREMELY Uncomfortable. The springs were poking into my back so I had to grab some extra pillows and sleep on those. Besides the very uncomfortable sleeper sofa and things looking a bit worn, and thin walls, the convenience (since we had no car), friendly staff, and included breakfast made the one night here a decent stay. Amenities included coffeemaker, frig, microwave, hair dryer, bathtub/shower, toiletries...Complimentary breakfast was basic but did the job. Biscuits and gravy, yogurt, fruit, hard boiled eggs, mini muffins, bagels, cereal, toast, coffee, tea, juice, milk, jams, peanut butter. They stored our luggage for us at no charge while we toured Graceland. Cool place for after a flight and rest before a morning at Graceland, but if u plan on staying longer and want a more comfortable stay, you may want to check out some other places. But we enjoyed our stay for the most part!Their car service will also take u to Beale Street for free.*you can get a Triple A discount, but doesn't apply if you buy the Graceland package. Reservations staff was very helpful and courteous when I needed to make changes.We got a suite room letting my in-laws have the bedroom we crashed on the pull out. Thus our name for this place is "The BackBreak Hotel" LOL!Hubby and I did not sleep that night and giggled like teen girls every time we heard a noise :) The hotel is old and on the shabby side for the high suite price we paid, but hey it was fun being soooo close to Graceland.The common area is awesome. It's the breakfast bar area, so it the morning very early I got the heck out of the room and located some coffee :) They have a huge projector playing live performances nonstop.There is where I listened to a full blown conversation between two 70 year old ladies about how every morning they go early to the gates to pray. Their special new friend bond was amazing and they were full of tears for The King.I loved it!The room was outstanding. Very big, and comfortable. Overall, it was clean and I loved the decor. I was a little disappointed that the hotel keys did have the Heartbreak Hotel logo. It would've have been a nice touch.We got the love me tender package and it was a great bargain. The hotel room was clean and smoke free. The staff was very friendly and the free breakfast was ok. I love the atmosphere and the gift shop was small but decent with items you can not get anywhere else. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is the fact that you can hear the toilets flush in the other guest room. Overall the experience was great and the people and atmosphere was just what we were looking for.We showed up not sure what to expect. Check in was straight forward, great lobby and staff helpful. But then you walk toward the rooms and it just looks old and in need of some TLC. We then realized that an attempt was made to spruce at least our suite up when we walked in to the smell of paint with the bonus of a paint can and blue painters tape in their. The only thing the night staff could do after 30+ minutes was give me and my family 2 rooms with king sized beds (5 of us) so one person is sleeping on the couch as 3 of us are in one room and 2 in the other. The front desk people were kind enough and very apologetic when telling us that one room was comped. The other room would be discounted by $25 - will be revisited with management in the morning.I had high hopes when coming to this hotel, I thought it was going to be much more "elvis-ee". The lobby looks fantastic, but we just stayed in a normal room, not a suite and it was run down. The halls are all busted up as are the walls in the rooms. The rooms were clean (aside from the blue body pillow that had a substance on it that looked like...well someone had fun with the pillow if you know what I mean) and the hotel was clean, but everything was just old and run down. The walls are also paper thin, so you can hear toilets flushing from the rooms upstairs. The staff were very friendly and polite. The dessert in the "jungle room" was good and there is always coffee available for free. The breakfast was average.I think they should tear this place down and rebuild something nicer, they have the space and the $$. A recreation of graceland in a hotel. I would probably not stay here again.(2.5 stars, rounded up because I'm feeling generous)There's no denying that this was a really cute idea. When my girlfriend informed me that we'd be staying at the Heartbreak Hotel during the Graceland portion of our trip, I had to laugh. The hotel isn't the cheapest, but we were happy with the fact that it was walking distance to Elvis' house, so it was all good.The lobby is awesome. The seats are all tacky 70's throwbacks, complete with an old style TV box housing a small LCD TV playing Elvis films 24/7. I feel bad for the staff. If I had to watch those cheesy films for the duration of my shift, I'd probably lose my mind.The room itself is pretty average. The bed is comfy enough, and our room had a great view of the pool. Another thing with the hotel that reeled my girl in: The TV featured 2 Elvis stations, one which just plays his music with a photo slideshow, and the other plays random Elvis films 24/7.There were a couple of flaws. When calling for a shuttle to Beale street, prepare to wait a long time. We were told a few minutes, and sat waiting for about a half hour. Also, we had a big problem with the A/C in our room. It worked fine, but at random moments, it would suddenly start making a horrific banging sound, as if a little person was trapped inside and went crazy with a baseball bat. When we told the front desk, they got the message wrong, and told the maintenance man that the A/C wasn't working. Luckily we happened to be in the lobby when the man reported back that the A/C was working fine, and I swooped in to inform him of the actual problem. He quickly returned to the room, waited for it to happen again, and fixed it for us. Really nice guy.Cute concept, but feels average in many ways. You really can't pick a better spot for a hotel in Graceland though.This is a must for all elvis fans! They offer package deals that include tickets to all the must see tourist attractions in Memphis! What a fun experience!I couldn't pass up the novelty of staying at the Heartbreak Hotel, but you should only stay here for its location. It is right across the street from Graceland and, technically, part of its property.I was put in the worst room, Room 214, which another Yelp reviewer mentioned. I read this while in the room and the front desk courteously changed me to the ground floor. She didn't even mention the worst part about the room -- while it does indeed look out into the Jungle Room lounge of the hotel (a far cry from the real deal at Graceland), they blast the Elvis Sirius station all day (and maybe all night, I didn't hang around that long), which funnels its way into your room and slowly drives you mad.In my new room, several lights didn't work -- including the one above the sink. The room was tacky, as expected, with two large pictures of Elvis. But you can't expect anything less here.Pros:- Free, secure parking (meaning that you have to stop every time before you enter)- You can walk to Graceland- Staff is friendly enough- Free breakfast (highlight was the sausage gravy)- It's a lot like the song -- they actually have a Lonely Street sign at the foot of the driveway entrance and the staff wears blackCons:- Old, rundown hotel rooms- No amenities beyond free breakfast- Hotel wireless was inoperativeIf you're an Elvis fan, this is a fun place to stay -- and, of course, you are going to Graceland. I hear the themed suites, while insanely priced, are quite a hoot. I'm not sorry I stayed here, but there was no need to be that close to Graceland.If you are going to Graceland this is an easy and convenient location. However the hotel is in desperate need of some sprucing up and updating. It is in a horrible part of town so if you want to do anything besides the Elvis thing I would stay somewhere else.It's a over priced motel 6 across the street from Graceland . Secure parking lot. Offers a shuttle to Beale street that will cost $5 per trip, $10 round trip. Which seems expensive until you travel "through" Memphis, which is when you'll be glad your car is safe in that secure parking lot I told you about.So I could have stayed in any hotel in Memphis but the allure of staying in the Heartbreak Hotel was too much. It is by no means a fancy hotel. It is actually pretty plain unless you put out the big bucks for the special suites. The hotel is definitely on the cheesy side but you are also right on the grounds of Graceland which is kind of cool if you are an Elvis fan.The pool was also in the shape of a heart with what looked like a big crack at the bottom. So yeah... cheesy, but whatever.It's exactly what any sensible person would think it would be. It's tacky. It's gaudy. It's elvisy. You're surrounded by jean shorts, fanny packs, and NASCAR hats/tats. The wifi is almost non existent, probably due to a lack of computer owners staying there.At the same time:It's somewhat clean. It's safe. it's elvisalicious.All in all it's better than most of Memphis. Embrace the cheesieness and do the whole Elvis experience. Just don't go to Dodge's Chicken gas station. It's horrifying.Pure Elvis overdose. If you are not an Elvis fan you will be brainwashed into being one. Pictures, movies, music, everywhere. I guess that is why they call it the Elvis Presley heartbreak hotel.Problem is that it is rundown. They replaced a faucet here and patched a hole there but the infrastructure is beyond repair. The heart shaped pool is very small so forget about lap swimming.The rooms are spacious but need major renovation Bartender had a bad days and grumpy. Drinks expensive. Can't figure what continent the continental breakfast is from but it leaves a lot to be desired. Someone spilled coffee and when the attendant was told about it her response was that it is a slip free floor so there was no danger of someone slipping. Well what about the fact that people are walking through it. DaaaaGood part is that you are in walking distance of Graceland. You save big bucks by not having to pay their parking. Also you can walk back to the hotel when you need a rest. All in all the hotel is a one timer for the extreme Elvis fan. If you aren't an Elvis fan you are in the wrong hotel.My wife and I stayed here at the end of April 2103, it was clean and tidy considering its age. It's only about $17 cab fare to Beale st.Despite the convenience to Graceland, they could do better. The room was okay but housekeeping didn't replenish the supplies properly. No room service and the included hotel "continental breakfast" was the worst I ever experienced. As one person said - "all sugar and starch". Even with that, less offered on the second morning then the first. Nothing replenished unless you went to the lobby and begged. All bread was white bread, nothing healthy. I know it's part of the room price but I, along with others I spoke to, would have preferred to get a $2.00 discount (what the breakfast was worth) and pay separately for a real breakfast.Only thing good about this hotel is location near graceland. we booked 1956 Elvis package. Hotel seemed okay from outside but rest turned out to be a big hype. All those reviewes we read, nearly proved to be wrong. I rather stay at The westin or Peabody in memphis. Except being near Graceland and related area, there is no food around in area. Once you have done Graceland tour, you should probably go to other hotel if you want to enjoy memphis. Pool was good in heartbreak. Airconditioning is extremely poor. Elevators probably will break soon. Staff can not point you to any good direction, but guard in parking can. I thought that was hilarious. overall, I rather stay even at comfort inn and probably be just as happy. so we decided to go to The westin on Beale street. Not only we had excellent memphis experience, at least Sun studio tour, Gibson tour and blues museum tours were just nearby. Never again, Heartbreak hotel....We visited Memphis in 2005 for our honeymoon and stayed here for the ultimate Elvis experience. It was an experience, but not a good one. The hotel is nothing special. It is close to Graceland, but the part of town is not great and the hotel itself is a let down. The common areas are fun and full of tacky the '70's vibe and maybe the special suites are too, but the cost is too high for most people. The regular rooms are like an old chain hotel that has not be updated in years with a couple Elvis pictures on the wall. They are not worth being the pricey category. I would go to many other hotels in Memphis before ever staying here again.We had the regular rooms and they are worse than best western. Trust me. The only things that portrays Elvis are the two photos on the wall in the room. It's old, the air condition is loud and noisy and it seriously needs some maintenance work done. The lobby is a misconception of the rooms.The only reason I gave two stars is for the fact that I am a huge Elvis fan and I love the fact that this place is an Elvis lovers dream.However, my experience here was pretty bad. The front desk did not have my reservation on file, even though I was charged for one night at the time that I booked, and I pulled up the confirmation email on my phone. Rather than just making me a reservation (there were rooms available), the person at the front desk started to fight with me that I made my reservation for the wrong day. Finally, after waiting 30 minutes, a manager came up and took care of making a reservation for me.The rooms are very run down. The free breakfast is ok - I guess you cannot complain when it is free. It is right across the street from Graceland which is nice, and there are buses to Sun Studio and downtown. It was nice to stay here once for the experience, but next time I will stay downtown.
review_content_40: Not impressed. The room was okay (a regular room, not a themed one). It was clean but the wifi didn't work unless you are in the lobby. Worst of all is that I didn't come across one staff member that was helpful, never mind being polite or heaven forbid friendly.The complimentary breakfast has cereal and toast, bagels and such - acceptable for being included with the roomI didn't even bother going to Graceland I no longer saw the point as the staff was rude and their souvenir's etc were ridiculously over priced. I will not be going their again, I should of stayed at another hotel. Lesson learned...(sigh)My husband and I stayed here for one night on our 4-day trip to Memphis this past week.  The room was expensive given the quality of the accommodations but clearly you are paying for the location, kitsch, and the right to say you've stayed at the Heartbreak Hotel.  Room:  The room itself was clean and comfortable, though the bed was a little hard and the fan in the bathroom (which turned on with the lights) was deafening.Staff:  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  They are not allowed to show you the themed rooms unless you book one (to the tune of $300-$500) but they keep a binder full of photos at the front desk to satisfy one's curiosity.  It's definitely worth a look.  Also, if you stay in a themed room please be sure to tip your cleaning person; someone has to clean all those mirrors and polish all that gold-coated awesomeness every day!Pool:  The heart-shaped pool is a must-see.  Unfortunately I couldn't find an overhead view of the pool (our room was on the opposite side of the building) but I still got some fun pictures from the patio.  If you like pictures that are not full of other people sneak over to the pool in the morning just before its closed for cleaning (~9am) while everyone else is eating breakfast. Breakfast:  Get there early!  We were at the buffet at 9am and a lot of items were gone and were not replenished.  It's your standard cereal, juice, coffee, and bagel breakfast.  Also, it's a zoo; even on a weekday the line was long and people were sort of pushy.  I know it was "free" food but I would have been happier and more relaxed grabbing a bagel and coffee down the road for a few bucks.  (If the Elvis footage shown at night in the dining area were shown at breakfast I may feel differently.)Gift Shop:  Pretty decent for the area.  I found some postcards here (specifically Santa Elvis) and some TCB bottle opener magnets here that I didn't see at any other gift shop.Location:  You can easily walk to Graceland from here.  If you want a picture at the gates be sure to walk over in the evening after the tours have stopped (the gates seemed to be open all day when tours were going on); there will be fewer people and you can photograph the gates in full without getting run over by a shuttle bus. :)Most of the rooms are pretty much nondescript. It is only the themed rooms that go full-on into Elvis kitsch. Those regular rooms and suites and pretty reasonably priced, tidy and just fine. Do NOT accept room 214, however. Not only is it designed for handicapped visitors, which means rather ugly linoleum in the entrance rather than carpet (not sure how that's supposed to help the disabled), the room's sole window looks out on the INTERIOR of the hotel, directly into the "Jungle Room" (which is just a glorified cafeteria/bar). We initially had this horrible room, but when we asked to be moved, the staff was courteous and gracious about it. The complimentary breakfast deserves no compliment. The coffee, although dark in color, doesn't even taste like coffee (and no, it's not chicory, either). I mean, if you want a bagel or cereal, it's okay, but if you're looking for something more substantial, head out. We decided that the "sh*t on a shingle" (creamed chip beef on a biscuit) may actually have been sh*t. But all in all, this is a fine place to stay. And if you're an Elvis fan (which I'm not, particularly), the themed rooms are cool. We attended a party in the Hollywood Suite, and it really was quite fun! Tacky and wacky, but thoroughly fun.I want to lower my rating.  The breakfast bar was typical but the tables were dirty and the late to show attendant did nothing to improve the situation.I haven't been this disappointed since Elvis died.  This heartbreak hotel is aptly named.  When my friends and I planned our trip to Graceland we decided to spend our money on immersing ourselves in an atmosphere of Elvis rather than spend money on individual activities.  We regret that choice.  The hotel delivered what they promised but with no enthusiasm.  The lobby is small and has a flat screen TV that doesn't match the decor.  The desk clerk is dressed in black.  But not the way you would expect.  There are no bell hops.  There is a space approximately 10 by 20 feet called the jungle room.  B o r I n g.   A continuous DVD of Elvis past concerts plays on a screen in a cafeteria area.  Unimpressive.  The heart shaped swimming pool which was closed isn't big enough for a dozen people.  Graceland is in walking distance to this and about thirty other hotels.  Pick one of them and save the money.  The hotel was clean.  There was a TV free WI fi fridge and coffee maker.  If you don't care of the theme this was a decent place.  If you think it will be part of your experience you will be disappointed.This place cracks me up and I don't even know how many times I've stayed here while in Memphis. I've been to Graceland A LOT. Life is cruel in that each time I've been here it's been too chilly out to swim in the heart shaped pool. Graceland is right across the street and they have really awesome packages at this hotel that include room, tours and meals at restaurants downtown. I LOVE the 24/7 Elvis channel you get in all the rooms. Who doesn't want to watch King Creole as they drift off to sleep? Rooms are clean and fun and some rooms are Elvis themed to the extreme - those room are ridiculously priced though. I have a feeling that I will be here again.Ok...this place is HILARIOUS!  It's right across the street from Graceland for all you people who are wanting to check out Elvis's jungle room at the house. lolThe rooms are all different and Elvis themed, complete with memorabilia of the era. There are regular guestrooms and then there are the themed rooms...you can stay in a mini replica of Granceland lol.  Also an art deco themed room and a Burning Love room...a hunka hunka lol. Rooms from $99 and themed rooms from $520...ouch!The staff can hook you up with tix to visit the King's abode as well as tix to tour his plane, the Lisa-Marie.  Good times.Our hearts were broken and so were our wallets when we stayed here on 03/07/12. We had made reservations and requested two beds and a pull out sofa or rollaway. When we arrived we were given a room with two beds but no rollaway or pull out sofa. We returned to the front desk, explained the problem and the manager assigned us to another room. It had one bed and a pull out. We again went to the front desk and the personable attendant on on duty nicely told us that the hotel had no such rooms and that the reservation office will say anything to book the reservation. We kept the first room with the two beds and sofa that did NOT pulll out. We had no car and it was late. We shared our room with bugs crawling on the wall, soap scum under the soap dish in the shower and mold, mold and more mold. The sheets were paper thin, the rug was peeling from the wall border and the room looked liked it hadn't been spruced up since the hotel was built. We took a chance and ate in the bar. The food was edible and the person on duty informed us that we were in an unsafe neighborhood and not to venture outside until after the sun rose the next morning. We checked out as quickly as we could, toured Graceland and departed for the airport. We were disappointed with the whole experience and felt ripped off. I'm sure that if Elvis were still alive he would not allow his fans to be ripped off by such a dump!!!

review_content: So far from everything we wanted to do in Memphis.  No "pantry"  Otherwise we enjoyed ourselves.It's quite average, although some of the rooms are upgraded and renovated.  However, as a frequent business traveler, the LOW SPEED WIFI is just sad.  I think my  1200 baud modem might have been faster than this WIFI set up.  I'd say that they need to clean the place a bit more and improve the infrastructure some more and I'd give it 4 stars.  Typical Hilton property, minus the items mentioned above.I had a pleasant stay at this location as a group of 30. We were greeted with a smile and the check-in went quickly. Unfortunately, several of our rooms still weren't clean at 4:30 but that was only 2 of 16. The rooms and lobby were in good shape and must have been renovated in the last year or two. Reasonably clean and well kept, the help staff did a good job cleaning each morning. The workout room was decent as well. Free-weights up to 45/50 lbs and several treadmills. In the surrounding (walking distance) there are numerous eating choices, grocery stores, and a movie theater immediately behind the hotel.I travel for a living, and I can't recommend a better place to stay in Memphis than this Doubletree Hotel.The hotel is recently remodeled.  The staff is extremely nice and helpful, from the front desk to the on-site restaurant to the service people, everyone is professional and a pleasure to do business with.I wish the same hotel and people were coming with me to my next work location!Newly renovated with super nice accommodating staff. Hotel is reasonably priced, in a nice neighborhood with a bunch of dining option even within walking distance. everything in the room was new and well-kept. The business center and concierge lounge was also updated and everything was functioning.New day at the Doubletree - give them a try!I travel for work, this double tree is easily one of my favorites list. The staff is always pleasant, there are a handful of restaurants in the area, grocery stores within walking distance, nail salons also near by- check out Diva's around the corner of you're interested. The rooms are nicely remodeled, always clean & every room I've ever stayed in has had a fridge.This is the filthiest Hilton property I have ever seen. I am shocked that anyone would spend more than one night here. I would never return. I will recommend others seek alternate accommodations. As a Hilton Honors Gold member, I have written Hilton (as well as my company, to never send me here again).Dirty bedding, faulty cooling/heating units, broken bathroom sink, smelled of straight mold.Bad bad bad.And the staff was cordial ...when addressed first :/Pretty entrance that went down hill from there.  The bathroom was on an angle and you couldn't even go to the bathroom sitting straight.  It was filthy and nasty.  My first room had pubic hair all over the toilet so I changed rooms and my second room wasn't vacuumed.  The third room was pretty close to the second room - errant hair and sticky surfaces.  Kinda grossed out.Nice staff, but the location is FAR from downtown, the airport and any other attractions I was interested in. Oh and no free breakfast. If you don't mind driving 10 miles to anywhere go for it. I would consider this hotel again if the price is right but Zi may bite the bullet and stay downtown.I will say this.....I received a email from the manager AFTER I booked my room to notify me of upcoming construction in the hotel....ya know jack hammering! Fair warning!My closet door wouldnt close either but no huge biggie....not enough to make a maintenance call over.Not the nicest hotel, but passable. The primary issue with this hotel is that it's run down. The walls are all dinged up and could use an extra coat of paint. The carpet is messed up in places. Also the bathroom tile just looked raggedy and could stand to be redone. Thankfully, the bed did not appear to suffer the same issues as the rest of the room. It was relatively comfortable and seemed clean. The rooms also have a fairly nice flat screen TV.  The staff here is also incredibly nice and helpful.  They give you cookies when you check in! And the restaurant in the lobby is decent.  So overall, if you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel to stay in for a night or two, this isn't a bad option. But certainly don't go our of your way to come here.If I could give them 0 stars I would. Our keys would not open our door we were sent to a concierge room at 1:30am to wait until maintenance arrived at 6 am. Awful first experience at a Double TreeNice rooms, great business center, no free breakfast, no jacuzzi but they do have a pool and fitness center.  Slow service but overall I had a nice stay.Nothing on Internet about construction happening. As a Diamond member no thank you from front desk staff, no water or cookie. Place is old and it shows, had to keep AC on 63 just to stay cool. TV went in and out all the time during my stay. Housekeeping staff were very friendly and professional, front desk staff could take lessons from them. Had booked another night on my return from a business trip but cancelled and won't stay here again.Doubletree hotels are supposed to be really nice, but the rooms at this location are dingy and could use an upgrade. I do like how a fridge is provided, but it would also be nice to provide a microwave as well. There is no Hilton Honors lounge for Hilton diamond members here.The first time I stayed, the mirrored door for the closet had been shattered a little in the bottom corner. I explained to the hotel that I didn't cause the damage (so they didn't charge me), but it would've been nice if they had cleaned up the bits of broken glass. The second time I stayed, the freezer section of the fridge was dirty with remnants of who knows what had leaked from a previous guest. Both times I have stayed, the room is an interesting setup. You walk in, the bathroom and small counter (with fridge underneath) are to your left, you go around the corner, and then you'll see the desk/bed. The rooms are spacious, which is nice. The front desk staff have always been courteous. There's free parking. Due to status, I am not sure if everyone gets free wifi, but I didn't have trouble connecting (like I did at the Austin location). There are no outlets near the bed though.I do like the Hilton honors program because you can double dip. You can earn miles and hotel points simultaneously, unlike Marriott Rewards. I rated this hotel two stars (experienced better) for cleanliness. Attention to further detail would be much appreciated!We stayed here while attending a MU game in Oxford at Ole Miss. The price was reasonable considering we could not get a hotel room in Oxford; however, price alone could not make up for what seemed to be a 2 star hotel. Our room was noisy, we never could figure out what one of the noises was, but the other one was definitely the trash trucks. We did not have shampoo in our room and I waited 20 minutes after I was ready for my shower for them to bring some to our room.  I thought the pillows could have been better quality. We asked for water several times and as Hilton Honors member, that should have been given to us without question. We did not receive a receipt upon checkout and had to ask for one to be emailed to us. All in all, we will not be returning.Worst Hilton experience ever - NASTY!I was forced to stay here by Delta due to cancellation...Their shuttle quit at 10 PM - of course...Little did I know it would be a $30 cab ride from airport which then doubles when you go back.They do not staff for the travel disrupted travelers - so check in was OVER ONE HOUR in line - not the one lady on staffs fault as whe was nice.MY ROOM REEKED of stale smoke though it was non-smoking.  The picture by the bed had cracked glass...the light swith on the lamp was broken and the bathroom had mold on the grout.GROSS!  ROTTEN!  NASTY!  AVOID AT ALL COSTS...and they advertise they are remodeling and I think it is a ploy because no sign of it in room 224 and viciintyThere are better hotels to stay in the same area. I normally stay at another Hilton-brand down the street but when they were booked full I came here. It's outdated. The carpet is seriously stained. There is rust on the bathroom faucet. Overall the room is a solid 2.5 out of 5.... This needs a serious upgrade. I won't be coming here again and will actually be checking out a day early to move to another hotel. Pros: Fox and Hound is next door. Free parking. Ultimately - go someplace else until it's updated.And now for something completely different, somebody not totally hating on this hotel. I stayed on the 4th floor, as I don't have enough HHonors points to get bumped up to the HHonors floors but still had a fairly nice room.Yes, the hotel has been there for probably 20 to 30 years, but the air conditioning worked, the flat screen TV worked, the WiFi worked, lighting was good, the shower was hot, the furniture was fairly new, the bed was comfortable, and of course you got a cookie at check-in. Some things in my room looked a little worn (the fridge, for example) but most of the room looked recently refurbished. It was a comfortable stay, it's close to the airport, the rate was reasonable, and there's a ton of places to eat nearby.I'll call that a road-trip win.I've stayed in so many Hilton properties on business that I've lost track.  This has got to be the worst Double Tree in the country.  The rooms are so incredibly outdated that I had to laugh when I walked in the door.  We're talking old, dirty bathrooms, popcorn cielings, pealing wall paper, nasty curtains and valences, and the slowest airport shuttle ever.  Couple that with very uneven guest service, and you've got a lousy Hilton property.My favorite low point for this hotel was the manager's Hilton Honors reception that all Double Trees and Embassy Suites have during evening check-in hours.  Completely out of every single piece of complimentary food, a nasty mess on tables, and cash bar.  The only Double Tree I've ever been in that doesn't have complimentary house wine and beer.  Not to mention it's in an odd, converted room on the 8th floor.If it weren't for a comfortable bed and a decent hot breakfast, this would be one-star.Let me start by saying it has been 4 days since staying at this Hotel and I still have a rash under my arms and other unmentionable places.When I arrived I was told they were sold out, even though I booked a room 2 weeks ago. So, they gave me the mini suite...which you would think is a good thing??WRONG!The room was gross. Towels were gross. Bed and couch were gross. I felt icky and should have listened to my inner voice who kept telling me to get another room. Walls were yellow....food behind the couch (I had to move couch to plug in my cell phone) and no outlets near bed to charge phone. I have stayed at this hotel before (Hilton Honors Member) as I travel to Memphis quite a bit...and I have never had such a poor exp!Not 2 days later I noticed that I have a rash under my arms and in other places....Now, I have not been in any other hotels and I have not put myself in any other situations where I would contract a rash so I have to assume it is from this hotel room and towels. Again, after looking at towels I should have listened to my inner voice but I didn't and now I am paying the price.I will continue to use the Hilton Brand as I am a long time Hilton Honors Member but I will NEVER use this DoubleTree again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review_content_20: Decent hotel with spacious rooms and flat screen tv.  Pros:  Friendly staff!! Perfect example of true southern hospitality.  Love it.  At check in, the hotel staff gave me two breakfast vouchers for free.  Say what?! ;-)Two warm chocolate chip cookies are handed to you as you are checked in.  Mmmmmmmm...HHONORS Floors are on 6-8.  Clean rooms.  Clean bathroomsCONS:  water pressure is non existent. Boo. There is a train track near by.  I am a light sleeper and I was jerked awake when the horn sounded.  0_oNo creamer for coffee?? -__- black sugary coffee will have to do. Wolfgang coffee for the room is a PRO though. Decent place to stay.  I am on my way to Texas from NC and have been in the car for way too long.  I think I'd sleep anywhere...JUst wished for a hotter shower.  Fail.Great room and very attentive staff. Sam in the Concierge Lounge was amazing. The Salmon BLT was a great sandwich for the night we didnt go out.Save your time and money and don't stay here unless and emergency. Not worth the $110 we paid. Customer service at front desk was horrible coming and going. Worn down, beds were not comfortable. Totally disappointed.  Management needs to come in here and do an undercover boss for real!I really can't say anything negative.This is a pretty nice hotel and the staff is friendly enough.The room was clean and smelled fresh.The bathroom is another story. There were cracked tiles, the bathtub wall felt like it was going to fall off.IT is close to a lot of stuff and some really good food places.Undergoing major renovations. This hotel should not be open right now. Obnoxious construction noise. Room was never cleaned . Would never stay here again as...Let me start by stating that I'm a loyal Hilton Honors member and almost always choose the Hilton brand to stay at when I travel. I went to Memphis this past weekend for a wedding and had the WORST experience at this Doubletree. And I wasn't alone as many of the other wedding guests said the same thing. Let's start with the little good that there was: - The woman who checked us in was friendly and nice- We were able to check in early- The gentleman that drove the shuttle back to the airport was extremely friendlyNow the bad (we'll get to the ugly...): - Our TV didn't work. It would turn on and the picture would randomly just fade away and turn off- The construction is obnoxious- The service was inconsistent. Half the staff was nice (see above) and half were clueless and unhelpful- Hilton Honors floors are 6,7,8 and yet we were on 2?- The wifi was weak.The ugly: - Our bathroom, as well as another couple we were traveling with, was DISGUSTING. We asked them to clean it again and it was still gross. - Our friends tried to take the shuttle (after we scheduled it to pick them up) and it was 40 minutes late and then REFUSED to pick them up. So they had to cab it back to the hotel. The woman at the desk was woefully unhelpful in rectifying the situation. I would never stay here again and would recommend others find another hotel to stay at as well.This is a nice hotel and I love the cookies.  The room was clean and the staff was friendly.  I presented in the hotel as well and the accommodations were great.Clean, spacious rooms, comfortable beds and a decent small gym.  Service is friendly, free parking, and by far above the average ~ especially for a hotel that is used a lot by corporate management.  The cookies are a nice touch ~ always warm.  I did NOT try the attached resturaunt, it seemed a bit high priced and there were places close by (Corky's) that were better options.  All in all, a good, safe, quiet, comfortable place to call home for a few days.For me, it was just okay.  I read several of the Yelp reviews, but my decision to stay here was based on the following:a) priceb) no fee for parkingc) relatively close to airportd) i'd get Hilton Honors points and another stay towards HH statuse) yes, the cookie :)I didn't have a chance to take a look at the gym, but from the condition of my room and the other interiors of the hotel I wouldn't have imagined it to be pristeen. (But maybe I shouldn't prejudge...) But for 24 Hour Fitness members, there is a club not too far from this hotel. Cookie was good... like always. Warm and gooey this time... oooooh. Bed was comfortable, but I'm not still dreaming of it like other Yelpers have stated. Internet was SLOOOOWW! We're talking between 1mbps and 5mbps. Ouch! Very hard to catch up on my re-runs on Hulu. ha!Staff was friendly. Room was clean. Neighborhood was fine. Yes, per Pam A.'s review - -the AC was extremely loud in my room.A comfortable bed, a usable gym, and included Wi-Fi... What more could you ask for? Oh right, warm and gooey chocolate chip cookies upon check-in!Our room had a king-size bed, a work desk, a mini fridge, and a flat screen TV.  The people who work at the hotel were extremely nice and helpful with all requests.  There is a restaurant on site, but there are many places to eat within a few minutes drive (Corky's!).While the hotel is on the old side, there are enough amenities and upgrades to make the age a non-factor.  So, overall, this a great place to sleep, relax, work, and have a warm cookie!We stay at Memphis Doubletree on Sanderlin Ave almost exclusively. Because, 1. Most comfortable bed I have ever sleep on. 2. Very old hotel with nice facilities and free highspeed wireless internet  3. Great location for shopping and dinning. 4. Easy access to airport. The reason I didn't give it 5 star is because it is an old hotel need to be upgrade which they are doing right now. The carpet is very old and it smell funny at some room we stayed. The aircondition unit is loud and need to be replaced. They are in process upgrading their rooms these days. It will be a great hotel to stay after that, of course, they may raise price as well. Right now, weekend rate around 98, and regular goes to 120. If you stay at this hotel, check out restaurants at neighbor area. Such as: Pei Wei for lunch; Interim for after work drink; Dinner at Napa Cafe for wine drinkers; Belmont Grill the highly rated burger restaurant; Half Shell for Cajun cuisine; Looking for 5 stars dinning experience, Folk's Folly Prime Steak house and Erling Jensen Restaurant is nearby. And the famous Corky's BBQ is 3 minutes away by car. If you visit Memphis and your burget fit in this range, consider this hotel to rest your feet. :)The bar service was less than professional. I met a friend there for a couple of drinks. After last call, the employees complained about how ready they were to get out of there and go home. If your employees can't wait to leave, why would I want to be there? I would say a bar rescue is in order.I'm pretty impressed and pleasantly surprised, not going to lie. I'm on a tour for Peeps and we are going to 9 different cities, and we have to stay on a budget, so to make up for going way over in certain cities, I decided to really go cheap in Memphis. The price was fantastic, and so of course I was nervous it was going to suck. Nope! Not at all!Free cookie and amenity bag for HHonors members on check in, and they also have a free reception with hor d'vours [I have no idea how to spell that and neither does my spell check] and a cash bar [but free soda!!] The room is big, as to be expected for anywhere not New York or Boston, the beds are way more comfortable than the Hilton Garden Inns I've been staying at, cool looking amenities, a nice pool I can't use since I'll be working for 17 hours a day, and a fridge! No microwave, though, bummer, but the location is awesome. TONS of shops nearby including Krogers and Whole Foods. Free parking and free wifi doesn't hurt either.Mostly, I'm happy because I've been warned many many times about how...."urban" Memphis can be and this area so far seems really safe and nice.I was in Memphis for a conference and we stayed at the Doubletree as the other conference hotels were booked.The room was only slightly under my standards. The air conditioning was really loud, and we were unimpressed with some of the construction. BUT! There was free wireless internet and free parking, and a business center with free printing. I was most disappointed in the gym. On the confirmation e-mail there was information to "Experience our fitness facilities by Precor". I checked out the website and the pictures looked awesome. I went to my first workout and entered what looked like to be an old hotel room. Once you're on the treadmill, your head is about 6-12 inches away from the lay-in tile ceiling. There were only 2 (maybe 3?) treadmills, an elliptical, and two bikes. At one point we had 5 people in the gym and it was hot, sweaty, crowded... you get the picture. So if a gym is important to you, this is not your location.Fairly good hotel for your stay in Memphis!I stayed here for 5 nights.  I slept great, got 5 free breakfast.  Quiet, free parking, close to many food joints.I checked in 11/27/11 at about 2:00pm, by 2:30 I heard the fire alarm go off in my room and immediately smelled fumes strongly. I called to the front desk to report while the alarm was going off, the clerk said she would send someone up immediately, no one ever arrived, I called back downstairs and asked to speak to a manager, after a long wait the "restaurant manager" gets on the phone. I hung up on him and checked out, telling them why on the way out.  They were not in the least concerned about my fumes or smoke alarm nor were they sending anyone up.  This is a high rise hotel, I mean really......Needs refurbishment.  Cracked tiles, panels  loose in elevators, sloped beds, dirty drapes, ill fitting room doors and marginal desk staff.  04:15 train near by, so beware.  No outlets near where needed for standard business traveler devices, ie desktop, bedside, etc.  basically an older property showing age.  Though I am a loyal HIlton Honors gold member, I'd choose a different brand rather than stay here again.I love the location of this property.  There's a Whole Foods right down the street (which I often visit when traveling) and a restaurant in the same parking lot which was open until 3AM & came in handy since I arrived after midnight. Other pluses are close to the airport & free Wi-Fi & parking.  The rooms are okay, a bit dated, but clean.  The only big negative, was that I woke up to the housekeepers yelling down the hall to each other, which then happened several more times throughout the morning.  Since I got very little sleep, this was disappointing.VERY DISAPPOINTED!! I have stayed here before and at that time I would have given 4 stars. I am barely giving one star. The first day I had to show the maid that there the person before us in the room left smeared candy on the desk. The next day the maid never came in the room so I had to go downstairs for towles after coming upstairs ready to shower after my work meeting  which was fine but of course inconvenient. OK so the next day the maid came and made the beds that is ALL , never cleaned the bathtub, dirty glasses stayed on the counter, and most of all gave us wet towels to use for a shower. I will not stay here again.It was fine. It's odd though, some parts of the room were up-to-date and modern (TV and bed) but then other parts seem to be too outdated (AC unit, phone didn't work, water pressure in the shower was weak). All that being said, I slept fine and the staff was really friendly, so I'd probably stay there again.
review_content_40: Hotel have nice amenities and is pretty. But the cleaning room services is horrible. I booked two rooms for my family and my parents. Both were not clean. My one had lots hair in the bathroom floor. I found two straws plastic wraps, one in the bathroom, another in close to the bed. This is distisgusting!!! There was a shirt on the floor, probably from the previous guest... But the worst was to see a yellow/brown stain in the toilet that you can imagine where it came from... I cleaned it with toilet paper easily and I could not tell my family about it because I fear they would like to leave the hotel. So I do not recomend this hotel to anyone.Was in Memphis for Business and stayed at this Double Tree.  Overall this Double Tree is a nice and well kept up hotel.  Parking can be a little tight but there is enough here that you shouldn't have problems finding a spot.  One of the nice things about this Double Tree is that there are several places to eat at that are within walking distance if you decide to pass on Cal's Championship Steakhouse that is part of the hotel.The place is kept up nicely.  Everything seemed like it was clean and in good condition.  Some of the extra's they have here is a nice business center (about 3 computers, 1 laser printer, & fax), several conference rooms, an indoor pool that look nice, and a gym (though the gym was out of order during my time here but I give them credit for converting 2 rooms into a mini gym).  They also offer Free WiFi and Cable TV with HBO.I had to stay here a couple of times so I got 2 different rooms.  I was able to book one of the business rooms that came with a King Size Bed, a Desk Working Area, a mini Frig, and decent size bathroom.  Both the sink and the shower were in the same room and the mini frig had it's own little counter complete with a coffee machine.The bed was comfortable and the pillows was nice.  Service here was friendly and I have to say, those chocolate chip cookies they give you are great.Overall I would stay here again.  I paid about $99 but the taxes here are pretty steep because you got a room tax, sales tax, and a county tax on top of that, so expect to pay about another 15% on top of everything.  But overall, it was a good stay and would recommend staying here.I stayed at the Doubletree on Sanderlin when I was in Memphis for a conference in May 2010.  The hotel is located in east Memphis which is a nice, safe area with plenty of great restaurants.  The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful.  Parking is free and that's always a plus.  I enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and evening happy hour in the 8th floor concierge lounge.  I would definitely stay here again.  I highly recommend this hotel for folks who are visiting Memphis on vacaction.  The hotel is only a ten minute drive or so to the downtown attractions, the Liberty Bowl, Sun Studio, and Beale Street.i was here in 2006 for a work related trip.  i still think about how comfortable that bed was.and the cookies were an extra bonus.friendly staff.  southern hospitality.and that bed.  dang.  that bed.

review_content: This is rated as a three star hotel but it's in better shape and more convenient and cleaner than the four star properties I've stayed at in Memphis. Better than its $200 price would suggest. Blows doors on Doubletree room I stayed in a few weeks ago Jayant blocks away. Rooms clean and recently decorated. Downstairs public areas have food and coffee options missing from competitors. I also like the way this and three other hotels share an enclosed motor court off the public street. We rolled in at midnight and when we got out of the car we were on semi enclosed. hotel property so didn't worry about getting stabbed. I have an aversion to undeserved stabbings. Also valet is only 18 per night and the garage is nicer than the ones down by Beale St. So yeahThis is a bad place to stay!  The rooms are fine, but from the attitude at the valet stand, and then to charge me $20 for your attitude, no thank you. Next, no coffee in the lobby- every courtyard I've ever started in has free coffee, in the lobby, in the mornings...but not here!  I was told"This is Memphis".  Really, well this is a really good customer, platinum and gold level for as long as I can remember, telling you that it's coffee. Rooms are ok, but this isn't a 5 star Ritz or Four Seasons. The front desk people seemed nice and do their job well, but this hotel gives the impression they're too busy.  Seriously, isn't that the job- serving customers?  What irritates me most is I burned to certificates to stay here- because of its category- don't waste your time, it isn't that great. Pay more and stay at the Peabody, where at least you're treated with respect- which is also where you'll find me and my money next time I'm in town. And Aisha in valet should be fired for speaking to customers that way.Immediate problems with our room. For the price it wasn't worth the problems! We travel frequently and were in town for wedding, with plenty of our party staying here.-hair found right away on the toilet seat: gross.-trying to use the outlets and finding them to be faulty and shorted out by the bed: not trying to die in a fire.-the exposed wires falling out of the phone jack by the bed, also: not trying to die in a fire or get electrocuted.-fridge did not get cold the entire time, maxed out on the setting.-shower seal was false and leaky.  End of rant, but I expect more from a Marriott. Also, valet was incompetent and stained the drivers side carpet and refused to admit any knowledge of it.3.5Memphis, your hotels are not cheap. Between Nashville and Memphis, visitors to the Volunteer State might need to start packing tents! I was visiting Memphis for work and this hotel was the best blend of location, price and comfort. Don't be put off by the 3.5: this is a perfectly fine place to lay your head for a couple of nights. With a few changes, I would wholeheartedly come here without reservation.Pluses: the staff with whom I interacted were all Grade A. From the valet to the desk staff to the cleaning staff, everyone was friendly, approachable and engaged in making my stay as pleasurable as possible. It sounds like such should be second nature for hotels but when you travel enough, you begin to see that this isn't the norm and should be called out for commendation. My room (601) is one that I'd ask for. It was huge. It was a corner room that wrapped around the side of the building and had a terrace! Despite the weather (it could have been warmer), I, gladly, walked outside, sat on the chair and looked out and below at the life on the trolley line. Beale Street is only a quick walk away and there are plenty of sights to take in close to the doorstep. I enjoyed the view greatly.My king bed was comfortable but it did come with those small pillows people speak of in other reviews. Luckily for me, I don't have a big head so it didn't bother me that much. The bathroom is a good size but not very modern. I'd say it's comfortably mid-90s in amenities and appearance. Nothing offensive but you might be left wanting more. I felt the same way about the carpet. I try not to think about *some* things while in hotel rooms. The carpet is one of those things. Again, the appearance suggested a time gone by and, for me, that suggests things living in it. That might not be fair but it's a trigger. I'd imagine it's a trigger for others as well.Back to the positives, the work desk was quite generous in size and the cherry wood helped make me feel productive. After a workout one morning, I wasn't left with much time to hunt for lunch and was left going to a cooler of sorts to pick up a sandwich rather than getting something from the on-site restaurant. Not a huge thing, but nothing that helps earns a full four stars. This Courtyard has a lot of good things going for it and given the location and cost, it probably is one of the better bets in the area. There's some room for improvement but I don't think you'd dislike your stay.Unfortunately this hotel helps buttress the Memphis reputation for rude and indifferent service. No one ever smiled or even bothered to look us in the eye. Saturday morning we went downstairs for a cup of coffee, where a woman behind the counter could only briefly turn around and look at us as we offered a cheery 'good morning'.  With not so much as a grunt, she turned back around until we just gave up and walked 2 blocks for coffee.   This is only one example of indifferent service, there were three or four others. The room was as one would expect for a nice business travel accommodations.   Great location, on the bus/trolley line, etc   But if you like being treated like an appreciated guest - this hotel is not for you. It's worth mentioning that I am a Platinum level customer with Marriott. I shutter to think how they treat infrequent travelers.We stayed here for a wedding, and it was a very nice experience. The room was absolutely gorgeous, and I loved the furniture choices. I need to get one of those giant beds for myself...I was also a fan of the spacious walk in showers. The employees we interacted with were very nice as well.This hotel caters to the male travelers.  How do I know this?  Simple.  The hair dryers.  This bathrooms in this new and otherwise well appointed hotel have the most horrible, outdated, weak hair dryers that took a good 25 minutes to blow dry my hair.  As any woman would tell you, this is not cool.Other than that, the room was, for the most part, comfortable and large, with reasonably fast free internet.  The only other downside to the space was the pillow situation (see picture).
