Too small for the number of guests, woefully understaffed so there was no busing of tables, LONG waits for any of the buffet food, just plain poorly managed, but then that would imply there was any presence of management.Sheraton is supposed to offer an upscale offering. This location doesn't. Next time I travel it's going to be a challenge to consider the Sheraton brand.This place is super cool. Great beds and even better surroundings. Close to the river. And a really cool trolly.
review_content_40: I visited the Sheraton in Memphis for a conference. It is located in close proximity to the downtown Memphis area. It is also the perfect hotel for conferences because it is connected to the Memphis Convention Center. The rooms are nice. After roaming the hotel, I realized that the side I was staying on was the older part of the hotel. About 10 rooms from my room was I noticed newer rooms and different carpet. I'm assuming a renovation had happened or this part of the hotel was added. The bar was nice. It also offered food. The parking attendants/valet were excellent. We never had to wait long for our car. The hotel is large and very easy to get turned around. We noticed later that this hotel was a trolley stop. So I'll try to catch it on my next visit. If I were to stay in Memphis again, I'd likely stay here.I came here for a business Conf.. I expected atleast a decent staff and basic things to be good in the room.. I hated staying here.. Wouldn't recommend at all.. I came here for a business Conf.. I expected atleast a decent staff and basic things to be good in the room.. I hated staying here.. Wouldn't recommend at all..The hotel is undergoing renovations..was very hard to find the front door since there isn't one due to the renovations must check in in the back then ride an elevator up to the second floor...valet is $22 or u can park on the street at a meter which is free from 6p-8a or park across the street in the lot for $5 per park. I was given my room got to the room and the door was already open and the bed was unmade,..go back to front desk to get another room which the beds were made but the pillows were all on the floor luckily security was doing a walk thru and he saw the room called the front desk and they gave me another room all good right?? Wrong in the middle of the night we hear a loud boom like someone is trying to break the door down....nope just the ceiling in the bathroom falling down...go to front seat again this time they offer a $50 credit ugh!!! Not even an offer to change my room...the wall are extremely thin you hear everything...the food is extremely over priced...I will probably never stay at another Sheraton again in life one of my worst hotel experiences ever!!!When I buy the cheapest 4-star hotel I can find on Priceline.com in Memphis - I have pretty low expectations because well, I know I paid $104 a night for the place. Well, I was wrong. It's a bit of a mid 90's feel hotel in the interior but clean. The room was clean, but simple, and the dresser a little dated but clean and comfortable. I have to say the staff was overly nice. They smiled ALOT, the made sure I didn't need anything else and if I was enjoying my stay.. I asked for some extra pillows and within a minute or two they were there. And again asked, if I needed anything else. They asked if I needed recommendations for anything. They said thank you, and seemed like they really wanted to make sure all was good in my world while I was there, and it was. For the price, the location and the friendly staff, it's going to be hard to beat. I'll go back for sure. Tip: It's $22 to park plus tax.Trolley stop RIGHT outside doors of hotel - $1 to ride - can't beat it to any downtown attractions!! Loved it!Ordered food, or at least we thought we did, then 30-45 mins later the waitress comes up & says "I'm so sorry, but I totally forgot, was so busy, I haven't even put your order in yet." NEVER AGAIN.room for a couple about $150 clean very comfortable great staff easy distance to Beale Street where all the Blues Music action is. The only thing isn't the Sheraton per se its the beggars and hustlers on main street on your way home from the bars and restaurant's that sucked...so catch the Trolley its a dollar pp each way its worth waiting for just so you don't get hassled by the local losers. in the daytime its all good. enjoy Memphis We DID.Staying here for two nights, not impressed with this hotel, I mean when you hear Sheraton you think upscale hotel but let me tell you this isn't the case here. While the lobby is nice, the room is old and the bathroom screams to be updated. Also $25 for parking per day!!!! Not cool. The bed on the other hand really nice and firm which was a plus. Overall I wouldn't consider this hotel next time in Memphis, for the money I could do better....This hotel is ... Slipping, and on the edge of bad. Nothing is truly poor, but everything is not quite running on all cylinders. Room wasn't made up on two different days during a four night stay. Breakfast buffet was the exact same thing each day and none of it really all that tasty or fresh. The dinner service was overloaded - plenty of open tables but not enough staff and sold out of key items on the menu (even ordering food to go takes 30-45 minutes). Front desk staff is, well not quite surly, but definitely not overflowing with friendliness. But then again, perhaps it's a perfect fit for Memphis - a sheen of hospitality, but lacking in so many regards.For a Sheraton you would think they would at least try. The hotel staff are children that have no customer service skills. The room had stains all over the ceiling. The shower head was falling out of the wall. Asked to get it fixed the staff just blamed one another. Then came to the room did a temp fix left didn't say sorry nothing. I would never stay in a Sheraton based in this visit and I stay in hotels at least half the year.Wonderful place to stay. Extremely friendly and helpful staff, very clean building and rooms, reasonably priced.My fiance and I visited the hotel on Feb. 6. He is in the military stationed in Little Rock and I am in NJ. We met in Memphis for the weekend to relax and spend some time together. First, let me say that the hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly (when we asked for things we needed). Unfortunately we stayed at the hotel during the same time that some sort of theater convention was being held. Not sure what it was exactly but from what I could gather, it seemed like a job fair for actors. A bunch of different auditions for shows being held at the same time. On our first night there we were in a room that had an adjoining door to another room. We didn't think this would be an issue even though we didn't know the people next to us. At about midnight, we were woken up by the guys next door 'running lines' . They were not necessarily being loud but the thin walls and adjoining door made it sound like they were standing next to our bed. My fiance had to go over and ask them to keep it down because we were trying to sleep. I also called the front desk that night to ask if it would be an issue to change our room in the morning. they said it would be no issue and just call in the morning to get a new room. The next morning, my fiance went down to get a new room key so we could start moving things. They told us they couldn't give us another room until we were ready to vacate the current room; just call the desk when we are packed up an ready. Once we were showered, dressed and packed I called the front desk and was put on hold... for 20 min! I hung up, called back and was told they were busy with guests... uh, was I not a guest??? I then walked down to the front desk (where there was no crowd) and let them know I was not happy about wasting 20 min on hold when we had plans that day. Phyllis at the front desk was friendly and gave us a ticket for a free breakfast for each of us. We changed rooms and went on with our day. On our way back to our room later that day we realized that one of the rooms in our hallway was holding auditions in their room. At first this didn't seem like it would be a problem, but we soon realized it was because there was constant talking and traffic outside of our room and there were always people in the hallway when we needed to get by. Not to mention that the 'audition room' had a card table and wooden reindeer set up in the already narrow hallway. At times there were people waiting to audition sprawled our in the hallway reminiscent of a college dorm or something. it started to get annoying that we felt like intruders in a hallway and constantly having to walk around people. The next morning we were woken up at 7am by our new neighbor practicing her singing exercise all morning. We got up, went out for the day and when we returned around 4pm our room had still not been cleaned. We got dressed for dinner went out again and returned about 10pm. Room still not cleaned. OK, fine but we needed more towels. I called the desk and they said they would send more up. An hour later I had to call again and ask where our towels were because we wanted to go bed. They then sent them up within 10 mins. We tried to sleep that night but starting at about 1am, the room above us were obviously practicing leaps and dancing routines for at least an hour. We couldn't sleep but we also didn't call the front desk because we didn't know exactly what room it was. It seems as though many of the people there for the convention were unaware of common courtesy and hotel etiquette. The next morning we used our free breakfast buffet coupon. It wasn't until we got the bill that we realized the coupon 'expired' the day prior. Why would you give something for our inconvenience and then only give us 12 hours to use it? We left it on the table with our bill and left before the waiter said anything to us. We went out that day, returned around 4 pm our room still wasn't cleaned. I called the from desk, again and was told they have til 5. We were out all day and we weren't going to leave for the housekeeper. I asked for more towels because we needed to shower and when they brought them up I asked if they could at least empty the trash since it has been 2 days. I should mention that part of the reason we needed so many towels is that our shower constantly flooded our bathroom floor, regardless of how we positioned it. I really feel that the hotel should have take precautions to make al guests comfortable during this type of convention. Maybe not allow auditions to be held in rooms or put all the audition rooms in the same hallway. Possibly put a curfew on auditions and 'practicing."The parking situation there is a bit of a rip off at $22/day, but there is a lot that we parked at across the street. an EXTREMELY short walk that was HALF the price per day. The trolley was cheap but hours were VERY limited. Probably wouldn't stay here again unless my company paid for it, not me.Hotel was nice people friendly but front counter staff were not trained or knowledgable. Took the lady 20 minutes to check us out and then gave us wrong directions to Graceland. Beds are comfortable and showers are very nice. Their shower soaps and shampoos are very good quality. Ordered French Onion Soup from the bar and it was excellent. Club lounge was just o.k staff couldn't get the coffee machine to work but like most Sheratons they need to work on a better brand of coffee to serve.My husband and I visited this Sheraton location for one night, just a brief trip to see the basketball game for my birthday. The staff was fantastic and the service far exceeded my expectations. We were truly blown away by the excellent way we were treated. They upgraded our room at no additional cost and even came by our room with a complimentary treat and hand-written card after the game. I almost cried. The room was really nice, warm & toasty, with a wonderful view. The bed was comfy, the shower was hot, and all of it was very clean. Every place we went was a short trolley ride away, which was not expensive. We will definitely be telling all of our friends and family about our experience. We were very well-taken care of and will definitely be back.This place has some of the worst customer service ever. Took 4 calls to get shampoos and towels up to the room and people were just not polite at all. The reception area were rude and laughing at us for thinking we had 2 nights and they only had us for 1. Never helped us to try and get another night there or at another hotel. Every person I encountered had a horrible attitude and did not treat me with respect. With that said, the hotel room was quite nice and I would stay at a place like this again, but not with the service. Something needs to be changed there. For $200 a night I expect great service, not what you will find here.My new husband and I stayed at this Sheraton for the tail end of our honeymoon. Coming from Nashville, Memphis is pretty much a dump but there were attractions that were exciting to us, so that's where we went. When we first got there, one of the valet/ porters helped us unload our suitcases and brought them into the lobby for us. I tipped him and thanked him, but he said he was also going to bring them up to our room for us. Once we checked in (less than 3 minutes later) the porter was nowhere to be found. We schlepped the bags ourselves, no big deal. The first room that they gave us (on the 14th floor) had no one from housekeeping in it, but there were dirty dishes, bedsheets and towels all over the floor like someone started cleaning and then left to do something else. This was also at about 5pm.. so it wasn't like we checked in at 8am. We called down to the desk and they said there would be no issue giving us another room that was ready for us. The room change was fast and they upgraded us to a slightly bigger room on the 15th floor with a better view and seating area that the first didn't have. The hotel was ok- nothing exciting but we were annoyed that EVERY SINGLE MORNING at exactly 8:20 AM the housekeeping staff would knock on the door and ask if they could come in to clean. There were no "do not disturb" things to put on the doorknobs so we answered every morning so they wouldn't come in while we were still in bed. The beds weren't comfortable.at all- but as plus they did have a pool, a fitness center, and free laundry facility ( you just had to provide soap). Location isn't ideal for everything in Memphis, but you can't go wrong with the $1 trolley stop right outside the hotel.Quite possibly the worst hotel I have ever experienced. The hotel staff were very rude.I called to notify the hotel that I had received by mistake a reservation confirmation that belonged to someone else. I must say, top of the line rude as hell telephone customer service agents, this includes the lady who transferred my call to Reservations! No customer service skills at all. To sum it up...UNPROFESSIONAL!enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton. it was very comfortable, convenient and the staff was awesome! the trollies stop right outside our door so we used them ALOT! room was very nice! we stayed memorial weekendThe hotel was going through some renovations. Front lobby was closed. Had to go to 2nd floor to check in. Not bad though. The only problem was jack hammers in the lobby first day. That noise went away for the weekend. The front desk was accommodating and gave us the corner room on 9th floor (view of city & peak of river). The windows were all along the front and side of room. Very nice!!! The bed was awesome with white down comforters, down pillows and 40 or 42" tv with cable. The cable was fading in and out of signal, but not why I was on vacation to watch tv. The trolley was under maintenance and was looking forward to riding it. The bus replaced the trolley for $1.00 each way. This place is 9 blocks from Beale Street. We walked it sometimes and it wasn't all bad. The bus goes there if you want to wait for it. I wished the hotel would have gave us some freebies for putting up with trolley down and hotel renovations. The adjacent room was not noise free. You could hear their tv and their baby. Not very quiet, but quiet than most hotels we've been in. I would recommend this hotel if you want to be away from it all. Nothing really to do in Memphis downtown other than Beale Street and Mud River Park. there is NO Shopping in downtown. Very strange downtown and dying out.My hat goes off to the front desk at this location. They've consistently gone above and beyond the call of service during my visit. At 1:30 in the morning I went to the front desk to get change for a drink from the vending machine. Unfortunately they were unable to accommodate my request at this time of the morning. However, instead of settling for that answer the night manager, Jenette, called another department and asked them to open the gift store so I could purchase a drink and they'd charge my room. As we awaited the other department to arrive I overheard the other front desk attendant named Kenyatta assist another guest request as respectful and polite as Jenette handled my dilemma. Upon exiting I thanked them all by saying "three people and 10mins later no I have a tea drink and I am very happy." Jenette responded "no problem we want you to be happy." I took the time to write this because believe they should be properly acknowledged from a customer level and a corporate level. I was unsuccessful in posting this comment on their corporate site so decided to post on Yelp.It may seem like a no brainer on the surface but I've worked in customer service and its not only about how they treat you but how they treat others when they don't know your paying attention. The other guest request was just as crazy as my 1:30 request but they did their best to assist and didn't say anything bad about he or his request.This is the 20th city I've traveled to within the last month and this hotel experience has been the best by far. .J.R.
review_content_60: No rest for the weary here. In the a.m. an Army of cleaners invade the hallways replete w/very LOUD Walky-talkies and slamming of doors. Never mind that a guest arrived after midnight, each room gets loud a banging knocks and a question,"are you checking out today? No coordination/communication between front desk and cleaning staff.If this hotel expects to remain a 4 star hotel it needs to step up its game a bit. We stayed here while in town for my daughter's wedding Friday through Monday morning (checking out today). Here are things that I don't expect to see when I pay over $200 a night for a room: - dead ladybugs on the carpet (maid said they were a problem everywhere...matter of factly, no offer to help and no apology)- active ant activity in the bathroom (I didn't report, will upon checkout,I am allergic to raid and didn't need them making my eyes swell or stopping me up for the wedding events)-hardest bed I've ever slept in, pillows are the exact opposite, way too soft, no support- security is a HUGE issue, hubs is in the military, -as we walked in from a late night supper run, he commented on how shadowy the trolley side is at night and how anyone could walk in and access the elevators, etc, with no security guard in site. we get on the elevator and another lady runs on and says, " Wow! Dangerous city! Two men were sitting outside on the curb, saw me coming in and came towards me, followed me in and I ran to the elevator!" She came in on the trolley side. Hubs called the front desk, they said there was a guard??? and they take security seriously...uh, no you don't! They asked him if he would like to speak to security...uh, no, what security? We told them what floor the scared guest was staying, but they didn't seem to care. - Breakfast buffet is good, but for $18 I didn't think it was that special...- rooms have no menus for in house restaurants, only room service- laundry area has no vending for detergent, fabric softener,etc, - gift shop is actually a coffee stand...if you call a few (maybe 8) random t shirts a gift shop okay, they have a gift shop- tv was RIGHT by the bed....awkward and too close- stains on the ceiling in the room and bathroom- parking is wayyyy over priced- pool is under major renovation...okay, this is spring break time, reno should have been done in the dead of winter. They were jackhammering when we went to the gym. I feel sorry for the folks on that floor trying to rest- rooms don't get cleaned until very late in the day. One day ours didn't get done until 6:00 and we only asked for fresh towels, toliet tissue, and trash removalA few bright spots: - ALL staff was super friendly and eager to help(except the ladybug situation and the security issue) - valet parking staff is pretty dang good- super friendly and helpful- very convenient to downtown venues- trolley access a plus-if you call for extra towels, more tissue, etc it arrives quickly with a smile! - complimentary bottled water in room dailyWe don't usually stay a Sheraton hotels, this was our first time in at least 6 years that I can recall. I think we'll stick with the Marriott or Hilton chains next time so I can at least rack up reward points.Quiet, clean, extremely friendly and helpful staff, a short cab ride to Beale St!Just wanted to update after leaving to note that the rest of my stay was NOT any better.In fact, our entire conference lamented over group dinners about the number of issues this hotel still has to figure out.My room was never cleaned while I was there, the room service that I waited over two hours for was cold (shocker) and actually inedible (and, listen, I'm a phd student, I eat pretty much everything). The front desk staff admitted that they forgot to get things ready for the "easy checkout" so there was a HUGE line at 5 in the morning (and only one person working the desk) from people just trying to leave. The hotel bar didn't have drink menus because the staff said they "hadn't made them yet" (it seemed like the staff was equally upset at the new management). Post-conference, most of my peers found out they were charged incorrectly (some were charged DOUBLE, two were charged only $33/night for no apparent reason).In terms of complaints from our conference organizers: -They scheduled a BALL in a room right next to one of ours so halfway through an academic talk Justin Timberlake's "Bringing Sexy Back" started BLARING through the wall (I mean, ok, this was actually pretty funny, but come on Sheraton). -Similarly, there was a kitchen next to some of our conference rooms and people had to run out and ask the staff to stop screaming and singing at the top of their lungs because they were drowning out our speakers.-I guess scheduling the catering/food service was a nightmare (according to one organizer), and the "breakfast" that was offered was prepackaged muffins, which were awful. -From my own perspective, the cash bars that were assembled during poster sessions charged $12 FOR A GLASS OF HOUSE WHITE WINE. Are you kidding me? -Someone took off with one of the organizer's credit cards for about 4 hours for no apparent reason (it was supposed to be for room service? But she said they already had her card on file?)Long story short: Pretty much nothing service-wise went smoothly here. Hopefully reviews in the future will be more positive as they get their act together.

review_content: I've never stayed here (except for one night in 2003 when I was a Princess in Cotton Carnival and needed to sleep the night's festivities off...aka I don't really remember anything about the room because I was a blacked out 19 year old), but I've been here abagillion times to attend parties, banquets, fundraisers, etc. And I was here this past Saturday for an annual banquet aka the same event reproduced down to the last detail every year. The ballroom is standard and the staff is always lovely. I've never been too impressed with the food, but the facilities are clean, so that makes me happy. I think their rental fees are slightly overpriced, but, again, this is a super safe bet if you book an event here. I don't have anything bad to say, but there's nothing particularly memorable or special either.Stellar customer service, affordable hotel, free self-parking, and proximity to the East Memphis business district were key factors in my selection of this Hilton location. It was obvious that hotel management ensured their staff had proper training on customer service etiquette. We were amazed by the level of friendliness and courtesy shown by hotel staff members on a daily basis. Being visitors from out of town, we felt very welcomed from our arrival to departure. We decided to stay on the lower floor to be able to freely use the stairs when needed, to save time waiting on the elevators and to get some healthy cardio in since we would be dining out for meals. We did get to ride up in the elevator all the way to the top of the hotel when someone inadvertently selected the wrong floor and it surely was a grand, scenic view of the city! The standard king room, although comfortable and clean, was more compact than rooms we have stayed in at Holiday Inn Express or Marriott Courtyard. Unfortunately, the room was not equipped with a mini-fridge nor microwave so do keep that in mind if you require these amenities. I did appreciate the gorgeous full-length mirror in the hallway, which was all I needed to get all dolled up for our nights out exploring Memphis. The hotel bar was a nice place to meet up friends for drinks, but drinks were overpriced, as to be expected. The lobby was very spacious with ample seating available and festively decorated for the holidays. There was a small business center area with computers for public use. The hotel was pet-friendly as we saw a handful of families with their pets inside the hotel. Outside of the hotel was a walking area with a pond and gazebo, in dire need of a facelift. The outdoor pool looked inviting but the cold weather prevented us from going out there. There was an event each night we were there, but the influx of people did not interfere with our stay. The fitness center was actually one of the nicer ones I've seen in a hotel and we made use of it a couple of time during our stay. The hotel does show some wear and tear but we were glad to see they were undergoing much-needed renovations. One downside with room for improvement was the parking lot. The confusing layout of the parking lot could be hard to navigate without signs to clearly direct people, and there was limited parking available close to the lobby entrance. We did not mind parking far and walking, but if you were traveling with young kids or older adults, it might not be the best option in terms of easily going to/from your vehicle.All in all, we were more than happy with the convenience of the hotel's location and nearby proximity to restaurants and shopping centers off Poplar Avenue. We dined out about 4-5 times along Poplar Avenue at local restaurants. With it being the holidays, we didn't really have to worry about sitting in traffic on the interstate to grab lunch or dinner. I would recommend the Hilton East Memphis for the value, location, and excellent customer service.Southern hospitality at its finest. I have yet to walk by an employee who has not greeted me in one fashion or another. The rooms are not the newest and greatest but it's very clean, comfortable, and I definitely recommend this hotel. We have a great view and considering that this hotel is one of the only tall buildings in the immediate area, I'm guessing every room has just as an outstanding view as ours.Lobby is huge and spacious. Haven't tried the gumbo at the restaurant downstairs yet but hubby says its one of the best he's had. They are undergoing construction in one area of the hotel right now and evidently there will be a pizza bistro going in.The bistro service was beyond excellent but unfortunately you can't stay with them. The elevators were down the first night we got in. We walked 23 flights down from our room the first night. The soda in the machines were outdated. The was no insulation in the room. That is pictured. The down comforter was stained. That is pictured. Just wondering what it would take to replace something. Overall I hate the hotel mediocre.We had a great stay here in June for a friend's wedding. Every time we entered the lobby, the staff greets you warmly. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. This is why I generally love any Hilton. There was a huge conference here the weekend we stayed, but the facility was always clean. The only down-side was two of the four elevators broke down on a check-out Sunday when the 300+ guests from the conference were checking. My friends and I subsequently were late for our reservations. Some of us took the stairs from the 11th floor in heels. Others waited 20+ minutes for an elevator. This is an average Hilton. I love staying at the Hilton, so no real complaints. We even got lucky each night with a parking so close enough to the lobby (the parking lot was always full, even after the weekend).There's a Target & several stores & restaurants right across the highway. Very convenient location.The price and location were right, which is what led me to this hotel for a recent visit to Memphis. As others have mentioned, the hotel is a bit dated and in need of freshening up. I am happy to report that the lobby does appear to be under construction to improve the experience. The staff was super friendly. I was able to check in early and get a little work done unexpectedly. The room itself was in much better shape than the common areas of the hotel. There was a decent sized vanity area, which was helpful, however the bathroom itself was a bit compact. If you have a fear of heights, ask for a lower floor. The elevators are on the outside of the building and are a bit like an amusement park ride. As you approach the hotel from I-240, there is a sign giving you instructions on how to get to the hotel. Were it not for that sign, I definitely would have gotten myself lost. Thankfully GPS was on the right track, so would definitely suggest plugging in the address if unfamiliar with the area. Once you enter, you are in the portion of the parking lot that is the farthest from the entrance, so it is worth trying to drive back towards the entrance. Initially, you won't see any signs directing you to the lobby area, but that changes as you head farther back. In a perfect world, there would be more directional signs as the layout of the hotel from the exterior is a bit confusing.Disappointing stay. We consistently stay at Hilton properties and rarely have bad experiences. The staff was great -- welcoming and friendly as we arrived. Three of the four elevators weren't working. There are 25 floors in this hotel and a conference (or two) happening in the adjoined convention facility. We waited 15-20 minutes for elevators going both directions. Our shower in our room didn't drain at all.There was only one towel left in our room for us. I hope this is an off day for them, but it was a frustrating instead of relaxing stay.Average hotel all around (I'd rate it 3.5 stars if I could)... under usual Hilton standards, but still a good place to stay for the price!!! While visiting Memphis I decided to stay here and it was an enjoyable time. Once landing at the airport, I called the hotel for a shuttle right and they were right there as I walked out of the airport.The hotel itself; lobby, common areas, gym, etc are slightly dated... think early 2000s, but you're not actually paying an arm and a leg to stay here, so it's petty nice for the price. To me the service was very friendly, despite what the other reviews have stated, I actually thought the service was spot on.The room is awesome! Make sure to get a higher level room so you can enjoy the view. The rooms are clean, spacious, and the beds are super comfy. Would I stay here again, yes... if the price was right!Location is the perk of this hotel and the employees. Other than that, Iwont come back and for a Road Warrior, I highly recommend do not stay here.Upon arriving at this hotel I was incredibly pleased with it's appearance and the customer service I received from every employee I encountered. My first annoyance came with the realization that there was no mini-fridge or microwave in the room. I felt like for the rate I paid, these things should be included in amenities. The deal breaker came at night when I tried to go to sleep. This hotel must have the thinnest walls/floors of any hotel I've ever been in. I could hear every door slam to what felt like every room around me all night long. I was here to run the St. Judes Marathon, and really needed a good night's sleep. Needless to say that did not happen. It was so incredibly disappointing. It was a very nice room, but the main reason we all stay at hotels is so we have a place to sleep and since that didn't happen for me here I can only give it 1 star.Although I haven't stayed in one of the rooms (I was born and raised around the corner), I recently went here for an interview. I was extremely impressed!!! Haven't seen a nice hotel like this in the area. Extremely clean and very nice front desk staff!! Meeting rooms are nice and there are also little TVs telling you which room has what event going on in them. If I ever need a hotel in this area I will be staying in this hotel or at least recommending it!Every time I come to memphis this is my hotel if choice. Awesome view of the city from high up, great hotel staff, beautiful entrance. The pool and workout area is very nice. The rooms are not family rooms their a bit small if you have children but if it's just you and wifey you will love it............ The breakfast is average it hits the spot and there is more than enough to get you going.The view of the lake is so sweet it puts you in a relax state of mind while enjoying breakfast.This review is simply about the upkeep of the public spaces at this particular Hilton Hotel. This is NOT a review of the restaurants or the rooms not staff. It is entirely about the state of the way our group is shuffled around from conference room to conference room and the sad state of the restrooms. I attend a monthly meeting at this hotel. We pay a LOT for use of a conference room and we are often moved around and placed in rooms that are not adequate in size with a giant post in the center of the room which is very inconvenient for our meetings. Many times there is no other conference being held in the hotel but we get sent to this terrible room. One would thing that they would appreciate the every month commitment but apparently not so much. Now about the bathrooms. Bathrooms drive me crazy! Does no one care about the sad state of the restrooms in a public venue such as this? Apparently at one time they had huge crowds and prepared for that by building huge bathrooms (I think the ladies room on the lower level where all the banquet rooms are has about 15-20 stalls.) yet the photos will show the terrible disrepair of some of the stalls. It's not like they got this way over night, I've been attending my monthly meetings for almost 3 years now and the issues have remained unchanged. But then again, this is only a 3 hotel yet I'll bet their prices reflect more of a 5 star! It is fancy-schmancy on the surface but apparently no one there cares about the sad bathrooms. Enjoy the pics.Can't beat a $70.00 (tax included) Hotwire.com weekend deal! Nice lobby with newly renovated guest rooms and comfortable beds. Throw in free self park and a complimentary airport shuttle (6:00am-10:00pm) and I am one happy traveler!Notes: Pets up to 75 lbs allowed for an extra $50.00.Midtown and Downtown are a 20 minute drive.Memphis International Airport is 10 miles away.Staying at this hotel really feels like you're in Memphis (instead of another hotel) and is smack in the middle of midtown with tons of great affordable restaurants within two miles. The Hilton staff was very friendly and our room had all the creature comforts you'd expect from this hotel chain. Despite being a chain , this hotel still had a local feel and some unique southern touches. The bistro restaurant downstairs is a tad pricey but the tables by the windows offer a great view of the outdoor fountain and geese. Our entrees were prepared well and tasted fine. Also, the wifi (which was free with a coupon) and elevators are super duper fast and they have four computers with laser printer in the lobby for business. The fitness room was clean and had a variety of machines.When we arrived we discovered that we were booked for a Double Room instead of King bed. Quentin was awesome! He placed us in a room with a King bed. In addition, I requested a room on an upper floor and he accommodated with putting us on the 20th floor - PERFECT. The room was spacious. The bed was comfortable. Housekeeping was awesome! They provided us with additional towels, tea, and cups daily. The location was good. There is a Target and Panera Bread near by as well as other restaurants nearby that are good.Fabulous room with a great view of a large flock of Canadian geese, which our Chihuahua and Shi-poo watched from our window! Although our room was not cleaned one day, Ms. LaWinter at the front desk made everything better! In addition, Pat Balfour, our waitress in the Rook Restaurant, was fabulous! Both of these fine employees deserve a thank you and a pat on the back for jobs well done! Got a great deal on PriceLine that was about half the normal rate!If I could negatively rate this hotel I would. The hotel itself could use some work. The staff is not willing to help in any way. The lady at the front desk had a sign next to her that said something like if you are not satisfied let us know and we'll make it right. YEAH right. I brought my issue to their attention more than once and was blown off like I didn't matter. From the restaurant to the front desk HORRIBLE hotel and WORST customer service of any Hilton by far.Did not stay here, thankfully. We were already booked at a hotel nearby. We were here for a convention. The restaurant is only open until 2 pm, hard to find. Where in the US is there a Hilton restaurant that doesn't remain open all day, particularly with a big convention taking place in their space. We were shuffled to the upstairs lobby hotel, where the bartender continued to ignore us, even while standing directly in front of us. He had less than 6 customers at the bar, yet couldn't find time to acknowledge us or thanks us for waiting. Pathetic service for a Hilton Hotel. We walked to a nearby hotel for lunch. Never again.Used to love this hotel. Till my daughters bathing suit got stolen from houSe keeping ! I mean who steals a kids bathing suit ! PleaSe be careful staying here. House keepers here r thieves !
review_content_20: This is the 2nd time staying in this hotel.  I always enjoy my time each and every time.  The entire staff is always very friendly and helpful.  I enjoy the fact that they allow dogs.  I will definitely be staying again in the future.Very nice hotel with a gracious staff. Shower need replacing desperately!The best part was the breakfast, a tad slow service but WELL worth it. Homemade hash browns.The hotel is very dated, the restaurant downstairs called the rook is awful, you can't get seated and when you do you will pay 16 dollars for powdered eggs which aren't even stirred up. I always stay in the hilton chain but I will never stay at this location again.I actually think it should get three and a half stars but I'm giving it 4 because one employee went way over above and beyond to help me. My room was very typical of a Hilton room so I have no problem with that. liked the headboard and the decor of the room Lobby definitely was very pretty but the parking is not what I expected. A bad parking space is a really bad parking space.  Sort of surprised that there was no covered parking. The bellhop got my bags and also went to get my car and discovered a flat tire. He went out of his way to get the air compressor and get it filled up enough to get me to the local Goodyear. Definitely made the experience greatHad to rush to Memphis due to my mom being sick. Diabetic but not taking her medication. Getting the wrong dietary information from her doctors. This is really stupid by the way. How you going to tell her she can drink juice and eat bread. (things you are giving her at the hospital) and then complain that her sugar isn't going down. I really need to write a review about that St. Francis Hospital. We picked the Hilton because it was right next to the Hospital. Thanks to Hotel Impossible, we can't help but to critique any hotel we get going forward. Normally it is no big deal, but this place started off really bad. As soon as we walked into the room we noticed the room had an odor. My wife walked into the bathroom and ran out saying the bathroom is dirty and the toilet wasn't flush. Checked myself and noticed their was urine everywhere. Yikes. We left Rm. 1203 and called the front desk that we had to be moved somewhere else. The front desk apologized and got us into a new room and a gift bag with an apology card in 5 minutes thanks to Kristal at the front desk. When we left the room the cleaning lady was outside and also apologized. The main lobby actually looks pretty awesome. There is a large water sculpure and the furnture around it are a modern style. At night the lobby has strobe lights that changes color that looks pretty cool. The Gym isn't bad. Treadmill and bikes have there own tv's attached and there are complimentary earphones. (they come wrap in plastic) Dumbbells go up to 50 pounds. Which isn't the norm, usually you are lucky to get 25 lbs. A nice fly machineHD TV with actual HD channels. Is it silly when you go to a hotel and they have HD tv, running on standard definition channels and it really looks bad. Might as well go with a regular tv if you are going to do that. After hours rant*After running around to get things my mom needed and eating out tired but ready for a drink me and wifey decided to check out the bar and experienced high comedy. I guess there was a lady that was talking about her child and how hard it was to be a mom. Then she started yelling at some dude about the fact that he was a dude or something. (hard to understand her in this drunkin state) The dude started going off about how people are good people and that he is a good person. But not everyone are good people. A few other people chimed in. Someone stood up and started yelling at someone (not sure why and I don't think they knew why either. (the person yelling or the person being yelled at)) Needed a good laugh and I got one. End After hours rant*Check out kind of sucked. When we got there we asked the check in lady about wifi. She said there is complimentary wifi. But I guess she thought that meant they have it if you pay for it. It is actually complimentary if you have a HHonors members. We are members but didn't know we had to use it. Check out was an extra 30 mins because they had to call to see if they could use our Hilton account (they couldn't) Then they had to find out how to remove it from our bill (because we were not going to pay it) Next time I am in Memphis I will probably go someplace else.Just ok.....The lobby is beautiful but the rooms are very average. The vanity has been updated but the tub is still old school. I have had some pretty annoying stays here... The floor to ceiling windows were leaking.... Housekeeping didn't show up before 5:30 PM!.... Room service takes a very long time..... Parking is always a hassle and usually need to walk a ways.  This isn't my number one choice but it's not horrible. It may be great for an event because the ballrooms are large.Stayed for a weekend. It qwas overbooked with Family reunions & wedding parties. I could not rest due to the noise level off kids running down the hallway. People next door were loud.  For a seemingly upscale hotel,they have absolutely nothing in the rooms. If you wanted a frig or microwave, they charge you per night. That's the basics that come with most  hotels /motels. There is no continental breakfast etc. Bar is over priced for watered down drinks.   If you come in after a certain hour, you have to walk quite a distance to get into the front entrance because your key does not get you in from the back like most places. Security cameras does not c over all directions............If I  had to say something positive, the staff is extremely nice,knowledgeable and accommodationing. The view. ( depending on your room location) is nice........My advise is to ask what they have going on and to put you away from the action unless that's what you like.The service was nice downstairs. But the actual guest rooms were just awful! The rooms were so small and cramped. Our bathroom walls had water damage and I didn't feel comfortable showering in the tub. Additionally, the room had a faint smell of smoke or some other odor (like wet dog and mold). They say free wifi but when you go to log in they say you need to pay per day. Just call the front desk and they will give you a complimentary wifi coupon code. No free breakfast (I'm sorry, but I thought that was standard!) And slightly far from any main attractions in Memphis. If I am ever back in Memphis, I will not be returning to this hotel. HOWEVER- If you need a church to go to for Sunday morning I recommend Saint Louis Church, it was near the hotel and it was a really beautiful and moving experience.Room okay but concierge lounge was unstaffed and no drinks.  Lobby is inviting but Lobby bar was out of most everything. Women bartender angela was a total bitch beyond belief... Appeared to be suffering major case of hemorrhoids.  Could not make basic drink.  Food was cold and tasteless--- salmon burger. Other than that, just dandy.The bed alone could be a four star!  The Hilton experience is defiantly present in the decor, toiletries and shower experience.  This hotel is near the airport and across from a strip mall full of stores and eateries.  It is twenty minutes from downtown and one exit from Graceland.  Downside the cleaning staff did not replenish the room at all and only laid a stack of towels on the desk?  It also took thirty minutes to check in.  Other than that fabulous main area and stay!The service was great, from bellhop, to security, to the front desk.   We really appreciated the fact that there was security patrolling the parking lots since it made the entire experience better.However, when arriving at the room, I have to say that there was something more to be had.  Judging by the neighbors and carpet, we were stuck in a "pet friendly" room since we had pets.  That's fine and all, but if you look at the pictures of the carpeting and furnishings, it seemed like we had been thrown into a second rate room, but paying what everyone else paid along with a $50 pet fee (to be expected at all Hilton chains that take pets).Kind of a let down for accommodations when the service was actually pretty nice.  I would probably suggest at least re-doing the carpeting and perhaps putting insulation into the walls so that you can't hear everything that goes on between rooms.I've stayed at Hilton Hotels at other cities.  This is by far the least impressive branch.  The rooms have an overall dinghy feeling.  The first time I stayed here,  my flight wasn't landing till midnight.  I called ahead and pre ordered food. At first,  the receptionist couldn't even tell me what was on the restaurant's menu.  She transferred me to two different departments she suggested I talk to.  Unfortunately,  none of them were available to respond.  Finally,  I asked that she order a simple burger.  I made it clear that I had been traveling for 10 hours and really needed this meal ordered before the restaurant closed since I hadn't eaten all day. She assured me that it wouldn't be an issue.  When I arrived, I was very disappointed to learn that they couldn't put my order in because I wasn't available to sign for it. I was amazed that the front desk clerk would not know this  policy and did not try to make an accommodation under the circumstances. When I've done this at other hotels, it was never an issue. I returned to stay at this hotel two weeks later. I discovered that my room much like my previous stay was not properly cleaned. There were stains and remnants of other people's hair on the phone, dink and toilet,   the sheet had a really bad encrusted stain in it. I did not discover the stain until the night before I was checking out otherwise I would have reported it. I hate going to hotels where I don't feel comfortable touching anything without gloves. This hotel makes some of the much cheaper brands look WAY more appealing and it is an overall disappointment to the Hilton brand.  I have to travel on Memphis on business frequently and  in the future, will ask my company to have me stay elsewhere.  The staff is also very unfriendly.The lobby is designed in such a way that even if there are only 20 people milling about in the bar (it's very open), it sounds as though there are 200. This isn't Hilton's fault, this building has been 5 other hotels previously.  But it made me want to avoid that part of the hotel.The staff were very friendly and helpful and were happy to recommend good Memphis eats.This seems to be one of the few upscale hotels in Memphis that is also cat friendly, though to the tune of a $50 nonrefundable fee. I think that is excessive, particularly when they claim to be "pet friendly." (I checked, and it's the same for dogs, who can weigh up to 75 lbs.)We lucked out and were given a room on the P floor ("first floor") which is right on the water (the hotel is surrounded by a "moat" with geese and ducks). They also gave us a code for the wifi, which I don't think is always free? Hard to tell.They do lose major points for seeming to have a great pool and spa, but it doesn't open til NINE. They have a fitness center that opens at 5am, but many people prefer to use the pool in the early morning, certainly before families come and overtaken it. Particularly since the fitness center hours are right below the sign for the pool and spa in the lobby, I found it very misleading.A wonderful room, great view and an excellent staff. A nice quiet escape but still close to downtown Memphis. Great Hotel!Nice location, great amenities, good service! No complaints. There was a conference in the meeting room on the ground floor. I was hungry after working out, and so in my sweaty gym clothes I walked right through a bunch of people in suits (they were having a business conference in the hotel) and b-lined to the desserts table and scrounged up some yummy brownies. SCORE!This is the average hilton, with an extended conference center. Expect rooms to be on par with airport Hilton's or the average Hampton inn. The breakfast center at Rooks is a nice touch, downstairs from the tower which contains all the rooms. The lobby and foyer has a nice seating area and bar.Of you are going to hold a conference here, the center downstairs is adequate. One thing to consider is that the staffing levels for a venue that size is fairly small. So if you need something quickly you may have to hunt for a coordinator to help you out.All in all a decent Hilton, especially for events.This is a very nice option when staying in Memphis.  It's not downtown, however, so keep that in mind.  Have always experienced friendly service and a decent room for the price.  Very pretty building, lobby and water moat around the outside of the hotel.  I would definitely stay here again.Let me preface this review by saying that the staff at the Nashville Hilton was extremely friendly and helpful at all times.  I was surprised and disappointed by the aesthetics of the lobby and the room that I stayed in.  The lobby furniture is old and worn out and looks like a throwback to the 80s.  The bar in the lobby had fruit flies buzzing around that we had to continually swat so that we could enjoy our appetizers and drinks.  The hotel room had a shabby, old headboard that was split and coming apart.  The full wall windows overlooking the pond was continually covered with condensation and the water that collected on the old rug permeated our suitcases (we didn't realize at first that the rug was all wet).  My roommate complained about the smell of mold and had a headache the entire time we were there.  This hotel should have been a lower end motel, not a Hilton.Good location next to I-240 and blocks from Germantown but on a quiet business street.Small bathroom. The design of the building is unique in that it is circular so Hilton had to be creative.Hallway - with hotels - 2 doors are built directly next to each other so if someone knocks on the door of the next room - the echo within the hallway makes you believe someone is knocking on your door.Bathroom - Surprised the sink is in the common area and not within the bathroom. "within the bathroom" is a toilet and tub in a room/confined space. Not much room to do more than that.Using the hot tub/whirlpool, I was disappointed. It did not feel as clean as other Hilton properties (grant it, it was 9PM) but the temperature was also not very warm. It was lukewarm at best and left much to be desired on this cool night.Parking - others have said it. There are about 20-30 spots relatively close to the door. Otherwise, you will be walking down a slight slope (not hill) to reach your vehicle. On weekends, it can be crowded and a good 2-3 min walk from the front door of the hotel to car.Bonuses: Hotel gave me free internet for my stay (but I was staying on a corporate account). Lobby sundry shop is open til 11PM.The rooms are just ok.  I'm a diamond at Hilton and I've stayed in better rooms.  For frequent travelers to Memphis, I would recommend the Hyatt.  The Hilton is just too much trouble with the elevators and keeping your stuff there for long term stays.The breakfast is good because they serve hot foods and all the water you can take!
review_content_40: On a business trip that I booked 3 weeks ago and I'm currently sleeping in a pull out bed due to overbooking. No pillows at all in the room and there are tiny LED lights above the bed shining down that cannot be turned off... My thoughts echo those of the other 1 star reviews.Lobby nice but by the elevators you're back to 1970 Elvis style. The elevator environs need upgrading. My room was nice, service staff nice and helpful. Hilton needs to invest money to bring it up to 2014. Food options very limited for a hotel this size. Pool area pretty parking goodOnce again, I am not sure about all of the negative reviews of this place.  I had a great stay over Liberty Bowl weekend, which was VERY busy.We arrived from a very long drive (all the way from Iowa) around 6:30pm on Saturday night.  We were greeted by a bellman who helped load up our stuff to take upstairs.  Although the lobby was busy (and not overly loud like everyone else said), there was no wait at the front desk.  The check-in process took only a few minutes, and the Gentleman that assisted us was very friendly.  Although, when I asked for change (to tip the bellman), the agent told me he didn't have any. I asked the next person and they also said they didn't have change - um, HELLO?! What gives.  They said another guest had just "wiped them out," doesn't that mean you should go get change for your bank? (I work in a hotel and would NEVER tell a guest just flat out "no.")We were given a room on the 24th floor.  Over the course of the weekend, the elevators were very busy and some were a bit old and creaky (scary).  They really need to be updated.  Our room was nice, nothing spectacular, but a typical room.  The bed was very comfortable and we had everything we needed.We ordered room service for dinner one night, and for breakfast one morning.  I was not impressed by the menu, or by the fact that it was only available until like 10pm.  This is 2013 - your room service should be available 24 hours a day!  Especially since the menu was very basic.  When the food was delivered, the server told us just to place the tray in the hallway when we were done and they would pick it up.  I did so later, and also place the breakfast order sheet on the door, but checked back after awhile and both were still there.  So I had to call the front desk to ensure both were picked up - since I don't believe they would have been and we wouldn't have had breakfast the next day.We did go to the hotel bar one night.  The bartenders were friendly, but very unprofessional.  It was pretty busy, but they were telling everyone they were probably going to close early, because it had been slow all day (??)....They had a limited selection - one of my friends asked what champagne they had and she (the bartender) just laughed and showed her the 2 bottles, neither of which I've heard of.  They did have Yuengling on tap, which I can't get in Vegas, so I was pretty happy.  The one weird thing was when we went back to the front desk to settle our bill.  My friend and I were splitting the charges and thought it would be pretty easy (once again, I work in a hotel and deal with this daily).  Well, we were assisted by a front desk manager, since there was a line - and it took her approximately 10 minutes to even log on to the computer and get our room number.  Once I explained what we needed to do, she said it wasn't possible until that night's room and tax charges had posted.  This makes no sense to me, but whatever - we had to go back in the morning.  Meanwhile, they are still holding a large amount of money on my debit card, which really hampered my bank account on the trip home.  Also, the front desk manager gave me a 1pm late check out (normal check out is at noon) and advised me if I needed later to let her know.  I realized that this would leave me waiting in the lobby for awhile until I caught the airport shuttle (which leaves every hour), so I called the front desk in the morning asking to extend it to 1:30pm.  I was told by the girl that it was not possible.  I explained that I was told the night before that it wouldn't be an issue and she very rudely responded "well, fine, if that's what the Manager said."  Wow, thanks!When settling the bill at check out, I was not really sure that it was handled properly, but made sure to get a receipt showing that my friend had paid half on her credit card, and that only the other half was charged to my card.  Still waiting on that refund.....For some reason I thought this hotel was downtown at first, and when I was double checking the hotel info/location I looked at the reviews....which I admit got me a little nervous about staying here. I agree with the recent review by Teri W where I don't see much reason for the negative reviews.  I'm on the 21st floor and the room is clean, carpet is newer and the decor is that of a hotel...not a motel :)It is the older circular style building, but the interior is well maintained.  Bathrooms are modern - shower/toilet room is a little cozy, and the hot water pressure makes for a nice shower.Whew!SLOWEST FRONT DESK CHECK-IN EVER!  We checked in early on a Saturday morning (2am), there were tons of people milling about in the gigantic and very loud lobby area and it took the one desk person over 30 minutes to check in the 3 people ahead of us.  This experience with the front desk was pretty consistent for our whole trip - it always took forever to get to the front of the line.  The lobby is garishly decorated and the moat outside is hideous, looking like someone dumped 50 gallons of teal colored paint into an otherwise nice moat.  The stay was comfortable and the view was pretty good when staying on one of the higher floors.  The bathroom was hard to maneuver in because of the strange orientation of the door and toilet.  Room was definitely not as nice as other Hiltons I've stayed at.We did initially stay on the first floor, which gave us an expansive view of the gross moat, but then had to move up to the 23rd floor because our room, mysteriously, started smelling intensely of cigarette smoke (non-smoking room).  The workout room is nice, similar to other Hiltons.  As for location, don't stay here if you want to get to any of the typical tourist sites (Beale Street, Graceland, Zoo, Sun Studio, etc) in less than 15-25 minutes of highway driving.  There was nothing wrong with the room itself, a fairly comfortable hotel room but I wouldn't stay here again because of the insanely loud lobby, extremely slow service and hideous common area decor.NO FREE WIFI :(Was here for a  training meeting for work. Rooms are not spacious, but comfortable. Bathroom clean, with good water pressure for shower. Big flat screen tv, and wi-fi access provided. Breakfast at their restaurant was good, with omelets made to order, or an extensive buffet. Coffee refills a little slow. The food they provided for our training session of about 90 people was very good. Staff is friendly and efficient. They do provide a free shuttle from the airport. Hotel is in a safe area with a big, free parking lot. Overall decor is nice and hotel looks up to date and well maintained.Greeting Hilton Honors,I was going to get my status with Hilton Honors back to Gold by the end of the year. I have been spending most of my time in Marriotts and Hyatts, lately.My two most recent stays in The Memphis Double Tree and The Garden Inn in Frankfurt were excellent. I needed to work in Memphis, TN on 09.09.2013.Late afternoon 08.08.2013, I booked a last minute room at the Hilton Memphis East. I have stayed there before and it was just OK.When I finished my job at a local hospital early, my company sent me to another location. I called to cancel and Hilton Honors told me I had to call the hotel.I called the number and no one answered the phone. Since I was only a mile away, I drove to the Hilton.I was then informed that I was going to have to pay the penalty of one full night. After the desk clerk spoke with the manager, it was dropped in half.OK, I am good with only having to pay half. If it were any other hotel including most Hilton, I would have until 1600-1800 to cancel day of arrival.I was told the General Manager of this location sets the policy.Well you can thank this general manager.I will. Because of his decision, I will now become Platinum with Marriott and hit Gold with Hyatt.Please feel free to watch my Hilton Honors account.It will not be exciting as there will be an extended period of inactivity.With an industry which is so full of Hotel options, one would think that Hotels would want to do everything possible to retain repeat business travelers.Memphis Hilton must not need return guests and they don't seem to care about future travelers visiting other Hilton properties in the future.We prepaid for a room through Amex and called at 6pm to let them know we would be arriving in town a little late.  We went to check in and no rooms were available.  Do you want to risk staying here?  I won't again.I am a travelling consulting and frequently stay in Hilton hotels, so my review might be a little weighted.  In summary, the Hilton Memphis is acceptable, but I wouldn't recommend it.The Good:Breakfast:  The breakfast was free (for HHonors members) and everything was fresh and tasty except for the occasional watery eggs.  The coffee was fresh and the breakfast lounge was usually busy with a lot of people.Appearance:  The hotel looks very nice.  During the day it looks classy and elegant, and at night it looks hip and trendy with all of the accent lighting and everything.The Bad:Parking:  The parking lot is designed in a way that you need to arrive to the hotel before 4:00pm in order to find an open spot within 100 feet of the hotel entrance.  Otherwise, you'll be looking for spots along one long strip with parking spots on each side.Food:  I ordered from the hotel restaurant twice.  The first time I ordered a BBQ burger, medium-rare, and it came to me charred and well-done.  The second time I ordered a normal hamburger, medium-rare, and received the same result, except that it took a whole 45 minutes to cook my burger.  The McDonald's down the road can cook a better burger in 2 minutes.  I expect much better from a hotel of the Hilton brand, and this disappointed me.Room Service:  One evening I decided to order a sundae dessert (ice cream on top of a microwaved brownie) and the lady on the phone said I should receive it in 20 minutes.  I actually fell asleep while waiting for the brownie to come, which ended up taking nearly 90 minutes to show up at my door.Since my stay at the Hilton I contacted the hotel management who stated that their Food and Room Service problems have been addressed.  I don't have a lot of confidence in this, since it's probably a staffing issue and I doubt they fired their entire kitchen and room service staff.  So this could be better now... but don't say I didn't warn you!Comfortable, Clean, FriendlyI called for a shuttle, was told it should be there in 20 minutes, 50 minutes later I ended up taking a taxi for $27.We took the shuttle to a restaurant, called for pickup, it was at over an hour to come. The restaurant closed, and we were told that it is a normal thing to have to wait forever on the shuttle.We were waiting outside, and then the shuttle driver told us that is a bad section of town.Lobby is beautiful.  Parking was a hassle. Executive Platinum happy hour and breakfast were amazing.  Great area.  The best service we've had at any Hilton.I recently attended an event at Hilton Memphis.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  We had dinner that was served during the event - think a lot of speeches and awards.  The wait staff was quick to retrieve old plates, give the next course and fill glasses, with very little disruption to the event happenings.  There weren't many options for food, which was the event planners decision.  We were given the option of vegetarian or a chicken entree.  Everyone had good things to say about the food.  As far as the banquet room goes, it was pretty standard.  Not, knock your socks off, swanky, but not tacky, either.  All in all, I enjoyed myself.  No complaints, whatsoever.Computers down at peak check in. Waited over 15 minStaff nice but unsure what to doAsked for a comp and was not offered. Person I traveled with checked in at a different station was given free drink and breakfast.  I am a freq hilton honors...not good move on Hilton's partThis is a strange hotel. It has some really nice and fancy aspects while other things were very run down. The biggest issue was the crappy parking lot. The front door is up a long driveway that has no parking near it. So you have to walk through a very large parking lot which was a blast the night it was pouring rain.The rooms are nice, but are a strange size. The seals on the giant window walls are also shot so there are some serious drafts if you leave the curtains open. The bar was nice, but a bit on the expensive side.The room were very nice and the bar in the lobby was a plus. The Hotel itself is pretty modern and the lobby is massive with a cool water fountain in the middle. The bar is a little pricey but it is convenient. It is also within walking distance of a Benihana's and a few other restaurants. It is not close to downtown but it was a great place to stay while on business!Read my earlier review for details on the horrible stay I'd previously experienced.  My new rating is really 2.5, but since we can't do half stars, I'll push it up, rather than down.First - let me update on the final results of my bad stay.  I was contacted through YELP by the hotel manager, who was very upset about my review.  I was offered some additional Hilton points, which I declined.  He then offered to refund an additional night's stay, which I accepted.  Following an email of my reservation number, I found that they did, in fact, credit my AMEX with $200.Last week, I was stuck in Memphis due to bad weather in a connecting flight.  There were a lot of people pushing for hotel rooms, so I decided to go out to the Hilton because I knew the room, at least, would be decent.  I don't know if my profile was marked in some way, or not, but when I arrived, I was treated very well.  It was late in the evening, and due to the weather, the airline was not footing the bill.  The woman at the counter indicated that she felt that wasn't fair, and then offered me a free meal in the restaurant.  She also went out of her way to find a nice room for me, away from smoking floors, without being asked.I did have a quick meal, and the food in the restaurant was only slightly better than the room service, but it was tolerable.  I have had MUCH better food in many other hotel facilities.  Someone should tell the chef that most people can tell the difference between "saute with peas, carrots, & bacon", and what was done - which was more like "topped with microwaved peas & carrots & crumbled bacon"I was told when I made the call from the airport, that the hotel had a free airport shuttle service.  They did pick me up from the airport, but when I got to the hotel, was told that I would have to pay for a cab ride the following morning, because my 6:00am flight would have me leaving the hotel before the shuttle service started (I find it odd that they can't cope with early morning flights).So... overall, not a bad experience, but not one that I'd note as "exceptional".  I'd stay again if needed, but probably not for a stay longer than a night or two.First room we checked into had huge horrible stains on carpet. Then moved us to executive suite, but took an hour for them to get our keys to work. Long line. Overpriced. Terrible service. NEVER will stay here again!!!Probably the nicest Hilton staff I have encountered in the nation. The staff was always willing and ready to help us and accommodate our service dog in training.  The rooms are nice, but the doors are a little too close to other rooms. It might have to do with the shape of the building though. The executive lounge is great and man do they do their breakfast right.I stayed here for three nights on business at the end of December. The property is located off one of Memphis' main roads and is a short distance to the I-240 beltway.There were some issues of varying degrees during my stay, but, to a person, every staff member I dealt with was pleasant and at least attempted to be helpful.It's a fair walk from the large parking lot to the front door and the sidewalk ends abruptly at one point, causing a step down to the driveway before picking up the sidewalk again. More often than not, this isn't a problem, but in heavy traffic while carrying cumbersome bags, it could be a tricky maneuver.The lobby is large and comfortable, with the lighting scheme continuously fading between various bright colors. Check-in was efficient, though the elevators to the main tower are located another fair walk from the front desk.The main tower is circular, so all guest rooms are just a short walk from the elevator bank. My room was clean and comfortable with a well-made king bed, a good-size desk and an HD television. There was plenty of closet and dresser space. Wireless internet access is available for $9.95 per day and the signal was reliable and strong.As other reviewers have noted, the walls between rooms seem thin. A crying baby in the adjacent room might as well have been in my room.The shower in the bathroom, at one point, was making a terrible noise, to the point where it sounded like the faucet was going to fly off of its fixture. This was coupled with a lack of hot water. After a few stops and starts, though, the noise abated and piping hot water followed.I had breakfast one morning at the on-site restaurant, which was my poorest experience of the stay. The restaurant was crowded - not jam-packed - but the staff appeared to be overwhelmed. It took five minutes just to be seated, another five to get a menu and about 30 minutes for a rather basic order to be delivered -- incorrectly. It's worth reiterating that the staff was pleasant and courteous despite the tough morning they were having.The hotel is a good - not great - option for business travelers who don't need to be close to the bustle of Beale Street. It was reasonably priced, generally comfortable, and the well-meaning staff compensated for some of the shortcomings of the property.Wife and I stayed while on a visit for an interview.  Checkin was quick and staff was very friendly the entire stay.  We received a free wifi password, although it was very slow at times.You can surf the web, check email and the basics, but we tried to stream Netflix on my iPad and it constantly lagged and was unwatchable.I also carry an HDMI cable to hookup the iPad to TV's and the TV's here are deliberately rigged such that any input ports don't work except for the basic antennae; not a huge deal but if you travel a lot like we do and like to keep up with your shows it simply won't work here.The restaurant was good, but average and the staff was extremely friendly on every visit.Overall this Hilton is a bit on the low side when compared to others of its brand, yet similarly priced.
review_content_60: I had trouble deciding if I was going to give this hotel 3 or 4 stars. It was a beautiful property, large glass elevator overlooking the city, striking fountain in the lobby. The rooms were large with a view. Of course, there wasn't really anything to look at unless you find Target and the highway visually stimulating. The employees were really nice, which is why I decided to give it a 4 star rating. The front desk was exceptionally friendly, they even called to make sure I was enjoying my room. In the concierge lounge, the woman running it made the effort to chat with my while I was eating my breakfast. Service like that can really make a difference when you are a lonely business traveler.The cons? Well the walls were paper thin. You can hear everything going on in the room next to you. In fact, when I woke up form my nap I could hear the man in the room next to me as clearly as though he was in my bathroom, I actually double checked! Also, the parking lot is really confusing. If you've never been to the property before, it is easy to park a mile away from the entrance. Even the closest parking spots involving carrying your luggage up a staircase. They do have valet parking however, so if this is a problem for you, you can easily fix it.All in all, I enjoyed my short overnight stay. I would certainly stay here again.The room was OK, but the food in the restaurant was just awful. The location was convenient for my trip because it was close to the building I had meetings scheduled, but it's pretty far from everything else in Memphis... Now I don't know if this is the incompetence of the staff or Hilton itself, but when I asked them to print or e-mail me my charges, they said that because I booked the room through Expedia, they were absolutely incapable of printing out an itemized receipt detailing all the charges to my card ... I found this extremely annoying. I wouldn't recommend staying here.Sadly disappointed with my stay at this hotel.  I stayed four nights and my room was on the 5th floor.  The first night I set out my breakfast card only to find it wasn't picked up.  The second day I came back to find my room was never serviced and each day when they did service my room they neglected to empty my ice bucket which was always full of water.  I found the room to be very outdated, carpet was stained and the bathroom wasn't in the best shape. The wireless Internet was extremely slow and would go in and out in speeds, the tv was also slow and didn't work very well.  The best part about the room was the mattress which I found to be very comfortable.  I ate 3 breakfasts and 1 dinner at the restaurant downstairs.  I found the food to be very good as was the service.   The elevators sounded old but were pretty fast.  I only had one issue mid week where it took nearly 15 mins to find an empty elevator getting lucky on the third car.  I think it was due to some conference being held there and everyone was heading out at the same time.  I personally will not stay here again.In room wifi password is hiltonwifi8. If that doesn't work, call down to the front desk and ask for the password.  It's that easy.This is an older Hilton property that is in dire need of refurbishment. Parking is not good as the convenient spaces are limited and additional spaces are a significant walk either up a slope or up many stairs. There was no room service menu in my room so I ordered room service from the restaurant via their best uneducated suggestions.  The food was below average.  Location of this hotel is not great either, as it is not in walking distance to any restaurants or stores.  I am a Hilton honors gold member, and I would not stay in this property again.I stayed here recently and was really displeased, though I typically find Hiltons to be decent. This particular location was determined to wring every last dime out of us, and had some misleading information posted online... first, it's nowhere near downtown or the river, which is easily apparent if you look at a map, but they market themselves as being in the heart of the city. I don't consider a 20-30 minute drive to be close, personally. Here, you'll find yourself in the middle of an industrial park enclave, not too far from some shops, but certainly not well located for the tourist visitor. We had two small dogs with us. When I booked the room they claimed not to have a pet fee, yet they dinged me an extra $75 when I arrived. They also banish pet owners to rooms below the lobby, which didn't bother me because I had a window, but may annoy some folks as it really feels like you're in the basement. The internet access was $9.95 a day, which I wasn't expecting because we'd been told it was free before we booked our room. In their defense, when I complained they gave me a voucher to log on. The greatest unjustified expense was the $18 PER (tiny) MARTINI they charged us in the hotel restaurant, with no warning. I complained and they told me that their policy is not to mention the prices unless a customer asks specifically, and this is why they have no drink menu printed in the restaurant. Another lady in the restaurant was so upset over the cost of her tiny drink that she refused to pay for it. We should have done the same, but I was too surprised at the moment to do so. I settled for complaining to the front desk after my shock wore off, and annoyance set in. The restaurant food was actually amazing- it's a shame that the other aspects of the hotel made us feel ripped-off.I stayed here for a business conference.  I've never stayed here before, but I'm pretty sure the hotel had it out for me.  It was no warmer than 60 degrees in the conference rooms.  I was wearing the entire contents of my carry-on suitcase.  I'm going to chalk this one up to climate differences, but  I was freezing in the meeting rooms and sweating in my room...EVERY day for four days.  The AC in the room was working, but somehow the humidity made me sweat like crazy!I found the service to be very good.  The bartenders were really nice, but those drinks were certainly over-priced.  Nice little bar area, and pool area.  The hotel and grounds were well maintained.  The hotel is quite a way from the downtown action, but close enough to the airport.  I would have preferred something closer to 'downtown'.  The complimentary airport drop off (shutle) was a very nice feature.
