So, if you aren't effected my spell much and can hold your breath until you get to your room, it's a fine stay from there. Otherwise, I would pass.This place was so noisy and wifi so bad I checked out a day early even though I had paid through Expedia. I hope Expedia will reimburse me. The highway noise was worse than I have had when staying at an airport hotel. The wifi was so weak I had to reboot several times. The TV reception went out several times. The room was supposed to have a refrigerator. It had the space for it but nothing. This room is years past it's prime. #817The self park is more expensive than nearby hotels valet. The walk in from the parking lot is not ADA compliant by any means. Curbs, doors that are not automatic. Hard enough bringing luggage-- can't imagine if I needed assistance. Worse? Reception didn't ask how my stay was. Did not ask why I was checking out early. Just said since I paid by a third party I have to ask about a refund from them. I thought I was in the south where hospitality was king. Apparently not. And when a room cost $250 including the crazy taxes and fees in Memphis I expect more!Don't let the door hit you in the back on the way out. IWell...I stayed here because I tried to do a cheap 3 star through priceline. This is listed as a 3 1/2 star Motel (maybe years ago) it was $116.XX with tax plus $17.00 to self park or $20.00 for valet (not mentioned on the website) Its a nice hotel, but its older and need some maintenance, I would not stay here again for $135.00Pros:* Clean room* Very comfortable bed* Clean, newer outdoor pool and pool-side lounging area* 1 block from Convention Center* 1 block from Freeway* Free shuttle to Beale St and other downtown attractions. * Easy 15-20 minute walk to Beale St and other downtown attractions.* Complimentary good, strong coffee in lobby in AM* Very friendly staffCons:* WiFi totally sucked. We could not get the WiFi to work on Windows, Android, or IOS at all during our multi-day stay. Business travelers beware.* Worn-out furniture in lobby and room. Crowne Plaza Memphis needs to make another trip to the Goodwill furniture store and restock furniture with cushions that have something left in them* Leaky bathroom faucet kept the top of the sink wet constantlythis may not be the newest hotel and it may be right off of hwy 40, but i would stay here again. THE STAFF IS THE BEST!! from the valet, to the shuttle driver to the front desk.........everybody has been fantastic!! the bath products are much better than a lot more expensive hotels. parking is $17 self park and $20 valet, but no more than most cities. the staff makes it!!I was charged a 17.00 per night parking fee and wasn't even made aware of this until I received my bill. When I asked about the charge they made the comment well you registered your vehicle. Yes pretty much all hotels have you register your vehicle. I am now staying at a Holiday Inn and I also registered my vehicle here but they didn't charge me 17.00 per night. I think that is ridiculous and sneaky as well as dishonest.I've stayed at many Crowne Plazas. We stayed at this one for a night while in Memphis. My boyfriend used his points to get a free room. When I checked in, I confirmed that the room was free. The person at the front desk agreed that it was free. He mentioned that they put a hold for $30 on the card but that it goes back. Well we were still billed for $30 and it was never refunded. The only reason why we picked this hotel was because of the points. It is still a decent walk to Beale St. The shuttle driver was kind and dropped us off at Beale St. The hotel room was nice with a comfy bed but the view was nothing special. The valet was rather pricey especially given that the hotel isn't in the best location and it is Memphis, not Chicago or Philly.The hotel room is very comfortable and had everything I needed except a bag in the trash cans... I like the lemon water and lemonade in the lobby. The hotel is not very pedestrian friendly since there is so much construction nearby. The hotel food is not worth it. The price for the room is too high.This place was great, but I will start with the negative. Once you check in, you get your room key and the key is uses to enter and exit the hotel parking lot, but it never worked. The hotel apologized for the inconvenience. The staff was very accommodating. The hotel is close to the express way and less than 2 minutes from Beale Street. The hotel has fresh lemonade in the lobby, that is very tasty. Besides, the key fiasco everything else was awesome and amazing. Parking is $17/night (self) and $20/night (valet), unlimited in and out privileges, which is not bad for downtown parking, considering that I am from Chicago and downtown parking here @ a hotel is at least $49/night.1st impression, very nice hotel. Very nice rooms. Not too far from Beale St if you trying to find something nice under $200/night.The cons. The free shuttle service is not reliable. We had to take a taxi, because it was just an SUV, and there were too many people waiting in line to use it. I booked a rate I could cancel. My buddy booked a cheaper non-refundable rate. He was also rewarded with a free breakfast (which he was completely unaware of until the day of our stay). I was not given the free breakfast. I found this particularly unfair, because we kept our reservation and paid $25 more. I think we earned that breakfast. I just think since I did keep my reservation, the hotel shouldn't continue to punish me during my stay for not taking the cheaper, non-refundable rate. I mean, I just made you more money, and you thank me by not giving me breakfast! On the flip side, he said it was terrible, and that the eggs nearly made him gag, so I guess we didn't miss anything.However, given I generally don't care about breakfast, I'd probably stay here again if I was trying to save some money. Memphis hotels near Beale Street will ream you for sure.The hotel wasn't bad, but it wasn't the greatest. It's in the 'quiet' part of downtown, and very close to the courthouse. The 'blues' attractions are about a mile walk, which isn't bad at all. I ranked it just 'okay' because, again, when I pay this much for a hotel, I expect complimentary breakfast. Instead the continental breakfast was $5, and we paid $14 for regular parking. The inside of the hotel looks quite upscale, so that's a plus. We were blessed not to have a window overlooking the freeway.Overall its a fence riding A-okay/ Great hotel. We did get a great rate on Hotels.com @ $81.00 a night for a king size no smoking room. I did request apon arrival that we get a city view room and it was no problem at all. (the back side faces the interstate)Pro's:-Free WIFI-Friendly/ Informative/ Fun Front Desk Staff-Free Shuttle to and from Beal St. until Midnight-Nice and Clean Hotel rooms with great bathroom products-All requests answered and delivered very fast-Great Bar and Restaurant down stairs-No penalty extended check out time (1 hour) 12 noonCon's: -$17 parking or $20 valet parking on site-No complementary breakfast-Loud hallways (thin doors) do not get a room by the elevator. After a night of drinking, the last thing we wanted to hear was loud Room Service staff out side our door at 8:00am. (we called the front desk and it was taken care of fast)For the Rate we received I would stay at this hotel again!Just another hotel. Fenced parking area, which is nice. $8 per day self parking, $20 per day valet. 1 block off the interstate 2 blocks from the trolley station.I had a horrible experience at this property [especially given the rate of $159/nt in Memphis which seems exorbitant given the quality of your property.] When I checked in Weds night, the front desk lady was very pleasant, and made a point of recognizing that I was a Platinum member. She said they had me setup in a "Platinum Suite." Not so. I was put in a standard room with a connecting door to another room. First I tried to connect online - I had complementary wireless - and it didn't work. I spent 30 min on the phone with your tech repair group and they were unable to fix. I unpacked, thought it'd be fine, until the neighbor came home and I could hear every sound. I would've been fine with a standard room, but had tons of work to do and couldn't handle the noise. I called the front desk and they assigned me to another room. I had to re-pack everything to move down the hall.A bellman came to let me into my new room. It smelled awful; I even asked him if he smelled it, and he agreed. So, called back down AGAIN and they put me in the room next door. At this point I was livid, and wished I'd paid a couple more dollars to stay at the Doubletree downtown which is MUCH nicer than this hotel. Finally, the 3rd room was standard without a connecting door and didn't smell, so finally had a room where I could begin my work. Then the TV didn't work - it was so annoying and inconvenient all around. The engineer came up and fixed it [then it didn't work again in the morning, so had to have him come back.]All in all it was a horrible experience, will not stay at this property again, and will likely not stay at another Crowne Plaza. I would expect impeccable service and quality room to be given to a Platinum member. Instead I was lied to, put in a horrible standard room, then a series of rooms with non-working services. I also was never provided any sort of compensation or apologies from the front desk managers I spoke with.The only reason I gave this property 2 stars instead of 1 is because the people I interacted with, i.e. hte bellman, engineer, housekeeping, etc, were all very nice.
review_content_40: The staff was wonderful and the shuttle to Beale street was a nice addition to make our stay great!!!  If you looking for a nice hotle look no further!!,Worst customer service ever!! Obviously the employees do not get paid on customer experience. This is unfortunate that a great hotel chain like Crowne Plaza has a property like this to tarnish its rep. Very dirty and out of date as well! Would not recommend!My eleven year old wanted a adventure this summer, she said like last year in DC but better lol I'm thinking less educational and I don't want to take her out of the states yet. And we love Elvis! Getting in to town at  6am from Houston doesn't leave you a lot of options on where you have breakfast. We ended up eating in the hotel. The food for Memphis was nothing you couldn't buy at Denny's the staff in the dining room wasn't available at Denny's:)star- breakfast staff The only thing about this hotel that is up to date is the 2012 Tahoe they use for private transportation witch desperately needs its  oil  pressure checked and rechecked. A prankster thought we needed to  have  a fire drill so to speak, I  understand if it was a actual fire the necessity to stand around for 30 min and "shoot the s   t" with your coworkers but really . "omg then I was like.... Oh kkkkkay totally" Grow up, behind you is a hotel that needs CPR in the customer service and hospitality dpt. The morning desk staff has the worst attitude, as if the rolls are reversed and how dare  I make her  work. Gasp!All in all the guys who take you to and fro are really nice and the beds are comfortable  -star But sadly this is the end and we will be moving to the Westin.My friends daughter is staying there right now, had to move her room 3 TIMES, still she is with BED BUGS. She even took some on a tissue to show them.  WTF!!!Hello Health Dept, hope you are on your way.Clean, friendly staff, nice pool, but pricey. The room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. They even gave us advice on a good BBQ place, which turned out to be great. The cost for the room and the restaurant bar was pretty expensive. We ordered dessert and a few drinks and it was $70 with tip. The pool area was clean and nice.My parents and I have had a wonderful time here. The staff is so friendly, they seem genuinely happy to be here. The rooms are very nice and clean and the shuttle around the city had been very convenient. I will stay on this hotel again!I never write reviews but I created an account just to review this place. Absolutely rude staff and our room smelled awful. We switched rooms and the second one is just as bad. The entire place needs updating. We paid 130 bucks for one night and it was not worth it. We stayed at the Sheraton the night before for thirty bucks cheaper and for a MUCH nicer hotel and service. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone...especially for the price they charge.My wife was attacked inside the ladies toilet at the above hotel. The woman attacker brandished a knife, pushed her over, stole a case containing an umbrella (probably thinking it was a purse) and ran from the hotel into an awaiting car.My wife suffered severe bruising to her elbows and knees and mental anquish about visiting ladies toilets alone. The incident was reported to the hotels Chief Engineer who called the local Police. the local Police attended but felt unable to pursue the matter any further. I asked whether the hotel had CCTV but was told no. Other members of the touring party attempted to block the woman assailant and reported that the woman had been seen talking to the desk staff who should have been able to provide information to the Hotel Manager. I asked the Hotel Manager for a copy of his Chief Engineer's report but was refused a copy. The Hotel Manager maintained that I would have to go through his Insurance Company. This to me indicated that he recognised that security at the above hotel was inadequate. The reaction of the Hotel Manager to my request to me indicated that this was not the first time that this had occurred. Further research on Trip Advisor proved that my suspicions were correct. Below are the reports of robbery at this hotel to be found on Trip Advisor. "Not Safe" Reviewed 23 October 2012................ There are no security cameras. One member's wife was robbed while she was in her room using the bathroom. ............ "A Beastly Atrocity of a Hotel" Reviewed 18 September 2010..During the second night at this shanty, someone broke into our hotel rooms and removed the contents of our wallets. The hotel staff was utterly incompetent in dealing with this matter. They refused to provide any description or timeline of when our emptied wallets had been turned in to the front desk. Additionally, they were unable to furnish any video footage, due to lack of hallway cameras. I was informed by a sympathetic member of the cleaning crew that "there aren't any cameras anywhere in this hotel" and that "stuff goes on all the time here". Management took down a rather half hearted report of the matter ..... and referred absolutely everything to their insurance company. The malevolent insurance company called 4 days later and humored me by asking two simple questions before viciously denying any sort of claim. There was quite clearly no serious investigation on the part of either the hotel or insurance company. It was an entirely corrupt process utilized to deny any semblance of responsibility, both investigative and preventative, on the part of the hotel. I urge anyone to consider the security ramifications before staying at this hotel. You are placing yourself, your valuables, and your family at risk. The woefully inadequate camera system undoubtedly encourages this manner of theft and cat burglary all the time. They stole money from my suitcase in my room" Reviewed 8 December 2009 ..We travelled from Australia, to the Uk and then to the US for 4 weeks, I loved Memphis but this hotel was shocking, I had hid AUD and GBP in my suitcase, which was zipped and hidden in a plastic bag and my wallet. We had pre paid 2 nights and after a day sight seeing checked my case and the passports weren't where I had left them and the money was gone.The hotel staff were not interested, the police were fabulous, the GM of the hotel never contacted me, just the insurance company and the police. Someone went through my stuff stole our money and the hotel staff did not show any compassion or understanding at all. There were no unauthorized entries for that day they tell me, so you make your own mind up  $300.00 AUD and GBP $30.00 stolen!!!! Just some Aussie tourists, so who cared. They work in gangs and this is want happened to us, October 14th and 15th October 2009. Stole it the day before we left, but they know when you are checking out .......Just remember... a 3.5 star hotel in Memphis is not the same as a 3.5 star hotel in Chicago or Boston.If you have ever stayed at a Crowne Plaza before.. Its like one of those.. except.. older.. and a little dirtier..If you can get a room here from a discount site like Hotwire or something and dont care/cant afford to spend the extra $40-50 a night to stay elsewhere.. then this is a perfectly fine hotel. No frills.. Its got a pool.. Its got in and out parking for $15 a day.. Its on the far end of Downtown so if you can get a room on the Southside of the building Im sure your view will be awesome. (we stayed on the Northside and had a great view of I-40 and St. Judes)They have a shuttle service that will drive you anywhere Downtown as long as its not raining. Its the most average hotel ever. We didnt hate it.. We didnt love it.. Like.. I cant even believe Im writing a review on it..But.. maybe thats why Im writing a review.. to either help you pick a totally average hotel.. or save you from a totally average hotel..Nice hotel but internet VERY SLOOOOOW and intermittent! They should have this nailed because is very important to business people!!!I stay in many hotels and this is worst WIFI I've experienced! You would think an "upscale" hotel like this would have fast internet... Oh wellThis place is great. They provide you with daily amenities if you ever forget anything or are traveling and do not want to carry too much. Toothbrush, toothpaste, and even deodorant. The staff is nice and very accommodating. The rooms were a good size for the rate that I paid. No dirty carpets and a clean bed and shower. The firealarm went off on the 2nd night it kept ringing for about 15 minutes and later turned off. Someone must have pulled it as a joke.Overall. I would stay here the next time I am on business around Downtown, Memphis.This hotel is pretty nice. I happened to stay in it the week of a very large Baptist convention, so it was very busy, and with a lot of people who didn't seem to travel often. The lobby was very crowded so it took awhile to check in. The staff were very nice and even called my room to make sure everything was OK! I like this southern hospitality! The room was fresh and crisp and clean. It is a super hot and humid day so I was so grateful when my room was CHILLY! You have to pay for parking ($18 a day I think?). To me it seemed really expensive for the area. The hotel is within walking distance of everything downtown and they even offer a shuttle to those who don't want to walk. The pool is strangely located across the street? I don't know about you but I would not want to walk across the street in a swimsuit to go to the pool.No continental breakfast :( Four stars for location, decor, friendly staff, and cleanliness.The man at the front desk, Darrell, was so kind and welcoming! He was also super helpful, giving is great pointers and helping make is as comfortable as possible. Great service. The room is comfortable. internet is sluggish. Clean and stylish room! There is a free shuttle service, a great perk to go out and see the city.Hotel is nice enough.  Considering the area, it's nicer than most.  Across the street is a low income complex where Elvis used to live with his parents, until he made too much money to qualify.The WiFi is spotty and very slow.  But it's free.  There's a shuttle that will take you to and from Beale St.  because you do not want to walk to and from there after sun down.  The shuttle will even take you to Gus's Famous Hot & Spicy Chicken which is AMAZING!  Take advantage!The buffet in the hotel is meh.  There's a better (but of course more expensive) buffet at the hotel across the street.  If you get a room with a view of the highway, be warned that you can hear the traffic in your room.  It was a little cold, so I had to turn the heater on which drowned out the sound of all the traffic.I had a TERRIBLE experience at what is supposed to be a "LUXURY" hotel. Nothing was explained to me at check-in as well as unfriendly clerks. One heavy set girl at the desk didn't even look up at me when I walked in for 5 minutes until someone else came to help.  I found dead bed bugs and lady bugs in my room. I spoke with the supposedly front desk manager who did nothing to rectify the situation. She only informed me that they "take these things very serious." I let her know that I would be reporting to Trip Advisor and she basically said "whatever go ahead" This was not at all professional. My experience at this particular facility was not what I anticipated. RUDE STAFF and BUGS is not what I anticipated paying for.Not worth the money. The lobby and hallways were burning up when we arrived. Not fun to have a drink at the bar and sweat worse than if you were outside. The valet attendant was no where to be found when we arrived back from dinner. I had to have her paged and she finally come out of her room. We booked through Priceline and they usually have better hotels than this.Upon arrival the staff was very friendly and accommodating.  There were two couples in our party and we requested that we be near each other and they put us next to each other with out any issues.  The room was mediocre, the bathrooms were small, and overall just pretty average.  We were in memphis for a long weekend, so it was perfect for that!  We hardly spent any time in the room anyway.  The location was pretty good.  We were about a mile off of beale street and the hotel had a free shuttle which was GREAT! it ran until midnight every night except sunday, so that was very helpful.  The drivers give you their card and you simply call them to tell them where you are and they pick you up to bring you back...speaking of the drivers, REGGIE IS THE ABSOLUTE BEST!!! He was funny, fun, and gave us AWESOME suggestions for places to go.  He works the night shift, so if you end up staying there, you'll see what I mean!This hotel was not a five star luxury experience. But was very clean and nicely decorated for the holidays. The staff at the hotel was amazing. Tangela Flemming recommended a perfect itinerary for the weekend getaway complete with amazing dining (Blue Plate Cafe, Ms Pollys and Flight) She also make sure we added some entertainment to our stay and encouraged us to go to Memphis sound for Karaoke. We felt like we had our own personal travel agent with her spot on recommendations. The entire staff were amazing, warm and friendly. They wanted to make sure two big-city ladies had a good ole time in the south. Reginald and Mr Taylor were lifesavers. (The hotel also provided complementary shuttle service.) Whenever we called -- he was a few minutes away and rescued us from the cold. Kenneth and Temera in the dining area were also a treat.I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Good location, gated parking (it's $10 a day...EEK!), easy access to the freeway, and REALLY nice staff. It's about a 10 minute walk to Beale St. and the downtown happenings from this hotel but it's a quiet and safe walk, especially during the day. I will definitely stay at this hotel again when I'm in Memphis! One minor complaint is about their paper-thin walls and ceilings! First off, you can hear the conversation going on between your neighbors, which in my opinion is kind of awkward. Also, if you stay in the 10th floor, beware of the gym above you. You can hear people dropping weights and running on treadmills , especially at night, which is VERY annoying. But other than that, this hotel rocks! Again, the staff is sooo friendly and the location is convenient...can't really ask for more than that!Well, as stated by others, this is a perfectly average hotel. The location is decent and the beds are comfortable and usually that is all one could really ask for. But one could have the tendency to ask for the coffee grounds from the previous guest to be thrown away and the coffee pot cleaned out. One might possibly ask for the bathroom door to latch, but that is no big deal. The free shuttle service to and from Beale Street until midnight is a plus if you are boring and want to leave the bars at a ridiculously early time (just kidding!). The ladies downstairs called literally five minutes upon entering the room to make sure we were settling in all right, which was nice. The staff was also prompt in delivering my request for a razor and shaving cream. My legs were so hairy! My friend and I sat down to have a cup of coffee and a small bite to hold us over until lunch in the restaurant. The prices were as expected for a hotel, but we could not justify paying $17 for the tiny buffet (we were going to have lunch in awhile anyway, so that's okay). I should add that there was an omelet bar, which is probably why it was a little pricey, eh? We settled for a side of breakfast potatoes, which were delicious! We were kind of disappointed to find out after it was too late that they had free coffee in the lobby for the guests and we were charged $3 each. I don't know if that is a legit complaint as I understand that not everything is complimentary and we were technically dining, but seriously... they had three coffee urns in the lobby 20 feet away from our table. Such is life! No biggie.We decided to treat ourselves to some dine-in room service. Ordering was a hassle, because they seemed to be revamping their menu and anything we wanted to order from the menu in the room they did not have. We settled on two sirloin steaks and a bottle of sparkling wine. They gave us an estimate of 30 minutes, but it did not take that long at all. Yay! The lady who delivered the food was very kind and engaged us in friendly conversation. We did not get the salads that came with the steaks, but after calling they sent them up immediately (wrong dressing, though. Oopsies!) . The food was pretty good. Average.And to be honest, we're still here so our experience is not completely over. We'll see how check-out goes tomorrow. But overall, the place is average. Not a bad location at all and the food is all right if you're okay with paying the bumped up hotel prices. The bed is really comfortable and I want to take it home with me. I would stay here again if someone was offering to pay (man, I sound cheap!), but not too impressed. But not too disappointed either. Just... okay, whatevs. It's a hotel.
review_content_60: The bed was fairly comfortable.  They offer a free shuttle service to beale st and around.  The pool was not linked to the hotel.  You have to walk out the entrance through the unloading area and to the pool.  Room service isn't bad.  But I wouldn't spend the extra cost to stay here over somewhere like the Days Inn, again.This hotel was overall ok.  Not too fancy and about what you pay for compared to the other hotels in Memphis.  Worth the $100 difference from the others.  It's a good walk away from Beale Street, but the trolly stop is a street away.  If your feet need saved, take the trolly.  Breakfast was $13. Hold on to your money and go some place local.Stayed here for business. I just started a project that is going to have me in Memphis about 50% of my time for the next 2-3 mos, I will not be staying here. The air conditioner was moldy, the shower curtain liner did not stay in the tub very well and there was a large grease spot on the window. I mentioned these issues to the hotel manager at the front desk the next morning when I was heading out for the day. She said they would be taken care of. They were not. Cleaning the grease spot on the window was a 30 second house keeping issue. A little mold on the AC is only slightly less disconcerting than a lot of mold on the AC. Thats a 5 min house keeping issue. I had no expectation of them resolving the shower curtain issue. I hope they don't get sued when some geezer slips on a slick tile floor. The location was mediocre WRT Beale St, but still  less than a $5 cab rideThe WiFi was painfully slow. Only the Marriot across the street was worse.I will not be returning.If I could give this hotel 0 stars I would. FIrst of all, DIRTY BED BUGS. The room we stayed in not only felt old and gross it was. After waking up in the morning and leaving I found little red bites all over my body matching bed bug bites. I have complained to the hotel twice now and seem to be getting brushed off non stop. The hotel felt unsafe, the room was old and antiquated, and the TV didnt work. Cant find a single reason to ever stay there again.Staff was friendly and the room was nice. The wireless internet seems to struggle the later in the day it gets. The water pressure in the shower was good. Self park was $10. If you cut through the Marriott you can hop on the Main Street trolley for just $1, or a guy told us you can also buy a day pass for $3.25. The Crowne does have a shuttle, if you'd rather not ride the street car, but the street car is vintage and the drivers are friendly.Forgot my sweater in the room. Our group was too concerned about time to go back, ok fair enough. I called the hotel and made arrangements for it to be sent to me. I specified that there was no rush and if they could please send it the cheapest way possible.The sweater arrived 2-day-air. They charged my card $33.O U C HThats twice what the sweater cost. If given the option, I probably woulda just told them to chuck it.Thanks Crowne Plaza for dropping the ball.We Pricelined this one, and for the money we paid I feel like we got a pretty good deal. It's an older hotel and its age shows in the hallways, but the room seemed like it had been renovated relatively recently and was in good shape. Although you are right on the highway, the rooms are quiet (ours was, anyway). It seemed from maps that this hotel was going to be a bit far from the action in downtown Memphis, but that wasn't actually the case. Apparently they have a shuttle that takes you to and from Beale Street, which we weren't aware of when we stayed there. However, we had no trouble walking across the street and through the lobby of the Marriott to the streetcar line that takes you pretty much everywhere you'd want to go as a tourist. It does stop running at midnight, but the hotel is only a 15-20 minute walk from the Beale Street bars. Other reviewers have said you wouldn't want to walk back to this hotel after dark. I suppose I wouldn't attempt it alone, but my husband and I had no issues doing so and never felt scared or threatened.I wish they served a complimentary continental breakfast, and the wifi was frustratingly slow and spotty. On the whole, nothing special, but not a bad deal for a downtown Memphis hotel.Stayed at the Crowne Plaza this past weekend.Positives: Clean comfortable room, insanely comfortable bed, great water pressure in the shower, great bartender in the downstairs lounge, free shuttle service, good room service options, nice view.Negatives: Although I called the day before to ask if we would be able to check in a bit early (30 minutes before exact check-in time) and they said that it would be no problem- upon arrival they made us wait at the desk until exactly 4:00 to check in. Us and several other people waiting as well. Also we had asked to have a room attached or next door to our friends rooms- they also said this would be no problem yet upon arrival they could not even get us rooms on the same floor. There was no tv remote in our room and we had to call for one to be delivered. The parking lot does not seem very safe and for $10 a day they accept no responsibility for any damage done to your vehicle. The shuttle and trolley stop running at 1 am yet Beale St doesnt close until 3am so a taxi becomes neccesary (although the taxi ride only ran us $7)None of the offenses were enough to completely write off the Crowne Plaza but for the money ($92 with taxes on Expedia + $10 a day parking + $30 in room service breakfast) Next time we'll stay at the Hampton Inn on Beale, it's got the best location, free breakfast, and an indoor pool and jacuzzi (Crowne Plaza had an outdoor pool only- its march so thats not really an option)Do not stay here. The staff is very rude. I had a custodian yell at for walking through where he had just mopped. The bartender scolded me for setting my dinner plate on the bar. A "thank you" and "you're welcome" are apparently unheard and unknown by the staff here. Southern hospitality my eye!The maid service did not clean or replace the in room coffee service. Only half the channels worked on the TV. The bar closes at 11? Lame. The conference rooms were not air conditioned. I could go on. Needless to say but I will never stay at a Crap Plaza again.Good points: Very affordable the rooms are pretty nice. Bathrooms are nicely decorated and the shower head works well. The beds are really comfortable and they have 7 pillows on the bed. I sleep very well here... They also have quiet floors for those that are not in the mood for kids...Bad points: Exercise room and pool are at polar opposites in the facility. Pretty far from Beale and other parts of the city, however, close enough to the cable car... Just not a lot happening close to the hotel so if your looking for a quiet place, this is a great hotel. Overall, it has worked for me twice very well...Perfectly average hotel. The rooms were nice, location was nice, beds were great, but the walls are paper thin. We could hear everything - and I do mean everything! - in the adjacent rooms and in the hallway. It's also kind of a bummer that the pool is outdoors, which means you can't use it unless you visit during the summertime months.GREAT ROOM!   CLEAN AND GOOD SERVICE.We were traveling cross country and stopped there.   We spent some time at the hotel bar and ate dinner and then breakfast.  What a treat.  The bartender (think name was Kevin) was really excellent.  I mean he knew his profession!  Treated us like royalty and the food was outstanding.  This is an understated place that may be looked over but we had a great experience!Nice stay overall. The hot water was an odd color. The biscuits & gravy in the restaurant are an embarrassment to the South,Pretty good deal for the price (booked on Hotwire, got a great deal) Rooms are large and updated, fitness center is just right if you're on vacation, because you won't spend hours working out by accident, or you'd run out of things to do.  Its a bit distant from Beale/entertainment, but you can hop the streetcar and be there pretty quick.  The staff was generally good, ask for Lee if you're at the bar and wanna chat, he's tops.Usually when I go somewhere, all I ask for is a clean bed and a shower since I wasn't in the room often. The staff was great even when I called in advance to ask when I can check in. I also booked a tour from them days ahead of time and they were very nice when I had to change it. An added plus was when someone called me a few minutes after to ask if I needed anything. True southern hospitality was when everytime I left the room, someone acknowledged me, unlike most places.There isn't much around it and I didn't have a car but it's only a 5 minute trolley ride to the action, a 15 minute walk, and they even have an SUV that will take you within 5 miles. I also saw a city bus behind the hotel so you weren't trapped. The bed was comfortable, the shower was great, and internet was free.I didn't use any of the amenities so I can't speak on them but I would stay there again just because of the way I was treated. Although it's not in the heart of things, I didn't feel unsafe when I was out and had no bad experience so this place is 5 stars in my book.This hotel is pretty much what you'd expect from any mid-level hotel chain.  Although, I have to say, the staff was especially nice here-- from allowing us to change rooms our first morning there to helping us get into our car after we had locked our keys inside (saving us the hassle and expense of calling a locksmith).  I'd stay here again, my only hesitation is that it's not very close to Beale street, so we ended up taking cabs a lot.Rooms are pretty normal in size for this type of hotel. Close enough that you can walk to the Memphis night life but it isn't right on your door step. The room I stayed in had a LCD TV and was reasonably clean. There are vents that connect the bathrooms so you can see if your neighbor has his bathroom light on, which is a little creepy. Also make it easier to hear your neighbors which is a little annoying. Which is probably why they give you ear plugs, a relaxation CD, and a sleep mask. Staff is friendly and Wifi is free.My car was vandalized in the hotel parking lot overnight after someone tried to break in by tearing out the passenger side key lock. One of the hotel managers gave me an insurance claim number the next day, and in hindsight I realized it was to get me out and on my way since I was booked for only one night. After a couple of hours on the road, the insurance company called to deny the claim saying that it is a self-serve parking lot and that the hotel is not responsible for any damages to my car. Considering I was charged a parking fee and the parking gates had been left up overnight, I still didn't understand how the hotel could have no responsibility securing the reasonable safety of my personal belongings. A follow up discussion with another member of hotel management said that they don't have coverage for this kind of claim. And phone messages to property management went unanswered. Fortunately, nothing was stolen but the passenger door was left unable to open from the outside. And although my insurance covered the damage to the car, I was unhappy with the way the hotel customer relations person packaged the situation and "handled me," and I didn't like how upper management pretty much dropped me and the issue.Although the room was clean and pleasing, no one assisted me when I arrived at night and I brought my own bags to the room. I will not book with Crowne Plaza hotels again.If I were able to give it 0 stars, I would.  I stayed at this hotel on Saturday the 19th of June and I can say I will never ever choose this hotel when I come back to the Memphis area.  While I understand that things do break down, but the lifeline of the hotel/hospitality industry is service.  The moment I entered the room, there was a strong stench, it smelled like mold and a recently opened dirty laundry bag that had been left under the sun with sopping wet clothes inside.  Excusing it as just maybe sloppy cleaning, the fam and i put our luggages down and proceeded to unwind for the day.   I hopped onto the bed and reached for the remote which did not work.  I figured, maybe it was because there were so many items placed in front of the television.  I moved everything that blocked the bottom front of the tv and tried clicking again -- nope! nothing.  So fine, I figure, let me pretend I'm living in the 40s (the pre-tv remote days) and I'll use the channel button on the tv itself, choose a channel and be done with it.  One night of non-channel surfing isn't going to kill me.  As i settle comfortably onto the bed, I hear this water sound coming from the AC, then I hear my mom say that the carpet around the AC is completely wet.  So i got up and walked over....thinking...hm...ok, a little water, not so bad...when I went over, I could hear the wet carpet sound underneath my flip flops.  I carefully surveyed the area and it was bad.  We had to move all our bags onto the chair.  I believe this was my last straw, I picked up the phone and dialed for the front desk...the attendee who picked up sounded friendly enough as i proceeded to tell him about the dripping AC.  This was all he could tell me (1) our technicians just left for the day so you'll have to wait until tomorrow morning (2) we'll bring towels to soak up the water (for which they brought 2 towels).  They clearly needed to see how wet everything was to know that 2 towels was not enough.  We ended up grabbing some of the towels in the room to use.  Next, I figured well since I called about the AC, let me just also let him know about the broken remote...and his response was "oh, then you just have to change the channels on the tv" (Durh!) I mean I know he couldn't offer anything more and that was clearly the only solution but the feeling i got after I hung up with him was "oh you are s**t outta luck, there's nothing we can do"  Tthe handling of the whole situation was just unacceptable and unsatisfactory.  Maybe i just had a strung of bad luck and it seems like all that could go wrong did, but had the situation been handled with more care, I would have left a happy guest.This is the best hotel I have ever stayed at. The staff was so nice at all times. We were treated so kind. Every time they saw us they greeted us so kindly. They gave us a quiet floor, the 8th floor. We slept like babies. I never heard another person in the hotel while we were in our room. The room was very nice and clean, the bed was SUPER comfortable. I must say that I usually don't sleep well in hotels and that the rooms are usually stuffy or damp, but not here, not our room. it was just perfect. and we were extremely please.  We never drove our vehicle again once we parked because they had a free shuttle that took you where you wanted to go downtown until midnight. And if you arent afraid to walk you can walk when the weather is nice. It's only about a 15 minute stroll to Beale. Nice way to check it all out.  The Breakfast there was just awesome too. Eggs, bacon, sausage, toaste, biscuits, gravy, fruit, pasties, juice, milk,  It was very good. But not cheap.    And you do have to pay 10 bucks night for parking. those are the down sides.  Over all. I loved our stay there. It wasn't cheap. It's in the Summer so maybe prices are high right now. But I got treated like a princes for the weekend and I loved it.
review_content_80: We really enjoyed our stay here. The staff was very friendly and professional. The room was clean and comfortable.Nice rooms - great toiletries!  Pool was nice, but needed some tiles replaced etc.  Lobby etc could use some updating.  Shuttle service was nice - could call them from elsewhere in downtown and they would come pick you up... Friendly, helpful staff.At times its not about the amenities or physical appearance, but the service of a hotel that makes it quality and this is the case for the Crowne Plaza. The Crowne is an older hotel, which appears to have been renovated in the past few years. The room was nice and comfortable, there is a small on site gym and pool. However, the pool wasn't in service for a few days, but guests were kept informed of the issue and the pool did reopen as scheduled. As previously mentioned this hotel rates high in my opinion due to the wonderful service provided by all the staff! We especially thank Terry and Reginald who were the hotel drivers during our visit and they were so courteous, prompt, and accommodating at all times.

review_content: I've been watching too much Hotel Impossible.... and could very much pick this hotel completely apart.    HOWEVER... for the price and location, yes, I am a fan.There are some issues that need to be addressed.    There are some rough spots that could be made smoother...   paint job in the bathroom, new tub would be nice, cover up screw/nail holes....   The towels are super rough...   And - warning to the wise - the floor and walls all need a steam cleaning.     Fiance took one look at my bare feet after walking on the floor and suggested washing them and putting some shoes or socks on.     Bring slippers... or be prepared to get dirty feet.   We think its because of the dogs... and they don't have time to steam clean between guests.Ok, that out of the way...  we had a very luxurious bed... it really felt comfortable and newish, clean.   Lovely nights sleep.  Its on a wooden platform, perhaps that helped. The wi-fi signal was strong.Staff is very friendly.Parking is free and seemed safe.Lobby was interesting.   Coffee decent.For the price, it really was a good deal.   I had done some research and this really was a good selection for being close to the airport and to Graceland .At first glance this is a bargain but we got the room that made me know why it was at a low rate. I've rarely felt so discounted. One bed had a dip in the middle so deep it was obvious and the foot of the bed was higher than the head. The biggest offense is to give us a non smoking room right next to a smoking room. It subtly dawned on me that our neighbors were either smoking all night or that room must be brown with smoke residue. I'll spend more next time on a room thanks to this lesson.Love this hotel! Elvis music playing in the lobby and outside, pictures up on the walls.  Really great location - 5 minute walk to Graceland.  The room had beds with sleep number mattresses, however, the remotes were not functioning, so the firmness could not be adjusted.  It would have been awesome they worked.  Good breakfast - eggs, cereals, pancakes, toast, tea, coffee...  One star off for crappy internet, holes in the walls that were plugged in with toilet paper, and "in case of fire" sign listing the wrong location of the room.  It's not too way off, but the difference could be important in real emergency.Priced right, located directly across from Graceland, and with a guitar-shaped pool, this Days Inn exceeded our expectations.Rooms are small and a bit outdated, and the Wi-Fi sketchy at best, but this staff were very friendly and clientele very international: in the breakfast room we heard accents from Britain, Germany, Ukraine and Japan, and several that were unplaceable.Hip Elvis tip: from 7:30-8:30, before the tours start, the gates of Graceland are opened up for fans to walk up and see the Memorial Garden atno charge. Staying right across Elvis Presley Blvd, I got in right at 7:30 and had a private audience with the King for a few quiet moments. You can't do that if you're staying downtown.Very clean rooms, friendly staff extremely comfortable beds. Fridge, microwave and coffee pot in room!Lots of channels and 3 Elvis movie channels. 1 block from Graceland !!!Elvis week and $113 with tax !!!Pool is awesome it's guitar shaped !!!Free breakfast Breakfast could have more choices but still ok for freeI am not a hotel snob. Really. But I wanted to finally do the Elvis thing and the Yelp reviews seemed okay for this place.  3-1/2 stars come with a certain level of expectation. I think this was 2 star at best.  I don't know what was worse, the cigarette smell or the spray used to try and cover it up. In any case the room  smelled awful. The  blanket had cigarette burns, the room had no closet or anywhere to hang clothes and the pillows were maybe an inch thick. The TV could not change channels. They provided one bath towel for two people. The front desk gave me another    The staff was friendly enough but could mot make up for the  room and sleepless night.  It is not really that close to Graceland. In hind-sight, i should have stayed downtown near Beale Street and driven the extra 15 minutes to Graceland. PS. Wife said bathroom was filthy.Great location to visit Graceland. The area around Graceland is not great for sure, but if your there to visit Graceland this hotel is perfect for one night. We paid $60 each for our two rooms.  The hotel is completely decorated with Elvis memorabilia . Our hotel rooms were very outdated but the staff truly had done everything they could to make it as appealing as possible. Bring your own pillow if possible.  The front desk could not have been any nicer throughout our stay. The pool is shaped in a guitar and in decent shape. Elvis music played throughout property. There is free wifi, free parking , and a free continental breakfast. The coffee was great! Not a lot of room in breakfast area so plan accordingly. We left our car in the parking lot of hotel to visit Graceland and avoided the Ten dollar parking charge per car. The walk is frankly just as close or closer than Graceland's own parking lot. I would definitely recommend staying here for a short stay.Comfortable, clean and very very close to a Graceland. Great price too. Features TV, fridge,  microwave,  ironing and coffee/tea making facilities.  Wifi was pretty weak. Breakfast included.Heaps of Elvis themed stuff around the motel and a guitar shaped pool. The surrounding area is fine. Not shady at all. Great place. Would recommend.Great rooms. Cool pool.  Cute breakfast.  Lovely staff.  Perfect for us and our dog.  Walking distance to Graceland (it's on the next block).  Saves you the $10 to park.This place is awesome. They took us in at 1 am and made sure we had everything we needed. It's clean, and we felt very safe.Talk about Elvis overload! But it's right next to Graceland so I suppose anyone should expect that.Memphis was just a stop on a road trip. But we did get to see Graceland and LOTS of Elvis. We got a great recommendation for dinner from the night clerk here. The room was ok. The pool was worth taking a picture of. Breakfast was free and filling.I'd certainly recommend it to anyone who wants to see Graceland!Wow! This place is an experience! You are seriously within walking distance to Graceland. Room is a bit dated but very clean. The hotel staff is super helpful and very friendly. The lobby is spotless and loaded with Elvis memorabilia. If you have the chance you should stay here for the night.Stayed 3 nights. I have zero complaints. I actually loved it.  I've read the reviews and people say its a shady area but honestly, i think the area was great. Close to Graceland and whole buncha businesses. Went to Walmart thats about 5 mins away and bought snacks and stuff. You literally have everything close by. The room was clean and the staff came in daily and changed sheets and towels and vacuumed. We sat by the pool, played some dominoes and drank some beer. Didn't feel uncomfortable at all.I didn't try the continental breakfast at all so can't say much about that. If i'm ever in Memphis again, I will definitely stay here again.$115, walking distance to Graceland, clean rooms, working A/C, a guitar shaped pool, pictures of Elvis in the room, quiet at night, Elvis radio blaring over the pool, and two Elvis movie channels, free wifi, free parking, free continental breakfast. Is it a luxury hotel? No. Is the pool grimy and overly chlorinated? Yep. Is breakfast carb filled? Yeah. Is it just what we needed after a long day at Graceland? Uh-huh. If you go to the pool, ask for pool towels at the front desk. They won't give you more room towels if you use those for the pool. The room towels are nicer than the pool towels, so you will want shower towels for the shower and pool towels for the pool.I agree with Susan K.  My friend and I stayed here a night in late November of 2013, and the room, though larger than some, was somewhat outdated and the cleanliness was questionable.  The beds and pillows were HORRIBLE.Not to mention, we were rudely awoken by Elvis music BLARING from the office around 8:30 in the morning.  I get that it's next to Graceland but as weary travelers, we were less than thrilled to be woken up.The neighborhood is not as good as some, the building itself seemed a little run down, and the bathroom was borderline dirty...Not pleased overall and wouldn't recommend staying here.Let's be honest with ourselves.  It's hard not to trust a Days Inn that sports Elvis memorabilia from top to bottom.The staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms were clean (albiet a little stuffy), and boasted a fridge and a microwave.  My biggest concern was the wooden block we had for a bed.  Okay, so it was a legitimate bed, but really, may as well have been a giant, king-sized block of wood because when I jumped on it (expecting to bounce), I just about broke my face.  It's a good thing I went out until 3 a.m. and was tired enough to fall asleep on a bed of nails.  Also, having Elvis watch over you can't hurt. Uh huh.It's walking distance to Graceland, and very nearby Uncle Lou's, which is a must try.  If you're in Memphis to see the fun and exciting Memphis tourist attractions, this is a no-brainer.  Especially since it's half the cost of the Heartbreak Hotel, and equally as cheesy and fun.  It's also right by the highway, so traveling to downtown Memphis was easy-breezy.Overall, I had a very enjoyable stay.  Did I mention they have a guitar shaped pool?  Pretty Elvis-tastic!After our Motel 6 incident we decided to head on over here! This hotel is really close to Graceland, no reservations are needed, and is pet friendly!!! Oh and also has a ton of Elvis crap everywhere, yea!!!! They even have a freakin awesome guitar shaped pool, too bad it was humid and 85 degrees and then suddenly tornado weather when I dropped by, lol. The rooms are nice and clean with comfy beds and pillows. They also have a good sized tv, fridge, and microwave. All the decor is kinda retro and funky, and there are Elvis portraits on the wall of course. The area is not very loud since it is a few miles away from any highways, so you will sleep pretty well here. There's a channel that shows Elvis movies 24/7 but it didn't work, so fail right there Graceland Days Inn. I was excited about that after reading about it in the other Yelp reviews. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was actually pretty good. There are lots of options: waffles, toast, fruit, cereal, etc. I wish there was soy milk though, so I can eat the cereal somewhere where there's a complimentary breakfast one of these days! I know, I'm getting greedy and picky over a free breakfast. Also, the breakfast cafe is all decked out in Elvis stuff too, so enjoy while you eat. Also, when we were checking the power went out in the entire Days Inn!!! It was pitch black in all of the room and lobby, I guess this is a problem in Memphis, lol. This part of Memphis is definitely not the nicest part of town, but it is where Graceland is, and wayyyyy better then West Memphis. So if you want a nicer area stay closer to downtown Memphis and drive over to Graceland, and pay the $10 to park there. Oh yea, and how can I forget the best part of all, Graceland is walking distance, so you can wake up and walk on over to start your Graceland tour. :) There is Heartbreak Hotel right next to Graceland which is definitely closer, but way more expensive and probably only a little nicer than this place, which is good enough and only $75 a night.Very convenient if traveling to Graceland. Pretty clean.. just smelled a little perfumey in the rooms.The pool is awesome- but it was winter when we were there.. so didn't get to enjoy it.Rooms are decorated with Elvis memorabilia.Complementary breakfast was pretty weak- stale pastry items and dried out cereal.But hey..  it close to Graceland and not very expensive. Can't beat that.p.s. walk to Graceland from hotel- we drove and had to pay $ 10 parking! It's totally walkable- save your $.During our 3,000+ mile trip from Chicago to Vegas, we made a stop to Memphis so that we could visit the King's place of residence. We needed a place to stay, had no reservations, we had pets and we wanted to be in a safe place in close proximity to Graceland. Days Inn was able to accommodate us with all the above! Like Rachel H. said, "Its a Days Inn... don't forget that..." It isn't the Ritz Carlton by no means but it provides the essential and never lets you forget that you are across the ways from the home of the King... He is plastered all over the place. Starting with the lobby, his photos, statues and the huge photo of Graceland behind the front desk. Once we were all good to go with our rooms, we passed by the guitar shaped pool. Granted, we were there in late October so we weren't able to utilize it, but I think it's very much unique and a nice touch for the whole Elvis theme. And once we reached our rooms, there he was again on the walls and 24/7 channel of all Elvis movies all the time! We're big time Elvis fans so we sure a heck did not mind the gorgeous man all over the place :) Again, it is a Days Inn, the rooms are average but this was the nicest Days Inn that we stayed at the entire trip, we stayed at 3 and let me tell you... The faucets worked, the toilet and shower were CLEAN, though outdated-- the TVs worked perfectly, the rooms were CLEAN and there were no remnants of anyone smoking in there, yea they're nonsmoking rooms but I am scarred for life w/ other Days Inn locations with their so-called "nonsmoking" rooms. It's walking distance from the Graceland tours area, but if you're traveling or touring w/ the elderly I'd suggest a wheelchair or dropping them off and parking your vehicle back at Day Inn, you have to PAY for parking at the Graceland tours area as to where at DI, it's free. They offer a free continental breakfast. But don't be fooled, they say "hot breakfast" the only hot part of the breakfast was the waffles. The rest of what they offer are toast, fruit, juice and cereal. Don't get me wrong, it's free but if you're expecting eggs and sausage, you'll be disappointed. What they offered was enough to suffice our appetite, so I loved it :) If we ever find ourselves in Memphis again, we'll definitely be staying here, LOVE our experience.The room itself was old/outdated and the bed was hard as a rock! Also had a group of college kids above us that kept us up all night. The area is questionable. The only upsides would be proximity to Graceland and the free breakfast.
review_content_20: This place is great for a night or two. Your going to Memphis, your there for Graceland, this place is perfect. You can walk right over to Graceland, ignore the Graceland parking price, and the place has a cool/corny vibe. It's a fun motel. Great continental breakfast, waffles always seal the deal. 3 channels on the tv show strictly Elvis movies to keep you in the mood. Guitar shaped pool? Awesome.Great place we had a great time here and would totally go back someday.Days Inn was a great hotel if you are looking to see Gracelands. But be aware it is a $20 cab ride to Beale St and there is nothing else apart from Gracelands nearby. Rooms were comfy and kitsch with Elvis memorabilia everywhere. I didn't swim in the pool but it was a nice touch. Staff there are friendly and helpful.You've gotta love a Days Inn that has a guitar shaped pool, pictures of Elvis above the beds, and is right next door to Graceland. I stayed here a few weeks back on a trip to Memphis where my friend could see the resting place of his favorite rocker. The hotel staff that I encountered was very friendly and accommodating. The Days Inn boats a lobby full of Elvis memorabilia and also serve breakfast for free. My biggest complaint was the rock hard mattress. It was really awful. But, since was were only there for one night it was not too bad. If you're looking for an inexpensive hotel next door to Graceland, this is your best bet.5 stars for Ramanda's amazing customer service. Super friendly and helpful. The lobby is cool, lots of picture opportunities. Room was clean. No complaints at all. I would have never written a review though if it weren't for Ramanda at the front desk. This girl needs a raise!!!!Maybe better than actual Graceland.Stopped here when driving from San Antonio, TX to Hartford, CT. Perfect location, walking distance to Graceland and the only place within walking distance that accepted pet guests. Rooms were kind of rundown, with Elvis prints as decor. Beds were decent. Decent place to stay if you're in and out, passing through.My husband and I considered staying here for a night due to the proximity to Graceland. When we walked in to inquire about rooms, the desk clerk was rude and could care less if she got our business or not. We obviously decided to go somewhere else. I would not recommend this place due to terrible customer service.This place is so dirty! The bathroom had hair clumped in greasy strips in every crevis in the bathroom, especially under the bathroom door, so every time we closed the bathroom door it left a grease ball with a thousand hairs in the bathroom. Disgusting! The pool had hair balls floating in it everywhere, and the water was clearly clouded. Although it came out so cute in our picture of the kids swimming, I can't believe I let my kids in that pool, it has haunted me ever since. I am no where near a neat freak either. The blanket you use on the bed (not the comforter) is so old it feels like sand paper and it had multiple cigarette burns on it, so I chose to go without most of the night every night. The second worst thing was the smell of the rooms, some really strong perfumy smell that they apparently need to cover up something?? It gave me a headache for the first 10 min every time we came back into the room.The staff is not trying to be friendly or helpful in anyway. The housekeeper seemed nice when she came by at 9am and we asked her to come back in a bit because we were still preparing to leave, but she never came back, so our room was never serviced on our stay.I can say the mattress & pillows were good, but the bad points far over shadowed the upside.I stayed in 10 inn type places rated the same as this one on my road trip and this was by far the worst. Although this was my favorite place (Memphis) to visit on this trip, I had to really try to not let my two nights here bring down my spirits. Don't stay here, its worth the drive to stay somewhere where there are more options, like near Beale Street. I heard the Heartbreak Hotel is also heartbreaking! Options are few around Graceland, but a short drive would be worth it for you!Lemme jus tell you this...Tracy helped us get all checked in, and gave us all the essential info on where to eat good BBQ, cracked a few jokes with us, and gave me extra coffee packets to brew in my room. The perfect personality to greet some weary travelers. She is all smiles and absolutely made our trip all the way from California so worth it!!! She's my new sister-friend!!! Thanks again Tracy!!!Other than that, don't expect the extravagance of the Hilton, but it provides the necessities (coffee, room safe, cable, free wi-fi) and free breakfeast. It's also walking distance to Graceland, and it is clad in everything Elvis!!! It's the perfect homage to the King of Rock n' Roll. I'd definitely stay here again. And the price is very reasonable. I'm not a pet person, but my friends are, and had we brought them, they'd be welcome as well.If you're not into frills, want something clean and affordable, this is your place to stay when visiting Graceland or the Memphis area.  The fact that it is within walking distance to Graceland is an added bonus.  Included with your stay is a continental breakfast, to the tunes of Elvis playing in the background.  Staff is pleasant and friendly.  Highly recommended.A pretty good hotel to stay in if you want to be right by Graceland (super close). If I had it to do over, I would have stayed in downtown Memphis (since I went to the National Civil Rights Museum (a must see!), Beale Street, etc. and saved myself the many taxis I took into the city. The hotel rooms were clean and updated, but the TV needed help and the towels were AWFUL (my husband likened them to drying off with jeans). They were threadbare and desperately need replacing. The breakfast in the morning was very good: yummy waffles, fruit, cereal, etc. I think this is a good value for its location for sure. As a side note, Graceland was wonderful!This place is pretty ideal. It's so close to Graceland, we were able to just walk down there in a few minutes. It has a guitar shaped pool, which was kind of nice, though it seemed a bit dirty once I got in. And it was only 5 feet deep at most I think. As others have said, there's one channel in the room that has non-stop Elvis movies. There's a bunch of kitschy stuff all over, and this is one of the cases were it's oddly appropriate. 5 stars this hotel is not, but for the convenience and price, it's a pretty damn good deal. It seemed like there were a bunch of signs saying they are not responsible for property stolen out of cars, but whatever. It seemed pretty safe, and I had most of my belongings in my car since I was moving. Wasn't a problem. Like someone else said it's kind of a dirty, run down part of town. I wonder what it was like when Elvis was still living there.wow for the money 65 bucks a night this place was awesome!! Great friendly people very clean rooms and the lobby was very cool from all the elvis stuff to the good breakfast. If your going anywhere near graceland put this one on your list .Cool hotel to stay at before you visit Graceland. Has Elvis movies and documentaries 24 hours a day and Elvis pictures up in the room. We were able to walk just a block to get to Graceland. Not super fancy, but a great place to get you in the "Elvis mood" We were very pleased with our stay and would recommend it.This place is tacky in the best kind of way.  It's elvis everywhere and they even have a guitar shaped pool.  If you have a sense of humor and don't want to spend a lot of money on lodging, this place is perfect.  The room was clean and we even had a little refrigerator and microwave.  This place was exactly what we needed for a three night stay and all for only 69$ a night! Not to mention you get free wireless service and free elvis movies 24/7.  People say this area is not safe, but I think people just don't understand that it's just what Memphis looks like.  Everything is run down in Memphis and nothing looks safe, but don't be fooled by the appearance, it's a perfectly safe area as long as you don't mind the occasional bum that tries to accost you for cash.  But hey, I get hassled by bums at least five times on my way to work every morning in Chicago.  If you like your suburban neighborhoods with new buildings and same looking people wearing their gap clothes, book yourself a room at the peabody in downtown Memphis and call it a day.  if you are shopping around for good hotels that won't put you over a 100$ and has good clean rooms, Days Inn at Graceland is the perfect choice.

review_content: Stayed here for one night as a stopover while on a road trip with my husband and 2 dogs. We were able to make a last minute reservation here on a Friday night and we were fairly satisfied. The hotel offers valet parking ($25/day), which looked fairly busy on a Friday night, so we opted on self parking in the adjacent garage which was about $18/day. Check in was quick and smooth. The hotel itself is fairly modern and in a great location. It is located directly across from the Memphis Grizzlies basketball arena and one block away from Beale Street. It's super convenient to many bars and restaurants which gives you a myriad of dining options to chose from all within a short walking distance from the hotel.The staff here were all very friendly and welcoming of our 2 dogs. We opted for a traditional king room which was clean and had a very comfortable bed. Elevators were on the slow side as there are only 2 for the entire hotel. Being an SPG member we also were able to access the internet free of charge.Overall, this is a fairly affordable hotel in an excellent location and they get an extra star of approval from me since they're dog friendly and don't charge an additional pet fee.My husband and I had a great overall experience at this hotel.We stayed here for two nights while he was on business and I tagged along for fun. The rooms were clean, the beds were "heavenly" and you couldn't hear through the walls or hallways, so our stay was extremely quiet and peaceful. The valet service was quick and the ladies at the front desk were really helpful with directions and suggestions for the "must see" attractions in Memphis. This hotel is in a great location, nestled just a block away from Beale street, across fromThe Gibson guitar factory, and walking distance to the civil rights museum, and a bunch of bars and restaurants.My only complaints about this hotel are that the showers are tiny (and I'm a small girl) and I had a hard time even trying to shave my legs in the shower and that the elevators broke one evening so we had to take the freight elevator which we waited over 15 minutes for.I've stayed at this particular Westin four times now and a review is truly past due!My first (and possibly most important!) tip: if one is available, go for the rooms with the treadmill and workout equipment! I was spoiled my first time here. These rooms were going for well under 200 dollars and if, like me, you're one of those people who get cranky when a small hotel gym has even one other person in it, you cannot beat this type of amenity. Add to this, the room is so huge, you can run around it a couple times and it's like you're running around a track, only with floor to ceiling windows and your own personal shower that can fit at least 10 other people in it (I did not at any point invite 10 other people over to shower with me). Oh, the stories this shower could tell, no doubt. This *is* the hotel that houses visiting NBA teams, so I'll leave it at that.That said, I've yet to be able to stay in such a room after my first stay. The typical guest room is spacious and comfortable, up to the Westin standard. I am disappointed that you have to request shower gel, though. It's just annoying as other Westins provide it in your room and I kind of hate requesting things (even though there's a long list of things they can provide you with). That said, I really needed a damn bandaid and they didn't have that most basic necessity when I asked. Speaking of hotel gyms, the one here is fine. All the cardio equipment (3 treadmills, 3 or 4 ellipticals and a stationery bike or two) faces windows, which is cool. I've worked out in far too many hotel basements! The worst. They have two benches, exercise balls, free weights and a cable weight system that does the trick for the traveling workout fiend. The front desk staff at this Westin are really helpful and nice! I once needed stuff faxed and they did this for me no problem (who faxes anything anymore, right?) The standard of customer service is quite high. I'll write a separate review for the restaurant, but yesterday the waitress went above and beyond for me and went to the adjoining Starbucks to get soymilk so they could make my oatmeal vegan. There you have it! Until that magical hotel opens in Midtown, the Westin is my hotel of choice when in Memphis.Staying here at the Westin for a few days and I must say after my arrival today I took a AMAZING 6 hr nap, their beds are just so comfortable not to mention their pillows, ahhh and they brought me extras because I'm pregnant. Favorite part is clearly the bed lol oh and the nice view of the arena :)I had a one night stay here just before Christmas Eve. Even at 12:30 AM, the staff  downstairs at the check-in desk were downright hospitable. A warm welcome that late is always nice to have.Joi B. is right on the money. If you can get it, get the workout mini-suite. They run cheap, and are downright cavernous. The room was clean and large, and the location is good. I'm happy to see Memphis still has a somewhat modern and upscale hotel property that isn't staid, crusty, and stuck in the 1980s like The Peabody.Great hotel in downtown Memphis directly across from the Fed Ex forum and Beale St. The newest hotel in downtown it's more modern than the others. They have a case of Gibson guitars you can borrow to play in your room if you'd like. They send up a set of headphones so you don't bother the neighbors.We just stayed at this hotel this past week. We have been Starwood Members for many years and frequently use our points for free nights. We booked our stay with our points and when we checked out, we were told that we had to pay for the 2 night stay. We called Starwood Customer Service and they verified we had used our points, but the front desk personnel, Linnete refused to refund our credit card. Starwood customer service lodged a complaint for us, but as yet we have still never heard from the general manager.  If you must stay at this hotel, be sure to verify the charges if you are using points. I give it a one star because the facility and room was very nice.  On a side note, my brother accidentally left his jacket in the closet of his room. When we called the hotel, two hours later, the jacket was gone. Very disappointing that the staff is not honest.  Beware this hotel!The only reason I am not giving this hotel all 5 stars, is because they did not handle a noise complaint well.  After I called down for the 3rd time at 4:15 AM to quiet my neighbors, I still heard them at 7:00 am sharp.  I wasn't the only one to complain about the neighbor's loud behavior, per the front desk...The hotel itself is very nice and clean.  Valet service was great, the hotel bar was great (bartender was awesome but it does close early around 11:00...) and the hotel restaurant was great for breakfast.  Just one block off of Beale Street and in a great location if you plan to party on Beale Street.  The rooms were very clean and all of the staff was very friendly.Stayed here for five nights while catching games 3 and 4 of the Warriors-Grizzlies series.Pros: great location. Right across the FedEx Forum, next to Beale Street (this could be a con for those sensitive to noise, but I wasn't too bothered by it). Lots of options for restaurants and bars. Rooms are spacious, convenient parking, and a very nice gym with new equipment plus water and towels available.Cons: Housekeeping needs to be retrained on how to thoroughly clean rooms. Floors were not swept, dust had started to gather on table tops and water marks on the faucet and taps, used wine glasses were not replaced. They basically only made the beds and emptied the waste bins. The worst thing was we weren't provided with toiletries and I had to ask for more shampoo, conditioner, etc. I'm not normally very picky about these things and even opted to skip housekeeping on a couple of occasions, but for the cost of staying at this hotel, this level of service is unacceptable. Daily parking and internet charges are also pricey, but that is common to all SPG properties.If the housekeeping staff is retrained to properly clean rooms, this could easily be a 4-star review. But as it is, this Westin is not up to par with other SPG/Westin properties.Very unprofessional staff. I wanted to look at this place for my wedding. The wedding coordinator said she's not available this weekend but the banquet manager would be available and to ask for him when I come in. So I Ask for him today and the front desk girl asks if I have an appointment. I say no Lorraine said to come ask for him when I come in. She calls him and can't get a hold of him. She asks for me to sit and wait and she will contact him again. I wait about 15-20 min. I go to the front desk and ask for him again. She says I can't get a hold of him and that he's somewhere in the hotel. I ask her to call him and she says "usually he sees people by appointment only." I informed her that Lorraine could have told me that and for  to call his cell phone. She tells me she doesn't have it. So I say you mean to tell me no one in this hotel can contact him and no one has his cell? She says give me just a second. She goes to the back and comes back 5 minutes later and informs me that he's upstairs and I can go upstairs. Um, excuse me I'm a potential customer who's about to spend 20k+ and you tell me to go find him and treating me like I'm a child?! I go upstairs and no one's there. I go to the office and could not  find anyone so I asked if anyone was there out loud. I took it upon myself to look at the rooms. By the end of the last room a guy comes out and asks if I'm the person looking for him. I told him don't worry about it. If this is how you're going to treat me on my wedding day no thanks and that Lorraine could have told me about appointment only "policy". He kept asking me not to leave but I need an organized and professional hotel for my day. So disappointed. Thank god I didn't like the rooms anyway as they were too brown and stuffy, but if I did like the rooms I would have asked to speak to the manger of the hotel and let him know.Loved this place! Excellent location directly across the street from the FedExForum and Gibson Guitar Factory. Super close to Beale Street also. This place has a modern feel with contemporary decor, but the best part of our stay was they had these expensive Gibson guitars in a glass case in the lobby that you could take up to your room and keep for as long as you wanted during your stay. My 14 year old son was in Heaven! Such a great idea!! Would definitely stay here again!I'm really disappointed at my stay here at the Westin.  The only thing that it has that would make me consider returning is its location and ample size bathroom.I'm disappointed that as a preferred guest that the internet costs money.  In most other hotel that's a standard feature with the room.  The room itself had a weird oder as if something is rotten.  Finally I think I got bitten from bed bugs or a rash from something because I have unusually large scratchy swollen circles on my arms, legs and chest.  I'm not sure the cause but I don't remember being bit by mosquitos or anything else abnormal during my stay in Memphis.I stayed here for 2 nights during the summer. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It's connected to the main parking garage in downtown Memphis. It's 1 block off of Beale St. It's right near all of the excitement in Memphis.I stayed in a room with 2 queen beds. Room size was decent. Bathroom was nice (and pretty big too). Room was relatively quiet. Air conditioning worked well. The room was cleaned well.The hotel lobby and hallways were nice and clean. Elevators worked well. Staff was very good.I'd definitely stay here again. The only thing that would have probably made it better is if they had a pool and hot tub. Oh, and if they had some room in the electronically monitored small fridge in the room for you to store your own drinks.They called this the Westin Memphis Beale Street, but it really ain't on Beale; but it's only a block away.  Great location due to its close proximity to Beale and just across the street from the Fed Ex sports arena and Gibson factory.  The hotel is modern, clean and very classy.  My room was perfect and the service was top notched.  Like any other major city hotel, you got to pay for parking.  I opted for valet, but probably should have gone the self park route since the garage is next door.  The nicest feature of the hotel is the close walk to Beale and the nice rooms.  If I head back to Memphis, I would chose this place just for its location alone.Westin makes me feel like royalty and I just love it! Every time I pull up to the hotel, super friendly and funny valet teams assist me right away (awesome that they have free valet!) someone greets me and opens the door for me and everyone in sight will say hello and welcome. When I'm waiting in the lobby, staff offer me water and coffee while I wait. It is extremely clean and elegant in the lobby and the Bleu restaurant always smells good and looks full of life. While I've never stayed in a room here, I have visited one and can tell you their heavenly bed's are just that, heavenly!
